This dining establishment offers good food, but patrons should be prepared for a lengthy experience, with meals typically taking around 2 hours from start to finish. Despite several visits motivated by positive experiences at its New Jersey locations, the slow service remains a consistent drawback. The waitstaff is young and generally friendly, yet the persistent delays have led to a preference for faster dining options, especially on weekends.

Body Cycle offers an unparalleled spinning experience that outshines any other classes I've attended over the years. The facility impresses with its cleanliness and state-of-the-art equipment, fostering an environment where every session feels premium. What sets Body Cycle apart is the exceptional team of instructors—they're not just professional and knowledgeable, but also incredibly welcoming and motivating, making each workout engaging and effective.

The online scheduling system adds to the convenience, allowing for easy class bookings without the hassle of early lineups, a common inconvenience at many fitness establishments. This feature is particularly beneficial for those with tight schedules looking to seamlessly integrate fitness into their busy lives.

A special mention must be made for Russell, the heart and soul behind Body Cycle. His genuine passion for fitness and cycling shines through, coupled with a sincere commitment to his clients' success. Russell's presence in classes—offering encouragement, checking in, and always being open to feedback—adds a personal touch that truly enhances the workout experience. His positivity, even during the toughest workouts, is infectious.

In summary, Body Cycle stands out not just for its superb facilities and classes, but also for its community spirit, led by Russell's exemplary dedication. Whether you're a spinning veteran or newcomer, Body Cycle promises a fulfilling and enjoyable fitness journey.

Visited a family diner with a surprisingly eclectic buffet selection – from a large chicken leg, fried jalapeño, and tamale to rolled grape leaves and fresh melon, every item tasted good. The diner leans heavily towards Mexican cuisine within its varied choices. They also offer a full menu, notably featuring breakfast all day, adding to the diner's appeal. Service was notable for the staff's friendliness and attentiveness. This spot is perfect for a casual, laid-back meal without high expectations. Conveniently located next to the Clarion Hotel, making it an accessible option for guests seeking local dining experiences.

This eatery left a strong impression with its delightful array of flavors. The lamb curry and korma stand out as favorites, complemented by an impressive selection of 10 different kinds of naan. Despite an unassuming exterior that nearly led us elsewhere, the experience inside encourages adventurous palates to try something new. Definitely a place that rewards the curious diner; you won't be disappointed!

Visited a charming spot with an adorable interior, where the friendly owner took the time to show us around the upcoming patio/rooftop area—perfect for sunny days. The cheese curds were a hit: tasty and generous. The option to have a salad with sandwiches is appreciated, especially after indulging in the curds. Tried the onion, gruyere, and tomato sandwich; it was nicely balanced in terms of cheese, though it could use a bit more flavor, perhaps some pepper jelly. The menu could benefit from more variety, particularly salad options with interesting cheeses. The beverage selection is robust, offering numerous beers, wines, and a handful of cocktails. Looking forward to trying one of the draft wines on my next visit.

As a long-standing and frequent patron of this establishment, I was taken aback by my most recent experience. When attempting to place an order for takeout, I was unexpectedly denied service due to the restaurant being "too busy," despite the fact that it appeared only half full at the time. This response was particularly disappointing given my loyal patronage and history of generous tipping. Consequently, I have decided to explore other options and are excited about the opening of Kanella, marking the end of my visits to Dmitris.

I had an excellent experience with this tour, making it a highlight of my New Orleans trip. The Groupon deal offered great value, perfect for first-timers like myself unfamiliar with the city's rich history. The guide was knowledgeable, sharing fascinating facts throughout. Surprisingly, the tour covered both the French Quarter and a cemetery, providing a comprehensive overview of the area. Meeting up in front of a grocery store was unexpected but practical for pre-tour preparations. The inclusion of a mid-tour bathroom break was a thoughtful touch. Overall, I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to explore New Orleans' history and charm.

This hidden gem offers an outstanding dining experience with its amazingly delicious wings paired with homemade bleu cheese. The ribeye is tender, expertly cooked, and flavorful, making it a highlight of their menu. They also boast a nice selection of craft beers to complement your meal. I would definitely recommend a visit to anyone looking for high-quality, tasty dishes.

This Easter, we swapped our usual trip to Lopez Lake for Los Padres National Forest, anticipating its reputed beauty. Although the landscape met our expectations, our enjoyment was marred by the upkeep of certain areas, particularly White Rock. The excessive dead grass both on the rocks and along the water's edge significantly detracted from the natural allure, leaving much to be desired in terms of maintenance. Moreover, the water's green and murky state further suggested a neglect that urgently needs addressing. Comparatively, places like Cachuma Lake seem to receive more attention from their respective caretakers. It's disheartening to see such a picturesque location suffer from inadequate care; a call to action for the Los Padres National Forest staff to elevate their conservation efforts is necessary to restore and preserve its beauty.

Attended a hibachi dinner with a party of 6 and encountered several service mishaps despite the restaurant being quiet. Our waitress mixed up our sushi orders by serving them all on one plate, making it challenging to distinguish who ordered what, and forgot several items. Although hibachi dining is typically vibrant and engaging, our chef, Francisco, though skilled at cooking, barely interacted with us, dampening the usually lively experience. While the food was satisfactory, the overall service felt lackluster. Considering the price paid, it wasn't compelling enough to warrant a return, though it’s hoped that this was merely an isolated incident.

My experience with Shalimar Jewelers was exceptionally positive from start to finish. I needed an engagement ring resized and was assured it could be done the same day for an affordable cost. The friendly staff confirmed the jeweler could meet my timetable and provided an accurate estimate. Upon collection, the ring was expertly resized, although, due to my error in sizing, it ended up too small. The Shalimar team displayed remarkable understanding and promptly adjusted the size at no extra charge, despite the mistake being mine. Their professionalism and kindness throughout the process not only resolved a potentially awkward situation with ease but also secured my loyalty as a customer. Thanks to their exceptional service, I highly recommend Shalimar to anyone seeking quality jewelry services.

Upon locals' recommendation, I visited Milktooth in Indianapolis and found it to be a true gem. My experience there was genuinely remarkable, and I'm thrilled to have had the opportunity to dine at this outstanding establishment.

This spot is a fantastic choice for both happy hour and dinner, offering a great patio equipped with fans to comfortably deal with St. Louis's heat. The staff here are exceptionally accommodating, happily modifying dishes to personal taste preferences, such as serving the Veal Milanese with mixed greens instead of pasta. Highly recommended for a delightful dining experience.

"Enjoyed an exceptional dining experience with delicious gnocchi served in a rich marinara sauce and a savory baked eggplant appetizer that impressed. While service was notably slow, the quality of the food more than compensates for the wait. A place worth revisiting for its culinary delights."

This review lavishes praise on the Sonoran Dog, particularly highlighting its bun as a standout feature, comparing its comforting embrace to that of a snuggie. The bun's warm, soft, chewy, and fragrant qualities are noted as surpassing expectations, defying initial skepticism of being overly indulgent. The hot dog itself is described as flavorful, with a suggestion for increased bite or snap in either the hot dog or the bacon to counterbalance the strong flavors of mustard and onions. The review also gives a nod to the carne asada caramelo, applauding its excellent tortilla, the combination of salty, melty cheese, and well-prepared carne. Notably, the affordability and convenience of a drive-through option are highlighted as additional positives.
Excellent spot for breakfast, offering fluffy, perfect waffles and deliciously crunchy home fries. The waitstaff is friendly, enhancing the dining experience. A definite return is in the plans!

This establishment offers an exceptional dining experience, with special commendations to Douglas for his tremendous service. The delicious culinary options, albeit on the pricier side, averaging $40-$50 per main course, are well justified by the top-tier atmosphere that rivals the nation's finest restaurants.

This restaurant consistently impresses with every visit—offering a delightful dining experience from start to finish. The staff, including servers and bartenders, are well-informed about the menu, providing excellent recommendations and modifications for gluten-free options. Their expertise greatly enhances the dining experience, ensuring safety and satisfaction for those with Celiac disease. Both the wine and cocktail menus are carefully curated, complementing the divine food offerings perfectly. The only minor drawback is the lack of a gluten-free dessert option, which means looking elsewhere for a sweet ending. Despite this, the overall excellence of the restaurant makes it a favorite destination worth revisiting.

I recently visited a blow bar where I had the pleasure of having my brows done by Natalie, a highly skilled brow specialist. I wholeheartedly recommend her for her exceptional work on my eyebrows. Additionally, I received a blow-dry from Victoria and was truly impressed. Despite my thin, straight, and lifeless hair, she managed to give me the most volume I've ever had. While I did try another stylist, Victoria surpassed expectations, making her my go-to from now on. The salon itself is remarkably clean and beautiful, enhancing the overall experience.

This cafe is a standout in the city, acclaimed for its exceptional black and white latte that strikes the perfect balance between sweetness and foam. Even those indifferent to soups will find their offerings irresistibly good. Its spacious layout provides an ideal workspace with an ambient noise level and music volume that enhances the experience. The pet-friendly policy adds a charming touch, making it a favored spot for both work and relaxation. It's clear why it has earned such loyalty from its patrons, including a commitment to return for as long as possible.

Holy Smokes indeed! The innovative fusion of actual pumpkin pie with frozen custard is nothing short of genius. It's a wonder this hasn't taken the country by storm yet. The highlight, undoubtedly, are the pie crust chunks - a delightful surprise that elevates the whole experience. It's like uncovering a treasure within a treasure. Absolutely delicious!

Upland Brewery, originating from Bloomington, Indiana, has expanded its presence within central Indiana, earning acclaim for its diverse range of high-quality beers. The brewery’s foray into the culinary scene has also garnered positive feedback, particularly for its burgers and tenderloins, which have become favorites among patrons. However, its venture into pizza seems to fall short of the high standards set by its other offerings. The margherita pizza, with its cracker-like crust and lack of a traditional red sauce, offers a lighter alternative that might not satisfy those seeking the hearty, flavorful experience typically associated with Upland’s food menu. Despite the quality of the cheese, the overall flavor profile of the pizza is somewhat lacking, making it more suitable as a group appetizer rather than a fulfilling main course. For those looking for a satisfying meal at Upland, the burgers and tenderloins remain the recommended options.
The show provided an immensely enjoyable experience, offering a perfect, relaxed way to spend a Friday night.

This local sushi spot, the town's sole option for sushi enthusiasts, surprisingly stands up to the task of satisfying sushi cravings, especially when time is of the essence. The salmon emerges as the star offering, highly recommended for its quality. Patrons also speak highly of the spicy edamame, tempura, ocean salad, and cabbage salad, adding variety and depth to the dining experience. Complementing the delectable fare is the consistently friendly and efficient service, making it a reliable choice for both sushi aficionados and those seeking a quick, pleasing meal.

**Review of Naked Tchopstix Express**

Rating: ★★★½

Having been a fan of the 96th Street Naked Tchopstix, I ventured to this new location with high hopes. Geared more towards takeout, yet with a sizeable dining area, this branch presents a different ambiance. The concept of ordering at the counter and customizing your sushi bowl via a paper selection sheet is convenient and eliminates any order confusion. While the sushi bowl was decent, offering a good variety of sauces and a selection of proteins, the limited vegetable options and an overly generous portion of rice detracted from the overall experience. My partner's attempt at enjoying our favorite Maui roll from the original location fell short here, lacking the consistency and quality we've come to expect.

Despite these aspects, I do see the appeal for those nearby and believe the sushi bowls could satisfy many. I also want to address service-related complaints I've come across; patience is key, as quality sushi preparation takes time, contrasting the fast-food industry's pace significantly. Additionally, the bubble tea here is a delightful discovery, with the strawberry flavor proving to be quite enjoyable. I'm eager to try the vanilla chai on my next visit.

Ultimately, while not without its flaws, Naked Tchopstix Express is a commendable attempt at offering a healthier fast food alternative in the area, meriting a return visit.

I had an excellent lunch experience with both the beef brisket sandwich and the pulled pork standing out for their juiciness and tender quality. Both dishes were equally impressive, making for a highly satisfying meal.
This restaurant offers the finest Thai cuisine in the area, presenting an authentic and delectable menu that promises a delightful experience. Its excellence guarantees repeat visits.
Disappointing dining experience with subpar service and mediocre food. Regrettably, not the farewell meal I had hoped for in town.

My recent dining experience with my wife at this restaurant over the weekend was exceptionally pleasing. The highlight of our meal was the rapid service and the fresh, homemade quality of our dishes. The only dilemma we faced was deciding what to order due to the tempting variety of options on the menu. We are eagerly looking forward to our next visit, especially to explore the upcoming chef specials. A definite recommendation for anyone looking to enjoy a delightful meal.

This restaurant offers decent food, warranting at least two stars. However, the service experience significantly detracts from the dining experience. Despite a considerable spend on entrées and appetizers, my request for additional avocado on my tuna entrée was met with a lack of helpfulness from the staff, including an assistant cook who was disengaged and unhelpful. The requirement to be billed extra for a simple addition, coupled with the effort needed to receive service, undermines the overall dining experience.

My first visit to this restaurant exceeded expectations! It boasts a warm, home-like ambiance that immediately puts you at ease. The service is commendable, with waiters who are not only efficient but genuinely funny and pleasant. The food, a true highlight, was served promptly and was nothing short of phenomenal. I'm already looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommend!

This charming spot offers delicious burgers, fries, and salads with a unique hint of salt and pepper flavor enhancing the burgers. The quaint setting is complemented by outdoor seating only, creating a cozy atmosphere. The staff is friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall pleasant dining experience. Conveniently, there is both street parking and a parking lot available at the back, making access easy. A great choice for those seeking tasty food in a delightful setting.

This store shines in its exemplary customer service, with staff consistently going above and beyond in helpfulness and friendliness. Its cleanliness and expansive size further enhance the shopping experience. Remarkably, it maintains a robust inventory, ensuring shoppers find what they need. A standout service is the customization of breakfast bagels by the attentive staff, adding a personal touch that makes each visit special. Overall, an outstanding establishment that prioritizes customer satisfaction in every aspect.

I had an excellent experience with this service center a few years ago when I took my vehicle in for a manufacturer recall. Not only was the initial problem resolved, but when I later returned with a different issue, Kevin and his mechanic quickly identified and fixed it at no extra charge, despite my willingness to pay. Their generosity and service quality are truly outstanding. Highly recommended!

This review highlights a strong affection for Sweet CeCe's frozen yogurt offerings and its wide array of toppings catering to both healthy choices and indulgent treats. While the reviewer expresses a love for the product, they also note some inconsistencies in service, such as the attentiveness of staff and the need to remind them about ongoing deals like "$5 Friday". Despite these service hiccups, the reviewer's fondness for the product itself is unwavering, leading them to rate their local Sweet CeCe's location no less than 4 stars.

This new spot in the Funk Zone is a delightful addition, offering delicious bites alongside tastings that exemplify the good life. Conveniently located right next to the Santa Barbara Wine Collective, it even shares tables with it, allowing for an integrated experience. Our visit was made memorable with the enjoyment of a fabulous savory croissant. A must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in the local flavors and wines.

This tranquil spot offers a serene atmosphere for massages with the convenience of accommodating same-day appointments seamlessly. Every therapist encountered here consistently delivers beyond expectations, ensuring a satisfying and rejuvenating experience.

Our experience at the Peppermill was overwhelmingly positive, marked by the ease of check-in around 2:30 pm, complete with the perk of complimentary valet parking. The vastness of the establishment bore a striking resemblance to the grandeur of Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, complemented by a diverse array of eight on-site restaurants catering to a myriad of culinary preferences. The casino area was expansive, presenting a wide selection of gaming options although the presentation of penny slots turned out to be misleading, with actual minimum bets ranging from 30 cents to $5—an unexpected twist that felt like false advertising.

We stayed in the Tuscany Tower, comfortably settled on the 12th floor. Our room offered a delightful view of the extensive pool area, and the amenities were notably generous. The inclusion of free WiFi, a spacious bathroom equipped with a large dual-head shower, a jetted bathtub, and even a phone next to the commode, elevated our stay. The room itself was well-appointed: a king-sized bed, ample seating, a mini-fridge, and a safe, among other conveniences, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable stay. The efficient thermostat maintained a pleasant room temperature, further adding to our comfort.

The hospitality of the staff was commendable; their courteous and helpful demeanor contributed significantly to the quality of our experience. The Peppermill, with its impressive facilities and attentive service, made for a very pleasant and memorable stay.

"My boyfriend and I visited a deli recently and had a delightful experience. I enjoyed a turkey, avocado, and bacon panini, while he savored a buffalo chicken wrap. We were both impressed by the swift service, especially valuable during a busy lunch hour. The variety on offer was a high point - from salads, soups, and macaroni to sandwiches and hot meals, the options seemed endless. The diverse menu ensures that there's something for everyone. We're already looking forward to our next visit!"

This bustling spot boasts amazing biscuits and unparalleled accompaniments, complemented by a great selection of cocktails. Highly recommended for its quality offerings, just be prepared for a bit of a crowd.

The dining experience was delightful, offering tasty food set within a cozy fishing lodge ambiance. The menu strikes a balance between Outback Steakhouse and Bonefish Grill, providing a range of appealing options. We availed a Groupon deal, opting for three meals alongside a calamari appetizer, all of which were impeccably cooked. Given the overall quality and setting, we're certainly planning a return visit.

This spot hits you straight with its budget-friendly allure, yet fails to rise above its affordability, delivering a taste and experience that screams 'cheap.' On the upside, its pricing and location score points, alongside a few edible delights like baked and fried chicken, mashed potatoes, a basic salad and meat and cheese bar, ravioli, pizza, and a commendable dessert selection. The service also stands out, thanks to an exceptionally attentive waitress. However, the offerings transition from okay to disappointing as you encounter a less impressive meat slicing station and a lackluster Mexican station, with underwhelming shrimp that’s not even deveined. The real letdowns are in the breakfast menu, notably the egregiously bad eggs, inedible eggs Benedict, and a steak and shrimp that miss the mark by miles, not to forget the regrettable breaded items. To top it off, the decor is trapped in a 1970s design nightmare. Despite giving it three chances, this place consistently fails to impress, making it difficult to recommend for anything beyond saving a few bucks.

My stay at Hotel Palomar was highlighted by the convenient location of their in-house restaurant, which could have easily earned a perfect score if not for a single pretentious waiter. On the first evening, my coworker and I faced an unwelcoming reception from this particular staff member, who seemed irritated by our presence and request to split the bill, leaving a sour taste from an otherwise unwarranted interaction.

Despite this initial setback, our subsequent visit was a complete turnaround, thanks to an exceptional bartender named Ben. His warm welcome, engaging conversation, and insightful cocktail recommendations exemplified the pinnacle of hospitality. Ben's passion for his craft and genuine interest in our experience redeemed the restaurant in our eyes, transforming our perception entirely.

The culinary offerings, particularly the room service options like the bacon-wrapped dates and chocolate cake, were delightful and underscored the restaurant's potential for excellence. It's a reminder that the attitude and service of staff can profoundly affect the dining experience. Overall, this establishment comes highly recommended, with a note that sometimes, a single negative interaction can overshadow an otherwise stellar experience.

After a Sunday morning stroll in the park, I decided to stop by this place and was pleasantly surprised. The food and coffee were exceptional, matched by their commendable customer service. The vibe inside truly sets it apart. Highly recommend for a relaxed and satisfying experience.

The experience at this hyped venue can be summarized as disappointing. Service was sluggish, with a considerable wait for the food, which did not meet expectations, particularly the burger that was significantly overdone contrary to a medium-rare request. While the Seafood Jumbalaya was acceptable, it did not justify the high price. Overall, this establishment falls short of its reputation, and better dining options are available in the French Quarter. It wasn't a terrible visit, but it certainly didn't live up to the acclaim.

This hotel offers a comfortable stay with its cozy beds, delicious breakfast, fast internet, and an unbeatable location, all at a low price point. Overall, it leaves a remarkable impression on its guests. However, a notable drawback is the long elevator wait times of up to 15 minutes in the morning for those staying on the top floors.

This establishment fails to meet the basic expectations of a restaurant, offering a bewildering self-service experience that necessitates patrons fetching their own water, paying for drinks separately up a flight of stairs, and settling into unkempt yard seating. Moreover, after placing and paying for orders at a window, the extent of staff interaction involves merely delivering the food. The sole redeeming feature seems to be the live music, but that hardly compensates for the overall lackluster experience. This visit was decidedly a one-time affair, never to be repeated.

This establishment takes an à la carte approach to dining, where nearly every addition comes with a price tag. The food, while not bad, fails to leave a strong impression. Service is accommodating, as demonstrated when a request for spicier salsa and pico de gallo was happily fulfilled. However, communication about drink options could be improved, evidenced by an unexpected switch from a requested fountain Coke to a pricier bottled version, without prior notice of available soda brands or the cost.

The menu prices appear reasonable at first glance, but the cost quickly escalates with add-ons. Simple requests like extra cheese on a taco or a side of sour cream come with additional charges, and even a second basket of chips is not complimentary. Surprisingly, the bill revealed that the price of condiments and extras eclipse the cost of the actual meal. For future patrons, a word of advice: always inquire about potential extra charges to avoid an unexpectedly high tab. This dining experience serves as a reminder that what seems like a budget-friendly menu at first can quickly become costly due to the à la carte pricing structure.

Visited a charming cafe that impressed with its ambiance right at 8am, featuring a live jazz band that added to the cozy atmosphere. I opted for the breakfast sandwich, which was not only delicious but also uniquely prepared with a rolled egg and bacon pieces inside. Besides the delightful meal, the pricing was reasonable for a filling breakfast. Highly recommend for an enjoyable start to the day!

This spot undoubtedly ranks high on the awesome scale, particularly heralded for its duckfat french fries, which, while tasty, were actually outshone by the rest of the meal. My visit, which doubled as a birthday outing, started with a modest wait and drinks nearby, culminating in a warm reception at the bar by Keith, a whiskey-savvy and friendly bartender. The appetizers, cape may salts and tater tots, set a delightful tone. Dinner impressed further with a standout Kentucky Fried Quail for me and a remarkable Fois Gras burger for my companion, justifying its price tag. While the accompanying cheese sauce was skippable, it hardly detracted from the overall experience. Eagerly anticipating my next visit, I recommend this place wholeheartedly to all acquaintances.

The dining experience at this restaurant was disappointing from the start, beginning with an artichoke dip that was served cold alongside stale chips. Despite mentioning this to our waitress, the issue wasn't resolved. The main course, a large thin crust pizza with added toppings, turned out to be quite pricey and only moderately satisfying in taste. Although the server performed her duties well, aside from not addressing our initial complaint, the overall experience failed to meet expectations. Having had a better experience during a previous visit for a Cardinals game, it seems the quality has dwindled. I'll be considering other venues in the future.

On my fiancé’s birthday, we ventured to Jasmine Rice on a Yelp recommendation and were mostly pleased with our experience. The attempt to order summer rolls fell flat due to seasonal availability, leading us to choose the pan-fried dumplings instead. While tasty, they wouldn’t be our first pick next time. The stars of the meal were the green curry fried rice with duck, which was exceptionally good, and the chicken pad thai, though we found it a bit sweeter than preferred. A dash of chili sauce enhanced it nicely. Service was decent for us, though we observed others facing delays. The owner's gesture to rectify a take-out error by personally delivering the missing item was impressive. Despite minor hiccups, Jasmine Rice provided a good quality Thai dining experience that warrants a return visit.

Courtney is an exceptional hairstylist, highly recommended for her unparalleled skill and ability to understand her clients' needs and preferences. Her knack for determining the best hairstyles for her clients without explicit directions stands out, showcasing her deep understanding of individual styles and limits. With a great personality and extensive knowledge, Courtney consistently delivers impressive results, leaving clients thoroughly satisfied and feeling their best. She represents the epitome of professionalism and talent in her field.

This location, while part of a well-known chain and lacking in allure, consistently delivers on the basics, making it a reliable choice for routine automotive needs. Whether it's an oil change or a state inspection you're after, this place has you covered. The trick to a swift visit is timing it right to avoid busy periods. Overall, while it might not offer anything out of the ordinary, it provides decent service for those in need of standard car maintenance.

Recently replaced two outdated 1970s Lennox units with brand-new models, and I couldn't be happier with both the installation process and performance. The new units have been operating flawlessly for 3 years, showcasing the quality of both the product and the installation team's workmanship. Highly recommend.

The Brewpub impresses with its diverse menu, offering everything from nachos to pizza and sandwiches, complemented by an extensive variety of onsite-crafted beers. While service tends to be slow, it encourages a laid-back atmosphere, perfect for enjoying the patio and the company of friends. The establishment is notably inclusive, catering to families, pet owners, and those with vegetarian or vegan dietary preferences. Personal favorites include the half order of nachos or the fish & chips, with the Pumpkin Seasonal Beer standing out as a highlight, aligning with some of the best pumpkin beers available.

This delightful farmhouse-style store brings a rustic, chic charm to SB, offering an impressive array of home decor options at reasonable prices. With helpful staff keen on sharing great decorating ideas, shopping here feels like a creative adventure. The store features a selection of items from Joanna Gaines of "Fixer Upper" fame among its treasures, ensuring quality and style. It's a breath of fresh air for those seeking a quality home store in SB without breaking the bank.

My brother's visit turned into a delightful evening thanks to this gem of a place. Not only were we able to grab a six-pack of top-notch beer, but we also stayed longer than intended, engrossed in rounds of Super Smash Brothers on a Nintendo 64, interestingly donated by patrons. Beyond the nostalgic gaming, the place boasts delicious food and a warm, friendly atmosphere, making it a must-visit spot in the Northeast. It's places like these that truly enhance the community vibe and should be celebrated.

At my recent visit to this establishment, I had the pleasure of indulging in my usual favorites: coconut soup and pad Thai with chicken. The coconut soup truly stood out, boasting the perfect balance of creaminess without being overwhelmed by herbs—a notable departure from the heavily Americanized versions I'm accustomed to, with the exception of my beloved cilantro. The pad Thai didn’t disappoint either. It struck the right note with its generous sprinkle of peanuts, chewy noodles that weren’t overly sweet, and a hearty serving of moist, white chicken meat. Overall, my meal was thoroughly enjoyable and left me very satisfied.

This diner offers excellent service along with great diner classics, including an all-day breakfast option. Despite visiting during a busy lunchtime, the staff remained exceptionally friendly and hospitable. Additionally, its location is conveniently accessible off the 295, enhancing the dining experience.

This bar has quickly become my Saturday night favorite, especially since Lucy's closure. Located just across the street, it offers unexpectedly good food, with their wings and fries being a must-try—though a word of caution on their 'wtf' sauce. While it can sometimes be a challenge to catch the bartender's attention due to the bustling crowd, the lively atmosphere is part of its charm. Plus, there's the added excitement of potentially seeing the Always Sunny crew. Overall, a pleasantly surprising find!

Despite initial reservations about the Shellfish Company on the Wharf, reminiscing experiences of tourist traps with subpar, overpriced food, this establishment proved to be a delightful exception. Encouraged by its strong Yelp reviews, our gamble paid off splendidly. The place, although small—and predictably with a wait time—managed to seat us in about 20 minutes during a tapering dinner rush.

Opting for the day's special, we indulged in the local rock crab served with salad and a choice between soup or chowder, all priced at an enticing $25 for 3 lbs. The portion sizes were generous, especially the hearty servings of soup and chowder. Between the two, the shrimp bisque stood out as a remarkable choice and comes highly recommended.

The star of the meal, the rock crab, was absolutely divine. Its juicy, buttery meat justified the effort required to crack open the rather thick shells, which, thankfully, splintered easily indicating they were cooked to perfection. Not only was our crab feast satisfying, but it also presented as an excellent value for money, making our dining experience at the Shellfish Company a memorable highlight of our trip. Ordering the crab here is, without a doubt, a "safe proposition" that I eagerly endorse.

Weaver's Way Co-op receives a glowing endorsement from a contented member who finds the community and shopping experience particularly suited to individuals living alone. Contrary to some critiques suggesting the co-op is inconvenient or exclusive to certain lifestyles, this review highlights the benefits of shopping at Weaver's Way for single shoppers, including the ability to purchase smaller quantities and access to locally-grown, natural, and preservative-free products at reasonable prices compared to other health-focused stores like Whole Foods. The reviewer appreciates the diversity within the community, moving beyond stereotypes to recognize a shared commitment among members from varied backgrounds. Beyond just shopping, contributing through work hours and committee participation has been a fulfilling aspect of their membership, reinforcing the co-op's emphasis on community engagement and support. The reviewer acknowledges that while the co-op model might not suit everyone, for those aligned with Weaver's Way’s values, it offers an unparalleled shopping and community experience. Those less certain about committing can still explore the co-op's offerings by paying a visitor's fee, ensuring the co-op remains inclusive and welcoming to all interested individuals.

This barbecue spot doesn't quite hit the mark for me personally, although it clearly has its fans, including my husband. It's not my first choice for BBQ, as my experiences suggest that enjoyment greatly depends on your menu selections.

The hotel's in-room entertainment options and amenities leave much to be desired, particularly for the price point. Charging $4.99 for TV shows, which inconveniently still include commercials, comes off as a nickel-and-dime strategy, not befitting the expectations set by a nightly rate exceeding $150. Additionally, the absence of a complimentary breakfast, a staple even in budget accommodations throughout California, and the presence of an overly expensive buffet option, further detracts from the overall value offered. This approach to guest services unfortunately undermines the perceived classiness of the establishment.

During my stay at a nearby hotel, I decided to visit this shop and was pleasantly surprised by the super nice and friendly staff. They offer an enticing buy one get one deal, which I took advantage of. I also tried their hot wings, which were quite tasty and generously coated in sauce. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and will definitely return for more pizza on my next visit to town.

I recently indulged in the cannolis from Termini Bros, and they were nothing short of awesome! What sets them apart is that they are filled fresh upon ordering, ensuring a perfectly crisp shell every time. The filling is truly phenomenal, striking the perfect balance of sweetness. Whether you're a cannoli aficionado or a skeptic, I highly recommend giving Termini Bros a try - their cannoli might just convert you!

During our RV travels, we stumbled upon a delightful cafe in Granite City. The welcoming and sweet staff made us feel right at home. True to its homestyle vibe, every meal we had was both fresh and delicious, capturing the essence of home cooking perfectly. We were so impressed that we ate there twice. Highly recommend for a taste of comfort on the road. Yum!

After three weeks of exploring, I discovered an outstanding spot off of Magazine Street that genuinely lives up to the hype. The staff is welcoming and the Phò is excellent, definitely satisfying my love for the dish. Highly recommended!
"Our family's repeat visit for breakfast once again showcased impeccable food and service, solidifying our high recommendation."

The kayaking tour at Santa Cruz Island proved to be an exceptional experience, greatly exceeding our expectations. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, thanks to our guide, Jen, who was not only helpful but also highly informative, enhancing our exploration of the caves. Overall, this adventure is one we highly recommend.
"Highly recommend for those seeking tasty food at a fair price. The shrimp and goat cheese crepes are a standout choice!"

After over a decade in the St. Louis area, my initial visit to this iconic local establishment left me regretful for not discovering it sooner. This multifaceted venue impresses with its factory tours (available Friday-Sunday, noon-5pm), a cozy shop, inviting bar, and a pleasurable dining space, along with live music events on weekends. It's a joy to explore, albeit you might experience a brief wait before dining, which is hardly a deterrent.

The beer selection is outstanding, with the Hefeweizen standing out as a perfect introduction for those less inclined toward beer. The food is equally commendable, featuring locally sourced ingredients that elevate simple dishes, such as the exquisite pizza and the noteworthy bison burger, to memorable culinary experiences.

Contributing to the venue’s charm is the exceptional service, marked by a staff that brings a vibrant and alternative energy to the atmosphere. While the pricing leans toward the upscale, the quality of food, drink, and the overall experience more than justify the cost. This place isn't just a dining option; it's a celebration of St. Louis tradition and local craftsmanship that demands repeated visits. An absolute must-try for both locals and visitors alike.

This restaurant visit was extremely disappointing, meriting a zero-star rating if possible. My simple request for a plain hamburger was unmet, as it was served with bacon, to which I am allergic. Attempting to resolve the issue at the drive-through resulted in the staff member taking the burger without comment and instructing me, somewhat rudely, to go inside for a resolution. Even then, an apology was notably absent. This experience has led me to decide against returning to this establishment, despite my desire for diverse dining options post-DT. It seems Freebirds will be my go-to place instead.
Had a fantastic first visit; the car wash and service were top-notch. Very satisfied and grateful.

Recently opened Sushi Nara has quickly become a favorite dining spot, winning over hearts with its cleanliness, friendly staff, and swift service. The sushi here is consistently delicious across multiple visits, offering great value with reasonable prices—for instance, four sushi rolls for just $24. The freshness of the menu, which boasts a large variety, is a highlight. A definite recommendation for those on the eastside looking for quality sushi.

This quaint shop stands out for its unique selection of tires and parts rarely found elsewhere. The knowledgeable and passionate owner adds a personal touch that enhances the shopping experience, making it a must-visit for enthusiasts and professionals alike.

This frequented spot in Florissant shines as a hidden gem, especially renowned for serving the best Panang curry in the area. The consistently good food keeps visitors coming back, cementing its status as a beloved local favorite. Though there's mention of a sister restaurant, the allure of this place's fare makes it hard to venture elsewhere. A testament to quality and taste, it remains a top choice for those in the know.

This dining experience was a mixed bag, meriting a 3-star review due to a combination of factors. While the overarching menu, restaurant design, and concept were appealing enough to warrant a revisit, the specific dishes sampled fell short of expectations. The tomato-basil soup was likened to a diluted marinara sauce, and the unique take on a tuna melt was marred by an excessively sharp, possibly citrusy flavor that detracted from the overall enjoyment. Despite these culinary missteps, there's an anticipation to explore other menu items in the future, particularly those featuring cured Italian meats such as mortadella and prosciutto, as well as the enticing baked goods like the Nutella bruschetta.

Visited once and left disappointed. The veggie pizza lacked flavor, particularly in the tomato sauce, and was skimped on cheese. The dough seemed machine-prepared, contributing to the subpar experience. My husband's sub sandwich also failed to impress. Despite the possibility of improvement, we're hesitant to give it another try.

During a late-night quest for desserts, my friends and I ventured into "More Than Just Ice Cream," intrigued by the name's promise of a diverse sweet treat menu. While we didn't explore beyond the frozen delights, our choice of milkshakes reflected a decent sampling of their offerings. We ordered three flavors: coffee, chocolate, and a black & white malt, with the latter stealing the show in terms of thickness and overall satisfaction. The coffee and chocolate options, though tasty, left a bit to be desired in terms of creaminess. An accidental star was discovered via a pre-order sample of their pumpkin pie ice cream, which was nothing short of amazing, sowing seeds of regret in my choice for not opting for it instead. This experience hints that while the milkshakes are enjoyable, the real treasures at "More Than Just Ice Cream" might be found elsewhere on their menu. Next time, I'm keen to dive deeper into what their name truly offers.

The experience of celebrating a 100th birthday at this establishment was truly exceptional. The attention to detail, from securing a great table with a view to providing complimentary dishes and a beautifully decorated cake plate, exceeded expectations. The servers were both warm and attentive, contributing to a memorable occasion. It's clear the establishment goes above and beyond to make special occasions unforgettable. Highly recommended for those looking to celebrate in a memorable way.

This establishment impresses with its welcoming atmosphere and outstanding service, particularly from the skilled bartender. The highlight is undoubtedly the burger, notable for its freshness and dedication to local ingredients, a theme that appears consistent across all dishes served. Moreover, the culinary presentation is equally amazing, promising a feast for both the eyes and the palate. Beverage-wise, the cold beer and expertly mixed drinks do not disappoint, enhancing the dining experience. This place distinguishes itself as a dedicated local gem, not just another chain, backed by a team of commendable employees. Highly recommended for those seeking quality dining with a personal touch.

During my 5-day stay, I frequented a particular restaurant adjacent to our hotel 4 times, drawn by its convenient hours (11AM-10:30PM), swift seating for parties of two, and the excellent value of their oyster deal at $9 per dozen. Additionally, the seafood shop next door offers a convenient option for fresh and boiled seafood to-go. The consistent friendliness of our server, who recognized us on each visit, added a personal touch to the experience.

However, despite these positive aspects, I can only rate this restaurant 3 stars due to several drawbacks. The overall quality of the food was disappointing, with the raw oysters not being properly cleaned, and other dishes such as the turtle soup and boiled shrimp not meeting expectations due to odd flavors or poor texture. Moreover, while the ambiance of the restaurant was inviting, it lacked comfort, prompting us to leave promptly after eating. A significant downside was the cleanliness of the bathrooms, which needs immediate attention.

In conclusion, although there are aspects of this restaurant that I appreciated, the cons significantly impacted the overall dining experience. I might consider returning for the convenience and the seafood deals if I'm in the area or for a quick takeaway, but it wouldn't be my first choice for dining in.

This dining experience can be summed up as disappointing, to say the least. The service left much to be desired with the server appearing disoriented and unattentive, requiring patrons to repeatedly request basics such as cutlery and water refills. The food order was inaccurately fulfilled, receiving eggplant parmesan instead of the requested chicken parmesan, bizarrely accompanied by a fish bone. The sole saving grace of this experience were the drinks. Overall, those seeking a pleasant meal should consider other options.

TDS restaurant leaves much to be desired with its lackluster ambiance, characterized by a striking lack of decor, no visible menu, and the unconventional choice of stainless steel prep tables for dining. Despite the food being reasonably priced and mostly enjoyable, the establishment's policy of charging for extra salsa—despite significant orders placed—leaves a sour taste. With an overwhelming presence of unidentifiable staff and a cold, unwelcoming atmosphere, the decent quality of the food couldn't compensate for the overall disappointing experience. Unlikely to revisit.

I've had the pleasure of working with Angela Clifton Photography on three separate occasions, and each time has been a delight. The quality of the photographs is outstanding—every picture captures the moment perfectly. What makes these sessions extra special, though, is the fun experience they provide, making the whole process enjoyable. Their pricing is very reasonable, offering great value for such high-quality keepsakes. My experiences with Angela Clifton Photography have been entirely positive, and I treasure the pictures we've received. Highly recommended for anyone looking for memorable and beautifully captured moments.

I had a pleasant dining experience at a sidewalk table, enjoying my fish meal. Though on the pricier side, the food quality was good. For those seeking a quieter outdoor dining option, I recommend heading to a side street in the French Quarter.

This courthouse, with its significant age, boasts magnificent art that enhances its historical ambiance. A notable feature is the amusing spiral staircase, adding a unique twist to the architecture. Visitors will find the panoramic city views from the 5th level particularly impressive. The tower clock room, with its intricate mechanical gears, is surprisingly fascinating. However, access to this area requires a prior appointment. Overall, spending 2 to 3 hours exploring this venue is definitely worthwhile for those interested in history, art, and mechanical wonders.

I had an outstanding experience with Ann today, who was not only incredibly helpful and positive but also went out of her way to ensure my first visit was exceptional. Her efforts have made me a loyal customer from now on. Thank you, Ann!

I recently ventured into a local Thai restaurant for the first time and was pleasantly surprised by the experience. Opting for a combination dinner of pad Thai and coconut soup, I found the soup delightfully tasty, a new experience for my palate. The pad Thai met my expectations perfectly, embodying the classic flavors I was craving. The ambiance was authentically Thai, complemented by great decor and music, enhancing the dining experience. Service was excellent, with attentive and friendly staff. In a town with limited dining options, this restaurant stands out as a refreshing alternative. It's quickly becoming my favorite spot in Carp for a satisfying meal.

This spot provides a truly chill and relaxing atmosphere, making it a must-return destination. The highlight was the entertaining and eclectic live artist, offering a memorable twist on classics like a country rendition of "Let It Go." An undeniable charm that's hard not to adore.

The Smoothie King Center, previously known as the New Orleans Arena, has undergone a significant transformation that enhances the overall visitor experience. While the seating remains unchanged, the rest of the venue has received a commendable facelift. A major highlight is the expanded variety and improved quality of food options, catering to diverse palates with offerings that range from standard concessions to full-service bars and sweet treats like funnel cake and cotton candy. The addition of upgraded drink selections, including spiked lemonade and an array of beers and smoothies, further complements the elevated dining experience. The arena now exudes a more sophisticated and top-tier atmosphere, signaling a positive shift in its appeal and functionality. Overall, the upgrades significantly enhance the enjoyment of events at the Smoothie King Center, making it a must-visit destination for both new and returning guests.

Whenever I'm feeling under the weather, Chipotle's steak has a magical way of making me feel better. However, it's essential to avoid the lunchtime rush for a more serene experience. I've found the sweet spot to visit is between 2 and 4 PM, where peace prevails. Regardless of the time, though, the service remains consistently friendly and swift. Highly recommended for a quick, comforting meal.

This Indian restaurant in Tampa Bay exceeded expectations remarkably. Despite initial skepticism, the combination of an elegant ambiance with white table linen and extraordinary cuisine truly impressed. Highlights included the unforgettable Chicken 65 and a rich, flavorful hot sour soup that showcased the culinary authenticity and prowess on offer. Service was another standout, with the waitress, Angel, providing friendly and attentive care. Given that this gem only opened a week ago, it's bound to become a sought-after destination for genuine Indian food enthusiasts. A must-visit.

On my third visit to New Orleans, I finally experienced one of its iconic jazz shows, thanks to reserving seats in advance for an additional $20—a decision that saved us an hour's wait in line and felt justifiable as it contributes to jazz preservation. The investment proved well worth it for the outstanding performance in a snug venue with a capacity of around 200 people, enhancing the intimacy of the experience. The musicians were not only supremely talented but also charismatic, exuding a classic charm reminiscent of concerts from half a century ago. Their finesse and interaction made the show unforgettable, truly embodying the essence of live jazz. This experience is an absolute must-do for anyone visiting New Orleans, marrying incredible live music with a touch of historical appreciation.

Title: Seamless Inspection Experience at Keystone Discount Tire

My visit to Keystone Discount Tire was nothing short of fantastic, marking my first experience with them as a new customer. Faced with unexpected free time due to rain and a too-busy dealership, I ventured to Keystone without an appointment, needing a PA State & Emissions inspection. This kind of service often leaves room for skepticism, given past experiences elsewhere with unnecessary add-ons driving up the bill. However, Keystone's superior Yelp reviews convinced me to give them a try, and I wasn’t disappointed.

Upon arrival, they promptly took my 2008 Pontiac Torrent in for inspection. The wait was comfortable, complemented by free coffee, which was a pleasant touch. During the inspection, I was invited to check on some minor tire wear, a gesture I highly value for transparency. The issue was minor, suggesting an alignment in the near future without immediate pressure or upselling— a testament to their honest service.

Bill, who oversaw my car’s inspection, impressed me with his knowledge and straightforward manner. My car passed its inspection with a clean bill of health, all within less than an hour. What I appreciated most was the final bill— no sneaky extras to inflate the charge.

I wholeheartedly recommend Keystone Discount Tire for their efficient, honest, and friendly service. Their process, from reception to completion, was streamlined and stress-free. Don’t forget to sign up for their mailing list to access valuable coupons. A genuinely great experience that will see me returning for future car service needs.

Phenomenal service! Was genuinely surprised to find my son's phone fully repaired in under 30 minutes after he dropped it. The professionalism and efficiency here are top-notch. Absolutely thrilled with the experience!

This Cracker Barrel experience was deeply disappointing due to poor service and management. After incorrectly preparing all four orders, the situation further deteriorated when the waiter reacted unprofessionally by cursing. Although the manager attempted to rectify the situation by offering free drinks, it hardly compensated for the overall negative experience. The food itself was a letdown, served cold and unpalatable, with most of it left uneaten after an excessive wait time of over an hour. This visit has completely deterred any future patronage of Cracker Barrel.

My experience at Loews city hotel surpassed all expectations for dog-friendly accommodations. Unlike the usual motel-like establishments I've encountered on the outskirts, this hotel, nestled in the heart of the city, welcomed my labrador/golden mix, Bentley, with unparalleled warmth and enthusiasm.

Right from the lobby, the staff's assurance and attentiveness immediately dispelled any unease. The reception was exceptionally hospitable, offering Bentley treats and even a welcome kit that included dog dishes, a mat, and more—a gesture that left me thoroughly impressed. It wasn't just the staff; even other guests showered Bentley with affection, making us feel entirely at home.

Our room on the top floor was fantastic, but it was the consistent, personalized service that truly stood out. From the reception to the car attendants, who greeted Bentley by name, every detail was thoughtfully catered to. This exceptional experience led us to extend our stay by an extra night.

Loews redefined city hotel hospitality for dog owners, particularly for those with larger breeds. It's a testament to their commitment to not just pet tolerance, but genuine pet friendliness. I'm wholeheartedly grateful and look forward to our next visit.

The food quality at this establishment can be hit or miss. When it's good, it's exceptional, suggesting a variability that might depend on who is in the kitchen. Sadly, this inconsistency affects the dining experience, as every second visit may not meet expectations.

Visited this spot twice and have decided to never return. The initial visit was unremarkable, but the follow-up was a disaster, particularly with a rib order that showcased inconsistent temperatures, requiring three attempts to reach an edible state. Despite multiple issues and the involvement of the manager, no compensation was offered, only a hollow apology. This lackluster experience and poor customer service response have firmly dissuaded me from giving this place another chance.

"After exploring several ramen spots with diverse menus and exceptional broth, my experience at Cheu fell short of expectations. Although the service was commendable and the beer selection appealing, the ramen itself—a crucial element—didn't hit the mark for me due to its thick noodles and overly salty broth. While my dining companion has a high regard for this place and has frequented it multiple times, regrettably, it didn't resonate with me in the same way. Despite my personal dissatisfaction, I encourage others to give Cheu a try, as my palate's preferences might be an outlier. Everyone's taste is different, after all."

Federal Doughnuts brings a delightful twist to ballpark fare, effortlessly combining the guilty pleasures of indulgent doughnuts and crispy fried chicken. This unique concession is a game-changer for food enthusiasts looking to elevate their snacking experience while enjoying the game. Additionally, the introduction of a dedicated gluten-free concession stand near Section 136 is a thoughtful touch, catering to those with specific dietary needs without compromising on variety or flavor. Offering gluten-free pizza, cheesesteaks, brownies, and cookies, this stand ensures that everyone has delicious options, making the ballpark experience inclusive and enjoyable for all attendees.

The second Red Kings location in Chinatown proves to be an excellent addition, delivering the same mouthwatering Szechuan cuisine fans have come to love. Having just opened, it's unclear if it aims to replace its predecessor or simply offer more spicy goodness. The takeout experience, featuring Dan Dan Noodles and shredded Pork in Garlic sauce, highlighted perfect spice levels combining mouth-burning sensations with sweet, earthy, and fresh flavors. Generous portions promise delightful leftovers. The prospect of trying more dishes, along with the unique offerings of sit-down dining, karaoke rooms, and a BYOB policy, makes a future visit highly anticipated.

This Chick-fil-A stands out for its remarkable speed and exceptional service, despite consistently being one of the busiest locations. The efficiency and quality of service are genuinely impressive, making it a favorite spot for many.
This place is a gem for salad lovers! Every visit guarantees a swift serving of the freshest veggies around. It's my go-to spot for lunch whenever I'm in town. Highly recommend!

On September 26th, 2015, my parents and I embarked on the Oak Alley and Laura Plantation tour. Though the name of our driver slips my mind, his engaging commentary throughout the drive significantly enhanced our experience. The scheduling of the tour was exemplary, allowing ample free time both before and after our guided explorations to leisurely wander the properties. Impressively flexible, the service accommodated drop-off locations on the return journey with ease. We chose to disembark near Jackson Square, which perfectly positioned us to soak up the vibrant atmosphere of the French Quarter for the remainder of our afternoon. Overall, the tour was a splendid blend of structured learning and personal discovery.

We've visited this spot for brunch on two occasions and loved each experience. The menu offerings, especially the scallions and sour cream grits, are outstanding. However, a heads-up for future diners: the dining area tends to be very cold, so bringing a sweater is advisable!

This reviewer highly recommends the establishment for its exceptional hot dogs and chili dogs, praising them as the best around. They express their frequent patronage and enthusiasm with a simple "yum."

Title: A Stellar Experience at the Waterline!

Review: My recent visit to the Waterline with friends on a Saturday for some live music turned out to be an amazing adventure. The ambience is top-notch, striking the perfect balance between laid-back and vibrant. When it comes to local beers, this place is unparalleled - a real treat for aficionados, offering a selection that I’d confidently say is the best in town, surpassing even the renowned Fig Mountain. A standout feature is the seamless integration with Topa, elevating the whole experience. But wait, there's more - the proximity to the Nook Restaurant allows you to indulge in incredible food with just a few steps. Not to forget, Lama Dog, which forms part of this eclectic mix, enhances the charm. If you're looking for a place that has it all, the Waterline is it. Highly recommended for an unbeatable blend of great music, superb drinks, and delicious food. A definite must-visit!

I had an exemplary experience with this tour, starting with outstanding customer service. Despite our group slightly exceeding their usual pick-up boundary, they went above and beyond to accommodate our group of 7. An incident of being overcharged was swiftly and efficiently resolved within minutes, highlighting their commitment to customer satisfaction.

The tour itself was an absolute delight. It was filled with laughter and smiles, largely thanks to our humorous tour guide. The opportunity to see a diverse array of wildlife, including alligators of various sizes, turtles, and birds, was truly exceptional. A particularly memorable moment was being able to hold a baby alligator, which underscored the guide's dedication to wildlife conservation.

The excitement was not limited to wildlife observation; the return journey featured high-speed rides and thrilling boat maneuvers, adding an adventurous twist to the experience. Based on the superb customer service, the rich educational and fun content of the tour, and the overall exhilaration of the adventure, I wholeheartedly recommend this tour to anyone looking for a unique and enjoyable experience.

We had an outstanding experience with Westfall for our roof replacement in April. The quality of the roof, the company's exceptional communication, and post-installation follow-up were highlights of the process. We are thoroughly pleased with choosing Westfall for the job.

This eatery offers a delightful choice of good food that is reasonably priced, complemented by a friendly staff. While it may not be the best spot for dining in, given its fast-food approach to vegan cuisine, it still delivers in quality and taste. The standout dish, in my opinion, is the Cheesesteak, overshadowing their highly promoted Buffalo Bella. A pro-tip for visitors: don't miss out on the sweet potato fries. They're a must-try!

The ramen spot offers an acceptable dining experience with satisfactory service. It's a decent choice for a quick visit although it might not stand out against competitors. Despite its average offering, the convenience and adequacy have resulted in repeat visits.

The restaurant offers a diverse menu that caters to various cravings, presented in a clean and trendy setting that enhances the dining experience. Its quality and variety have received high praise, making it a popular choice among patrons. To avoid the longer wait times that typically begin after 9 am, it is advisable to arrive early. Despite potential waits, the consensus is that the dining experience is highly rewarding, leaving customers exceedingly satisfied. This establishment comes with a strong recommendation for those seeking delicious food in a stylish atmosphere.

Enjoyed a delicious brisket sandwich accompanied by two sides and a drink, all for a budget-friendly $9.99. The barbecue quality was impressive for the price, and the side options - including a delightful potato casserole, creamy spinach, baked beans, and green beans - were all wonderfully prepared. A great value for excellent barbecue.

The restaurant delivered an exceptional dining experience with amazing food and service. However, a notable absence was vegetarian/vegan options, which could enhance their menu. Despite this, the anticipation to return remains high.

The establishment offers great food that clearly stands out, making repeated visits worthwhile. However, the customer service, particularly from two different older waitresses encountered across multiple visits, significantly tarnishes the dining experience. They were found to be unpleasant, detracting from the overall enjoyment. On a positive note, interactions with the owner have been lovely, indicating a potential discrepancy in service levels within the team.

I was tipped off about this gem during a flight by a Franklin local who praised it as one of Nashville's top breakfast spots, and it did not disappoint. Contrary to warnings about long lines, we breezed right in, which our waitress attributed to good timing. I indulged in a deliciously savory corn pancake topped with bacon, salsa, and sour cream—a flavor combination that left me wanting more. This spot has definitely earned a permanent spot on my must-visit list whenever I return to the south. Fantastic experience!

The service provided by Michael's detailing shop was extremely disappointing. Despite specifically making an appointment for full detailing and confirming it the day before, we were informed upon our arrival that Michael was unprepared for our appointment, suggesting we come back the following week. Upon returning at our scheduled time, the shop was unexpectedly closed, and attempts to communicate were met with a lack of responsiveness. Even after giving them another chance and waiting for an extensive period, we were still unable to receive the service we initially requested. This experience was not only frustrating due to the poor management and lack of professionalism displayed by the staff but also a significant inconvenience given the distance we traveled. Overall, this ordeal has been horrendous and absolutely not recommended.

This office provided exceptional service during a complex moving process, offering additional support beyond expectations. The team displayed top-notch professionalism and trustworthiness, ensuring a smooth experience that would confidently be recommended to close family. Their dedication and care, possibly exceeding their duty, made a lasting impression. Highly recommended for their outstanding service.

During a girls' trip last year at The Saint, my initial impressions were overwhelmingly positive—elegant lobby, enticing bar and restaurant, and a notably friendly staff created an atmosphere of sophisticated fun. Expectations for a fantastic weekend were high as I checked in early to focus on some work with the conveniences of room service. However, the appearance of a large flying roach in our room later that night dramatically shifted our experience. Despite immediate reporting, the solution offered—a different room—fell far short of comfort, presenting its own set of cleanliness issues including small spiders, dead bugs, a non-functional TV, and incomplete lamp fixtures. Our concerns seemed only superficially addressed, with no substantial action taken until I insisted on a refund the next morning, which was granted by a polite yet evidently unprepared staff member. Consequently, we moved to another hotel for the remainder of our stay, leaving behind a tarnished view of The Saint, despite their initial hospitality and decor. The incident underlined the discrepancy between first impressions and actual living conditions, leading to an unforgettable experience for all the wrong reasons. My conclusion is firm: I won't be considering a return visit, despite the offer for reconsideration after improvements.

The Green Project stands out as a versatile and sustainable solution for both sourcing inexpensive building materials and responsibly discarding excess construction supplies. With a budget as tight as $35, finding a new door is remarkably possible here, demonstrating the organization's commitment to affordability and environmental sustainability. Similarly, it serves as an invaluable resource for donating leftover building materials, preventing unnecessary waste from reaching landfills. The Green Project proves to be an essential asset for eco-conscious consumers and builders alike, promoting both economic thrift and environmental stewardship seamlessly.

This establishment on Broadway falls disappointingly short of expectations, primarily due to poor customer service and unjustifiably high prices. The bouncer's unnecessarily rude behavior significantly tarnished the experience, highlighting an unwelcoming atmosphere. It becomes clear that this place exploits its Broadway location to mistreat guests and inflate charges. As a local, I am left thoroughly dissatisfied and cannot, in good conscience, recommend this venue to anyone, tourists and fellow residents alike. It's a firm decision to never revisit.

Had an excellent lunch experience here with my girlfriend - the cleanliness of the place was outstanding, the food was delicious and impressive in its quality, and the prices were very reasonable. Eagerly looking forward to our next visit!

This once beloved spot has regrettably taken a nosedive in culinary standards, much to the dismay of longstanding patrons. Beginning with a lackluster artichoke appetizer that clearly wasn't freshly prepared, the meal spiraled downwards. The Greek salad, purportedly straight from a bag, suffered from an excessive and bland dressing, further disappointing expectations. The low point was an almost inedible serving of grilled yellowtail, which was both overcooked and of noticeably poor quality. Despite the charming setting and commendable service, the drastic decline in food quality renders this venue a hard pass. Without a significant improvement, it risks degenerating into merely another forgettable destination catering to the undiscriminating tourist crowd.

**Milktooth Review: A Twist on Brunch You Won’t Forget**

If you’re venturing into the brunch scene of Indianapolis and hunger for something beyond the conventional, Milktooth should be at the top of your list. This place turns the idea of brunch on its head with a menu that might leave you puzzled at first glance but promises a delightful culinary adventure. From innovative takes on a Dutch pancake to a raclette grilled cheese that melts in your mouth, Milktooth knows how to keep your taste buds dancing.

A standout feature here, apart from the exceptional food, is their assortment of breakfast cocktails, including a must-try michelada. Perfect for those who like their brunch with a side of boozy indulgence. The ambiance, especially if you manage to grab an outdoor seat on a warm day, adds to the allure of spending your morning here.

Be warned, though; Milktooth's popularity does mean you'll likely face a wait, often around 30 minutes on weekends. However, they ease the pain with a walk-up bar serving coffee drinks and pastries - a small teaser of the culinary excellence that awaits.

Though the menu often sees changes, certain staples receive creative updates, ensuring there’s always something new to try without straying too far from the classics that have helped cement Milktooth’s stellar reputation.

In conclusion, Milktooth isn’t just a brunch spot; it’s an experience. A place where daring dishes meet familiar comforts, all wrapped up in a vibrant atmosphere. Whether you're here for their innovative eats, delightful drinks, or both, Milktooth promises a brunch adventure worth the wait.

I recently stayed at a hotel that offered an outstanding bar experience and exceptional staff service, making my honeymoon even more special with a complimentary room upgrade. The view from our room was absolutely gorgeous, adding a memorable touch to our stay. However, the room's quality, particularly the bathroom, fell short of expectations, with noticeable rust in the tub and odd stains on the tiles. Despite these shortcomings, the hotel's positives, including its prime location in the heart of downtown St. Louis, surrounded by vibrant bars and restaurants, make it a worthy recommendation. The only drawback was the expensive valet service, prompting us to find parking a few streets away. Overall, I'd rate this hotel four stars for its great staff and strategic location, albeit with some room for improvement in its accommodations.

I had a wonderful experience taking the beginning class at this studio. The pace was just right, offering exercises that were manageable yet effectively targeted unexpected areas, providing a good little workout that even prompted a bit of sweat. Feeling fantastic afterwards was a huge plus. The cleanliness of the studio added to the positive ambiance, and the availability of Beyond Organic food products for purchase was a delightful convenience. Highly recommended for those looking to start or continue their fitness journey in a supportive, well-maintained environment.

Lobster Haven is a hidden gem for anyone craving authentic New England seafood. Previously frequenting popular chain lobster spots, my discovery of this quaint establishment was a pleasant surprise, reminiscent of the family-owned eateries in Massachusetts. The service exceeded expectations with its speed and friendliness, complimenting the extensive selection of beloved seafood classics. Whether dining in or opting to cook fresh selections at home, Lobster Haven provides an unparalleled experience. A must-visit for genuine seafood aficionados.
"Absolutely fabulous spot with an unbeatable happy hour and a fresh, delightful menu. The drinks are delicious and enticing. If possible, I'd visit daily!"

Men's Clubs barbershop consistently delivers outstanding grooming experiences. The barbers are skilled and ensure customers leave satisfied. I've been a loyal customer for three years and have always received top-notch service. On one occasion, there was a misunderstanding about a haircut style, but Tim, one of the barbers, handled it professionally, enforcing the uniqueness of each client's style. Highly recommend for anyone looking for quality and reliability in their grooming routine.

"My husband and I are regulars here, drawn back time and again by the consistently fresh food and excellent service. We can't recommend this place enough to fellow sushi and hibachi enthusiasts. It's a must-visit!"

**Chickie's and Pete's: A Spirited Sports Bar Experience**

Chickie's and Pete's embodies the quintessential sports bar ambiance ideal for catching a game and enjoying some casual dining. While the cuisine may not top the charts of culinary excellence, it offers a satisfactory selection that perfectly complements the lively atmosphere. The menu highlights include the signature crab fries and mussels red, which offer a delicious departure from the norm. Other noteworthy dishes such as the spicy pull and peel shrimp, steamers, and the indulgent blue crabs (for those willing to put in the work) enrich the experience.

A thoughtful addition is the placement of sinks throughout the venue, encouraging a hands-on dining experience without the worry of messiness. This Philadelphia staple ensures a good time with its blend of good food, drinks, and sports viewing. However, patrons should brace themselves for the bustling crowds and high-spirited fans during major sporting events, which, while part of its charm, can be overwhelming for some.

In essence, Chickie's and Pete's is a must-visit for those seeking to immerse themselves in Philly's vibrant sports culture and enjoy a laid-back meal in good company. Despite the potential for crowded spaces and the lively, sometimes rowdy, atmosphere, it remains a beloved institution for both locals and visitors.

Prompt and professional service, even on a Saturday. They seamlessly handled a simple mirror fix for me, exemplifying their consistent excellence, having experienced their great service in Charlotte as well. Highly recommend for their ease and professionalism.

I recently dined at a restaurant within Union Station in St. Louis, where the overall experience was pleasantly satisfactory. Opting for the Ponchartrain, a dish confusingly explained as synonymous with Tilapia (despite both names featuring on the menu), I found it to be a delightful choice. It was well-prepared, featuring a harmonious blend of mushrooms and a creamy sauce that elevated the dish. Our table also sampled the shrimp cocktail and lump crab cake appetizers; while both were acceptable, they didn't quite hit the mark of 'wonderful'. The drinks and service met our expectations, being perfectly acceptable without any particular faults. Opting to dine outside on the patio was a wise decision, given the favorable weather conditions, though a peek inside suggested a comfier and slightly more formal setting. In summary, this dining spot in Union Station offers a decent dining experience, especially if the weather permits enjoying their outdoor seating.

This establishment in St. Pete offers an exceptional atmosphere, earning an A+ for its unique and meticulously detailed remodel that transports patrons to a scene reminiscent of a Harry Potter film. With low-volume background music, conversations can be easily enjoyed without the need to shout, enhancing the old library-esque vibe. The bartenders, Michael and Peggy, add to the welcoming ambiance with their friendliness and engaging conversations. Although I did not sample the food, the competitively priced meat/cheese trays are enticing for a future visit. Highly recommend for an experience that stands out in the area.

Absolutely thrilled with Maple Street Patisserie! It's an outstanding spot for both breakfast and lunch, not to mention their exceptional specialty cakes perfect for Mardi Gras celebrations.
