The blueberry muffin here is unparalleled – truly the best I've ever enjoyed. Ziggy, the dedicated owner, works tirelessly to produce these delightful treats. A highly recommended gem!

I recently visited this place for their highly recommended burgers and opted for the Bourbon Black and Bleu. The burger itself met my expectations - it was delicious and cooked to my preference. However, the experience was dampened by the wait time. Despite being part of a large group of 9, the wait of over an hour for our food felt excessive. For this reason, I'm rating them 3 stars. While the food quality was top-notch, they need to improve on serving times, especially for larger parties.

Katie's has firmly established itself as our go-to dining spot for entertaining out-of-town guests, delivering a consistently delightful experience. Offering an unparalleled variety of expertly prepared dishes, this restaurant stands out for its quality and affordability. From their grilled oysters and shrimp and grits to the Cuban sandwich, pizza, and the classic soup & salad combo, Katie's guarantees a satisfying meal for every preference. Their daily specials, highlighting local and seasonal ingredients, ensure a fresh dining experience with each visit. The service at Katie's is as warm and welcoming as its meals, further enhancing the dining experience. Sundays are particularly bustling, so arriving before the post-church crowd is advisable; however, the wait is made pleasurable with bottomless Mimosas. In essence, Katie's is a culinary gem that consistently exceeds expectations, making it a favorite among locals and visitors alike.

After a warm and slightly humid day at the Zurich Classic golf tournament, I found respite at Creole Creamery. Luck was on my side as I managed to snag a street parking spot near this charming parlor. The cozy and inviting interior was a pleasant surprise, and the vast selection of ice cream flavors, including some quite unique offerings, was impressive. Opting for a scoop of cookie monster ice cream on a cone, I was pleased with my choice; it was delicious and perfectly sweetened. My visit to Creole Creamery was a delightful way to cool down and cap off the day. Definitely a must-visit spot!

This vibrant dining spot wins over hearts with its funky vibe and young, energetic atmosphere. Perfect for those who adore generous servings of Saki, beautifully prepared rolls, and heaps of rice and sashimi. While it's advisable to steer clear of certain adventurous dishes like escargot for safety reasons, the restaurant shines with its offering of lively dance music and a compelling selection of Japanese cuisine. A go-to for years, it remains a hit for a lively culinary experience.

This place is an absolute gem! We've enjoyed everything we've tried, with the Backyard Bowl standing out as our top pick. Even opting for a kids size each, or sharing a large, leaves us satisfyingly full thanks to the high-quality, nourishing ingredients used. Prices are very fair for the quality offered. Yes, it can get busy, but trust us, it's worth the wait. Highly recommend!

The service was decent, with a noticeably inexperienced but intriguing server. The food was presented well, but the gumbo could benefit from additional rice or potato salad for balance. The beverage experience was less satisfying, as the Sprite served was flat, though it wasn't a necessity for me. Overall, a mixed dining experience with room for improvement.

This pancake spot offers a decent dining experience with its fairly tasty, albeit overly sweet pancakes, priced attractively. While it boasts the convenience of serving breakfast all day, the restaurant's operation can appear disorganized during peak hours, potentially dampening the experience. Despite its offerings, there isn't anything particularly standout about the menu that sets it apart from other breakfast eateries.

Absolutely thrilled with our discoveries at this place! The staff are exceptional, making the experience even more delightful. We are in love with our finds and are eagerly looking forward to our next visit!

This cherished restaurant has been a family favorite across generations, offering a warm, personal touch that extends from its staff to its service. The team, especially Yoli and Frank, are celebrated for their kindness and efficiency, making each visit memorable. The highlight, however, is the exceptional cuisine, with the shredded beef burro and cheese crisp standing out among an array of authentic Mexican dishes. This place is a testament to tradition, quality, and the sort of hospitality that keeps you coming back for more.

The dining experience at this establishment warrants a 2-star rating, primarily due to underwhelming service and a lackluster venue. The highlight, perhaps, is the food, which is passable and might nudge the rating to 3 stars were it not for the dine-in disappointments. Specifically, the lamb kebab, my dish of choice, was serviceable in taste but disappointingly simple, served without any accompaniments like sauces or lettuce, leaving much to be desired in terms of presentation and flavor enhancement.
"The best middle eastern restaurant in the area, boasting consistently great food that never disappoints. A go-to spot for a satisfying meal that always leaves the tummy happy."

This glowing review passionately champions Potito's as the undisputed king of cannoli in the city, unequivocally surpassing both Termini's and Isgro's in quality and taste. The reviewer expresses disbelief that anyone could rate this establishment poorly, highlighting their annual tradition of visiting on Christmas Eve as a testament to its excellence. They narrate a personal anecdote to illustrate the superiority of Potito's, recalling a disappointing two-hour wait at Isgro's for tiramisu, only to find immediate satisfaction at Potito's with their unique and delicious bambino cannoli stuffed cannoli. This review positions Potito's not only as the reviewer's favored choice but as the ultimate destination for cannoli connoisseurs.

El Limon offers an authentic and delightful Mexican dining experience that stands out as the best in Pennsylvania. This charming eatery impresses with its expansive menu, including favorites like sopes, tostadas, enchiladas, fajitas, burritos, and notably delicious fish tacos, all at reasonable prices. The homemade tamales and complimentary margaritas are standout features that elevate the dining experience. Coupled with a pleasant and attentive wait staff, El Limon is ideal for family outings, promising an amazing feast that pays homage to true Mexican flavors. Owing to its authenticity and excellent service, it's a must-visit for anyone craving genuine Mexican cuisine. Ole!

This newly opened eatery has quickly captivated my palate, earning a solid 4 stars with clear potential for a perfect score pending minor improvements. Despite being a frequent patron, due to its proximity to my workplace, I've observed a few issues, which the establishment is eager to rectify. Their willingness to accommodate and fix mistakes is commendable.

The culinary offerings are where this place shines, especially when it diverges from the much-debated pizza, which I find lacks the authenticity of 100% mozzarella, leaning towards the greasy side. However, dishes like The Quaker chicken steak, crisp and flavorful fries, and notably crunchy onion rings stand out for their quality, despite the latter's slightly greasy texture that doesn't detract from its taste.

Their spanakopita and baklava deliver on the promise of delightful flavors, with the baklava being particularly exceptional. The signature salad, boasting fresh vegetables and a standout balsamic, underscores their commitment to quality ingredients. The (turkey) Greek Burger, a personal highlight, combines a moist and flavorful patty with what seems to be homemade tzatziki, raising the bar for turkey burgers.

Despite minor missteps, such as a slight variance in the Greek Burger's advertised greens and a missed feta request, the overriding excellence of their dishes, emphasis on fresh ingredients, and a dedication to high standards assures my continued patronage. This establishment is unmistakably on the trajectory towards culinary excellence, and I eagerly anticipate its evolution.

Planet Fitness earns a solid four-star rating, primarily for its 24-hour accessibility, offering unbeatable value for anyone seeking an affordable gym membership. At just $20.00 per month for full access, including tanning beds, massage chairs, and a sculpt machine, it's the best bang for your buck. A basic membership is available for $9.99, excluding the massage and additional features, and does not allow for guest passes. While the environment may not cater to bodybuilders, leading to a diverse gym-going demographic, this should not deter anyone. Importantly, the staff at Planet Fitness are consistently polite and helpful, contributing to a positive gym experience.

I was quite disappointed with my recent attempt to dine here. Despite arriving at 2:15 PM on a Saturday, we were turned away because the kitchen had already closed at 2 PM, contradicting the restaurant's website indications of being open "Sat & Sun all day" until 5 PM. Such inconsistencies in basic details like operational hours raise concerns about their attention to quality and other seemingly minor aspects, leaving me skeptical of their overall management and reliability.
This service comes highly recommended for their quality work, punctuality, and reliable warranty coverage. They are a trustworthy choice for anyone in need of their services.

This dining spot is a frequent choice, visited at least twice a week for its consistently friendly service and exceptional food. The experience never fails to satisfy, ensuring patrons depart not just with a full stomach but also with no disappointment. Highly recommended for those seeking a reliable and enjoyable meal experience.

Discovering the revamped Carrow's Restaurant at Plumb and Kietzke was a truly delightful experience. This establishment not only boasts charming redwood beams and fascia that saved it from demolition but also serves up impressive cuisine that left us thoroughly satisfied. My wife enjoyed the tri-tip salad, which presented a harmonious blend of fresh greens, balsamic vinaigrette, succulent medium-rare tri-tip, and innovative potato "croutons". I opted for the tri-tip/chicken combo, perfectly paired with a fresh corn salad and potato salad, rounding out a satisfying meal. Not usually one for dessert, the quality of the meal enticed us to indulge in their dessert offerings - we shared a perfectly executed lemon meringue pie. The value for the quality of food and overall dining experience was surprisingly reasonable. Having already recommended this gem to our local family and friends, we are eager for our next visit. A job well done!

Rebecca served as a nanny to our firstborn daughter, and although she didn't function as a doula for my birth, her presence, knowledge, and support were invaluable during my second pregnancy. Conversations with her were something I looked forward to daily, thanks to her ease of communication, honesty, and insightful suggestions. Her passion for her role as a doula and her appreciation of the strength and beauty in laboring women shine through in her interactions. Rebecca's genuine love for what she does, combined with her truthfulness—a trait I particularly admire—makes her an excellent candidate for anyone looking for a supportive, knowledgeable addition to their birthing team.

I recently had the pleasure of getting my car tinted at Orange Tint and Tune, and the experience was top-notch from start to finish. Their handy car pick-up service within a 4-mile radius added a layer of convenience I deeply appreciated. Carlos, the technician assigned to my car, was exceptionally informative, discussing all the tint options with me. He was also accommodating enough to adjust the grade of tint to match the specific aesthetic I was aiming for. This level of customer engagement and care easily merits a 5-star rating. Additionally, the reception was welcoming, and the owner, Dustin, made a commendable effort to follow up on the service. Overall, Orange Tint and Tune exemplifies customer service excellence.

Stayed at the TownePlace Suite for three nights on a business trip. The hotel's proximity to the airport is a plus, as you don't experience any flight noise, making for a peaceful stay. The rooms come with all the expected amenities, like a refrigerator and stove, which are standard for TownePlace Suites. Location-wise, the hotel sits in a quiet area, surrounded by other hotels and office buildings, and is conveniently about a 20-minute drive to downtown or the university, with the Pima Air Museum just 5-10 minutes away. Dining options on foot are limited, though a notable sandwich shop called Baggins is within walking distance and offers tasty options.

The staff at the hotel were particularly friendly and helpful, enhancing the stay. Breakfast is offered as a standard continental, with a few hot dishes included, and there's an evening reception on weekdays. However, one should note that both food and drink tend to run out quickly during these receptions, so early arrival is recommended. The rooms were comfortable and the area felt safe, making for a generally pleasant stay. The only significant room for improvement involves maintaining a better-stocked food and beverage selection throughout the reception.

During an unforeseen detour to Tampa, we strolled into an exceptional local establishment, evading the usual chain dining experience. Opting for robust flavors, the ladies enjoyed a 7 oz. Tampa strip while the gents indulged in a 14 oz. ribeye. The steaks, masterfully grilled over oak and citrus wood, unleashed an intoxicating smoky aroma, sending our taste buds on a delightful journey reminiscent of home-cooked, wood-smoked steak— a rarity in most dining places.

Accompanying our meal were fresh veggies and sweet potatoes, complementing the meats' rich flavors. The wine selection was a pleasant surprise, offering a variety of quality options without the steep markup ubiquitous in many dining establishments. Our experience was further enhanced by our waitress, Lisa, whose recommendations were spot-on, and her service was nothing short of welcoming and exemplary.

This local gem not only satisfied our hunger but also provided a memorable culinary experience that beckons a return visit. It stands as a testament to the unique charm and quality that local spots have to offer, making it a must-visit for anyone passing through or near Tampa.

Following a less-than-stellar initial review, the owner of Saladworks (who also owns additional locations, including one in Southampton) personally reached out to me. Our half-hour conversation revealed his commendable approach to business, underscoring a dedication that left a strong impression on me. Motivated by this exchange, I revisited Saladworks twice, noticing a significant upturn in service quality. Additionally, their new summer salads proved to be a delightful addition to their menu. This experience has solidified my interest in continuing to support this establishment.

This deli is unparalleled in the US, offering an extensive and unique selection that makes choosing a delightful challenge. Their Muffalata stands out, both for its impressive size, capable of feeding four, and its delicious taste. Enhancing the experience, live music is available on Saturdays and Thursdays, providing the perfect backdrop for dining. Their specials never disappoint, and the assortment of sides, including great chili, potato salad, and chips, complements any meal. It's a must-visit destination.

During a memorable father-and-son cross-country trip, our first notable stop at Saguaro National Park was made unforgettable thanks to a guided tour with Park Ranger Carolyn. Her infectious enthusiasm and profound knowledge about the saguaro cacti enriched our experience. Carolyn's passion for her work shone brightly, making the tour not only educational but also highly enjoyable. We wholeheartedly recommend embarking on this tour, especially under Carolyn's guidance, for a truly captivating visit.

This wing spot impresses with a diverse range of flavors, spanning from familiar favorites like lemon pepper and mild, to unique New Orleans specialties such as yaka mein and noonie bird, offering an adventurous palette something new to savor. Not just their wings, but their beverages stand out too; the watermelon drink specifically garners high praise for its irresistible flavor, though what makes it so special remains a mystery. Situated in a less desirable location, the establishment is nonetheless making efforts to contribute positively to the community. Being in proximity to a daiquiri shop makes it an acceptable daytime destination, though caution is advised for solo night visits. This place is worth trying, not just for the food and drinks, but you might also spot a local celebrity, Skip. A hidden gem that combines great taste with community spirit.

Title: A Timeless Gem: Revisiting Tom Jones

My return visit to Tom Jones warrants an updated review due to several noteworthy changes and consistent favorites. The once peculiar ATM machine adjacent to the restrooms, peculiar for its function solely for bill payments, has disappeared. However, the much-appreciated payphone remains, accompanied by new ATM machines conveniently located at the front entrance, enhancing the restaurant's accessibility.

The "blue ribbon" breakfast special, now priced at $3.79, continues to offer unbeatable value with its lavish spread including pancakes, two eggs, toast, sausage, bacon, juice, and coffee - a complete meal ensuring a solid start to the day. My family's recent dining experience covered a broad spectrum of choices from the menu: from the hearty blue ribbons and sweet French toast to the savory chicken, club sandwich, and baked potato, catering to diverse preferences effortlessly.

One cannot help but admire the restaurant's consistent ambiance - the loud orange booths and the nostalgic payphone take you on a pleasant journey back in time. The eatery has managed to maintain its cleanliness and is devoid of any stale smoke odor, directly contrasting with some past diner stereotypes.

The service at Tom Jones is remarkable for its efficiency and friendliness, noticeable through the fast service and the variety of attentive waitresses and adept managers encountered over multiple visits. It's a place where staff excellence adds significantly to the dining experience.

Given these elements and the special place Tom Jones holds for my daughter, elevating my rating from 4 to 5 stars seems only fitting. Tom Jones not only remains a family favorite but also a testament to quality, value, and timeless charm in the diner scene.

As an amateur athlete and a single mom on a teacher's salary, encountering an injury during a softball game was both physically and emotionally challenging. Fortunately, Dr. Ferrel was present at the game and immediately provided on-field assistance by relocating my ankle. Despite the invaluable initial help, financial constraints pushed me to seek treatment elsewhere, resulting in a prognosis that threatened to keep me away from sports for months. In a moment of desperation, I reconnected with Dr. Ferrel, who graciously agreed to treat me. To my astonishment, his treatment significantly expedited my recovery, allowing me to return to my passion weeks rather than months later. Over the years, Dr. Ferrel has consistently provided exceptional care, positively impacting my physical well-being and restoring my hope whenever injuries arose. His dedication and skill have not only solidified his status as my hero but have also left an indelible mark on my life.

This venue offers an enjoyable experience with its entertaining shows and relaxed atmosphere. It's a great choice for those looking to have a good time, complemented by tasty food at reasonable prices. Highly recommended for an enjoyable outing.

"In-N-Out Burger captures a unique dining mood that sometimes just hits the spot, especially when indulging in their mouthwatering 4 patties done Animal Style. It's more than just a meal; it's fulfilling a craving that only In-N-Out can satisfy. The blend of flavors, the customizable menu, and that unmistakable In-N-Out vibe make it more than just fast food; it's a love affair with a classic that never disappoints."

Cindy's stands out for its exceptional quality in both food and service, offering an authentic taste of Mexican cuisine that distinguishes it from others. The freshness of their dishes enhances the dining experience, clearly setting a high standard at the very first bite. Highly recommended for anyone with an appreciation for genuine Mexican flavors.

**Trust Me BBQ Review**

After much anticipation and a previous attempt, I finally managed to dine at Trust Me BBQ, driven by its hyped reviews. Despite my high hopes, the experience fell disappointingly short of expectations, particularly in service and part of the food quality, making it unlikely for me to return.

**Pros:**
- The BBQ sauce was notably delicious which added a nice flavor to the meals.
- The macaroni salad stood out for its unique twist, offering a fresh take on a classic side.
- The "pulled" pork was commendably moist, demonstrating their potential in mastering BBQ essentials.

**Cons:**
- Service was starkly unsatisfactory; the staff member’s lack of engagement made the ordering process feel impersonal and unwelcoming.
- The chicken was unforgivably dry, reaching a point where not even their tasty BBQ sauce could salvage it.
- The mac & cheese appeared to have been neglected for days, and the collard greens were bland, pointing to a lapse in fresh preparation.

In conclusion, while there were a few highlights to the meal, the negatives heavily overshadowed the positives. The indifferent service combined with inconsistent food quality ensures my next BBQ outing will be at the tried-and-true "Down to the Bone BBQ" instead. Trust Me BBQ was a letdown, especially for someone who held it in anticipation for so long.
Visited this hidden gem during a week in town and tried their pa nang chicken at one star spicy level, which was excellent and arrived promptly. Definitely planning a return visit!

This gem of a spot is an absolute must-visit for anyone looking to celebrate Cinco de Mayo—or any day, really—with flair. While not explicitly a Mexican restaurant, this place skillfully melds flavors from various cultures to create truly unique dishes. They have a knack for expertly mixing rock salt and tequila, making their on-the-rocks margaritas and homemade sangrias (both white and red) nothing short of sensational. Adding to their appeal, they’ve recently expanded by opening a wine bar nearby, catering to those in search of specialty bottles or a bit of overflow space. If you're in the mood for a festive blend of cocktails and culinary innovation, this locale deserves a high five and a visit.

Tucked away in one of Hermitage's oldest shopping centers, this quaint donut bakery is a hidden gem that's worth a visit. The dedication required to bake their fresh daily offerings is palpable, with work starting in the early hours to ensure that every treat is as fresh as can be. Yeu, the friendly owner, goes above and beyond the usual donut selection to offer unique creations including bacon-topped donuts, apple fritters, pigs in blankets, breakfast pastries, kolaches, and the standout doughssant—a delightful hybrid of a donut and a croissant that alone is worth the trip. With such innovative treats priced so affordably, with doughssants at just $1.99 and regular donuts around $.60 each, it's a haven for anyone looking to indulge without breaking the bank. Plus, it's become a go-to for thoughtful gifts, with their sweets proving to be a hit among school teachers. Don't forget to grab a cup of coffee to complement your treat!

Our experiences attending various events here, from concerts to basketball games, have been thoroughly enjoyable. Each event has delivered a blast of fun and excitement. Additionally, the food offerings have been impressive, featuring a delightful array of local favorites that greatly enhanced our overall experience. Highly recommended!

Absolutely delightful dining experience with outstanding food quality. From the three appetizers to the five entrees we sampled, every dish was a hit. Prices are reasonable, complemented by good service. Definitely a place worth revisiting multiple times.

The service quality at this establishment has noticeably declined. Previously frequent patrons, we've now opted for an alternative due to the slow and neglectful service experienced during our recent visits.

This chicken and rice plate proved to be a major disappointment, starkly contrasting with the establishment's health-oriented claims. Despite assurances of no sauce to keep it healthy, the dish was drenched in an excessive 5-7 tablespoons of oil by the time it was taken to go, completely misaligned with expectations and the promise of a healthier meal. The encounter not only underdelivered on the promised quality but also contradicted the essence of their "healthy" branding, making the overall experience regrettably subpar.

My experience with purchasing a washer and dryer from Sears was outstanding, surpassing my expectations in every way. Despite initial reservations due to some negative reviews, I found no issues whatsoever. The selection was excellent, complemented by knowledgeable salespeople who ensured a seamless and timely delivery process. The service exceeded what I anticipated. The team was committed to providing the best possible price, presenting numerous options to fit within my budget. They diligently searched for additional discounts, ensuring I received the best deal available. Their honesty and thorough responses to my questions greatly contributed to my satisfaction. I highly recommend Sears for anyone in need of new home appliances.

The food at this venue is fantastic, complemented by their swift service. The staff is exceptionally pleasant, making every visit feel welcoming. Highly recommended for a delightful dining experience.

I recently had the chance to check out the newly remodeled venue and was genuinely impressed. The makeover has elevated the entire ambiance. The highlight of my visit was undoubtedly the mushroom cheese steak – it was exquisite. A delightful experience overall!

This espresso spot excels in serving an excellent Americano, making it my go-to cafe. The staff is both polite and friendly, contributing to the overall mellow atmosphere. Though it lacks power outlet access, the unlimited wifi is a big plus. Cleanliness is a priority here, with both the bathrooms and the establishment well-maintained. A comfy and connected nook for coffee lovers, despite the absence of charging points.

I visited this establishment buoyed by its high ratings and positive word-of-mouth, only to find the experience disappointingly lackluster. Navigating their website to preview the menu was a challenge, requiring selection from three locations and scrolling to encounter minimal descriptions devoid of prices or details about the offerings, namely a series of basic dishes with a combo option that merely adds cheese.

Upon arrival, the venue presented more as a bar than a restaurant, which was unexpected but manageable. However, the ordering experience did not redeem this impression. Opting for both the roast beef and roast pork combos at a reasonable $6.85 each, I encountered a jarring disparity in their serving temperatures; the roast beef was inexplicably cold while the roast pork was appropriately hot. Despite the staff's willingness to reheat the roast beef, it returned only marginally warmer, falling short of expectations for a freshly made sandwich.

Moreover, the sandwiches themselves were disappointing, offering scant meat yet drenched in an excess of gravy, compromising both flavor balance and the sandwich's structural integrity. Though the menu hinted at a "wet meat" option for less gravy, this small concession could hardly salvage the overall experience.

In summary, despite its buzzing reputation, the establishment fails to deliver on the fundamental promises of quality and satisfaction, marred by a user-unfriendly website, inconsistent food preparation, and a problematic approach to sandwich assembly that prioritizes gravy over substance.

I recently had takeout from Village Whiskey and while I didn't dine in, I had a great experience with their food. The Whiskey Burger, though on the pricier side at $26, was well worth it for those who don't mind a bit of grease. It was delightfully tender, complemented by exceptional bacon, and generous in size. Despite the steep price, I highly recommend it if you're looking for a premium burger experience. Additionally, the Duck Fat fries were a standout side dish, offering a rich and indulgent flavor that rounded out the meal beautifully.

Spent $80 on a family meal and it was absolutely worth every penny. The food arrived hot, and the orange chicken was the best I've had in a long time. This place has now become our go-to spot for Asian cuisine.

I recently had an outstanding experience at a local laundromat, which was a necessity after hosting family and being left with an abundance of linens to clean. This spot exceeded my expectations in providing a secure, pristine environment for tackling laundry chores. The facility stands out due to its clean, well-lit space and the exceptionally friendly and accommodating staff.

I was thoroughly impressed with the efficiency of both the washers and dryers; I managed to power through what would typically amount to 8 regular loads of laundry in just under two hours—an absolute time saver. The amenities further enhance the experience, from security measures to entertainment options like flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi, not forgetting the clean restrooms and access to snacks via vending machines.

The laundromat wasn't crowded, offering ample machines for use, contributing to the ease of completing my laundry tasks in record time. It's a relief to find a place where you can feel comfortable and secure while doing laundry, and I'm genuinely grateful for the great service and facilities. Highly recommended to anyone in need of a reliable place for their laundry needs.

Had a late-night dinner there, and while the prices were quite steep, we opted to share plates, which seemed to irritate our server. The food was decent, yet didn't justify the high costs. A standout was the garlic bread—truly memorable and would gladly indulge in it again. Despite this, I'm inclined to explore other dining options in St. Louis due to the fierce competition and the overall experience not compelling enough for a return visit.

During a Seahawks/Saints game, I decided to grab a burger at the Haven and was not disappointed. Despite the bustling atmosphere due to the game day, I managed to quickly get my hands on the Haven burger, which was absolutely fantastic. Seated near the entrance, the increasing crowd only attested to the place's popularity, though it somewhat limited my exploration of the venue. The sheer volume of people turned navigating out into a minor adventure. This experience has left me eager to return, perhaps at a quieter time, to fully savor what the Haven has to offer.

This place offers vermicelli bowls that are a good value for their size and price, a handy option for Alberta Ave residents. Orders, including on busy Friday nights, are consistently ready in 15 minutes, although I haven't tried their Pho to comment on the full menu.

During my recent visit to this restaurant, I was eager to try the Chicken Marsala upon our waiter's recommendation. Unfortunately, it fell significantly short of expectations. The chicken served was disappointingly thin, tough, and dry, coupled with undercooked pasta that clumped together, both entirely lacking in flavor. Similarly, my friend's experience with the lasagne was underwhelming, characterized by a scant layer of pasta and a noticeable absence of taste. Another dining mishap involved a friend's meal being prematurely cleared while she was away, despite her indication of not being finished—though it's worth noting the staff did attempt to rectify this by providing a replacement meal in a doggie bag.

On the brighter side, the restaurant boasts an excellent atmosphere enhanced by live music, which lent itself to an enjoyable dancing experience with my husband. However, when considering the dining experience as a whole, the quality of the food did not justify the high prices. This discrepancy between the ambience and the culinary offerings leaves much to be desired and suggests that while the setting might attract patrons, the food may not inspire return visits.

This hidden gem boasts a fantastic location near the Broad Street line, complemented by ample street parking and an attractive space that invites patrons to bring their own beverages. Its culinary offerings are a hit, with personal favorites including the delightful chaats, succulent beef short ribs, spicy lamb vindaloo, refreshing beet salad, varied breads/pickles, and aromatic chai. Not to be missed is the chocolate cake, a group favorite that rounds off the dining experience perfectly. Additionally, the convenience of takeout beer from the nearby corner bar adds to its appeal. With two visits down and undoubtedly many more to come, this spot is firmly on the "we'll be back" list.

This restaurant claims the top spot as my favorite dining destination, largely due to its exceptional ceviche that never fails to impress. The lively ambiance adds to the dining experience, while the service is consistently excellent. A special shoutout to Alex, our server, who stood out with his friendliness, attentiveness, and considerate approach, enhancing our experience even further.
"Absolutely love this store! From its fresh salad bar to an array of ethnic foods to explore, N-JOY truly has something for everyone. Highly recommended!"

Ordered a Mediterranean chicken shawarma that did not disappoint. The shawarma was flavorful, and they didn't skimp on the chicken. Impressively, the food was all set for pickup upon my arrival, showcasing their efficient service. I'm definitely planning a return visit next time I'm around.

An excellent dining spot, celebrated for its delightful food, welcoming staff, and pleasant ambiance. This restaurant comes highly recommended, catering superbly to both vegetarian and non-vegetarian preferences.

The service initially took some time but ultimately satisfied. The gumbo and chicken & waffles were delightful, backed by a friendly staff. Its Bourbon St location offers excellent people-watching opportunities.

Earl offers a commendable selection of grab-and-go sandwiches at the airport, with choices ranging from turkey to tuna, and even a Hawaiian option. The roast beef sandwich, in particular, was a standout, featuring a generous portion of well-cooked beef, cheddar cheese, and a delicious horseradish sauce, which is best enjoyed without the addition of lettuce or tomatoes. Its convenient location between the security station and the D gates, close to the Delta SkyClub, makes it an ideal spot to grab a quick and tasty meal before a flight or during a layover.

This dining spot receives an enthusiastic thumbs-up for its fantastic culinary experience and exceptional service. The cheese curds appetizer with red pepper jelly was a hit, and both the fish tacos and beer brat main courses impressed with generous portions at fair prices. The server's attentiveness and menu knowledge enhanced the dining experience, making guests feel extremely welcome. The proactive engagement by the manager, mentioning special game day deals and weekend brunch, added a personalized touch. The friendly farewell, complete with a reminder to take a rootbeer candy, underscores the establishment's commitment to memorable service. Definitely a recommended venue for great food, service, and a lively place to watch football.

I had a delightful experience stopping in for dinner and drinks. While I seldom opt for a burger when dining out, this particular burger convinced me otherwise for future visits. Additionally, the beer selection was satisfactory, and the service from the wait staff and bartenders was notably welcoming. My order was executed flawlessly and served promptly, contributing to a satisfying dining experience. The restaurant's ambiance and the cleanliness of the restrooms were the cherries on top. Overall, my visit left me very content and eager to return.

The hotel, while impressively large and aesthetically pleasing, falls short on providing a convenient and cost-effective experience for conference attendees, especially those on a tighter budget. The location, being far from Downtown Nashville and near the airport, limits dining options to expensive in-house meals or the daunting task of traveling far for more variety. A particular pain point is the exorbitant pricing for basic meals, such as a $10 charge for a generic pizza slice, side salad, and soda.

Valet services add another layer of inconvenience, with significant delays in vehicle retrieval and an overwhelming property size that complicates navigating to and from the hotel's amenities and the conference center itself. Despite discovering a helpful shortcut that significantly reduced walking time, the logistical challenges overshadow the property's beauty and spacious room accommodations.

Room pricing and billing issues further mar the experience, with a notable discrepancy in expected versus actual charges for the suite, leading to an ongoing legal investigation — a distressing end to any stay. The check-out process exacerbates the situation, characterized by long waits for luggage assistance and valet services, culminating in a laborious self-service exit.

In sum, despite the hotel's grandeur and the pleasant room setups, the combination of location drawbacks, hidden costs, and logistical bottlenecks makes it a less than ideal choice for those attending conferences or seeking efficient, budget-friendly accommodation options near Nashville's vibrant city center. Future visits, if unavoidable due to professional commitments, will be approached with considerable reservation and likely adjustments to lodging arrangements.

During my first visit to Ava, the overall experience was quite enjoyable, though with some minor critiques. The appetizer of Ricotta cheese and toasted bread was flavorful, yet the proportion of bread to cheese felt imbalanced, with the cheese being scant. Despite this hiccup, the two pizzas we shared – sausage, and potato with rosemary – were delicious, albeit missing the promised herb on the latter.

The grouper served with Israeli couscous stood out as a delightful entrée, alongside our dessert choice of zeppoles, which were exceptionally good. The cherry tart, however, did not entirely meet my expectations due to its overly sweet candied cherries and dense crust, though it seemed to be a hit with others in my party.

Intrigued by the prospect of house-made pastas, I am eager to return and explore more of Ava's offerings.

Had my first dining experience here and was thoroughly impressed. The establishment was notably clean, and the staff were friendly, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The sushi exceeded expectations - fresh, delicious, and reasonably priced. The service was efficient and spot on, ensuring a pleasant visit. Definitely a place I plan to return to and would recommend.

This establishment truly lives up to its name, offering an exceptional experience particularly for poultry enthusiasts. Their chicken dishes are standout, described as "fly", suggesting both a high quality and a delightful taste. Additionally, the fried corn on the cobs comes highly recommended, labeled as "dank" for its apparently excellent flavor. However, it's suggested that those not fond of chicken might want to look elsewhere, as poultry is a clear focus here. Overall, the review indicates a very positive experience with a strong recommendation to visit.

I recently visited a highly recommended breakfast spot, hoping for a delightful experience, but was met with profound disappointment. The quality of food was strikingly below average, reminiscent of what one might expect at a Waffle House rather than a reputed eatery. The pancakes were unimpressive, resembling something you'd find in the frozen section of a grocery store, and the so-called "homemade" maple syrup was a letdown, bearing an artificial taste that betrayed its advertised authenticity. The hash browns were greasy and bland, while the bacon was overcooked to the point of being chewy and hard, suggesting it had been left sitting out for too long. Overall, the meal was uninspired and fell short of expectations. This establishment seems to rest on its laurels, relying on an outdated reputation as a "must-visit" location. For those seeking quality breakfast in Nashville, there are undoubtedly better options available.

We had an excellent lunch experience, opting for the budget-friendly prix fixe menu. My wife savored the prime rib po'boy, an upscale take accompanied by a delicious tomato fennel soup, both of which she found excellent. I indulged in the seafood jambalaya and gumbo, which were outstanding and arguably the best I've sampled. The po'boy, enhanced with gruyere and a delectable horseradish sauce, stood out. Overall, a top-notch dining choice we highly recommend.

I recently had the pleasure of working with Pure Design for a significant event at a local hotel, and from start to finish, my experience was exceptional. From the initial meeting, the staff at Pure was attentive and professional, eagerly discussing my budget and presenting a range of beautiful and unique floral options that surprisingly fell well within my financial parameters. Their expertise shone through in every interaction, making the planning process smooth and enjoyable.

On the day of the event, Pure Design truly transformed the space with stunning arrangements that became a talking point among guests, with many praises still being shared days after the occasion. A notable perk was the ability to take home or give away the arrangements, a flexibility not often found with other florists. Impressively, the flowers maintained their beauty for several days post-event.

Based on my wholly positive experience, I wholeheartedly recommend Pure Design for anyone in need of a florist for large events.

My husband and I, far from our youthful days, discovered a vibrant spot perfect for those who love to 'Par-Tee'. From the moment we stepped in, the server greeted us warmly, showcasing an impressive knowledge of the drink menu. He guided us through an excellent selection of beers and divine liquors. Though the bar's food menu was modest, it far exceeded our expectations in taste and quality. Initially skeptical about trying pork bellies, I was pleasantly surprised by their delicious pork belly sliders, making me an instant fan. We hope to see more scrumptious tapas added to their menu soon. The staff's engaging demeanor and excellent service assured us of many return visits. Highly recommend for a delightful experience.

This restaurant falls short of its hype, landing at average or slightly above. Pricing is on the expensive side; a meal like ours - one beer, one iced tea, a burger, a bison burger, and a shared large fry - tallied up to an unjustifiable $37. Particularly, expecting fries to be included with a $10-$12 burger seems reasonable, not an $8 add-on. The attempt to stand out by adding unconventional toppings like slaw and BBQ sauce only detracted from the bison burger's appeal, rendering the $12 price tag not worthwhile. Despite the allure of trying a bison burger, the overall experience is underwhelming. There's little incentive to return.

Title: Unpleasant Experience Overshadowed by Exceptional Service from Server

Rating: ★★☆☆☆

My recent visit to the restaurant was a mix of highs and lows, with the bright spot being our server, LaToya. Her thoughtful and engaging demeanor added a positive note to our experience. Culinary-wise, the black bean burger left much to be desired due to its dryness, though the sweet potato fries were a delightful counterpoint.

However, the main issue that drastically affected the dining experience occurred while lunching with colleagues. An alarming incident unfolded when law enforcement, directed by a manager, apprehended a food delivery person right next to our table. This situation, combined with the subsequent handling of the arrest - in full view and amidst the dining customers and staff, without any attempt to mitigate the disruption or ensure the comfort of those present - was both disturbing and unsettling.

The lack of communication and poor management response following the incident only compounded the discomfort, leaving customers and staff alike without any reassurance or explanation.

The severe handling of the situation, unfortunately, overshadowed the positive aspects of our visit, leading to a significantly diminished dining experience.

Absolutely loved the sliders here - the perfect bite-sized delight that allows you to sample multiple flavors in one visit! Tried the Fried Chicken, BLT, Monte Cristo, and Cuban sliders, and each was fantastic in its own right. Now, off to grab some donuts to go. A must-visit for slider enthusiasts!

Visited the restaurant for the third time under new management and was not disappointed. They offer enticing daily specials at an excellent price of $7.95, which includes a main dish, ice tea, and soup. On the day of our visit (Friday), the special featured Carne Asada with rice and beans, a fried fish plate, and chicken enchiladas, all inclusive of a drink and soup. Opted for the Carne Asada plate, and they were accommodating with my request to substitute rice and beans for a salad. The steak was notably good. It appears their specials vary daily, adding an element of surprise with each visit. Overall, the experience was positive with commendable, attentive service.

Sweet Divas spices up the culinary experience with its aromatic and inviting shop that immediately captures your senses. This hidden gem offers an extensive array of spices, allowing customers to sniff, sample, and purchase a variety of unique flavors. The staff's knowledge and willingness to assist significantly enhance the shopping experience, helping patrons navigate through the overwhelming selection to find the perfect addition to their pantry. One of the standout features is the longevity and quality of their products; items such as specialty salts, sugars, and powders not only last about a year or more, even with frequent use but also surpass the taste quality of similar items found in conventional stores. The pricing, deemed reasonable by patrons, further cements Sweet Divas as a worthwhile destination for enhancing your cooking with fresher, longer-lasting spices, offering good value for money—a culinary treasure for enthusiasts looking to elevate their dishes.

Steve and his partner receive high praise for their exceptional service, notably for offering a variety of demo racquets. They offer competitive pricing and a wide selection, making it a go-to destination for players seeking quality and choice. Definitely recommended for anyone in the sport.

Despite the unexpected crowd at Chick-fil-A's opening day in Reno around 6 PM, the experience was surprisingly pleasant. The establishment was packed, yet the efficient staff managed the long lines swiftly, with only an 8-minute wait. Service was impressively quick, with food arriving in under five minutes after finding a table. Although there was a minor mistake with one sandwich order, likely due to the noisy environment, the issue was promptly corrected with commendable speed. The staff's attentiveness, including checking on refills and overall satisfaction, added a personal touch to the experience. This location successfully maintains the Chick-fil-A standard, providing exemplary service amidst the bustling atmosphere of its opening day.

This wine tasting spot is fantastic, offering an unmatched combination of great wines, beautiful location, friendly service, and affordable prices. Highly recommend for an enjoyable tasting experience.

Beck's offers a culinary adventure with its gator gumbo, a dish that stands out for its perfectly balanced spices, neither too spicy nor too salty, making it a savory delight to relish. Though the portion sizes might feel a bit on the smaller side considering the price, the gumbo, featuring gator meat in sausage form, is an undeniable highlight. On the downside, the chicken alfredo pasta, tried as a safer option for a young diner, proved to be somewhat disappointing, coming across as dry and not memorable enough to order again. In summary, while Beck's might have room for improvement in some areas, its gator gumbo remains the unequivocal star, making it a must-try for visitors.

Despite initial concerns due to mixed reviews, the experience exceeded expectations with minimal wait times and commendable hospitality from both the lobby and office staff, making the overall visit pleasant.

"The Taint has failed to live up to its hype for me, despite multiple recommendations. The venue's vibe, characterized by a palpable sense of apathy, and its clientele reminiscent of a disheveled Garden District gathering, leave much to be desired. Unfortunately, it’s a miss in my book. Boo."

Stumbled upon the latest Chick-fil-A addition in Bloomingdale and it lived up to the chain's reputation for pleasant service and tasty meals. Despite it being a fresh opening, the team efficiently managed the typically chaotic Florida parking situation, ensuring a swift drive-thru experience. Encountered six staff members, all embodying the chain's signature welcoming vibe. The food maintained its high standard, although the fries left a bit to be desired in terms of crispiness. Nonetheless, the classic Chick-fil-A sandwich and sweet tea hit the spot. A hearty welcome to Bloomingdale, Chick-fil-A!

This charming spot on Germantown Ave offers a delightful sweet treat experience. With a selection of cookies, bars, and an innovative option called "cake scrapple," which includes different kinds of cake and icing combinations, it caters to a variety of tastes. I opted for the Red Velvet with cream cheese frosting and an M&M cookie, both of which were delicious - the cookie being soft and chewy with the perfect amount of texture from the candies, and the cake moist and flavorful. Enjoying these treats while sitting outside on a bench added to the overall pleasant experience. This place is a gem for anyone with a sweet tooth.

"This establishment has seen numerous enhancements, creating a significantly more comfortable ambiance. The only drawback is the chairs, which could be improved for longer seating durations, such as an entire football game. Overall, the improvements are commendable."

This dining spot earns three stars primarily due to its service speed rather than its culinary offerings, which are commendable. The suggestion for improvement includes hiring an additional one or two personnel for the front area, especially for customers who prefer to place their orders directly rather than using the self-service kiosk. This enhancement could potentially elevate the overall dining experience by reducing wait times.

Visited this spot shortly after their opening and found the options limited with just one flavor available, which unfortunately didn't impress. The pricing felt steep, with a bill of around $70-80 for a trio, leaving us unsatisfied in terms of portion sizes. The sauce, an underwhelming blend reminiscent of buffet offerings mixed with fish sauce, contributed to the overall mediocre experience. Despite this, I'm offering a rating of three stars, considering there are superior dining experiences available elsewhere.

Our family excursion through Ybor, led by the knowledgeable and friendly Raymond, was a delightful blend of cultural enlightenment and culinary delight. Extending slightly over the scheduled three hours, due in part to engaging conversations and delightful diversions, the tour proved to be both entertaining and educational. We delved deep into Tampa's rich history, its vibrant culture, and the essence of Ybor City, enhanced by tasteful food stops along the way. The standout, without a doubt, was the Cuban sandwich from the Stone Soup Company. Not only is this tour a must for newcomers and long-time residents alike, offering a fresh perspective on the city, but it also serves as a fun way to clock in over 5,000 steps, humorously balancing out the delicious calories consumed. Highly recommended for an enjoyable adventure through the heart of Ybor.

Franzone's continues to impress with their delectable offerings, particularly their standout sweet spiral plain pies. Sticking to plain never disappoints here, offering a satisfying experience for those who appreciate the simpler things. Venturing beyond the basics, their white pizza adorned with onions comes as a delightful twist, with the onions enhancing the flavor in a surprisingly harmonious way. This establishment maintains the classic charm and quality reminiscent of the Franzone's from Bridgeport, making it a nostalgic yet fresh culinary adventure.

During a distressing time with my 18-year-old daughter suffering from a severe sore throat, our experience at this clinic was far from satisfactory. After receiving an initial misdiagnosis at a different location, which led to a worsened condition due to an incorrect medication, we turned to this clinic hoping for better care. Unfortunately, despite being the sole patients, we encountered a disappointingly long wait time exceeding an hour. The staff exhibited a disturbing lack of empathy, behaving more like robots than healthcare providers. My attempt to seek clarification on departure was met with an unwelcoming response, indicating I should not be there, despite the absence of other patients. This bewildering rush, combined with the overall unfriendly atmosphere, deeply marred our visit. The take-away from this regrettable experience is a reinforced belief in the importance of having a reliable primary care physician and steering clear of such facilities.
The chicken sandwich here stands out as exceptional, making it a noteworthy dining option in an otherwise industrial location.

Our experience was seamless from the start, with an easily arranged online appointment. The transaction was straightforward, leading us to a 2-hour side-by-side ride. We were in a comfortable four-seater, guided by the fantastic Matt, whose insights greatly enhanced our journey. The ride itself was a pleasure, offering breathtaking views throughout. Highly recommended for those seeking an enjoyable and hassle-free adventure.

This bar offers an excellent Happy Hour from 4-7 daily, featuring wine and drafts for just $3, alongside $5 pizzas and $4.50 appetizers. Their to-go dinners and lunches are not only reasonably priced but also prepared quickly, making it a convenient option. The staff here are incredibly friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. Highly recommended for both drinks and dining.

My experience at this restaurant was disappointing. Despite the pleasant waiter, the meal was marred by finding hair in both my appetizer and my friend's noodle dish. This incident significantly affected my appetite. Upon returning the dish with the hair, the restaurant failed to offer a replacement or comp my meal, which was surprising and unsatisfactory. Consequently, I have decided not to return.

Title: A Gem in the City: An Evening at ITV

Review:

My visit to ITV, following an unforgettable dining experience at Laurel, was driven by high expectations and a hope for a culinary adventure that wouldn't break the bank. Suffice it to say, ITV did not disappoint and might just have exceeded every one of those expectations. Nestled in a beautifully dim, yet perfectly visible small room, ITV offers an ambiance that is both intimate and welcoming, complemented by its aesthetically pleasing decor and staff—a fact too charming not to mention.

The evening commenced with a marvel—the $3 beef fat biscuit, a delectable creation that I boldly declare the highlight of my culinary experiences in the city this year. The encounter with Chef Nick Elmi, much like my previous experience at Laurel, added a delightful personal touch, underscoring the warmth and excellence of the establishment.

The culinary journey didn't stop there; the menu was a parade of stars. The Foie with Apricot Miso, Pork Cheeks accompanied by incredibly prepared vegetables, Trout Pumpernickel Soldiers, and last but certainly not least, the Ouroboros cocktail, each dish was a testament to ITV's commitment to quality, creativity, and flavor. The adventurous culinary techniques, such as cold smoking, incorporated even into their bar menu, left me in awe of the innovation at play.

In conclusion, ITV stands out as an unequivocal delight, effortlessly marrying exquisite culinary artistry with an atmosphere that beckons you to stay and indulge. Whether it's the best thing I've eaten all year, the innovative menu, or the inviting ambiance, ITV has etched a memorable culinary experience that beckons for a return. To those in search of some of the best dining the city has to offer, look no further than East Passyunk's ITV.
Absolutely love this place! It boasts great hours, maintains impeccable cleanliness, and offers a truly relaxing experience. Highly recommended!

Buckingham Pizza excels in crafting top-notch pizzas, with its plain option and unique specialties, such as the cool ranch pizza, standing out as must-tries. Though it offers a variety of entrees, sticking to their pizzas and perhaps a few sides is the way to go for a truly delightful experience.

We had an outstanding experience with the iced latte and beignets at Cafe Beignet, which easily outshone our visit to Cafe du Monde. The live music added to a delightful atmosphere, making it more than just a culinary excursion. The service was commendable, and the absence of long lines was a pleasant surprise. Highly recommend for a superior taste and experience.

Captain Bill's offers a delightful dining experience with its uncomplicated, cheerful ambiance right by the water, allowing guests to enjoy both scenery and marine life. Catering to a diverse age group in our party, from a choosy 7-year-old to a 72-year-old grandmother, the restaurant displayed impressive versatility in its menu options and flexibility with ingredient adjustments. The food was served hot, fresh, and tailored to our requests, reflecting the excellent service and reasonable wait times we experienced. Overall, Captain Bill's left us thoroughly satisfied, promising a return visit on our next trip to John's Pass. It's a recommendable spot for those looking for great food and service in a pleasant setting.

This sushi restaurant in Valrico offers an exceptional dining experience, highlighted by its notably delicious sushi, particularly the peanut avocado roll and the Volcano roll, which come highly recommended. Beyond the food, the service stands out for its friendliness, contributing to a memorable visit. Despite its distance from my residence, the quality of both the food and service makes it a place worth revisiting. If you're ever in or near Valrico, treating yourself to this restaurant's offerings is a decision you won't regret.

This restaurant offers typical Cuban cuisine that doesn't particularly stand out but isn't disappointing either. Its proximity to my workplace makes it a frequent lunch spot for me. The daily changing specials, which are freshly prepared, add an appealing touch. Worth a visit for those interested in exploring Cuban options for lunch.

The dining experience featured a mix of satisfaction and disappointment. While the 6 oz pepperloin meal was met with approval from one diner, the shrimp kabob meal fell short, offering just four overcooked and notably small shrimp. Despite the kitchen's inconsistent performance, the service remained commendable, unaffected by the restaurant's calm atmosphere.

Upon visiting this bustling sandwich spot, it's evident you're in for a unique experience the moment you step inside. Despite a line out the door, service was impressively swift; it took only 7 minutes to have a meticulously crafted sandwich in hand, even as a newcomer unclear on what to order. The staff's patience with first-timers, coupled with a welcoming atmosphere where locals mingle freely with the owners, adds to the charm.

The interior, adorned with bottle caps covering nearly every surface, provides an amusing visual distraction that complements the vibrant ambiance of the establishment. Opting to dine inside enriched our experience, allowing us to fully soak in the eclectic decor and nostalgic feel that defines this eatery.

The culinary experience surpassed expectations, especially with the pastrami sandwich that proved to be unlike any other – lean, flavorful, and possibly the best pastrami to be had. The menu encourages diners to venture out of their culinary comfort zones, promising delightful surprises like the one we encountered.

Overall, this sandwich shop delivers an unforgettable experience through its rapid service, unique atmosphere, and exceptional food. It's a place that captivates not just the taste buds but also the visual and social senses, making it a standout destination for both locals and newcomers alike.

I can't express how thrilled I was to see Heather open her own shop, a place I've eagerly anticipated as a long-time client. Heather possesses an unparalleled talent for hair color, combining artistic innovation and personalization to craft unique styles that truly stand out. Not only is she adept at bringing your own vision to life, but she also offers imaginative and refined suggestions if you're looking for inspiration. The atmosphere of her shop in E. Passyunk is as inviting as her skillset, providing an unpretentious, relaxed environment that mirrors Heather's approachable personality. Her ability to build a trustworthy team reflects in my confidence to recommend her shop to friends and family. Beyond her styling expertise, Heather's interests in cactus houseplants and vintage bikes add another layer of charm to the experience. Visiting her shop is not just about getting a haircut or color—it's about immersing yourself in a genuinely caring community.

Sally's stands out as the premier destination for hair supplies in the area, boasting an unparalleled selection that caters to those eager to explore different hair styling options. The staff's friendly demeanor ensures a welcoming shopping experience, although a deeper knowledge of the extensive product range would enhance customer service further. While typically well-stocked, the store's ambiance leaves room for improvement; cramped aisles, insufficient lighting, and cleanliness issues detract from the overall shopping experience. A makeover to create a more spacious, brighter, and cleaner environment would elevate Sally's to mirror the beauty and trendiness of its offerings. In summary, Sally's is highly recommended for its vast product assortment and friendly service, with a nudge to management to invest in the store's physical appeal.

After years of loyalty to a single hairstylist in Austin, I had to venture out due to necessity and stumbled upon Rodney Mitchell Salon (RMS) through a friend's recommendation. Initially skeptical about the price and quality, my reservations were quickly alleviated by the salon owner, Rodney, who was immensely helpful over the phone. I was booked with Allison, a stylist who managed to exceed my expectations by delivering a shaggy bob that perfectly embodied what I was looking for.

Allison's approach was professional yet personable, striking the perfect balance between being attentive and giving me space. Her skill and understanding of what I wanted were evident in the final result. Moreover, RMS offers a welcoming discount policy for first-timers, students, teachers, and referrals, which is a significant perk for someone mindful of their budget like a grad student.

In conclusion, my experience at Rodney Mitchell Salon, although born out of necessity, was nothing short of delightful. Allison's expertise, coupled with the salon's friendly policies and Rodney’s customer service, not only met but exceeded my high expectations. RMS is now my go-to recommendation for anyone in search of quality hair service.

This coffee shop located in the stunning Mercer Building offers several enticing features, including its spacious interior and the warmth of its friendly baristas. The additional appeal of gluten-free options and delicious Italian sodas make it a potentially great spot for those looking to enjoy a cozy café experience. However, the establishment falls short on a couple of critical aspects that significantly detract from its overall charm.

A major downside is the intrusive, constant, and loud music that permeates the space, making it challenging to engage in activities typically associated with coffee shop visits—such as reading, working, or having meaningful conversations. Requests to lower the volume have been denied, citing a policy of a fixed volume level, further exacerbated by the omnipresent speakers, leaving no escape from the overbearing ambient noise.

Tea enthusiasts might find their experience particularly disappointing due to the unconventional and impractical method of serving tea in unwieldy, huge filters rather than in pots, which undermines the enjoyment of the beverage.

While the place has potential thanks to its ambiance and select offerings, these significant drawbacks—especially the unmodifiable loud music—can make it difficult for patrons to fully enjoy their time and may deter repeat visits.

Spice n Grill undoubtedly offers the best Indian cuisine in St. Louis, presenting an unforgettable dining experience with its meticulously flavored dishes. The beef nihari and palak paneer stand out, both perfectly spiced and leaving one craving more. Particularly, the nihari, a new dish for many, promises to be a delightful discovery worth revisiting. While the intimate seating within the restaurant suggests a more to-go experience, the warm hospitality of the owner significantly enhances the visit. This establishment, a renaissance of the beloved 'Indian Food' by its previous proprietors, is a must-visit for anyone craving exceptional Indian take-out in the city.

Having ventured from California, where boba tea is ubiquitous and often authentically crafted, I had high hopes for this place, especially after learning it had roots in Cali. Unfortunately, my expectations were somewhat deflated upon my visit. 

While the establishment prides itself on a variety of flavors, it's a mixed bag when it comes to the authenticity of these tastes; some beverages boast real fruit ingredients, showcasing their natural flavors, but others fall short, relying on powdered substitutes that lack the genuine essence I crave, especially notable in their taro offering—a personal favorite of mine.

However, if the purity of ingredients isn't your top priority, this spot might still appeal to you. The staff is accommodating, allowing customers to customize the sweetness level of their drinks and choose from an array of add-ons like boba pearls and grass jelly—the latter being a delightful discovery for me.

This locale is not just about the drinks; it doubles as a vibrant social hub. Its popularity among University of Arizona students is a testament to its inviting atmosphere, suitable for leisurely catch-ups, gaming, or even hitting the books.

While I harbor some reservations, mainly surrounding the authenticity of some of their flavors, this destination could very well resonate with others less finicky. Its merits as a community gathering space cannot be understated, making it worth a visit for those looking for a casual hangout spot, if not solely for the boba tea.

This updated review reflects a continued decline in satisfaction with Silver Mine's service over a period of 4-5 years. The reviewer criticizes the establishment for failing to include paid additions in orders, such as ingredients in soup or chili, and often omitting free sides like bread. They also highlight a consistently slow delivery time of at least an hour, suggesting the business could learn from competitors like Jimmy John's. The critic suggests the proximity to Eller Business School could offer opportunities for improvement but concludes that the current level of service and operational efficiency makes the establishment a poor choice on University Blvd, vowing never to order again. This review paints Silver Mine as an embarrassment to their industry and a disappointing dining option.

Recently experienced impeccable service at a bike shop after an unfortunate accident left my new bike in need of repair. Despite expecting a lengthy repair process, the team amazingly completed the fix in under 30 minutes. They not only restored the mangled front basket to near perfection but also adjusted a gear shifter issue at no extra cost. The shop's staff, including the owners, salespeople, mechanics, and even the welcoming shop dog, exuded warmth and friendliness. Exceptionally happy with their outstanding service and highly recommend this shop.

This store offers an enchanting shopping experience that feels akin to an adult Disneyland, captivating those who simply wander in for a look. While the prices might lean towards the higher side, the sheer joy and excitement it brings make it a beloved spot.

"Stumbled upon Pag's during a walk in Doylestown and decided to try their cheeseburger, which surprisingly turned out to be a hidden gem – easily one of the best I've had recently, reminiscent of a superior quality Big Mac. The patty was perfectly sized, the bun complemented rather than overwhelmed, and the sauce was deliciously memorable. Although we dined in the wine bar area, which isn't the most family-friendly setting, the staff was welcoming and made accommodations for our son. Despite the menu not immediately catching our eye, the burger alone is worth a return visit. A must-try for burger enthusiasts!"

This delightful dining spot offers an absolutely wonderful experience in both food and service. A personal favorite for lunch or dinner outings with my boyfriend, we find ourselves returning at least bi-weekly. The pricing is commendable for its affordability. While weekends witness a surge in patrons causing slight waits, the inconvenience is negligible to us. Our go-to dishes include the Indian Pancake and either the Hainanese Chicken or Curry Chicken, though we've ventured through other menu options, all of which are delicious. This place has become a staple in our dining routine, never failing to impress.

The diner, despite its high ratings and appealing waterfront location, unfortunately delivered a disappointing experience. The service was notably slow, and the wait staff seemed indifferent, diminishing the overall dining atmosphere. Situated in a prime tourist area, one would expect more emphasis on customer satisfaction. A particularly concerning issue was the lack of environmental responsibility observed with trash, especially lightweight items like straw wrappers and napkins, littering the outdoor deck with the potential to pollute the adjacent water body. This highlights a significant oversight in managing environmental impacts, suggesting a need for simple corrective measures such as installing screens to contain waste. Although the quality of the food was satisfactory, these drawbacks overshadow the positives, leading to a decision not to return.

I recently indulged in the $22 pre-fixe meal and was pleased with the harmonious flavors on my plate. The chicken was notably moist, and although the vegetables were delectable, I found them slightly on the greasier side. Regardless, the meal was overall a delightful experience. Additionally, I frequently opt for their takeout/delivery service and commend their eco-friendly packaging approach, utilizing reusable plastic containers over excessive boxes and cardboard, aligning with my environmental values.

While the food at this establishment may not always be extraordinary, it serves as a reliable option for consistently enjoyable meals. The pricing might appear a tad high, yet the modern ambiance, exceptional service, and dependable quality of food justify the cost. This restaurant strikes a balance between offering a pleasant dine-in experience and an eco-conservative takeout option, making it a commendable choice for both casual dining and eco-conscious consumers.

This eatery offers a familiar experience akin to other Chinese restaurants with a similar menu selection. However, it stands out for its appealing lunch specials and the reliability of having orders ready for pickup promptly.

Visited this spot for the first time and was impressed by their eclectic foodie menu. Started with an onion tart and veal meatballs on polenta, both of which were delightful; the red gravy was reminiscent of homemade. We opted for the citrus short ribs special with fat noodles and brussel sprouts for our mains, a choice so hearty we couldn't finish. Although the place is small and crowded, the atmosphere is incredibly welcoming. Eager to return and explore more of their interesting offerings.

After an unexpected change of plans from a fully booked oldest Italian restaurant in South Philly, we stumbled upon Angelina's - a charming find that soon felt like home. The intimate setting provided a personalized experience with Angelina herself cooking at the front and her husband attending to guests. Our party of three began with an eggplant and roasted pepper appetizer that set a high bar for the main courses to come. Each dish - from the Veal Osso Bucco and Carbonara to the lasagna - was absolutely delicious, leaving us eager for our next visit. Angelina's not only salvaged our evening but turned it into a memorable dining experience.

Indulging in a dining experience here offers not just tantalizing flavors but also a feast for the eyes, courtesy of its stunning view. A standout dish that is a must-try is the Lobster Mac and Cheese, perfectly blending rich, creamy cheese with succulent lobster pieces. It's a match made in culinary heaven that elevates comfort food to gourmet level. Highly recommended!

This ice cream store impresses with its delicious offerings and generously sized portions, presenting some unique flavors that set it apart. Its remarkable quality makes it a model that other ice cream stores should aspire to. A must-try for everyone.

The establishment offers average food paired with attractive drink specials. However, its appeal is diminished by its typically sparse crowd, even during what should be peak hours. On a recent visit on a Friday night, the bar was notably underpopulated, and surprisingly, last call was announced just minutes after arriving, at 10:15 PM. This early closure on a weekend night has led us to exclude this location from our evening plans in the future.

This spot is a fantastic late-night haven for satiating those unavoidable munchies, regardless of the reason. Whether it's the quality of their offerings or the convenience of their service, they've got you covered for those nocturnal nibbles. Definitely a go-to for anyone in need of a tasty, after-hours treat.

Value City may evoke notions of affordability, but this review suggests otherwise, describing prices more akin to Rothman with the stock quality resembling Ashley Furniture, rather than the budget-friendly Broyhill many might hope for. The store's inventory and pricing policies leave much to be desired. The selection of entertainment centers and TV stands is criticized for being both limited and disproportionately expensive. Similarly, the clearance section hardly qualifies as a bargain, presenting slightly damaged items at non-competitive prices. Sectionals, priced around $1,000, are from obscure brands, raising concerns over value for money.

Customer service falls short with staff described as inattentive, focusing more on their social interactions than engaging with visitors. Dining sets fail to impress both in uniqueness and price, hinting at a lack of competitive edge in the market. The military discount offered is panned as insignificant, further illustrating a disconnect with valued customer segments.

One of the few redeeming aspects highlighted is an assortment of modern furniture pieces. This, however, is not enough to sway the overall opinion that Value City's offerings are overpriced for the quality provided. The advice concludes with a recommendation to shop elsewhere or hold out for significant sales, indicating a dismal overall shopping experience.

Franzone's offers a delightful dining experience, enhanced by the owner's friendly presence and evident care for the products served. Though their use of sweet sauce may not suit everyone's palate, their cheesesteak and fries are commendable alternatives. The overall pleasant atmosphere significantly contributes to their appeal, making it a solid choice for those in search of good food and a welcoming environment.

Bab Cafe in Reno proved to be a delightful discovery for two Asian cuisine enthusiasts. The welcoming and knowledgeable staff made choosing from the diverse menu a breeze. Opting for the Jeyuk Top-Bab, the spicy pork did not disappoint, offering an incredible flavor experience unmatched in the area. The sauce bar and complimentary miso soup add to the overall value, making for a fresh and enjoyable meal. Its convenient downtown location caters to various dining preferences, including takeout and delivery via UberEats. Bab Cafe is a must-visit for those looking to expand their culinary horizons in Reno.

On my first culinary adventure in New Orleans, I opted for a seemingly modest $15 lunch special, which turned out to be a delightful surprise. Despite my usual ambivalence towards seafood and a lack of appetite, I found myself thoroughly enjoying a rich seafood stew. This concoction was brimming with an array of seafood - oyster meat, crab claws, shrimp, and redfish. Paired with a thoughtfully prepared salad, the meal went beyond expectations. The stew was a harmonious blend of spices, perfectly cooked to achieve the right consistency and exceptional tenderness of the meat. It was an unexpected pleasure that I consumed with gusto, proving itself to be a worthwhile dining experience.

Totally worth the delay even in the heat! The vegan grits coupled with a biscuit were divine, and my sisters were equally pleased with their meals. A word of warning - the Bloody Marys pack quite a punch! Impressive service too; despite a 45-minute wait, the line was swift, and our food arrived promptly. Biscuit Love has certainly perfected their service, making for a delightful breakfast experience. Big thanks!

**Ichicoro Ane Review:**

Ichicoro Ane impresses with its seamless blend of ambiance, diverse food offerings, and an exquisite whiskey selection.
