The establishment delivers a delightful dining experience, enhanced by the attentiveness and friendliness of its servers. Highlights on the menu include the fulfilling katsu and the lighter, yet satisfying bao buns, both of which I strongly recommend. It's wise to inquire about portion sizes as they can vary, although I've yet to encounter a dish that disappointed. 

The cocktail offerings stand out, especially the Japanese Old Fashioned, which, despite its higher price, showcases the quality of Japanese whiskey at its finest. Ichicoro Ane is best enjoyed with a group, allowing for a broad sampling of its menu - a practice reminiscent of the convivial atmosphere found in Izakayas across Japan and Korea. It's a place I eagerly anticipate returning to, eager to delve further into its culinary delights.
Absolutely adore this bakery for its amazing breakfast sandwiches, delicious coffee, and irresistible donuts! It's become a favorite weekend morning spot for my friend and me. Highly recommended!

This establishment offers an impressive selection of whiskey and bourbon that caters to diverse preferences. Their burgers, especially the one topped with a fried egg, are exceptional, ranking among the best. The duck fries are highly recommended and not to be missed. Although the venue boasts a charming ambiance, seating arrangements for groups can be a bit awkward, possibly hindering conversation. Despite this minor inconvenience, the overall experience is positive, ensuring a return visit.

This English pub-style establishment scores an A++ for its cozy ambience and excellent drink selection, with skilled bartenders who truly know their craft. However, patrons should be aware of the steep prices, such as $7 for a standard mixed drink, and the limited seating availability.

This cozy spot offers a charming setting for drinks with friends, featuring aesthetically pleasing glassware that harks back to the kind found in some grandmothers' china cabinets. While the drinks are delightfully tasty, the menu lacks variety, largely rotating around ginger, lime, and honey combinations differentiated only by the choice of liquor. The bacon-wrapped dates, unfortunately, disappoint with an overpowering sweetness. The ambiance, initially quiet, quickly becomes noisy as more patrons arrive, diminishing the ease of conversation despite the heavy use of fabric decor intended to muffle sound. Service is polite and unobtrusive, although there may be oversights in drink refills. Overall, the experience is a mix of quaint charm and some culinary missteps, with an atmosphere that shifts from tranquil to bustling as the evening progresses.

This venue continues to impress with its consistent delivery of a fantastic experience. Offering hayrides, pumpkin picking, and a plethora of engaging activities, it's another year well spent at this delightful spot.

Disappointed by the customer service received when inquiring about service information for my 2015 $110K AMG. Despite the vehicle's value and the expectation for high-quality service, I was informed that because the car wasn't purchased from their dealership, I'd be charged for a loaner car during warranty work. This experience has discouraged me from using their services in the future.

This compact yet comprehensive grocery store is akin to a mini Whole Foods, offering a diverse range of items from a fresh salad bar and a modest but quality selection of fresh fruits to a juice bar. Its uniqueness stands out, particularly due to the scarcity of similar stores in the city. Moreover, the convenience of a parking lot adds to its appeal, making it an excellent spot for those seeking healthy options. Its location is also prime, being just a short walk from various clothing stores, enhancing the shopping experience. Overall, a great little grocery store catering to those looking for quality, fresh options in a convenient, central location.

This delightful outdoor venue offers a unique wine selection that stands out from your typical grocery store offerings. The addition of fabulous live music, even on a Thursday afternoon, contributes to the vibrant atmosphere. Patrons can indulge in a curated selection of cheeses and wines, guaranteeing satisfaction. The regular menu is both crafty and artistic, complementing the beautifully ambient setting. This place is a must-visit for an exceptional experience both in ambiance and on the palate.

"I highly recommend this location for smog checks due to its exceptional service and competitive pricing. It's my go-to spot for my cars, and their great service always makes the experience positive. Definitely a place worth checking out!"
Outstanding dining experience with excellent gluten-free and vegan options available. The salad, pizza, and root beer were all perfect, making it a top choice for diverse dietary needs.

Our group of six visited and unanimously enjoyed the burgers on offer, finding significant satisfaction in both the quality and taste. The establishment stood out for its cleanliness and appealing decor, creating a welcoming atmosphere. A standout side was the sweet potato tots, which we highly recommend.

This dining experience scores a solid 9 out of 10 overall, showcasing an impressive atmosphere and excellent service. The lighting and noise levels were both ideal, creating a perfect ambiance with a full score of 10 in each category. The environment was also highly rated at 8.5, complementing the overall dining atmosphere. Staff were friendly and efficient, deserving a commendable 9. While the food was very good with a score of 7.8, it was slightly outshone by the other aspects of the dining experience. Nonetheless, this restaurant offers a well-rounded, enjoyable dining experience.

This convenience store deli may not offer the ambiance of a full-service restaurant, which is the sole reason for a 4-star rating instead of 5. However, it excels in delivering delicious, made-to-order sandwiches, including a memorable Cuban press and a breakfast sandwich. It does feature some indoor and dockside outdoor seating, offering ocean views. Despite its proximity to the more frequented Maggie Mae's, this deli stands out for its superior taste. Highly recommended for a satisfying meal without the need for formal dining.

My second visit to this establishment was an improvement over my already positive initial experience, highlighting the venue's responsiveness to feedback and their ongoing refinement of service. The previous issues, likely teething problems associated with their grand opening, such as limited bottle openers and less satisfying portion sizes, have been addressed effectively. The generous serving of garlic noodles on this visit was a notable step up. Although the restaurant's layout might still present challenges with draftiness at certain tables, our seating this time was comfortably placed away from such concerns. The quality of the food remains exceptional, further enhancing my anticipation for future visits. The ease of securing a table on a Saturday evening around 5pm was an added convenience, bolstering my appreciation for having such a quality dining option in our locality.

The reviewer expresses a deep fondness for Skyline Chili, having been a fan since experiencing it in Cincinnati. They were initially excited about the opening of a new location in Clearwater, but their experiences there have been underwhelming. The primary issues highlighted include poor service, slow food preparation, and frequent shortages of menu items or malfunctions with kitchen equipment. Despite these setbacks, the reviewer maintains a particular fondness for the cheese coney hot dogs served "all the way." The review closes with a hopeful note for improvement at this specific Skyline Chili location.

This establishment offers excellent eyebrow waxing, but unfortunately, it falls short in the accessibility and efficiency of booking appointments. Despite being flexible with scheduling, finding an available slot within two weeks proves almost impossible, and attempts to contact them by phone often result in delayed responses. Such inconveniences have led to the decision to no longer patronize this business, opting instead to pay an additional $10 elsewhere for more reliable appointment availability. Consequently, this review awards the business 2 stars, primarily due to the significant challenges faced in securing timely appointments.

An excellent spot for delicious tacos, nachos, and top-notch margaritas, all served in a vibrant atmosphere. Make sure not to miss their Triple Special Day every Wednesday for fantastic deals. Highly recommended for an authentic and lively dining experience.

This review reflects a notably poor experience with a car rental agency, characterized by multiple disappointments. The customer faced significant waiting times, noting an apparent lack of staff as a persistent issue, leading to over an hour's delay in getting the car ready. Furthermore, the vehicle was inadequately cleaned both inside and out, diminishing the overall satisfaction with the rental.

Adding to the frustrations, an oversight with the wiper fluid necessitated an unnecessary return trip, further inconveniencing the customer. Financial grievances also surfaced, particularly concerning an underage fee of $20 per day, which was deemed excessive and unavoidable, even though the rental was very close to the customer's 25th birthday. The review advises against opting for the fuel option, criticizing it as misleading and not cost-effective, suggesting it is a tactic to overcharge customers.

The review concludes with a significant logistical issue: the provided return address for the car was incorrect, leading to further wasted time and frustration. The negative experience was compounded by this disorganization, highlighting a critical area for operational improvement.

Overall, the customer expresses dissatisfaction with the service and recommends exploring alternative companies, such as Hertz, that might offer a more favorable policy regarding underage fees and better overall service reliability.

Title: Exceptional Service That Exceeds Expectations!

Review: Following the recommendations of many enthusiastic Yelp reviewers, I decided to enlist the services of Todd and Roberta for my carpet and couch cleaning needs, and I'm ecstatic to report that they did not disappoint! The transformation of my home is nothing short of remarkable. Every spot left by my dog's accidents vanished, leaving everything smelling fresh without the overpowering scent of chemicals or the usual damp aftermath. What surprised me the most was how quickly everything dried. Beyond their impeccable cleaning service, Todd and Roberta stand out as genuinely gracious individuals, brimming with helpful advice on maintaining my home's cleanliness. Their service is worth every penny, and I wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone in need of top-notch cleaning services. They've certainly earned a loyal customer in me for future cleaning endeavors!

Absolutely adore this place! Their sips mocha is my favorite, and the staff is always incredibly kind. The convenience of the drive-thru is a huge plus, especially for not having to unload the kids. Plus, their cakes are simply delicious! Highly recommended.

Chateau La Vin has remarkably evolved from a quaint wine store to a bustling wine bar, offering an expanded experience for both wine aficionados and casual visitors alike. The transformation includes not only an increase in seating but the addition of cheese and crackers to complement their extensive wine selection, making it a cozy spot for an evening out. The inclusion of live music creates a lively ambiance, further enhancing the overall experience. The owner's willingness to share his wine knowledge adds a personal touch, ensuring that each visit is informative and enjoyable. For those who prefer beer, a thoughtfully curated selection is available, catering to diverse tastes. The option to order food from local restaurants, with some offering delivery, adds convenience and variety to the offerings. With its charming outdoor seating, Chateau La Vin has established itself as a versatile and welcoming destination for both locals and visitors seeking a relaxing and enjoyable venue.

The Hollander Hotel provided an exceptional wedding experience, combining beautiful accommodations with impeccable service. The venue excelled in every aspect, from the charming and eclectic décor to the cozy and clean guest rooms. The Tap Room offered a perfect setting for an after-party, and the abundant, delicious brunch on the patio was memorable. The hotel's location in downtown St. Pete, complete with a convenient shuttle service, added to the guests' enjoyment. What truly set the Hollander apart was the personalized and caring service from the management and staff, making the wedding experience feel like a family gathering. The dedication of the team, particularly Nick, Will, and Zach, highlighted their commitment to guest satisfaction. The Hollander Hotel comes highly recommended for its unique charm, excellent facilities, and outstanding service, making it a perfect choice for a wedding or any special occasion.

The gyro platter I tried for lunch was a major disappointment, both in terms of presentation and taste. It was dry, lacked inspiration, and strayed far from the essence of a traditional deconstructed gyro. To make matters worse, the vegetables accompanying the dish were not only visually unappealing, resembling something unmentionable, but their taste was equally off-putting. Fairmount boasts of better lunch spots that promise more appealing meals and definitely avoid such unpleasant surprises.

Visited for drinks and enjoyed a wonderful atmosphere with the brewery in view, enhancing the experience. The beer was pleasing to the palate, and service was exceptional, courtesy of a knowledgeable and kind waiter.

Had an outstanding dinner experience at this highly recommended spot in New Orleans. The BBQ shrimp and bread pudding were exceptional, highlighting the restaurant's culinary prowess. From the ambiance to the service, everything was top-notch. The fried green tomato appetizer set a delicious tone for what was a truly memorable meal. Definitely a must-visit for anyone in the area.

This store boasts an exceptional array of products, paired with outstanding customer service. The vast selection is nothing short of impressive, making it a standout choice for shoppers. However, there's a notable caveat - the absence of a location in Ft. McMurray is a significant bummer for potential customers in that area, clearly leaving room for expansion. In brief, while the store excels in offerings and customer relations, the geographical limitation dampens the overall accessibility and convenience for some.

This review recounts a highly unsatisfactory experience with a tanning salon, particularly at the Chippewa location, due to what the reviewer describes as deceptive practices. Despite an advertised online coupon offering first-time customers unlimited tanning for $15 for a week, the staff at this location refused to honor it. Initially, the refusal was based on an undisclosed students-only requirement, then shifted to claiming the coupon was expired — contradictions to the promotion's availability on both Yelp and the salon's website. Attempts to utilize another promotional offer were similarly rebuffed. A call to another location confirmed the original coupon's validity, but only if services were consistently used at the chosen location. The reviewer warns others to avoid patronizing the business, citing their experience as evidence of lying and scamming through bait-and-switch tactics.

I had a fantastic experience at this establishment. The highlight was undoubtedly the food - simply amazing. The quick-service, Chipotle-style line made ordering a breeze, and it was refreshing to see such high-quality Indian cuisine served this way. The staff were incredibly accommodating, guiding me through the menu options with great enthusiasm, which was much appreciated as I'm relatively new to Indian cuisine. I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit!

El Sabor Poblano on Federal may blend into the myriad of Mexican eateries below Washington Avenue, but its offerings stand out, particularly for fans of traditional and slightly Americanized Mexican fare. The fish tacos, generously filled with an entire filet of flaky, fresh-tasting fish, are a delightful surprise, especially for those accustomed to lesser portions. While the tacos come with more Americanized toppings like lettuce, tomato, and cheese, the option for more traditional toppings likely exists upon request. Additionally, the super crispy chorizo tacos are commendable for their absence of gristle, a common pitfall in similar dishes elsewhere. Despite its unpretentious appearance and the minimal staff presence, El Sabor Poblano delivers on quality and value ($8 for 3 tacos), making it a noteworthy stop in South Philly's crowded Mexican food scene.

I recently had the chance to visit a local establishment I've been eager to try, and it didn't disappoint. Despite a recent burglary at the venue, the atmosphere remained welcoming and vibrant. The service was outstanding, with the bartender ensuring our experience was top-notch from the moment we sat down at the bar. My friend and I enjoyed a pint of refreshing dark ale and shared a delicious order of wings, both of which were exemplary. I had the pleasure of meeting the owners previously and was impressed by their commitment and friendliness, adding to my anticipation of this visit. Their dedication to running a successful, non-franchised local business truly shines through, making it a comfortable spot that feels like a community gem. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for quality food and drink in a cozy, inviting setting. It's a fantastic spot that I plan to continue supporting, conveniently located close to both home and work. Fellow Yelpers, you won't want to miss out on this one!

I discovered this eatery through Yelp, and the glowing reviews didn't disappoint. The sandwiches were absolutely delicious, justifying the wait in line. Service was both swift and cordial. Despite a 15-minute queue, our order of four varied sandwiches was promptly taken care of. By the time we settled at our table, our order was served right to us. Overall, a delightful dining experience worth recommending.

This theater offers an exceptionally comfortable viewing experience, thanks to its cozy recliner seats. However, the design requires patrons to lower their footrests for others to pass by, which can be a minor inconvenience. The highlight is the pleasant bartender at the adjacent lounge, enhancing the experience by allowing patrons to enjoy their drinks within the theater. On the downside, the concessions area suffers from disorganization and slow service, even when adequately staffed, and the quality of snacks, like the burnt popcorn, leaves much to be desired. Future visits will be planned with pre-theater dining and a return to the enjoyable bar area.

"This hotel stands out as an exemplary choice for accommodation, delivering a top-notch experience with its impeccably clean facilities, courteous staff, appealing pool, and majestic entrance. It has left a lasting impression, making me eagerly anticipate my return next year. Highly recommended for a memorable stay."
Visited this establishment upon its opening and was greatly let down by both the quality and taste of the food. Based on my experience, I cannot recommend dining here.

Visited on a quiet Sunday afternoon with sparse attendance, opting for beers at the bar due to a limited food selection. Sampled six beer varieties, finding them averagely satisfying but unremarkable. The ambiance was dampened by the visible frustration of staff members over a scheduling issue, detracting from the overall experience. Despite the establishment's appealing setting, the visit left us uncertain about returning, especially with superior alternatives in proximity.

Upon visiting Tony Luke's at terminal F, I was seriously disappointed with the Philly Cheese Steak. The lack of options in the terminal led me to Tony Luke's, anticipating a taste of a true Philadelphia classic. However, the reality fell short of expectations. The sandwich presented bore no resemblance to the tantalizing image advertised, a common yet disheartening experience. More disturbing was the quality of the meat, which was so poor that it left me questioning what I had just consumed, likening it to the unthinkable. With a price of $10, the experience was not only underwhelming but also left a bitter taste regarding value for money.

Absolutely adore this gem in Creve Couer! It's a fantastic, affordable 9-hole course that feels like a well-kept secret. The staff members are genuinely helpful, enhancing the overall experience. Highly recommend it!
My initial experience at this venue left mixed feelings. Although the service was notably slow and the staff attitude could significantly improve, the redeeming quality was the delicious food.

This establishment is a place I've frequented several times, primarily for its culinary offerings rather than its service, which notably falls short in comparison. The food consistently exceeds expectations, remarkably so for a dive bar, delivering on taste and quality every time. If you're considering a visit, come for the delicious food, but be prepared for less-than-stellar service.

Discovering this gem of a museum in Indianapolis was an unexpected delight during my travels. With its vast and impressive collection, it's astonishing that admission is free. The African Art and Modern Art exhibitions were particularly captivating, though remember that photography in the Modern Art section is frowned upon. The outdoor sculpture garden and the gift shop added to the overall enjoyable experience. I highly recommend a visit to anyone who appreciates fine art and is looking for an enriching cultural experience without the expense.

Despite its size, managing a visit with a large group can be challenging at this establishment. Attempting to dine with a party of nine on a busy Saturday morning resulted in a lengthy and somewhat frustrating wait for seating, as the restaurant does not accept reservations for smaller groups. Although the manager's gesture of offering coffee to those waiting was appreciated, the overall approach to accommodating waiting guests could be improved.

When it comes to the dining experience, the menu's highlight includes the option for half-and-half combos, catering to varying tastes and preferences. The turkey Reuben, despite a minor hiccup with an additional charge for extra sauerkraut that did not meet expectations in quantity, was enjoyable. Another notable dish, the sunrise chile rellenos, stands out as a compelling choice for future visits, preferably with a smaller party to ease the seating process. Overall, while the food offers some satisfying options, the logistical aspects of dining here with a large group necessitate consideration.

The Shop excels in providing an exceptional workspace, distinguished by meticulous attention to detail and a comprehensive range of services. It offers an excellent environment for both private meetings and productive solo work sessions, making it a top choice for professionals seeking a versatile space.

This dining spot provided an exceptional anniversary experience, marked by culinary mastery that delivered melt-in-the-mouth dishes. The customer service was equally impressive, ensuring a memorable visit. Highly recommended for a return visit.

Terrace Lounge at Peppermill attempts to establish itself as a premier cocktail venue but unfortunately misses the mark. Key issues include a noticeable lack of awareness among the staff about their own cocktail menu offerings, with one bartender seemingly unaware of a newly introduced cocktail list. The quality of the drinks suffered too, as cocktails turned out weak and watery, compounded by a disappointing selection of corporate-standard liquors available across the Peppermill venues.

Service also left much to be desired; the review highlighted an instance where four bartenders struggled inefficiently to serve a modest crowd of around 45 customers, lacking a structured bar area and failing to establish any meaningful rapport with patrons. Additionally, the atmosphere of the lounge was criticized for being overshadowed by the typical casino-goer crowd, which detracted from the experience for those seeking a more dedicated cocktail bar environment. Notably, the presence of smoking within close proximity further marred the reviewer's visit, pointing to a broader concern about the lounge's consideration for all patrons' comfort and enjoyment.

In contrast, the reviewer expresses a preference for Cin Cin, praising it for its superior cocktails and a more enjoyable atmosphere devoid of gaming machines. This critique serves as a call to action for Terrace Lounge and Peppermill more broadly, suggesting improvements such as better staff training, the introduction of more unique liquor options, and rethinking the integration of gaming machines within the bar area to truly elevate the cocktail experience.

I had an excellent experience here, highlighted by top-notch service. Amanda, who doubles as the resident comedian, made our visit unforgettable with her humor. The staff overall was incredibly friendly, adding to the welcoming atmosphere. Both the food and beer impressed with their quality—the meals deliciously prepared, and the beer served ice cold. Highly recommend for a delightful dining experience.

I've been a loyal patron of this nail shop for years, and it remains my top choice in the city due to its tranquil atmosphere and the warm, efficient staff. Not to mention, at $25.00 for a pedicure, the value is unbeatable in the South. Highly recommended for a serene and friendly experience.

Visited a delightful diner in New Jersey for a morning meal, indulging in both a savory taylor ham, egg, and cheese sandwich on an unexpectedly quality hamburger roll and a sweet side of fluffy blueberry pancakes. The sandwich stood out with perfectly layered cheese and accompaniment of flavorful sautéed home fries enriched with peppers and onions, a highlight for someone not usually keen on breakfast potatoes. The pancakes met expectations but were slightly let down by the use of pre-packaged syrup, detracting from the otherwise homemade feel of the meal. Service was commendable, with a friendly, attentive server ensuring a pleasant dining experience through continuous coffee refills and a supportive attitude towards my hearty appetite. Despite the minor syrup setback, the overall satisfaction with the meal and the exceptional service provided a memorable experience, echoing the lasting charm of Jersey diners. Looking forward to returning.

This establishment benefits greatly from its attentive and friendly service, as well as the delicious maple wings, which were the highlights of our visit. Our positive experience, however, was overshadowed by an incredibly inappropriate and distasteful incident. Despite paying $35 for a birthday song performance for our celebrant, the performers chose a song we did not request and transformed it into a vulgar spectacle that was both embarrassing and offensive. The lyrics were highly inappropriate, and despite our birthday guest's objections, the performance continued, exacerbating the discomfort. This incident, compounded by a poor sound system, ruined our experience, and we left immediately, feeling that our time and money were wasted.

The new Han Dynasty location has quickly become a favorite, surpassing its Olde City counterpart for me, despite giving both a solid 4-star rating. The service at this new spot is exceptional, standing out in particular for their attentive care when they learned of my peanut allergy, even though my selected dishes contained no peanuts. Their proactive approach, likely spearheaded by Han's sister, added a personal touch to the dining experience.

I've frequented this Han Dynasty more in a single month than I ever visited the other location, drawn in by the welcoming atmosphere and preferable layout. It's worth noting that the menus do differ between locations, with each boasting its unique specialties. While I've heard the dan dan mian is a standout in Olde City, it's not an option for me due to a peanut allergy, and opinions seem to vary on the quality across branches. The spice level here, as with the other branch, could do with a bit of a kick.

A major plus for this location is its lunch offering. They provide smaller, more affordable lunch portions at half the menu price, making it an excellent choice for a midday meal alone or with a small group. Overall, while the food quality is broadly comparable across both locations, the superior service, ambiance, and value for money at the new Han Dynasty make it a standout choice for me.

My experience at Carisma Restaurante was nothing short of exceptional, solidifying its place as my go-to dining destination. The cuisine here is top-notch, with each dish, from the Paellas and salmon to the filet mignon, arriving impeccably prepared, delicious, and piping hot. Beyond the excellent food, the service and ambiance add to the dining pleasure. Owner Jose's personal touch of visiting guests adds a layer of warmth and hospitality, ensuring everyone's satisfaction.

Moreover, the recent addition of a cafe, managed by Jose's daughter, complements Carisma’s offerings with exquisite baked goods and coffees, matching the restaurant's quality. This venture is a testament to the family's dedication to providing a comprehensive and delightful culinary experience. Carisma Restaurante, transcending the typical expectations of tacos and burritos, is a must-visit for anyone looking for high-quality, freshly prepared meals served with genuine care. You're bound to leave impressed and eager for your next meal here.

Tucked away on Woodland Avenue, this unassuming spot is a treasure trove of Senegalese and West African cuisine. Despite its modest appearance, the kitchen produces authentic and delicious dishes, like the national dish of Senegal, Thiboudienne, served here in a unique version without the typical tomato sauce. The Jollof Rice, a must-try known as the precursor to Jambalaya, did not disappoint and made for a delightful take-home meal. The restaurant offers a few high-top tables for those who prefer to dine in, complemented by friendly service, making it a cozy spot for those looking to explore African culinary delights. Whether you're dining in or taking out, this hidden gem is definitely worth a visit.

Visited this place a few years ago for a falafel wrap which was decent, prompting a return visit recently. Unfortunately, the latest experience was disappointing. The wrap was overwhelmingly salty, and both the falafels and pita lacked any discernible flavor. I had hoped the tzatziki sauce might salvage the meal, but it too was bland, resembling tasteless glue rather than the rich, creamy sauce expected. The only redeeming feature was the fresh cucumber and tomato, though their potential was marred by the subpar sauce. Overall, a letdown from a previously acceptable experience.

This spot masterfully balances the epitome of upscale charm and relaxed vibes, making it a perfect choice regardless of your attire. Whether you're sporting a Gucci bag or dressed in your comfiest yoga pants, you'll fit right in. The highlight? Their irresistible cocktails are a must-try, inviting you to savor not just one, but perhaps three, in a setting that feels both luxurious and laid-back.

My group of six sought a fresh dining experience, leading us to this restaurant—a decision that delighted us all. My partner and I opted for the special, finding it a generous assortment of the establishment's offerings, ideal for two. The highlights included exceptional chicken, steak, and a flavorful mix of rice and beans. Although the egg included wasn't to my personal liking, it was easily set aside, and even the yuca, which I typically don't enjoy, proved palatable. The plantains were a particular standout, though I chose to skip the salad. For anyone looking to try something new, this place comes highly recommended for its ample servings and tasty selections.

Today's lunch featured a delightful spread: a generous serving of smoky and juicy pulled pork, nestled in a smokehouse bowl, accompanied by perfectly spiced red beans and rice, and a scrumptious sweet potato casserole. The balance of flavors was impeccable, with the spicy kick of the beans and rice beautifully complementing the sweetness of the casserole. The meat was both abundant and tender, making this meal deeply satisfying. It's a dining experience that is definitely a must-try.

Fantastic detailing service! I opted for the executive detailing package on my car, which hadn't been washed for months and was extremely dirty. The transformation was impressive. Highly recommend for those seeking a thorough and quality cleaning.

During our search for a potential second home from Colorado, we had the pleasure of visiting a local Lifetime club and were immediately greeted with exceptional service. Jen, the front desk person, was not only welcoming but also very informative about the club's amenities, setting a positive tone for our visit. In addition, meeting Joe, the general manager, further impressed us with his friendliness and leadership qualities.

Despite its smaller size compared to other Lifetime clubs, this location did not disappoint in offering full-service experiences tailored to those seeking premium service. The attention to detail, especially in the men's bathrooms, which were stocked with shavers, shaving cream, and lotions, was remarkable. It's clear that members' comfort and convenience are a high priority, as there was no need to bring any toiletries.

Moreover, its strategic location next to the mall adds to its appeal, providing easy access to additional amenities and shopping options. Based on our delightful experience and the excellent level of service and facilities, we highly recommend this club to anyone looking for a top-tier fitness and lifestyle destination.

I had a mediocre barbecue experience, sampling the pulled pork, green beans, mac 'n cheese, and cornbread. While not unpleasant, the dishes were unremarkable, with the pork slightly overdone and dry despite its appealing smoky essence. The original BBQ sauce leaned excessively sweet for my taste. I might revisit due to convenience, but it wouldn't be my first choice if another option were nearby.

During a Lenten Friday visit, my husband and I experienced considerable wait times at this restaurant, which significantly impacted our dining experience. We started our meal with blackened alligator and oysters for appetizers. The alligator, arriving in about 15 minutes, was satisfactory, albeit slightly greasy. A misunderstanding with our server led to a delay in receiving our raw oysters, which I had mistakenly assumed would be char-grilled. Despite having a sensitive stomach, the freshness of the oysters was undeniable.

The wait for our entrees added to our growing frustration, leaving us longing for a simple meal at home. When the food did arrive, the roast beef po-boy my husband ordered was notably salty, and my tuna and shrimp kabob was disappointingly bland, comprising a meager portion of seafood alongside an abundance of bell peppers and onions, and served with baby shrimp creole with rice.

Reflecting on the pricing and our overall experience, I feel somewhat forgiving, though it seems we might have missed out by not trying the seafood boil, which appeared to be a popular choice among other diners. Despite the fresh ingredients, the service missteps and inconsistency in the quality of the dishes were notable drawbacks.

Review: One Star for Poor Customer Service

I had a frustrating experience with this establishment, predominantly due to misleading information and poor customer service regarding a promotional discount for Tulane students. Despite being assured over the phone that I would receive a 50% discount upon showing my ID and even making an appointment based on this information, I was informed upon arrival that the discount only applied on certain days – a detail conveniently omitted during my initial inquiry and contradicted by staff's earlier assurances. Attempts to resolve the misunderstanding were met with inflexibility; the management refused to honor the previously stated discount due to concerns over setting a precedent, despite their own error. The staff's response was dismissive and patronizing, showing little regard for customer satisfaction or the value of my time, which was wasted due to their mistake. I left the establishment without the services I sought, deeply disappointed by the lack of professionalism and customer-centric values. For those who prioritize respectful and honest treatment as much as the quality of the service itself, I advise looking elsewhere.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience with its delectable spicy and ultra-flavorful Chinese cuisine, perfect for sharing among large groups. Its popularity is well-deserved, as every dish served is a hit, ensuring a pleasurable meal for everyone. A must-visit for those seeking a top-notch culinary journey.

During an unexpected detour on a trip to Tampa for a concert, my friend and I discovered the Bricks of Ybor via Yelp and decided to give it a try. The deviation came at a high cost due to a mix-up with our concert tickets, costing an additional $800 in airfare. Despite the mishap, the visit to the Bricks of Ybor proved to be a silver lining. 

The restaurant charmed us with its phenomenal meat sandwiches, particularly the pulled pork sandwich flavored with ponzu on Hawaiian sweet bread, transforming a frustrating situation into one of the best meals in recent memory. The owner, Brian, enhanced our experience by engaging us in conversation, offering us a complimentary drink, and allowing us to sample new appetizers. 

The Bricks of Ybor appeals to a diverse clientele, from hipsters to families, indicative of its varied menu and welcoming atmosphere. Despite the crowd, the service, food, and drinks remained impeccable throughout our visits before and after the concert.

Given this exceptional experience, I wholeheartedly recommend the Bricks of Ybor. It stands as a must-visit destination in Tampa, promising not just a meal but an experience to remember.

The dining experience was absolutely worth the wait, with the crepes being a standout favorite for their amazing taste and quality. Additionally, the grits were surprisingly delightful, marking a rare occurrence of satisfaction with this dish. Sampling the pancakes from my husband's plate, I found them to be equally awesome. Highly recommend!

Visited a restaurant on 8/28/15 with my sister-in-law and had a below-par experience. Difficulty in communication was immediate, with the hostess barely audible over the music, requiring multiple requests for louder speech. Seating led to an unending loop of a Larry King vitamin ad on the TV - an odd choice for dining ambiance. Initial service seemed promising with an introduction to our waitress and a trainee, but that was the extent of their presence. Despite the restaurant not being crowded, service was disjointed, with unclear responsibility among staff for our table, resulting in delayed drinks and a long wait for food. The food, when it arrived, was mixed; the blue cheese burger was overpoweringly cheesy, though fries and onion sticks were commendable. The lack of follow-up service and difficulty obtaining necessities like a carry-out box further marred the experience. Observing another family's prolonged wait for their meal underscored the service issues. The experience makes a return visit highly unlikely.

The dining experience offered dishes that ranged from decent to good with standout items being the guacamole and the Mojito. Unfortunately, the offerings seemed overpriced especially when considering the peach pork medallions, which, while well-prepared, were lacking in flavor. The corn cakes with Barbacoa did impress, adding a positive note to the culinary aspect.

The venue boasted an inviting and hip atmosphere, potentially appealing to those seeking such an ambiance. However, the parking situation significantly detracted from the overall experience. With high price points, the lack of sufficient parking or a valet service (complimentary or otherwise) was a notable inconvenience, especially given the challenging and potentially unsafe parking conditions behind the building. This forced a lengthy walk from a distant parking spot, which was less than ideal in the summer heat. The combination of food quality, pricing, and logistical issues with parking suggests that while there are definite positives, potential guests might weigh these factors carefully before deciding to visit.

I recently dined at Rusty Pelican for the first time on a Saturday night, having made a reservation in advance and specifically requesting a table next to the window for the water view. Upon arrival, the hostess initially attempted to seat us away from the window, and upon our inquiry, she somewhat rudely left us standing in the middle of the dining room before eventually seating us as requested. Fortunately, the rest of the evening significantly improved with excellent drinks, food, and service from our outstanding server, Liz, who went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction. Despite the fantastic meal and service, the initial encounter with the hostess was notably disappointing.

This review reflects a mixed experience at a winery with a fantastic location on the pier, offering a stunning setting for wine tastings, complemented by exceptional staff who received high praise for their service. However, the wine itself was described as fairly average, with an anticipation for the premium wines not yet tasted. The primary concern and reason for a three-star rating was the wine club's perceived poor value and restricted benefits, particularly in comparison to other wine clubs which offer more generous perks to their members. The recommendation is to enjoy the winery's beautiful location and excellent service, but to avoid joining the wine club, suggesting that better value can be found at other venues along the Urban wine trail.

Review for Domenick's Barber Shop:

After a disastrously cheap haircut elsewhere in NY left me looking less than presentable, I found salvation at Domenick's Barber Shop. Seeking a more professional look for upcoming job interviews, I was treated to a great experience. Robert, one of the barbers, provided a clean and stylish cut, transforming my previously butchered hair into a look that made me feel confidently human again. The atmosphere in the shop was welcoming, and the service was top-notch.

The total cost came to $35, which, while slightly higher than I'd hoped to spend, felt justified by the quality of the haircut and the level of service provided. As someone unfamiliar with standard pricing in Philly, others might find this a fair rate. Overall, I'd rate Domenick's Barber Shop 4 out of 5 stars. It lost a point due to price, but for those willing to invest a bit more for a quality cut, it's certainly a recommendable option.

This review expresses profound dissatisfaction with the service received at Bergeys, triggered by a mishap involving an underfilled engine by Monro Muffler which led to engine damage. The reviewer highlighted various shortcomings in their experience: from being frequent customers and spending a substantial amount on repairs, to dealing with Joe, a service associate, who was accused of being unhelpful, providing minimal information to the insurance company, and being exceedingly rude to the reviewer's wife, to the extent of causing her distress. The situation escalated when the necessity for a timing chain replacement was identified— a repair typically unnecessary unless due to oil-related issues. Despite assurances from Monro's insurance for coverage, the lack of support and professionalism at Bergeys has led the reviewer to decide against future patronage for both service and potential car purchases, stating a loss of a lifelong customer.

This charming shop dazzles with its clean, inviting atmosphere and an array of homemade delicacies guaranteed to impress. From breakfast tarts to sumptuous chicken pot pies, and a selection of sweets that are as stunning visually as they are delicious, it’s a feast for the senses. Though portions may seem modest for the price, the premium quality justifies the cost. Perfect for locals and worth the journey for those coming from afar, its friendly counter staff adds to the welcoming vibe. Definitely a spot to revisit and recommend.

Visited for breakfast and joined the queue before 8:30am, waiting roughly 30 minutes. Tried a variety of pancakes including the raspberry, sweet potato, San Antonio, and sugar and spice. All were satisfactory yet slightly dry, leaving me puzzled by the restaurant's hype. While it's an acceptable option for standard breakfast fare if the wait is short, longer lines might warrant skipping. Instead, heading to Fido down the street is highly recommended for their excellent coffee and superior breakfast offerings.

This service center has experienced a significant decline in the quality of their service advisors since Kelly and her team departed. Although it was previously commended for its services, current interactions leave much to be desired. Despite this, its convenient location makes it a practical choice for quick necessities, such as an oil change, before reaching an alternative Honda dealer.

This hidden gem offers the best soon-dubu in the city, providing an experience akin to stepping into a welcoming Korean home. It stands out for its vegetarian-friendly options, with soft tofu stewed to perfection in dol sot pots, making each serving feel personally crafted. The menu caters to everyone, offering beef, seafood, mixed meats, mushroom, and plain varieties, all customizable in terms of spice levels. The option of extra hot is a thrill for spice lovers. Additionally, the rice served in a dol-sot is a standout, especially when left to form a crispy shell. Beyond tofu, the restaurant also serves Korean BBQ and other stew options. A visit here is a must for a mouthwatering experience. Love this place!

This motel offers good value for its rate, providing clean and comfortable accommodations with efficient management. While the breakfast buffet meets basic expectations without standing out, and the small pool may disappoint those looking to swim laps, it compensates with a spacious and comfortable lobby area. Perfect for travelers seeking a moderately priced, pleasant place to rest.

This concise review highlights a disappointing experience with the management of a columbarium. The individual expressed frustration over the refusal to provide the owner's contact for addressing the cleanliness and maintenance of the columbarium, particularly an older area that has been neglected for years. Despite efforts to discuss upkeep and the replacement of deteriorating plastic vases with something more durable for all niches, not just for their father’s, their concerns were met with indifference, lacking any acknowledgment or empathy from the management. This situation reveals a disheartening disregard for both the sanctity of the site and the sentiments of those wishing to maintain the dignity of their loved ones' final resting places.

This deli offers a delightful experience the moment you walk through the door, greeted warmly by the personable woman at the counter. While I'm not a regular enough to be recognized by name, the atmosphere is welcoming nonetheless. The vegetarian breakfast sandwiches, notably the veg. sausage with Havarti on an everything bagel, are a standout and available all day, providing a satisfying option for any meal. My partner and I have also sampled the veggie club sandwich, chicken cheesesteak hoagie, and chicken salad on a croissant, all of which were fresh and favorably priced, particularly noticeable in comparison to alternatives like Wawa. The helpful staff are eager to recommend or adapt menu items to suit preferences, ensuring a pleasurable dining experience. Additionally, the deli boasts an impressive selection of snacks, from chocolate bars to an extensive variety of chips and the irresistible hi-chew candies. With its combination of fast, delicious, and attentive service, this establishment has secured itself as a must-return venue for anyone in search of a quality, affordable meal in a friendly setting.

We had an unexpectedly delightful brunch experience with standout dishes like the 3 meat hash, turkey sandwich, and bagel with salmon. The staff was notably friendly and accommodating, adding value to our visit despite the slightly higher prices. It's definitely worth a revisit when we're back in the area.

This hidden gem at the far end of Terminal E at Tampa International Airport offers a refreshing touch of local flair among its newer restaurant additions. Its modest size belies its appeal, especially for those looking to catch a game with conveniently placed TVs. While seating is somewhat limited and it's a bit removed from the TSA checkpoints, this niche spot compensates with very reasonable food pricing for the portion sizes offered, ranging from $5-$10 for appetizers and around $12 for the majority of sandwiches. Though I didn't personally sample the food, it looked incredibly tempting. The drink selection doesn't disappoint either, with prices that are fair for an airport setting—$8.50 for a 22oz Jai Alai, for example. Notably, you can't take your alcoholic drinks into the terminal, a policy shared by some other establishments. My Manhattan, priced at $11, was delightful, and the service was attentive and warm. This place has quickly become my go-to when I'm awaiting a Delta flight.

The Depot offers an unforgettable dining experience, featuring a delectable burger partnered perfectly with shishito peppers. The ambiance is just as impressive as the cuisine, matched with a top-notch drink selection. Everything about this place can only be described as perfect!

This review reflects a significant decline in the quality and convenience of shopping at this Giant store over recent years. Once praised for its broad selection of reasonably priced food items, the store has unfortunately seen a drop in the freshness of its produce while simultaneously increasing its prices, making it more expensive than competitors like Whole Foods. A recent visit highlighted serious accessibility issues due to excessive roping off of aisles and the main entrance, making navigation and checkout a cumbersome process. Additionally, the early morning shopping experience, which used to be quiet and efficient, was marred by unwanted confrontations with staff during a poorly planned floor cleaning operation. These negative changes have led the reviewer to prefer Wegmans for future shopping needs.

Discovering this restaurant was a delightful surprise, perfectly hidden within a strip mall. Celebrating my birthday here, I was thoroughly impressed by its sophisticated and romantic ambiance, a stark contrast to its unassuming location. The culinary experience was exceptional, with the Fois gras leaving a particularly memorable impression. Opting for the prix fixe menu allowed for a satisfying exploration of their offerings, from the flavorful short ribs to the exceptional dessert selection, with the caramel tart standing out as a true highlight. Eagerly anticipating my next visit, this establishment has earned its place as a must-visit hidden gem.

Title: A Disappointing Birthday Dinner Experience

Summary: A group of 8, including myself, visited a well-hyped restaurant for a birthday celebration, expecting a night of good food and service. Despite making reservations and the restaurant not being overly busy, the experience was deeply disappointing due to poor service and mediocre food, failing to live up to the excitement surrounding it.

Review: Unfortunately, this dining experience can only be described as one of the worst. Our group, eager for a pleasant evening, faced inattentiveness right from the start. Despite being seated in a prime location near the staff's base, getting any form of service was a struggle. The long waits for wine and food significantly dampened our spirits, and the need to constantly flag down staff for service was unacceptable. The anticipation of celebrating a birthday with a special gesture as mentioned to the hostesses was met with a lackluster ending, further spoiling the occasion.

Food-wise, the offerings were a mixed bag. While the whipped feta and braised lamb received our applause, the majority, including a poorly prepared sirloin and a disappointing grilled Caesar salad, left much to be desired, especially considering the price point. 

Although the atmosphere of the restaurant was trendy and promising, the abysmal service significantly overshadowed any potential positives. It's with regret that I share such a negative review, but for a restaurant basking in hype, the reality, based on our experience, falls dramatically short of expectations.
Fantastic value with delicious offerings, including tender steak and perfectly cooked shrimp. Definitely worth a return visit.

My visit to Tako was influenced by its positive Yelp reviews, but the experience did not live up to expectations. Despite bringing our own bottle of white wine, the staff neglected to provide an ice or chill bucket. Service was notably slow, with a 45-minute wait for appetizers which were disappointing; the edamame was mushy and overcooked, and the spring rolls seemed uninspired and possibly pre-frozen, a quality easily outmatched by supermarket offerings from places like Trader Joe's. Our sushi, while decent, was allowed to sit at the bar for 15 minutes before being served, detracting from what could have been a more enjoyable meal. The sushi itself was satisfactory but not extraordinary. Should I decide to give Tako another chance, I would likely skip the appetizers in hopes of a better experience. Overall, the service was lethargic, and the food quality inconsistent.

This restaurant boasts a lunch buffet with a sumptuous selection that is absolutely irresistible. The catfish, chicken, gumbo, and mac & cheese stand out for their exceptional flavors, all served piping hot and fresh. Following a local's recommendation proved extremely worthwhile, making for an unforgettable dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for authentically delicious fare.

See's Candies, originally from California, has made its way to Florida, offering a delectable selection of soft and tasty chocolates. While my first introduction to See's was through my wife's experiences in California, I recently had the pleasure of visiting their seasonal store in Tampa's International Plaza Mall, open from Thanksgiving to Easter. Conveniently located near the H&M clothing store, this temporary outlet provides an opportunity to sample their chocolates before making a purchase.

I opted for the lollipop candies and an assorted chocolates box, both of which were exceptionally good. Notably, the store clerk went above and beyond by offering us a taste of their assorted chocolates beyond the standard samples, enhancing our shopping experience.

See's offers a variety of chocolates to suit various preferences, including options with nuts, mint, toffee, and in milk, white, or dark chocolate forms. Their offerings are a guilty pleasure with a pleasantly sweet twist. For those not near the mall, See's Candies also accepts mail orders through their website, making it convenient to indulge in their sweets from afar. However, if you're in proximity to the International Plaza Mall, I highly recommend visiting the store to save on shipping and enjoy their delicious chocolates firsthand.

Visited R2L during Center City Restaurant Week and enjoyed a spectacular dinner for $35 each. Perched on the 37th floor of Two Liberty Place, R2L offers a fancy-cool atmosphere paired with breathtaking views of Philadelphia. Although we didn't snag a window table, the sunset and nighttime cityscape were still a treat. The dining experience kicked off with delectable crisp peas, ham, and garlic risotto balls, followed by a hearty main course of Butcher's Filet, complemented by braised short rib, Steuben bean chili, and a flavorful potato and farm veg slaw with basil. The final flourish was a sumptuous milk chocolate and hazelnut pudding with salted caramel, coffee, and candied almonds. Paired with a bottle of wine, the meal was a delight. The service was top-notch, notably with our waiter's thoughtful guidance on menu items. Overall, R2L delivered a classy, delicious, and thoroughly enjoyable dining experience.

Becca excels as a bartender, offering excellent service that enhances the bar's appeal, particularly during happy hour with enticing specials like Land Shark. Though the food menu might be limited, the overall hospitality makes up for it. It's a spot worth supporting, with the potential to become a local favorite.

The recent visit to this establishment was disappointing for a newcomer to the area. The encounter included not receiving change or a receipt when specifically requested, and the oversight was dismissed by staff. Additionally, the meal was incomplete without a spoon for the chili, and the quality of the meal was compromised by the use of old cheese on the burger, suggesting it wasn't freshly made. Despite the food tasting acceptable, the overall experience was underwhelming, leading to a decision not to return.

This restaurant offers fantastic value for family-style orders with competitive prices. The pot roast was equally delightful as carry-out, retaining its warmth and quality perfectly during a 30-minute journey. Impressively, the portion sizes are generous, adequately serving a family of four. A notable highlight was the exceptionally tasty green beans. While the establishment may not boast extraordinary flair, its solid performance as a reliable family restaurant is commendable and worth recommending.
Had a disappointing experience ordering a caramel frappe through the drive-thru. Despite only two cars ahead, the wait time stretched to an unnecessary 30 minutes. A big letdown!

This bakery impresses with its inventive and delectable offerings, notably the pizza cookies - a must-try. Both the Peanut Butter and Oreo flavors were sensational, coming hot, soft, and delicious. The establishment's decision to stay open till 3 am enhances its appeal, catering to late-night cravings effectively. However, the pricing is a bit steep, which slightly dampens the overall experience. Despite this, the unique taste and convenience may just justify the cost for those late-night indulgences. Rating: 4/5.

After relocating from Chicago to Philadelphia over a year ago, I've had the opportunity to explore the local dining scene. Despite hearing high praises for many restaurants in the city, none truly met my high expectations until I dined at this particular establishment, which I now consider the best in Philadelphia.

From the moment the tahini and bread arrived, I was hooked. The tahini was inexplicably addictive, complemented perfectly by excellent bread. The menu boasted a variety of organic meat options, a rarity that I greatly appreciated. I opted for an organic beef shishkabob, which was cooked to perfection, accompanied by near-caramelized onions and a purslane salad that felt like a fresh taste of a garden. It was a dish so memorable, I find myself dreaming about that salad.

My husband's choice, a chicken dish paired with black-eyed and green peas along with exceptional rice, was equally impressive. The unique blend of spices, including zatar and a house mix, enhanced the flavor profile beyond our ability to describe. 

Despite being full, I indulged in dessert – a decision I didn't regret. The pistachio crème brûlée was a delight, striking the perfect balance between richness and lightness, encapsulating pure pistachio bliss.

The service matched the quality of the food; attentive, accommodating, and well-timed, especially given the constraint of a tight reservation schedule. Small details, like the refolding of a napkin when my husband stepped away, showcased the staff's training and attentiveness.

Given the exceptional experience and the justifiability of the prices, my dining strategy in Philadelphia has now shifted. I plan to dine out less frequently overall, saving my outings for this outstanding restaurant. My heartfelt kudos to the chef and the entire team for a truly remarkable dining experience.
This establishment severely disappointed with its offerings, serving a frozen pizza alongside beer that had gone bad. Absolutely subpar experience.

Our family's experience at this frozen yogurt establishment was deeply disappointing. Shortly after our visit, everyone fell ill, which marred our overall perception of the place. Despite the visually appealing presentation of the yogurt, its taste failed to meet our expectations. Based on this experience, we cannot recommend this venue and will not be returning.

This eatery stands out as a gem for anyone craving authentic Indian street food. My numerous visits have allowed me to explore a broad spectrum of their menu, encompassing items like bhel puri, pav bhaji, vada pav, deconstructed samosa, aloo tikki, dabeli, and kulfi, each dish impressing with its exceptional preparation. My only regret is not discovering this culinary haven sooner.

Title: A Wild Night Out at The Saint: An Unforgettable Experience

Review: Venturing out to offer my sister a memorable night on the town, our search for excitement took us from the quiet streets of Frenchmen to the lively bar scene Uptown. Our bar crawl spanned several notable spots, including Delachaise, Columns, and St. Joe’s. However, the true adventure began after a spirited debate on our late-night destination.

Ultimately, curiosity led us to The Saint, a choice that would leave a lasting impression. From the moment we walked in, the atmosphere was palpable; with my sister’s deer-in-the-headlights expression, I knew we were in for a unique experience. True to the character of a late-night haunt, we encountered all the usual suspects: unwelcome dance-floor advances, excessively chatty patrons, and even Big Buck Hunter to round out the dive bar feel.

Despite the initial shock to the senses, discovering The Saint’s outdoor seating became our night's saving grace, offering a much-needed respite from the indoor smoke and chaos. Reflecting on the night, I appreciate the blend of mild trauma and satiated curiosity it provided, making for an unforgettable night out with my sister. For those looking to dive deep into the Uptown scene with all its grit and unexpected charm, The Saint might just be your next stop—just maybe head straight for the outdoor seating.
The restaurant excels in serving fresh and delicious food. Their Wonton Soup, a favorite among children, stands out for its quality, indicating the care and time invested in its preparation.

The food quality was commendable; however, the hospitality significantly marred our experience. Despite arriving at 9:15 pm, well before the closing time of 10 pm, our group, which notably included two pregnant women and a child, was unjustifiably denied dine-in service. We were informed we could only order takeaway. This lack of accommodation, especially given the context, was disappointing. The inconvenience forced us to undertake an unnecessary hour-long drive home for a meal. Such an attitude towards customer service is unacceptable, and we have no intention of returning. The establishment's treatment of guests, especially those in a vulnerable condition, is deeply regrettable.

This place utterly exceeded our expectations with its exceptional offerings. The steak here outshines any other steakhouse fare we've encountered, setting a new standard for quality. The staff, featuring the coordinated efforts of hostess Mallory, waiter Max, and a diligent busboy, operates with seamless precision, ensuring a smooth and attentive dining experience. Our visit was nothing short of amazing, guaranteeing our return. Highly recommended for an unparalleled culinary journey. Love this place!

The service received was outstanding, highlighted by Dr. Dinh's kindness and attentiveness during the exam. The selection of frames catered well to personal pickiness, and the receptionist's patience added to a positive experience. Overall, highly satisfactory and worth returning for annual exams.

My experience with this pizza place fell far short of expectations. The pizza provided was surprisingly small, inadequate for a group. Additionally, the delivery took an excessive amount of time. The interaction with the delivery person was unpleasant; she was rude and attempted to withhold change, incorrectly assuming it was a tip. To add to the frustration, the change given back was incorrect and in an inconvenient form—all coins. Based on this experience, I cannot recommend this establishment.

Visited this spot on a recommendation for their Sonoran hot dog while in town. Though famous for it, I found the hot dog had too many components for my personal taste, making it good but not great for me. However, the guacamole was a highlight, truly delicious. I also tried the taco combo; both the chicken and carne asada tacos hit the mark, but unfortunately, the cabeza taco felt slimy. A plus point was their self-serve salsa bar, which added a custom touch to the meal. Service was efficient, with food arriving quickly, even though the place was bustling during a weekday lunch. Overall, a mixed experience with some standout dishes.

Upon visiting the restaurant with a reservation, we encountered an initially disappointing moment when the request for a window table was declined due to all being reportedly reserved. Despite this, the various window tables remained unoccupied throughout our stay, which spanned over two hours. The culinary experience, on a brighter note, was pleasing with satisfactory dishes; I opted for the filet while my companion enjoyed the salmon. However, a surprise arose with the wine selection - a bottle recommended by the staff came with an undisclosed price of $75, revealed only upon billing, which was an unexpected aspect of our dining experience.

This Indian restaurant is a real gem! It not only serves the best Indian cuisine I've ever had, with standouts like the freshly made paleek paneer and briyani, but also impresses with its warm, clean, and welcoming atmosphere. The staff's friendliness and attentiveness further enhance the dining experience, making it a must-visit for a delightful meal.

This establishment offers what are undoubtedly the best smoothies in the world, complemented by amazing fresh bread that adds to the allure. Staff members are remarkably knowledgeable, ensuring a delightful experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking quality refreshments and service.

During a recent visit to Nashville, I had the pleasure of stopping by Bell Meade, an experience I can only describe as memorable enough to warrant a definite return on my next trip. While my primary motive was to hunt down specific bourbons, such as the elusive Elmer T Lee, my visit coincided with an off-peak season for such finds. Yet, this did not dampen the experience.

Despite not securing the Elmer T, the visit was enriching. The highlight was engaging with Max at the tasting bar, whose company alone makes a revisit compelling. The tasting offered a delightful exploration, and I even discovered a Tennessee whiskey cream not available locally, alongside another intriguing bottle unexpectedly found on the shelf.

My experience at Bell Meade is one I look forward to repeating, warranting a well-deserved five-star rating. It's not just about the bourbon; it's the warm encounters and discoveries that make Bell Meade a must-visit destination in Nashville.

In search of fresh seafood and a delightful seaside dining experience, this restaurant located at the end of the pier truly stands out from the rest. Unlike many disappointing visits elsewhere, the quality of seafood here is exceptional, offering both freshness and great preparation. The picturesque view adds to the dining pleasure, making it more than just a meal but an experience. Despite a previous visit that led to an unsatisfactory cioppino, a return trip proved worthwhile with selections that hit the mark.

Opting for the local crab special, the offering was both generous and delicious, presenting a 3-lb. steamed crab accompanied by a fresh garden salad and a choice of soup at an unbeatable price of $26. The simplicity of the salad and the flavorful lobster bisque option were highlights. Additionally, the fried seafood platter, despite being a potentially greasy option, impressed with its freshness, particularly the fried oysters, making it one of the superior fried platters encountered.

Service was exceptional; attentive and friendly staff ensured a comfortable and satisfying dining experience, going above and beyond with gestures like providing extra ice for drinks under the sun. Despite the minor inconvenience of waiting for a table and the unsheltered seating, the overall experience was positive, underscored by the fantastic view and the incredible value of the meal offerings.

For anyone planning a visit, expect waits especially during late lunch/early dinner times, and consider parking options as the pier's can be challenging. This restaurant is not just about eating but enjoying a moment of nature’s beauty, enhanced by stellar service and quality seafood.

**Review Summary:**

I had an incredibly disappointing experience at this restaurant, an establishment I would caution potential patrons about. The management and waitstaff's behavior was shockingly rude and unprofessional, culminating in a hostile interaction when I simply inquired about substituting brown for white rice. Beyond the appalling service, the food quality was mediocre at best, making any compliments a significant stretch. An unusual policy of charging for soda refills further diminished the dining experience, adding unnecessary expense. Considering all these factors, I strongly recommend finding an alternative dining option and will not be revisiting this establishment. **Overall Rating: 1/5**

My first foray into NOLA cuisine was a mixed bag, landing on the lackluster side of experiences. Visiting on the Sunday night before Fat Tuesday, I anticipated a bustling atmosphere but hoped for stellar service. Understandably, the staff was stretched thin, with our waitress pulling long shifts. This perhaps contributed to forgotten drink orders and mixed-up plates. Opting for a po'boy shrimp, I found the dish underwhelming. While the shrimp portion was generous, it was let down by scant lettuce, lackluster sauce, and predominantly soggy fries. Regrettably, this visit didn't inspire a return, despite other reviews suggesting we hit an off-night.

This establishment, though favorably located with ample parking, severely lacks in ambiance and service quality. It projects a run-down feel not suitable for family outings, closely resembling a neglected banquet hall rather than a lively comedy club. An urgent renovation is needed for it to recapture any sense of vibrancy and comfort.

Review of Stay at Orange St Location:

My stay at the Orange St location from Friday to Monday was a delightful surprise. Despite the initial challenge of locating the place due to the absence of signage, positioning near a landmark Starbucks and the availability of limited but free weekend parking in front of the multi-business complex smoothed over the entry process. The check-in was unconventional, involving a security guard who provided keys and minimal support, yet an available phone offered a lifeline for further assistance.

The accommodation itself transcended expectations; described best as an apartment rather than a mere room, it offered a lavish expanse of space and amenities. The well-appointed suite boasted a fully stocked kitchen, ample workspace, a king-sized bed, generous living area, and plentiful storage - a dream setup for any guest seeking comfort and utility. Nonetheless, the inability to open windows for fresh air due to them being sealed was a minor setback. The thoughtful addition of a welcome bag with snacks and useful local information compensated for this slight inconvenience.

Notably absent was the disturbance of daily maid service, aligning with the property's inclination towards longer stays. This detail, along with self-catered provisions from a local Shoprite, facilitated a serene and autonomous living experience.

The apartment's tranquility was its crowning feature, creating an ideal environment for both hosting visitors and focused study. Its modern updates and spacious layout not only catered to my needs for entertainment and academic preparation but also provided a profound sense of solitude and peace.

In conclusion, the Orange St location is a hidden gem offering spacious, modern, and quiet accommodations. It adeptly merges the privacy of apartment living with the transient nature of short stays, making it a compelling choice for future visits. Highly recommended for those in search of a discreet, comfortable, and self-sufficient lodging option.

This restaurant boasts an awesome location and has consistently provided good service over the 15 years I've frequented it. However, my ongoing concern involves issues with the steak quality, which has prompted this review. While I'm willing to pay a premium for high-quality steak, the recurring excuses, often placing blame on the supplier, are disappointing and detract from the overall dining experience.

Title: A Nightmare Dealership Experience

I had an incredibly frustrating experience with purchasing a vehicle that turned out to be beyond my budget. Only two days after making the purchase, I realized my financial mistake and reached out to the dealership for a solution. Despite my efforts to rectify the situation promptly, communication with the sales team, particularly Stephen, was consistently poor and unresponsive. 

Upon realizing my predicament, the dealership informed me I had no choice but to sell the car back to them as a used vehicle, which would result in a significant financial loss for me. However, this claim was contradicted when the bank later advised me that the loan had not been approved, and funding was not in place—a direct opposition to what I was told by the dealership's finance department.

Despite several attempts to resolve the matter and even seeking legal counsel for support, the dealership has remained uncooperative and elusive. This ordeal has been ongoing without any resolution, and the dealership’s dishonesty and lack of customer service have been appalling. Potential buyers should steer clear of this dealership to avoid similar deceptive practices and poor customer support.

Having been a longtime patron of Desi Village in West Philadelphia, I ventured to try their King of Prussia (KOP) branch with some initial skepticism due to a less impressive experience at Mood Cafe, run by the same team. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find the culinary quality at the KOP Desi Village remarkably similar to its West Philly counterpart.

The KOP location itself leaves a lot to be desired in terms of atmosphere. Situated in a nearly deserted strip mall, the restaurant does not offer an inviting ambiance with its tired and outdated decor. Despite the spacious interior hinting at a potentially bustling lunch buffet, one might question its ability to draw a crowd purely based on its setting.

That said, the food unequivocally shines as the redeeming feature. Our order included Keema Naan, Samosas, Saag Paneer, and Lamb Biryani—all of which were served perfectly seasoned, not overly oily, and with just the right level of spiciness. A noteworthy mention is their conscientiousness regarding my nut allergy, a detail that is often overlooked in many establishments but was diligently catered to here.

In conclusion, while the ambiance at Desi Village KOP may not entice, the food compellingly beckons a return visit. It's a testament to the fact that, at the end of the day, it's the quality of the meal that matters most. A relocation to a more appealing venue could potentially elevate the overall dining experience, but for now, the culinary delights are enough to ensure my continued patronage.

Disappointingly turned away by another spot due to them running out of food, our serendipitous journey brought us to LA Smokehouse via a quick Yelp search while wandering around Mid City. The warm welcome by the super nice woman at the counter, who walked us through the menu, set the tone for a remarkable dining experience. I indulged in a one-meat plate featuring succulent "wet" pulled pork, alongside delectable sides of grits and potato salad, with an irresistible medium mac and cheese on the side. My boyfriend opted for the two-meat plate, savoring both the brisket and pulled chicken with potato salad and fries. Each dish was a palate pleaser, masterfully prepared and brimming with flavor, notably the perfectly sauced pulled pork and the standout mac and cheese.

The quality of the food, coupled with the casual, friendly atmosphere, and the personal touch of the owner ensuring diner satisfaction, made our visit to LA Smokehouse an unforgettable one. It wasn’t just the food that delighted us, but the overall experience that converted our initial disappointment into a newfound barbecue favorite. We’re already planning our return trip to Earhart for another taste of what we’ve proudly added to our "BBQ Favorites" list. LA Smokehouse is a must-visit for anyone in search of top-notch barbecue served with a side of genuine hospitality.

Iris has quickly ascended to my top spot for dining in New Orleans, an impressive achievement in a city celebrated for its culinary riches. This restaurant distinguishes itself by its exemplary performance across all fronts: delectable food, an inviting atmosphere, impeccable service, and a prime location, enhanced by judicious musical choices.

Arranging lunch for a group size that fluctuated between 10-15, Iris showcased remarkable flexibility and preparedness, ensuring comfortable seating for all, a testament to their outstanding service. The atmosphere was made even more enjoyable by a thoughtfully selected soundtrack that allowed for easy conversation—striking the perfect balance between entertainment and ambiance.

Though lacking a full lunch drink menu, the available selection of martinis, wines, and spirits like Chartreuse met with unanimous approval, indicating a well-curated beverage offering. The food, from the in-house baked bread to the main courses like the superbly prepared drum fish in a soy reduction and diverse options like gnocchi and chicken, was universally praised for its freshness, creativity, and the use of local ingredients.
