Opting for the prix fixe menu proved not only to be a culinary delight—with highlights including heavenly salads and the best strawberry sorbet dessert—but also an exceptional value at under $35 per person, accounting for drinks and tips. With its combination of culinary excellence, serene environment, and top-notch service, Iris stands as a sterling example of New Orleans' dining scene. My experience was such that I am already looking forward to my next visit, regardless of group size.

This restaurant boasts a great atmosphere and decor, complemented by super friendly staff who promptly seat guests upon arrival. My experiences with both lunch and dinner offerings were generally positive, with a minor disappointment in one dinner starter. The lunch special, Pad Thai with chicken, was flavorful and well-portioned. Dinner began with chicken satay, which, although tasty, especially with its peanut dipping sauce, was disappointing due to the small serving size of just two skewers. The main course of Panang Curry with chicken was more satisfying, served with a generous portion of rice and boasted good flavors. A small letdown was the absence of Pad See Ew on the menu, though there are other dishes I'm interested in trying on future visits. The dedication of the staff and manager to customer service is noteworthy, making me look forward to returning soon.

We stumbled upon Petra Restaurant near our home when craving Middle Eastern cuisine and were pleasantly surprised. The highlight was their weekend special rice with lamb, reminiscent of Indian fried rice, which was exceptionally tasty. Despite its unassuming location, the restaurant's interior is inviting, complemented by good service. All in all, Petra Restaurant is a hidden gem that offers a delightful culinary experience beyond its facade. Highly recommended!

I celebrated my birthday at The Pearl and the entire experience was incredible! From the exquisite food and wine selection to the exceptional service, everything was flawless. Even when we lost track of time and stayed past closing, the staff was incredibly gracious, never once making us feel hurried. Highly recommend for a memorable dining experience!

Stopped by Albertsons on a snack run and was pleasantly surprised by the clean, well-stocked store. They offer wide aisles and an impressive selection ranging from bakery goods and flowers to standard groceries, with a nice touch of locally made snacks like California Kettle Corn and Taco Works chips. Found some semi-unusual chips not always available elsewhere. Completed my visit with a Diet Coke at checkout. The parking was convenient, and the staff was notably friendly and helpful. A satisfying experience overall. Thanks, Albertsons!
Under new ownership, the establishment now disappoints with both poor quality food and subpar service, a significant downfall from its once enjoyable status.

Dr. Gloudemans comes highly recommended for her approachable and informed manner. She's celebrated for being friendly, always upbeat, and current with the latest medical research, particularly advocating for vaccinations. Her proactive stance on medical issues, preferring to monitor before escalating to specialists, is particularly appreciated by her patients. However, the practice has encountered some administrative challenges, notably in billing, where there have been errors in processing payments leading to undue stress. These issues, while resolvable with communication, have been a point of frustration. Overall, despite the administrative hiccups, Dr. Gloudemans' medical care is exemplary.

I recently attended a meeting for the Homebuilders Association of New Orleans, which was coupled with a delightful dining experience. The organizers successfully ensured a comfortable and pleasant atmosphere for all patrons, contributing to the overall positive vibe of the event. The culinary offerings notably enhanced the experience, from the refreshing mimosa to the scrumptious bites of food available.

The corn and crab soup stood out for its fantastic flavor, though the small serving left me wanting more. On the other hand, the grits and grillades were not only delicious but also satisfying in portion, marking a high point in the meal for $10—a great deal considering the quality of the food provided. An added convenience was the inclusion of the menu photo, aiding in meal selection.

While I didn't have the opportunity to test the Wi-Fi, the combination of the inviting ambience and the high-quality food makes me look forward to repeating this experience. Overall, it's a commendable venue for those looking for good food and a welcoming atmosphere at a reasonable price.

Review of Frist Cafe:

As an employee at the Frist, I rarely dine in at the cafe, preferring to head home for my midday meal. However, on particularly gloomy days, I find myself opting for the convenience of the on-site cafe, indulging in my go-to dish: the Cobb Salad. This salad is a great option for those looking for gluten-free meals, and I personally recommend adding an extra egg to amp up the protein. The combination of plentiful meats and a simple oil and vinegar dressing makes for a satisfying lunch. The cafe's affordable prices and quick service attract a mix of museum visitors and local workers, making it a popular spot. One word of caution: it can get particularly crowded during Senior Mondays (every third Monday of the month) and on weekends around 11:30 am to noon.

Ghini's offers a delightful French breakfast experience with a menu that tantalizes the taste buds. Their Eggs Provencale is a unique standout, skillfully combining eggs with tomatoes, thyme, garlic, and herbs de Provence, further enhanced by their baguette toast and incredibly valued hashbrowns. However, it's their crepes that steal the show, offering a perfect balance of sweet and savory fillings, with the spinach and Swiss variant being particularly noteworthy. Highly recommended for a delicious and authentically French culinary adventure.

This place is a hidden gem with its unique graffiti art decor and delectable dining options. The special hummus flavors are a standout, and the food, including the greek steak pita with guac hummus I tried, is delicious and reasonably priced. The portion sizes do not disappoint. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

Prep & Pastry has fast become a favorite brunch spot, captivating us enough to visit twice in just two months. Their ingenious waitlist system, which allows you to place your name on the list as long as you're within 5 miles of the restaurant, brilliantly cuts down the wait times often experienced on busy Sundays. The menu, a delightful mix of savory and sweet brunch items, has never disappointed — with the breakfast sandwich particularly standing out as a favorite. Even the non-alcoholic beverages, like their ice tea, are of noteworthy quality, surpassing familiar offerings elsewhere. It's not just the food and convenience that make Prep & Pastry a must-visit; the staff's exceptional friendliness rounds out a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for an excellent brunch experience.

The Edmonton Fringe Festival is a standout annual event, spanning over two weekends and the week in between, packed with an eclectic mix of performances. It boasts a wide array of venues, engaging plays, lively street performers, and talented musicians, making it a cultural feast for the senses. The festival is well-organized, with an online schedule to assist attendees in planning their experience, buying tickets, and discovering more about the artists involved.

Foodies and shopaholics will delight in the half-block of 104th Street that transforms into a bustling market, offering everything from gourmet mini donuts (a must-try hidden gem behind the farmers market) to artisanal artwork, jewelry, and clothing. The festival's atmosphere encourages leisurely exploration, whether it's meandering through the various street performances or simply enjoying the vibrant array of food and artisan vendors without attending a play.

Set in a fantastic location, the Edmonton Fringe Festival is more than just a series of theatrical performances; it's a cultural immersion that offers something for everyone, making it a highly recommended addition to Edmonton's annual festival lineup.

Visited an old favorite lunch spot after a year and found it significantly changed for the worse. The customer service has deteriorated notably, marking a departure from the once friendly and accommodating staff to a server who lacked warmth, was unhelpful with recommendations, and did not offer the customary tea to go. While the food quality remains passable, the overall dining experience was negatively impacted by the subpar service. Additionally, the wear and tear on the premises, particularly the taped-up benches, detracted from the ambiance. Sadly, this visit has diminished my fondness for what used to be a favorite dining choice, prompting my decision not to return.

Although this plumbing service provided the highest quote compared to two others, their prompt communication made a positive impression. Despite opting for another plumber this time, their reliability leads me to consider them for future projects, acknowledging that their pricing may reflect higher quality work.

"This Mexican restaurant offers what is arguably the best Mexican cuisine in Florida, captivating guests with its culinary prowess from their first visit. The consistent quality and delicious flavors have made it a favorite, compelling patrons to return time and again. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy top-notch Mexican dishes."

This spot offers authentic Thai cuisine, accommodating those who prefer their dishes spicy by adjusting the heat level upon request. The soups stand out for their quality, pleasing even discerning palates, while the curries deliver on flavor, although their consistency might appear thin to those unfamiliar with traditional Thai curries. While the eggrolls did not particularly impress, especially the vegetarian option, they could be more appealing to those opting for the meat variant. Overall, it presents a genuine taste of Thailand with the flexibility to cater to different spice preferences.

Last May, my wife and I had an exceptional experience with Jump on the School Bus for a pre-wedding winery and brewery tour, as well as our wedding day transportation between Goleta and the Circle Bar-B Ranch. Darin and Sierra's communication from the planning stages in Washington, DC through to the execution was outstanding. They were incredibly flexible, accommodating last-minute changes with ease, and their attention to detail was impeccable. Darin's personal visit to one of our stops reassured us of their commitment to our satisfaction. Moreover, our driver's deep knowledge of the area enriched our tour immensely.  Jump on the School Bus was undeniably the perfect choice for both our joyful celebrations and logistics. Their superb service and genuine care for our needs make them highly recommendable for any significant event.

Bailey's Range is a must-visit restaurant for both locals and tourists alike, providing a delightful experience with its exceptional selection of burgers and unique boozy shakes. Its central location makes it an ideal spot for visitors exploring downtown attractions. The restaurant's ambiance is inviting with a preference for seating on the upper level for a more traditional dining experience away from the communal tables on the ground floor.

The menu at Bailey's Range is impressively diverse, catering to a wide range of tastes - from mac 'n' cheese patties to bison and turkey burgers, ensuring that there is something for everyone. The quality and creativity of the food are consistently high, with the horchata shake being a standout offering that leaves a lasting impression. Additionally, the honest insights provided by the waiters enhance the dining experience, adding a personal touch that is appreciated by customers.

A unique highlight of Bailey's Range is their weekly burger showdown, introducing an element of innovation and competition that sets the restaurant apart. Despite the overall excellent experience, it's important to note that there have been minor inconsistencies with the cooking of the burgers on rare occasions. However, these instances are few and do not significantly detract from the overall positive experience.

In conclusion, Bailey's Range earns a well-deserved rating of 4 out of 5 stars. While there is slight room for improvement in achieving consistent burger doneness, the restaurant excels in offering a wide variety of tasty options, friendly and insightful staff, and a unique dining concept, making it a fantastic choice for anyone looking to indulge in the best of what the area has to offer.
"This breakfast sandwich is possibly the best ever, served on a delightful biscuit. It's incredibly delicious and truly a standout meal. Highly recommended!"

This review expresses significant dissatisfaction with the service and quality of food at the University location of Silver Mine. The reviewer, a previously loyal customer of another location, cites several issues that led to a disappointing experience. Firstly, the staff made an error with the order, adding unwanted ingredients to a sandwich and responding dismissively when the mistake was pointed out. Secondly, a sandwich intended to be served hot was received cold, suggesting it was not freshly made nor properly packaged to retain heat. Finally, the customer experienced rude behavior from an employee when inquiring about the order's readiness. These incidents collectively resulted in the reviewer deciding to cease patronizing Silver Mine.

Had an excellent first visit! Grace transformed my challenging, thick, and super long hair into something fabulous. The salon boasts a modern, clean atmosphere without any pretentious vibe, all at a reasonable price. Highly recommend!

Enjoyed a delightful Sunday Buffet at this cozy eatery that truly reminded me of dining at my grandmother's house. Offering a hearty selection including fried chicken, greens, smothered steak, corn, and cabbage, among others, the food quality was commendable. Far from being a fine dining venue, it offers a homely ambiance that greatly enhances the dining experience. The pricing is reasonable, and local recommendations speak volumes about its popularity. Despite any potential wait, the visit was absolutely worth it, surpassing my expectations. A gem worth checking out for anyone seeking a comforting, home-style meal.

I recently tried the "Passion Passport" smoothie, drawn in by its captivating name and was not disappointed! The combination of passion fruit juice, bananas, pineapple mango juice, papaya juice blend, and a touch of raw cane sugar created a delightfully delicious and refreshing drink. Every sip was bursting with exotic flavors, perfectly balanced to satisfy. Highly recommend it for a vibrant taste adventure!

Today's private tour with Carrie was a remarkable experience, especially given the rainy weather which seemed to deter other visitors. Carrie's deep knowledge and evident passion for the Civil War, particularly the Battle of Franklin, were truly captivating. This tour underscored the importance of commemorating such a pivotal event in history. Highly enjoyable and enlightening.

This review praises a glass service for offering the best service and prices in town, highlighting a positive experience from the initial phone call to the completion of the service. The reviewer initially contacted Fast Glass, which quoted $200, significantly more than a previous service, prompting them to search for alternatives. They found this business, which charged $165 and provided value for the price. The same-day service included not only the repair of a windshield chip but also additional cleaning services for the car and a cozy waiting area with amenities. The reviewer appreciated being treated respectfully, contrasting this experience with previous patronizing treatment elsewhere. The overall satisfaction and intention to return underscore the exceptional service received.

Review of TD Bank:

I experienced a highly frustrating situation with TD Bank that left me absolutely livid. Upon checking my account, I discovered an overdraft fee of $220 due to a policy change that was neither clearly communicated nor understandable at face value. Instead of my card being declined for insufficient funds, TD Bank's new policy allows transactions to go through, incurring hefty overdraft fees.

Dealing with customer service proved to be another ordeal. The wait time was exorbitant, clocking in at 45 minutes before I was able to speak with a representative. While the service representative was cordial and helpful, the overall experience was marred by the lack of communication regarding the wait time and the bank's new overdraft policy. 

This incident has significantly tainted my view of TD Bank, compelling me to switch banks. Furthermore, in a moment of frustration, I expressed my dissatisfaction through a gesture to the ATM cameras. 

Overall, TD Bank's handling of policy changes and customer service leaves much to be desired, pushing me to look for banking services elsewhere.

During a 3-night business stay in November, the Four Points Hotel provided a satisfying experience. Check-in was efficient, particularly with an advantageous rate obtained through Sheraton/SPG membership and AAA discount, sweetened by complimentary breakfast. Its proximity to the airport, a mere 5-minute drive, alongside several neighboring hotels, adds to its convenience. The staff was commendable for their friendliness and assistance. The room met our expectations, parking was hassle-free, and nights were peaceful, making for a good overall stay.

This hotel, conveniently located right at the Union Station Metro stop, offers easy access to downtown attractions, making it a great weekend stay option due to its reasonable pricing—though be warned, prices do tend to spike during the week. The rooms are clean and boast an exceptionally comfortable bed adorned with an abundance of pillows, a feature sure to win over many guests. The bathrooms are spacious, complete with a tub and a surplus of white towels, enhancing the overall comfort of the stay. However, the hotel isn't without its faults; the in-room coffee machine was disappointing, and the thinness of the door meant hallway noises were all too audible, particularly early in the morning. Despite these drawbacks, the hotel’s main lobby is notably impressive, adding to the reasons this place is worth considering for those visiting the area.

This establishment boasts some of the finest Mexican cuisine available, with the fried fish taco particularly standing out as a delightful dish. The excellence extends to the rest of the menu, leaving patrons regretting not purchasing additional red sauce and birria for enjoyment at home. However, diners should be prepared for the lack of air conditioning on the premises, as the ceiling fans provide limited relief, especially during the monsoon season. Despite this, the exceptional quality of the food makes it a worthwhile destination.

As an avid runner, I consider my shoes the essence of my performance. Endurance House has exceeded my expectations with their wide-ranging selection tailored for all types of runners. The customer service is exceptional, characterized by a friendly and knowledgeable staff. What truly distinguishes them from competitors is their personalized approach to finding the perfect shoe for your specific stride, aiming to minimize injuries. Their commitment to providing value, alongside top-notch, tailor-fitted assistance, ensures my continuous patronage. In summary, Endurance House is my go-to for quality running shoes paired with exceptional service.

**HipCity: A Meat-Lover's Plant-Based Paradise**

HipCity has become a surprisingly delightful lunch spot, even for a self-professed meat enthusiast like myself. The thought of replacing my last meal on earth, a hearty burger, with anything vegetarian would have seemed ludicrous until I stumbled upon HipCity's fajita wrap. It's *that* good, potentially life-altering for carnivores exploring plant-based options.

The menu is a treasure trove of flavors and alternatives that don't make you miss meat. Standouts include the buffalo bella and the crispy hipcity ranch, which, when paired with the tangy green lemonade, create a symphony of flavors. For those seeking a lighter option, the groothie is a flavorful, budget-friendly choice that promises to satiate afternoon hunger pangs.

Beyond the food, what stands out is the friendly and efficient service. The staff is proactive, managing congestion by taking orders in line, which keeps the wait time surprisingly short given the bustling atmosphere.

However, navigating the interior can be akin to performing yoga amidst a sea of undecided patrons, with the main challenge being finding where to stand either when ordering or waiting for your food. This spatial confusion, especially during peak hours, is the only flaw in an otherwise delightful dining experience.

In summary, HipCity is a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in delectable plant-based fare without missing the meat. Just be prepared for a possible game of human Tetris if you visit during a busy time.

This establishment's posted closing time of 10PM is misleading. Upon entering at 8:30PM, I was immediately informed that the kitchen was closed, despite the early time and active preparation for closure. This experience raises questions about the accessibility of their services and the reliability of their advertised operational hours. Customers should be aware that arriving well before closing does not guarantee service.

This Chinese restaurant stands unparalleled in the area, boasting the title of the best due to its sublime cuisine. The owners enhance the dining experience with their remarkable kindness. Adding a delightful touch, complimentary wontons served while awaiting takeout orders underscore their commitment to exceptional customer service.

Title: An Authentic Gem: Rosemary's Grill Review

Rosemary's Grill has swiftly become a culinary haven for my family and me, transcending the typical dining experience with its blend of American and Turkish cuisines. Renowned for its extensive menu, Rosemary's Grill excels in delivering meticulously prepared dishes that exude a level of care and authenticity seldom found in chain restaurants. Our recurrent visits have made Rosemary's our go-to destination for delectable meals, especially on Saturday nights.

On our recent visit, the Mixed Grill Kebab platter was a standout, demonstrating the kitchen's adeptness in spicing and grilling to perfection. Of particular note was the Adana kebab, which was both tender and flavorful, marking a delightful introduction to this variant of kebab for me. The accompanying shepherd's salad, grilled tomatoes, rice, and flatbread rounded off the meal beautifully.

Not to be overshadowed, the American classics on the menu also shine. My mother-in-law's enjoyment of the crab cakes, and my wife's praise for the French onion soup and the succulently roasted turkey platter, underscore the kitchen's versatility and commitment to quality across its diverse offerings.

Portion sizes are generous, providing the added pleasure of relishing their dishes the following day. Beyond the food, what sets Rosemary's Grill apart is the warmth and hospitality extended by its staff and owners, making patrons feel like part of the family.

In conclusion, Rosemary's Grill is a standout establishment that marries the richness of American and Turkish culinary traditions in a welcoming, family-oriented environment. It's a testament to the owners' passion for food and hospitality, making it not just a restaurant but a dining destination that beckons to be revisited time and again.

Visited this spot twice and both times were met with very friendly staff and a pleasant atmosphere, though noticeably not too crowded. A highlight is their Tuesday deal - $3.50 margaritas after 4 PM, which are definitely worth a try.
This establishment disappointed deeply; I won't return, even in dire circumstances. Their general Tso's failed to impress. I recommend choosing East Cuisine instead.

The dining experience could have been excellent at this establishment, regrettably marred by the interaction with a particularly pretentious waiter, whose demeanor and approach detracted significantly from the overall enjoyment. His lack of warmth, condescending manner, especially evident when asked for wine recommendations, was off-putting and reminiscent of the very attitude one might seek to escape from a place like New York. Despite this, the culinary offerings, particularly the blueberry lasagna and a chocolate dessert, were standout highlights, suggesting that the kitchen's efforts are well worth experiencing. Ultimately, the place merits a visit, with the hope of being served by someone more gracious and less inclined to dampen the dining experience.

The selection of flavors, including Bananas Foster, Pear Champagne Sorbet, Blueberry Fig Sorbet, and Cassis sorbet, consistently offered delightful surprises. Each flavor was enjoyable, but the Cassis was particularly noteworthy for its subtle initial taste that intensified wonderfully with each spoonful. This experience was so positive that it warranted a return visit with another group of friends to share in the joy of these uniquely flavorful frozen treats.

This pizzeria offers an unparalleled pizza experience, easily taking the title of the best pizza around. The owners add a personal, charismatic touch to the establishment – one is a former hockey player with a notable party trick, and his wife, who manages to be both adorable and incredibly tough. Their dedication to quality is evident in their homemade sausage and mozzarella, ensuring each pizza is a masterpiece. Though they lovingly poke fun at pronunciation mishaps, especially with 'Ricotta', it all adds to the charm of the place. Every pizza option is exceptional, down to the crust, which is a marvel on its own, especially when dipped in olive oil or their homemade vinaigrette. A visit here isn't just about enjoying a meal; it's about experiencing the passion and humor of its owners, making every bite memorable.
"Friendly and helpful sales staff, especially Mike, who went above and beyond by taking us for a ride in one of the Razors. Considering purchasing one thanks to the great experience!"

I frequent this spot at least monthly, drawn by the delicious food and the service which enhances the dining experience. The standout item for me has to be their zucchini muffins - absolutely irresistible; I always make sure to take a few home. The affordability is a big plus, as is the fantastic frozen yogurt bar complete with unlimited toppings. It's a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy a tasty meal and a bit of fun. Truly a yum experience!

Visited for the all-you-can-eat option and faced a disappointing experience with service, as it took over half an hour to place our order, during which we felt ignored by the serving staff. The menu contained surprises as many rolls came with unlisted "extras", notably one with an unappealing sweet mustard sauce. However, a silver lining was the reasonably quick preparation time once our order was finally taken.

This restaurant stands out for its pleasing decoration and cleanliness, providing a welcoming atmosphere. Our group of six universally enjoyed our meals, ranging from the perfectly seasoned fried green tomatoes, despite a minor timing hiccup, to the savory chicken salad, homey fried bologna sandwich, and a classic cheeseburger. The shared peach cobbler dessert, especially recommended with ice cream, was a delightful end to our dining experience. A solid choice for varied tastes.
"The food served was enjoyable, but the lack of cleanliness in the café significantly detracted from the overall experience. Without improvements in hygiene, I am hesitant to revisit."
Absolutely loved our experience here! The dishes, especially the chicken parm, were delectable with very generous portions. Excited to return and explore more of the menu!

This modest burger restaurant offers a fairly positive dining experience, particularly noted for its bacon cheeseburger. The bacon impresses with perfect cooking and thickness, while the bun delights with a great toasted crust. Accompaniments like fries and the chocolate shake also receive praise. However, there are notable downsides: the burger could benefit from being juicier, the portion size feels small for the price, and a lingering burger grease smell upon departure dampens the overall experience.

After consulting Yelp, I ventured into a restaurant that, despite being empty, I opted to try. The meal turned out mediocre at best, prompting me to leave and head to the bustling Charlie's across the street. The experience there, starting with the first bite of their redtop pizza, made me instantly regret not choosing it from the start. While the initial choice may offer a fine sit-down experience, for those in pursuit of truly delicious pizza, Charlie's is the unequivocal winner.

This review reflects a long-term customer's satisfaction with a Whole Foods location that transitioned from Wild Oats. The reviewer notes apparent improvements since the merger, praising the store's selection of produce, seafood, and cheese. What stands out most to the reviewer is the personal care section, known for its natural cosmetics and handmade soaps, along with the salad bar, which is a frequent draw, especially in cooler months for post-yoga lunches. Favorites include Carrot Ginger, Split Pea, and Corn Chowder soups, along with the curried tofu salad, sushi to-go boxes, and everything cookies. A recent discovery mentioned is the lavender soda, noted for its unique taste and relaxing properties.
The Mediterranean chicken quesadillas were an absolute delight, perfectly complemented by an awesome sauce. Highly recommended for fans of fresh Greek cuisine.

This place has won me over with its stunning, spacious, and modern design, but what truly sets it apart is its impeccable cleanliness. The staff, including Will, Amanda, and Sal, are simply fantastic. As someone new to vaping, I've made several purchases, ranging from mods to atty's. Despite occasionally disassembling my device and not being able to put it back together, the team has always been on hand to assist, ensuring I can continue enjoying my vaping experience. Their selection of juices, mods, and atty's is impressive, and I find myself constantly trying new flavors. If you're considering a visit, I wholeheartedly recommend it — you won't be disappointed. This place is truly a gem for both vaping enthusiasts and newcomers alike.

This breakfast spot comes highly recommended for its delicious offerings, with the reviewer having tasted practically everything on the menu. Favorites include Jebb's open face and the huevos rancheros, accompanied by addictively good coffee. However, the Monte Cristo is criticized for its hefty price tag, deemed not worth it despite the inclusion of truffle oil. It's suggested to skip this item or wait for a price drop. The place doesn't accept reservations, so early arrival or timing your visit about 30 minutes before hunger strikes is advised. Overall, aside from the Monte Cristo, everything else is considered worth trying and tasty.

This review reflects a disappointing experience at a butcher shop where the customer's request for a plain deboned duck was mishandled. Despite confirming the possibility of deboning a duck over the phone a day prior, the staff struggled to understand the order when called the following day. Upon pickup, the customer received a whole stuffed duck instead of the requested deboned one. Further frustration arose when the shop offered no compensation for their mistake, only suggesting a trade-in shortly before dinner time, which was inconvenient due to the shop's distance. The reviewer indicates that this will be their last visit to the shop, citing poor customer service as a significant drawback to the otherwise quality food offered.

Visited the preserve recently and had an excellent experience. The hiking trails are well-maintained, offering stunning views of wildlife and nature, with the added benefit of clearly marked paths. The birds of prey aviary was a highlight, showcasing these magnificent creatures in a way that's both educational and entertaining. The learning center offers valuable insights in a beautifully presented manner, with the bonus of air conditioning for a refreshing break post-hike. An added treat was the opportunity to see the birds up close with their handlers in the mid afternoon. The staff and volunteers are notably friendly and helpful, enhancing the overall visit. Highly recommended for nature enthusiasts.

This diner stands as a solid option in North Wilmington, notably distinguishing itself from others in the area with its satisfactory offerings. Offering typical diner cuisine, it has served as a reliable spot for a post-swim meet meal. Neither outstanding nor disappointing, it provides a quintessential diner experience without any frills.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience, combining delectable food, attentive service, and inviting decor. From the moment we entered, the manager’s warm greeting set a welcoming tone. Our server, Christina, added to the delightful ambiance. The extensive beer selection was impressive. We savored the chicken rabe sandwich, served on delicious focaccia, and the pepperoni pizza, which stood out for its superb “well done” flavor. The absence of a children’s menu, however, might pose a challenge for families with picky eaters like our 7-year-old. Despite this, the overall excellence guarantees our return.

I've frequented student salons for my haircuts and styling, specifically the Aveda Institute, and have gleaned quite the understanding of what to expect. My experiences have varied, which isn't surprising given the different stylists I've encountered. My hair type is long, fine, and mostly straight Asian hair, presenting its own set of challenges and opportunities for stylists in training.

A critical piece of advice for anyone considering a student salon is to temper expectations. These stylists are learning, so while they may not deliver perfection, they offer something valuable in return. One noticeable difference is the duration of the visit; expect to spend around two hours for what might otherwise be a quicker appointment with a seasoned professional. However, this extended time is not without its benefits. The service typically includes a massaging wash, cut, and blow-dry style. The student stylists are thorough, repeatedly consulting with their instructors to ensure the desired outcome is achieved, which I appreciate for quality assurance.

Another highlight is the professionalism and dedication displayed by the stylists at the Aveda Institute. They genuinely care about providing a good service, a sentiment that isn't guaranteed across all educational salons. Lastly, the affordability of these services is a significant draw. While student salons may not be everyone's first choice, the combination of earnest service, comprehensive procedures, and friendly pricing at the Aveda Institute makes it a worthwhile consideration for those willing to support and benefit from emerging talent in hairstyling.

This delightful dining spot boasts scrumptious meals and welcoming staff, making every visit enjoyable. It's advisable not to arrive with a full stomach, as the generous portions ensure you get the most out of your dining experience. For an added treat, opt for seating outside and soak in the ambiance. A perfect blend of quality, quantity, and kindness.
Enjoyed an outstanding dining experience with great food and friendly service. The menu boasts a fantastic variety, and the Monte Cristo crepes were absolutely amazing. Will definitely return!

Discovering this charming spot proved to be a delightful alternative to the bustling Cafe du Monde, offering beignets that rivaled, if not surpassed, the iconic café's in both taste and quality. What truly set this place apart was the absence of the notorious lines, allowing for a serene breakfast experience amidst the usually lively Bourbon St. The contrast was especially notable at 8:30 am, a quiet hour when only garbage men and street washers populate the street. Although our visit fell on a holiday and thus missed the chance to enjoy live music, the serene ambiance added to the charm. While we indulged in a full breakfast, opting for a crawfish omelet and Cajun hashbrowns, these dishes didn't particularly stand out. However, the spotlight rightfully belongs to the beignets, confirming that when a place specializes in these delightful treats, the other menu items can afford to take a backseat.

While Mixx may not offer the finest sushi in the city, its appeal lies in the combination of swift service, affordability, and a broad menu selection, making it a solid choice for a quick, inexpensive sushi fix.

I had an extremely disappointing experience with this service. Initially, when I called for price quotes on a battery and brakes, the staff member was pleasant and provided quotes that were competitive. However, a subsequent call to schedule the service was starkly different. I encountered a rude individual, possibly named Mike or Nick, who not only denied the previously quoted prices but also rudely dismissed my request to speak to another representative, and abruptly hung up the call. This level of unprofessionalism and poor customer service is unacceptable. I strongly advise against using this company.

My experience with this car dealership was overwhelmingly negative, leading me to advise against using their services. The absence of a dedicated customer service department is a glaring oversight. Instead, their sales team doubles as customer service, causing delays and unresponsiveness since they are often out on sales calls. This structure resulted in multiple instances where I was unable to receive timely support or answers.

When purchasing my car, several promises were made regarding vehicle preparation, such as removing the tint from the rear window for better visibility. Not only were these promises unfulfilled at the time of purchase, but corrections were also mishandled, requiring multiple inconvenient visits. Furthermore, a lack of transparency and last-minute changes to the purchase price added to the frustration, though this was eventually resolved.

Service issues persisted beyond the sale. For example, attempts to address a leaking trunk were met with the same inefficiency and lack of knowledge that characterized my previous interactions, dissuading me from seeking further services.

It's clear that a comprehensive overhaul of their customer service approach is necessary, starting with the establishment of a specialized department. The sales staff, while doing their best under the circumstances, are not equipped to handle service and support issues effectively. This lack of proper management and customer care infrastructure significantly detracts from the dealership's reliability and reputation.

This restaurant is a delightful find with its warm, family-owned atmosphere and scrumptious offerings, particularly the bacon pizza which stands out as a personal favorite. The addition of a playroom for kids adds a thoughtful touch, making the dining experience enjoyable for both children and adults. Highly recommended for its tasty food and welcoming vibes.

"An exceptional dining experience with delicious fried rice that stands out for its gorgeous presentation. Offers great value with excellent pricing for the quality provided, making it one of the finest Asian restaurants in town."

"Harry's Blue Bell offers a cozy dining experience that's a local favorite, hidden away in a shopping center corner. The venue is small and often crowded, reflecting its popularity among locals, yet it manages to maintain a charming atmosphere. Service is adequate, nothing more, nothing less. The establishment impresses with its selection of beers and reasonable pricing, although the food menu is somewhat limited, sticking mainly to standard bar offerings. Our choices of BBQ pulled pork and a chicken and honey mustard wrap were satisfactory; the pork was enjoyable but marred by an overly sweet sauce, while the wrap was fresh yet unremarkable. The standout sides were the perfectly crispy fries and a delicious, albeit scant, serving of kale slaw. While our visit was pleasant enough, the experience doesn't compel a dedicated return trip, though we'd drop by if in the vicinity. A solid average: 3 out of 5 stars."

Kajuns Pub has commendably addressed the previously mentioned issue of pervasive smoke by installing efficient smoke eaters, significantly enhancing the air quality for sensitive individuals. This improvement reflects the establishment’s dedication to customer satisfaction, making extended visits much more comfortable for non-smokers, though clothes might still retain a smoky scent. A thoughtful gesture that’s much appreciated!

I recently discovered Brio's through my work friends, who have an excellent taste in food, especially around St. Louis. I was immediately taken with everything Brio's offers, from the complimentary bread and chips to their delectable bruschetta, pasta, and salads. The restaurant itself is stunning, creating an inviting atmosphere. The exceptional service further enhances the dining experience, making Brio's a must-visit for anyone looking for quality dining in the area.

This establishment in Tucson disappoints profoundly, marred by consistently cold food and discourteous service. Although their concept shows promise, their execution falls significantly short of expectations.

Absolutely enchanted by Gennaro's, I'm a dedicated fan of their culinary delights. The pizza, with its perfectly thin crust, complemented by a sweet yet rich tomato sauce and topped with fresh mozzarella, is a masterpiece. Their meatballs are equally commendable for their excellence. The vintage and adorable decor of the place just adds to the overall charm and experience. I have consistently been impressed with every visit and look forward to my next meal there. Gennaro's never disappoints.

Visited this bustling spot around 7pm on a Monday and it didn't disappoint. The bartender offered friendly and attentive service, complementing the well-stocked bar. Although not a drink aficionado myself, the highlight was undeniably the food. The Pear Gorgonzola Melt was nothing short of spectacular in both taste and presentation. The place attracts a diverse crowd, adding to its charm. Summary: Highly recommend for delicious sandwiches priced around $10 and a great place to watch soccer games.

This eatery in Philly offers a fantastic atmosphere and exceptionally friendly service, all at reasonable prices. However, the dining experience was somewhat let down by the food, which, though not bad, was found to be somewhat bland. It served to satisfy hunger after a long journey but failed to leave a memorable impact. Consequently, a return visit seems unlikely.

This establishment offers a pleasant atmosphere for enjoying a drink, complemented by a warm and friendly staff. While the dining experience was not explored, there is some reservation regarding cleanliness, potentially impacting the decision to eat here.

This local Greek-owned pancake house stands out as a delightful alternative to mainstream pancake chains like Robert Evans, IHOP, and Denny's. With whimsically named dishes like "Freedom toast" and "Freedom fries" alongside an impressive selection of other breakfast favorites, it offers a unique and flavorful start to the day. A tradition for one group has been to visit every New Year's Day around 2 pm, despite a night of revelry, and they consistently find the service accommodating for their large party, attentive, and swift. The presence of an enthusiastic owner, ensuring customers' satisfaction, adds a personal touch that enhances the dining experience. The food here is not only thought to surpass that of larger chains in quality but also carries the warmth and uniqueness that can only be attributed to being made with love. This pancake house is highly recommended for those seeking a cozy, welcoming spot for an excellent breakfast or brunch, promising more than just good food, but a memorable dining experience.

After numerous satisfactory visits to Fresh, it's disappointing to report that my latest experience fell short. Despite attending with a large group, the lack of acknowledgment upon arrival was disheartening. Further disappointment came with the Vienna Latte; not only did it fail to meet expectations in taste, but its price was exorbitantly high at over $7. Such a stark decline in service quality and product value makes it hard to justify future visits, despite my previous enthusiasm for Fresh.

During an office outing with a group of 12, the service was decent but not outstanding, with delays in serving food to one member and a somewhat cumbersome checkout process. However, automatic tipping for large groups simplified payment. The lamb kebab (Shish Kebab) plate, accompanied by rice and babaghanoush, boasted well-cooked rice and excellently prepared babaghanoush, though the meat itself was disappointingly dry and lacked outstanding flavor. Despite these issues, the dish presentation was appealing. Having visited this restaurant multiple times, the reviewer notes better experiences in the past, particularly recommending their Ramadan buffet for its variety and appeal, though advising early arrival due to popularity.

This place offers a lovely opportunity to observe birds, making for an ideal Sunday morning stop. It has been a repeated destination for bird-watching, especially appreciated by those with a keen interest in avian life. The staff is notably friendly and welcoming, enhancing the overall experience. If birds captivate you, this spot comes highly recommended.

Review:

We decided to try dining at an establishment primarily known as a club. Surprisingly, it caters to families during dinner time. The food quality was commendable; the sashimi plate was particularly pleasing, and the child-friendly option of a burger and fries was well-received by my son. However, the dining experience was marred by the subpar service. From having to fetch our own plates and napkins to a noticeable oversight in providing basic tableware for my son, the lack of attentiveness was palpable. While the meal itself, made more affordable by a Groupon certificate, would invite a return, it would likely only be under the circumstance of not bearing the full cost due to the service issues encountered.

Cuenelli's Peruvian Style Rotisserie Chicken elevates the humble pollo a la brasa to an art form, infused with love and pride that sets it leagues apart from any grocery store counterpart. The secret lies in the meticulous preparation: a thorough marination process ensures flavors penetrate deep to the bone, complimented by a seasoning rub that adds an extra layer of taste. The use of a charcoal-imbued rotisserie oven introduces a delightful smoky essence while maintaining the chicken's moisture through a self-basting process, resulting in an exquisite blend of tender, juicy meat with varying textures of skin from crispy to succulent. The experience is further enhanced by the addition of two delectable sauces – a zesty chimichurri and a creamy, garlicky aioli – that perfectly complement the chicken's smoky richness.

No meal at Cuenelli's would be complete without indulging in their standout sides. The cilantro rice, with its fresh, herbaceous profile, and the fiery pinto beans offer a harmonious balance of flavors, while the caramelized sweetness of the maduros provides a delightful contrast. To wash it all down, traditional beverages like Inca cola and chicha limena add a refreshing and uniquely flavored finishing touch to the dining experience.

Cuenelli's not only impresses with its exceptional pollo a la brasa but invites diners to rediscover rotisserie chicken with a new sense of appreciation and wonder. Amidst a menu brimming with remarkable Latin dishes, it's clear that love is the main ingredient that distinguishes their fare, urging all to experience the culinary delight that is Cuenelli's chicken, as if for the very first time.

I recently celebrated an early birthday date with myself, indulging in a feast of meat, bourbon libations, and a salad for good measure. Opting for a simple medium rare burger without cheese, bacon, or dressing, I aimed to test the establishment's meat quality without any disguises—and it didn't disappoint. Perfectly cooked and seasoned, the burger was a hit, despite the odd looks for eating it with a knife and fork due to my gluten intolerance. The salad was decent, enhanced by just the right amount of dressing, rounding out the meal nicely. The service was attentive yet unobtrusive, with the bartender-cum-waiter crafting delicious sazeracs that perfectly complemented my meal. I'm eagerly looking forward to my next visit to try one of their fancier burger options.

Visited for lunch on a Monday and opted for bar seating, where I experienced prompt service. The carne asada taco lunch special I ordered was notably above average. Overall, I was more than pleased with my experience at this establishment.

Absolutely positive experience! Tony was incredibly helpful, especially when I had a flat tire. Not only did he get it fixed, but he also did it for less than the initially quoted price. Highly recommend!!

My hairdresser paid meticulous attention to understanding exactly what I desired for my haircut, ensuring my satisfaction by frequently checking in during the process. The result was precisely what I wanted, and I was very pleased with the outcome.

I had a delightful experience with both the sweet and sour chicken and chicken chow mein, finding them excellent in taste and quality. The cuts of chicken in the chow mein particularly stood out for their quality. Additionally, I've sampled the sushi on multiple occasions and thoroughly enjoyed it. While the pricing is on the higher side, the exceptional quality of the food justifies the cost.

In a recent experience with Comcast, the customer faced significant billing issues. Despite being a loyal customer for 14 years, efforts to lower a bill that had escalated to $250 monthly were initially met with inflexibility, only dropping to $225 after removing some services. It was only after switching to Verizon and attempting to cancel Comcast services that an offer to reduce the bill to $140 was made, showcasing a lack of proactive customer retention efforts. The customer expresses satisfaction with Verizon's installation, customer service, and overall product, contrasting sharply with their disappointment in Comcast's handling of their account. The experience has left the customer with a strong negative sentiment towards Comcast, emphasizing their belief that the company lacks a commitment to quality customer service.

B's Diner may be a hidden gem, but it's undoubtedly worth the effort to find. Nestled in a cozy spot, this diner is a vibrant mix of quirky antiques, humorous posters, and an inviting atmosphere, thanks largely to its friendly staff. It stands out not just for its unique ambiance but also for its commendable community work, making it not just a place to eat but a venue to support.

Affordable and relaxed, B's Diner promises a quintessential diner experience, where the food speaks volumes of its character. Its clientele is as eclectic as its environment, ranging from bar staff unwinding from the night before to hipsters and musicians, ensuring there's never a dull moment for people-watching enthusiasts.

Though many rave about the Elk sausage and perogie poutine, the entire menu is ripe with options that capture the diner's distinct personality. If you're in for a hearty meal amidst a captivating crowd, B's Diner is the spot to be.

This once-decent restaurant has suffered a significant decline in food quality over the past year, leaving much to be desired in its current offerings. The buffet now features dishes that are overwhelmingly salty, with the pulled turkey coming off as tough, the fish having an overly seasoned taste, and the vegetables reduced to an unappetizing mush. The only saving grace in the meal seemed to be the corn pudding, mashed potatoes, and passable desserts that felt almost store-bought in quality. Despite these culinary mishaps, the service remained commendable, with attentive and prompt action from the waitstaff. A disappointing experience overall, marked by dismal food quality contrasted with satisfactory service.

During our most recent visit to a restaurant, my wife and I experienced unacceptable service levels, solidifying our decision to never return. Despite being the only customers, it took approximately 15 minutes for our order to be taken and an additional 45 minutes for our small pizzas to be prepared. The waiting period was further marred by the negative ambiance created by a staff member loudly complaining about the establishment, compelling us to move to the bar area for some relief. When our order finally arrived, the pizza was barely warm, emphasizing the overall disappointing experience. This establishment has been definitively added to our list of places to avoid.

Fellini's Cafe in Newtown Square offers a cozy BYOB dining experience that adeptly balances romantic ambiance with generous portion sizes, all at reasonable prices. My repeated visits have unveiled a mix of delightful experiences interspersed with minor inconsistencies that detract from the restaurant reaching its utmost potential.

On a recent Friday evening visit with my wife, we encountered a slight hiccup with our seating arrangement, initially being placed less privately than desired, though this was rectified upon request. The environment, while quaint and ideal for a romantic outing, tends to become quite loud, potentially diminishing the intimate atmosphere.

Service varied, with our waitress exuding warmth and enthusiasm that contrasted with another staff member's more brisk approach during our seating transition. Despite these service irregularities, the culinary offerings largely impressed. The meal commenced with commendable complimentary bruschetta and bread, although the presentation of butter packets with the latter struck me as slightly odd for an Italian establishment.

Our selections, a shared Caesar salad and main courses of tagliatelli with mushroom cream sauce and tortellini pasticiatti, were flavorful, notwithstanding a few small areas for improvement. Notably, the salad's warm plate undermined its freshness, and the partially frozen peas in the tortellini dish interrupted an otherwise exceptional experience.

A notable gesture of goodwill was the manager's accommodation of an expired gift card, enhancing our overall satisfaction. Despite encountering occasional service inconsistencies and minor culinary missteps, Fellini's Cafe nails the balance of quality, value, and ambiance, ensuring my continued patronage.

The reviewer expressed disappointment with their experience at a dining establishment they chose over the Catbird Seat. They encountered an unconventional and uncomfortable entry process, involving an awkwardly large entrance and the need to ascend stairs to reach the seating area, which was off-putting. The restaurant's ambiance was dampened by a sparse crowd and an indoor decision due to weather, contributing to a lackluster first impression. 

Interaction with the server was a highlight, marked by light-hearted conversation. However, the beverages ordered, including a julep and a gin-based drink, failed to impress, being described as average to bad. The clientele was perceived as stuffy, and the complimentary bread did little to elevate the dining experience. The main courses, a tenderloin and Amish chicken, were found to be lacking; the tenderloin was appreciated only for its quality cut, while the chicken was deemed average with an unsatisfactory jus. Signature grits also fell short of expectations. 

Overall, the experience was characterized by underwhelming food and drink offerings, a stuffy atmosphere, and a sense that the high prices were unjustified. The reviewer concluded with a sentiment of regret for their choice of venue.

Stitch-It in Nashville, TN, comes highly recommended based on my personal experience in June 2013. In need of a last-minute alteration for an intricate Tadashi Shoji evening gown, I was immensely satisfied with the exceptional work done by Stitch-It. Despite the urgency and complexity of the alterations, they managed not only to accommodate my tight schedule but also to exceed my high expectations. The premium price was justified by the outstanding service and the flawless alteration. From my initial panic to the final pickup, every interaction—from the helpful hotel seamstress to the professional staff and the skilled tailor, Maggie O'Neill, at Stitch-It—was positive and reassuring. Their ability to handle intricate details under pressure makes Stitch-It a go-to tailor that I would eagerly recommend to anyone in Nashville or those visiting.

This salon offers an exceptional experience, excelling in both Brazilian waxes and blow-outs. The professionals here are not only skilled in their craft but also boast amazing personalities, making any potentially daunting visit incredibly comfortable and relaxed, with a special shoutout to Jenne for exceptional service. Additionally, their sense of humor ensures a delightful and entertaining visit. Highly recommend for a standout beauty treatment experience, leaving you eager for your next visit.

Santana's in Camden, NJ, comes highly recommended for anyone in or around New Jersey. Their coffee outshines big-name contenders like Starbucks and McDonald's, making it a must-visit for coffee aficionados. The pastries are described as incredible, rivaling those found in Puerto Rico for their authenticity and flavor. A favorite for local business people from neighboring Pennsauken, Santana's is hailed as the go-to spot for breakfast and pastries, ensuring a delightful start to any morning.

This dining experience offers both a treat for the taste buds and an intriguingly unique atmosphere. The food is delicious and comes at a reasonable price, although there is a suggestion that the escargot might benefit from a more traditional preparation, despite its visually appealing presentation. Adding to the allure is the option to dine in the company of the mansion's former owner, a ghostly presence tied to a tragic history, for an additional fee. This special dining setup is located in a secluded, chilly room that adds a touch of eerie charm to the whole experience.

This unassuming spot in Philly might just serve one of the best burgers in the city. Despite its low-key ambiance and limited seating, with a kitchen that opens into the dining area, this place genuinely impresses. The menu boasts creativity and offers full customization, catering to every burger lover's whim. The burgers themselves are a masterpiece, cooked to perfection on a flattop grill, achieving that ideal sear, juicy interior, and slight char that elevates a good burger to greatness. Accompanying the burgers, the fries are a standout - hand cut, freshly fried, achieving that elusive crispy yet fluffy texture, seasoned with just the right amount of salt. It's hard to find fault with their offering. For an added bonus, consider downloading the SPOT app for access to a rewarding loyalty program and enticing coupons, including free fries. Definitely a must-visit for any burger aficionado in Philadelphia.

I had an excellent experience with this locksmith service after being recommended by my mechanic for car key replacements. My vehicle uses transponder keys, which are notably expensive through dealerships. Opting for more affordable eBay blanks, I was impressed by the locksmith's diligence. They first created a test copy to ensure accuracy before proceeding with my provided blanks. Their meticulous approach didn't stop there; they verified the functionality of the keys in all locks, including the trunk. Their caution, thoroughness, and positive attitude made a strong impression on me. I highly recommend their services for anyone in need of reliable key duplication or replacement.

This salon stands out as exceptionally beautiful, clean, and organized, complemented by a remarkably friendly staff. The owner, Doug, is not only welcoming but also impressively skilled, with a global teaching background that enriches his salon through weekly training sessions for his staff. This ensures they stay current with the latest techniques and trends. With such dedication to quality and expertise, it's the kind of place you can trust with your hair without hesitation. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors alike.

Bab Cafe in Reno offers a delightful dining experience with its diverse and delicious menu options. The service stands out for its efficiency, especially noteworthy during the busy lunch period. The Dak-Galbi Bibim-bab, with its flavorful teriyaki chicken, fresh vegetables, and delightful sauces, is a standout choice. Additionally, the potstickers are a must-try for any visitor. The only drawback is the downtown location's parking challenges, which can detract from the convenience of visiting. Overall, Bab Cafe is a shining example of the increasing variety and quality of Reno's dining scene.

Mr. B's in New Orleans is a prime brunch destination, offering a delightful experience for enthusiasts of Southern cuisine and signature drinks. The Brandy Milk Punch, an indulgent alcoholic milkshake, comes highly recommended and is a must-try for those of legal drinking age. The ambiance is complemented by the provision of fresh bread and butter, setting the stage for a memorable meal. While the trio of appetizers (duck springroll, fried chicken livers, and fried oyster) might seem modest in size, each is uniquely flavorful, particularly the duck springroll with its tangy sauce. The shrimp and grits entree is a standout, featuring bacon-wrapped shrimp and authentic Southern grits – a dish we're eager to have again. Additionally, the fish of the day, blackened Mahi Mahi, received high praise. Our visit to Mr. B's was thoroughly enjoyable, and we can't wait to return.

This salon exceeded expectations right from the start with its clean, simple, and professional appearance, which instills confidence in their skills. The welcoming staff promptly discussed preferences, packages, and prices, making the entire process straightforward. Their appointment-only policy ensures dedicated service, enhancing the customer experience.

I opted for an armpit wax as an initial trial and was assigned to Despina, who was not only friendly but also highly skilled, making the session as pain-free as possible despite my concerns about thick hair due to previous shaving habits. The use of hard wax was a game-changer, contributing to a swift, clean, and relatively painless experience, all for a very reasonable price of $16.

Impressed by the service and results, I booked a follow-up appointment and even ventured into getting a bikini wax, which turned out to be the least painful experience I've had with such treatments. The salon also offered a product for ingrown hairs, which I decided to try.

Overall, the salon lives up to the hype, delivering exceptional service and creating a comfortable environment, thanks to the professional and kind-hearted Despina. The positive experiences from both the armpit and bikini waxing sessions have solidified my trust in them, and I look forward to future visits. Highly recommend for anyone seeking quality waxing services in a welcoming setting.

After multiple unsuccessful attempts to seize a meal promptly, I finally managed to arrive early enough to be fifth in line at the renowned food truck operated by Gus, famously dubbed the "falafel nazi." Despite the intimidating moniker, Gus exceeded expectations, warmly welcoming a newcomer like me and passionately detailing his commitment to fresh ingredients. The meal itself, featuring coal-cooked chicken that was flawlessly tender inside with a perfect exterior, alongside delicious falafel, grapes, and homemade pasta, was notably generous, amply serving two people. The experience wholly justified the anticipation and certainly lived up to the buzz surrounding this standout food truck. Absolute must-try!
SRS management company excels in their field, demonstrating exceptional accommodation to highly specific client requests. Highly recommended for their outstanding service.

Fresco delivers a stellar dining experience, offering fresh and delicious pizza that stands out in Tucson, especially during the gem shows. With reasonable prices for the quality provided, this establishment impressed us with its commitment to fresh ingredients, as highlighted by the friendly staff. The cleanliness and welcoming ambiance set the stage for a memorable meal. We opted for the meat-special pizza, which surpassed expectations with its crispy yet tender crust, generous toppings including chicken, and overall taste that warranted multiple napkins. Conversing with the passionate young owner further convinced us of Fresco's dedication to excellence. Our verdict: Fresco is a must-visit. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch pizza that doesn't disappoint. We eagerly anticipate our next visit!

After completing the Philadelphia marathon, our large group including kids, parents, and grandparents, dined at this restaurant, which impressed us with its cleanliness and fresh or newly decorated ambiance. The service was commendable for its excellence and friendliness. While the food was a hit among the adults, the spicy flavor profile posed a challenge for the children and grandparents. The dim lighting added to the struggle, particularly for the elders trying to read the menu. 

Noteworthy dishes like the Veggie wings, cactus and sweet potato burritos stood out, and the guacamole was delicious, although accompanied by spicy chips that weren't universally appreciated. The availability of pitchers of margaritas was a convenient touch for our sizeable group.

As a self-proclaimed chicken-finger connoisseur from Buffalo, NY, and a fast food skeptic, I ventured into Zaxby's on a post-beach road trip back to central Tampa with low expectations. To my surprise, the experience defied my fast food apprehensions. The service was outstanding, reminiscent of the enthusiasm often found in Disney employees, with both the counter staff and possibly the manager going above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction.

The chicken finger sandwiches on Texas toast were the highlight, with the chicken being notably juicy and moist. However, the Texas toast fell short due to its excessive greasiness, which detracted from the overall enjoyment of the sandwich. The sauce variety was commendable, though the absence of a spicy BBQ and the quintessential Buffalo Blue Cheese was a glaring omission for someone hailing from the birthplace of this cuisine. While the ranch served with hot sauce might seem blasphemous to a Buffalo native, the array of sauces including Zax, hot honey mustard, and insane hot, offered a delightful sampling.

Affordability was another high point, with two meals including drinks coming in at just over $12, adding to the appeal of this establishment. Despite not fully capturing the essence of Buffalo-inspired food, Zaxby's puts a commendable southern twist on chicken fingers, making me a fan. My overall experience is a solid 4 stars, elevated by exceptional service and value, despite my minor qualms with the bread and sauce selection.

Sugar Coated bakery delivers an exceptional array of baked goods, excelling in every aspect from texture to flavor. The attention to detail is evident in the delicate, decorative touches adorning each item, showcasing the love and time invested. Their signature flavors, especially the classic cupcake with its divine cream cheese frosting, are a testament to their mastery. For those seeking high-quality cakes, cupcakes, pies, or cookies, Sugar Coated is a must-visit to treat yourself and your loved ones.

This store, despite its unique location and appealing brand, significantly disappoints with its service. The wait times are excruciatingly long, with hardly any assistance available. An attempt to get gifts wrapped during the Christmas season proved to be nearly impossible, demonstrating a severe lack of efficiency and disregard for customer time constraints. Even with the option to leave items for gift wrapping, the service failed miserably, with no progress made even after a considerable wait. Although the products are appreciated, this experience has unfortunately deterred further visits to this location, pushing towards online shopping as the preferable alternative. It's truly a shame that such potential is marred by poor customer service.

This establishment boasts some exceptionally helpful ladies who go above and beyond to assist customers. However, be warned that there is an individual among them who may be less than pleasant. You'll likely discern who this is rather quickly. Just a heads-up.

Hendricks in St. Louis is a standout barbecue spot that's well worth a visit. Their meats, sauces, and sides surpass what you'll find at most other barbecue restaurants. The onion rings are notably large, and the coleslaw is both tasty and finely shredded, enhancing the dining experience. The service is commendable for its friendliness and efficiency. While there might be a wait for your meal, it provides a great opportunity to appreciate the eatery's unique decor. Overall, Hendricks offers a satisfying and enjoyable dining experience, making it a must-try for both locals and visitors.

This dining spot proved to be a delightful find for a late-night meal with kids, offering an impressive variety of food options. The service was commendable right from the person at the register to the exceptional waiter, Eric, who elevated our dining experience with his attentive, friendly demeanor, accommodating odd requests with efficiency reminiscent of high-quality restaurants. Additionally, the staff at the grill house station demonstrated commendable thoughtfulness and flexibility, especially when handling dietary restrictions, such as a pepper allergy, by offering practical solutions. My only wish is for a similar quality establishment closer to our home in upper Pennsylvania.

This coffee spot left me with mixed feelings. The absence of a menu was the first setback, especially since I’m not deeply versed in coffee. Opting for simplicity, I asked for an iced tea but ended up with a hot tea and a cup of ice, which was unexpected. The venue boasts an artsy crowd, making it an intriguing place for people watching, though it falls short as a study spot due to the noise level. Even with headphones, I found it challenging to concentrate, given the ambient sound choices not aligning with my taste. On the bright side, the staff was amiable and diligent about cleanliness, frequently tending to the tables. Overall, while the experience wasn’t negative, it didn’t particularly encourage me to return.

This review enthusiastically praises an exceptional dining experience at Milk and Honey, particularly highlighting the outstanding service provided by Kyle, described as a chill waiter deserving of a raise. The reviewer was particularly impressed by Kyle's recommendation of the honey hot sauce, describing it as one of the best they've had in ages, and credits Kyle with significantly enhancing their dining experience. Additionally, the review mentions the biscuits as heavenly, noting they were so irresistible that the reviewer ended up sharing from a friend. The reviewer strongly recommends visiting Milk and Honey and asking for Kyle, expressing a heartfelt wish for a reunion.

Visited a Philadelphia pub located conveniently across 30th Street Station and near Drexel University, making for an easy parking find two blocks away. The service was adequate for our dinner plans before a show in University City. We started with a mac and cheese appetizer that was hot and topped with the right amount of breadcrumbs, albeit average in taste, and cheesesteak egg rolls that were creative but slightly lacking in filling. The accompanying special mustard added a distinctive kick. Our main course, the chicken pot pie, featured a generous amount of vegetables and white meat chicken, though the meat quantity was less than expected and part of the crust was undercooked. For dessert, we indulged in massive portions of bread pudding and a brownie, both served ala mode. The bread pudding was average, and the brownie, while dry, might only disappoint those with high brownie standards. Overall, a decent dining experience with room for improvement in food quality.

Attended a bachelorette party at a vibrant venue this past Saturday in April, and the experience was overall memorable. It's advisable to arrive early; we got in at 8 PM without a hitch, but by 11 PM, there was a significant line outside. The place was alive with energy, largely due to an impressive cover band and the multitude of celebrations happening simultaneously - several bachelorette parties and 50th birthdays were in full swing. While the signature cocktails added to the night's enjoyment, they felt a tad overpriced. Despite the crowd, the atmosphere was perfect for such celebrations. I would consider returning for similar events, though maybe not for a casual night out.

This BBQ spot delivers an unparalleled dining experience with its fall-off-the-bone barbecue that easily stands out as the best. The pulled pork impresses with its rich, smoky flavor, and the side of very creamy mac and cheese complements the meal perfectly. Fast, friendly service enhances the experience. Their dessert, a delightful combination of walnut brownie and ice cream, rounds off an outstanding meal. It's a fantastic discovery for any food lover.

Visited Copabanana during university city restaurant week and was disappointed, to say the least. The initial outdoor dining experience was disrupted by children playing football close to our tables, leading us to move inside. Unfortunately, the indoor experience didn't redeem the visit. The food was unsatisfactory; the steak was overly fatty and overcooked, and the mashed potatoes didn't taste fresh. On a positive note, the waitress was empathetic, acknowledging the poor quality of the steak and replacing it with chicken upon request. However, the chicken was tough, akin to rubber bands. The only commendable aspect was the service provided by our waitress. All things considered, this visit was regrettable, warranting a single star rating, solely for the service.

This spot in New Orleans is a must-visit for the best shrimp and grits in town, according to my fiancé who's sampled many and still ranks this as his top choice, even after two years. They also serve deliciously fresh juices, adding to the overall delightful dining experience. It's a place we'll keep coming back to for those unbeatable flavors.

"Discovered a gem of a tapas spot in Nashville featuring a welcoming staff and an inviting open kitchen setup. The food was delightful, leaving me eagerly looking forward to my next visit to savor more of their offerings."

Had an amazing culinary experience! The seafood dishes were simply delicious, and the sourdough bread was fantastic. The added charm of '80s music playing in the background made for a lovely ambiance. Highly recommended for straightforward, quality dining.

Dr. Curtis Dechant comes highly recommended for his exceptional chair-side manner and ability to establish good rapport with patients. His office boasts a comfortable environment equipped with the latest high-tech gear, making eye appointments a breeze. Additionally, the selection of eyeglass frames is commendable, complemented by a friendly and accommodating staff.
This charming spot offers good food and an excellent pear cider beer, complemented by attentive service and a great ambiance. Prices are very reasonable, making it a delightful experience all around.

Seasons is a delightful little restaurant nestled at the end of a strip mall, offering a refreshing blend of traditional classics with a modern twist. While it primarily shines as a dessert haven, particularly famous for its unique shaved ice and extensive boba tea selection, Seasons does not fall short in delivering scrumptious food dishes. The hula and koko loco shaved ice come highly recommended, offering the option to mix flavors for a small additional fee. Their model of service is hassle-free, with a clean, bright ambiance that welcomes everyone, including families with children.

The restaurant’s location is conveniently situated across from a shopping plaza, ensuring plenty of parking spaces. The highlights include not just the exceptional concoctions of desserts but also commendable savory options like the flavorful quail and the well-seasoned chicken wings, which have received rave reviews from patrons.

With its friendly, fast service and a cozy, modern setting, Seasons stands out as a must-visit spot for those looking to indulge in a variety of treats, from inventive desserts to tasty, modernized dishes. It promises and delivers a pleasant experience for repeated visits, making it a perfect hangout spot for friends and families alike.

This quaint meeting spot, charming in concept, unfortunately doesn't quite hit the mark with its offerings. While it presents a delightful venue for a casual catch-up, the high prices do not reflect the quality of its products. Personally, I find more satisfaction in my homemade coffee. With a tweak in product quality and a readjustment of prices, this adorable concept has the potential to fully charm its visitors.

This place offers an exceptional dining experience with the highlight being their 75 cent oysters. After indulging in two dozen, the transition to their excellent cheesy grits didn't disappoint. It's an ideal spot, especially during happy hour, for both quality and value.

This place is a gem! A frequent visitor, I have consistently been delighted by their offerings. Emphasizing organic and fresh ingredients, their commitment to sourcing from local farmers and even growing their own veggies is commendable. The menu boasts a variety of choices, ensuring there's always something new to try. A personal favorite breakfast dish, Carly's breakfast, combines avocado on sourdough toast with a fried egg and sweet potatoes - simply divine. Highly recommended for anyone looking for quality, fresh fare.

The burgers, specifically the El Mariachi, are a flavorful delight, perfectly compensating for their modest size with rich taste. Additionally, the homemade-style salted caramel ice cream offers a delightful dessert option. It's also worth noting the recommended rooster sauce, which further enhances the dining experience. Overall, despite the smaller portions, the quality and taste of the food make it a recommendable choice.
