Enjoyed a surprisingly good sushi experience during a late Sunday dinner at this establishment. The variety on my plate was both delicious and remarkably affordable, totaling just $13. Impressed with the upbeat and welcoming staff. Definitely a gem worth returning to for both the quality and value.

After several visits, I regretfully conclude that this establishment fails to meet even the most basic culinary standards. The hoagies, dripping with grease, induced nausea, and a mistakenly ordered buffalo chicken sandwich was overwhelmingly doused in blue cheese and greasy sauce, making it inedible. Every dish I've tried suffers from excessive grease and overpowering seasoning. A plea for moderation and fresher ingredients goes unheeded. Additionally, their desserts are notably lackluster, lacking any redeeming flavors and thus not worth the expense. To compound the disappointment, the sodas are often expired and lack carbonation. My experiences here have been uniformly negative.

Our stay was marred by several issues despite the cleanliness of the room and the friendliness of the staff. Despite booking a non-smoking room, we were greeted by an unpleasant odor and ashtrays, indicating otherwise. We chose not to address this issue, as our stay was brief. Additionally, the shower drainage was remarkably slow, and the lumpy pillows contributed to an uncomfortable night's sleep, resulting in a migraine. While the room was clean and the staff was amicable, the free WiFi's failure to connect further detracted from our experience.

During my visit to the pharmacy, I encountered less-than-friendly staff, which could have been an off day for them. Despite being promised a 15-minute wait for my prescription, it wasn't ready until 50 minutes later, contradicting the initial estimate. For those in need of prompt service, I recommend considering alternatives like the nearby Walmart for filling prescriptions.

El Camino offers a delightful selection of seitan dishes that are bound to please enthusiasts of this wheat-based protein, with their seitan wings and nachos standing out for their delectable flavors. These offerings are a big draw for patrons who appreciate plant-based cuisine. However, the dining experience is somewhat marred by the notably slow service, which can dampen the overall enjoyment. Instances of exceptionally delayed orders, to the point of meals being comped, highlight areas where improvement is urgently needed. Aside from their seitan options, the restaurant's attempt at fried pickles falls short of expectations, suffering from a grainy coating and an overall lackluster flavor profile. Despite these drawbacks, the excellent taste of the core seitan dishes, alongside enjoyable margaritas, ensures a steady flow of returning customers, willing to overlook service shortcomings for a taste of their favorite items.

I highly recommend B13 for anyone looking to get a tattoo. I've personally had two tattoos done here and am extremely satisfied with the results. The place stands out for its ability to accommodate clients, even in group settings and on short notice, without compromising on quality. While I believe all the artists here are talented, Amanda's work is particularly outstanding. If you're undecided on where to go for your next tattoo, B13 is a solid choice.

Visited the establishment on a bustling Friday night and faced a reasonable 20-minute wait despite the crowd. Service was inconsistent; while the effort from our server was evident, it fell short of expectations. The food was mediocre, leaving an overall impression that doesn't compel a return visit.

Twisted Twig comes highly recommended for their outstanding service, friendly demeanor, and stunning floral arrangements. Dealing with the stress of finding a florist two weeks before her wedding, the reviewer found solace in Jen's responsiveness and genuine care. Despite the tight timeline and the client's open preferences regarding flowers, Jen skillfully crafted beautiful arrangements within the budget, demonstrating her expertise and ability to tailor services to individual needs. Not only did she deliver the flowers on time, but she also surprised the bride with extra touches that enhanced the ceremony's ambiance. Jen's dedication to exceeding expectations, coupled with her friendly and professional approach, makes Twisted Twig a top choice for anyone in need of floral services.

The dining experience showcased a mixed bag of superb culinary prowess shadowed by lackluster service. The service took a hit due to an unwelcoming waiter who prematurely steered us towards lunch options, mildly dampening the initial mood. The menu, however, did partly redeem the day. Standouts included a commendably fresh sashimi, the uniquely delightful Banzai roll—praised for its innovative no-rice approach—and a notably tasty seaweed salad. The Shiomay, whilst smaller than anticipated, didn't disappoint in flavor. The salad's dressing, leaning towards a carrot purée, struck as an unconventional choice, differing from traditional expectations. Overall, the establishment promises a culinary adventure worth exploring, particularly for those seeking unconventional sushi experiences like the riceless Banzai roll, albeit with a pinch of patience for the service. 4/5 stars.

I recently discovered a hidden gem for brunch just four blocks from my place, thanks to a friend's recommendation. The honeybee crepe and almond croissant I tried were absolutely delicious, leaving no room for leftovers – a rare occurrence for me. While the place does feature a cozy seating arrangement across two floors, space can be limited. So, for those planning to visit, especially in groups, an early arrival is advisable. Perfect for smaller gatherings, this spot has definitely earned a return visit from me.

This location is outstanding, arguably the best for donut enthusiasts. Their unique offer of made-to-order donuts after 5pm guarantees you get them piping hot, almost too hot to eat right away. Impressively, the donuts retain their deliciousness even the next day, making every visit a memorable culinary experience.

I had a delightful experience at this charming location, captivated by its commitment to sustainability. The ambiance is inviting, augmented by the wonderful and attractive staff. Both the food and coffee exceeded expectations, leaving an indelible mark on my taste buds. I wholeheartedly recommend this gem to anyone seeking outstanding culinary delights in a friendly and sustainable environment.

The food from this establishment was extremely disappointing—both in quality and price, failing to justify its cost. The delivery was excessively delayed, taking more than two hours, and the staff displayed unprofessionalism and rudeness over the phone when inquired about the order. Overall, ordering from this place was a regrettable decision, one not to be repeated.

The reviewer expresses profound admiration for Evan, emphasizing his significance and positive impact as the door guy at OMALLZ. Evan's exceptional presence and personality are highlighted as key reasons for the reviewer's patronage, suggesting his role greatly enhances the venue's appeal.

This dining experience was deeply disappointing, marred by subpar food and excessive pricing. The eagerly anticipated meal turned into a frustration with a tasteless burger served on a soggy bun, reminiscent of fast food quality, and excessively salty fries buried under truffle oil, failing to justify their $16 price tag. The long wait to enter only added to the dissatisfaction, making a return visit highly unlikely.

"Pleasant Surprise in Reno: A Taiwanese Gem Amidst Hotels

Stumbling upon this Taiwanese restaurant in Reno was an unexpected delight. Conveniently located near all major hotels, it offers an authentic journey through Taiwanese cuisine, provided you're familiar with what to order. The solid boba tea is a standout, promising a genuinely refreshing experience. A commendable spot for those seeking a taste of Taiwan in the heart of Reno."

Disappointing and overpriced, this establishment fails to deliver on quality, leading to two unsatisfactory dining experiences. Despite being compensated by corporate, the consistent lack of satisfaction underscores the advisement against wasting money here. The restaurant evidently lacks direction, cautioning potential patrons to steer clear to avoid being ripped off.

This delightful establishment surprised me during my visit to St. Louis. Initially skeptical due to its seemingly meat-centric menu, I was pleasantly proven wrong. Their excellent veggie burger stole the show, complemented by a wonderful array of local microbrews and homemade ice cream. A hidden gem for vegetarians and beer enthusiasts alike, it's a spot I eagerly look forward to revisiting.

Returning from a culinary hibernation with an unwavering craving for Indian cuisine, I ventured to satisfy my appetite, only to find my go-to chef, Mohammad Butt, had parted ways with "Best Taste of Asia." Amidst a personal crisis, I discovered Zaika, a beacon of hope that redefined my love for Indian food.

Zaika, true to its name, unfolds a mesmerizing canvas of flavors starting with its in-house fresh paneer, setting a new benchmark for the texture and authenticity of cheese. Their unexpected twist on Chicken Makhani with smokey tandoori chicken slices through the rich tomato sauce, elevating the dish to a whole new level. Vegetarian dishes like Dall Fry and Palak Paneer are so rich in flavor, they astoundingly eclipse the absence of animal protein.

However, caution is advised with their specials like the intensely spicy stuffed chili peppers, and I found the fish pakora disappointingly fishy. Nonetheless, Zaika shines with staples like its impeccably textured naan, despite missing the classic sweetness, it performs excellently as a conduit for their flavor-rich dishes.

With an extensive menu of nearly 120 items, each conveniently numbered for easy ordering, Zaika breaks down barriers, ensuring a seamless experience even for those apprehensive about language difficulties. The inclusion of detailed dish descriptions and the availability of both sweet and salty Lassi variations, not listed on the menu, adds a thoughtful touch.

Head Chef Mohammad Butt's transition to an all-HALAL meat menu at Zaika marks a significant evolution from his days at "Best Taste of Asia," promising only the finest culinary experiences.

In conclusion, Zaika not only salvaged my quest for authentic Indian cuisine but elevated it with its artful execution of flavors and meticulous attention to quality ingredients. For dessert, while the nearby Nifty Fifties beckons with milkshakes, the in-house Ras Malai, with its heavenly combination of ricotta cheese dumplings in sweetened milk, cardamom, rose water, and pistachios, comes highly recommended, epitomizing the unspeakable joy found in Zaika's offerings.

This restaurant provided a bustling yet accommodating experience. Despite the crowd, the thoughtful touch of offering special coffee while we waited was greatly appreciated. Our table was promptly ready, paralleling the swift service. The server was notably welcoming, readily providing suggestions that catered to our dietary restrictions with enthusiasm. My daughter and I enjoyed sharing a salad, an entree, and the standout Special grits, each dish delighting us with its taste and presentation, all at a price that felt reasonable for a downtown location. We're fond of this place and look forward to returning.

This place is fantastic with its super friendly staff, excellent kid-friendliness, and delicious food, particularly the hash browns. The option of side tomatoes and grits is a delightful bonus. Moreover, it offers great value for money, making it an all-around wonderful dining experience.

Visited for gelato with an out-of-town friend, hoping for a positive experience. Unfortunately, while the gelato itself lived up to expectations, the service left much to be desired. The daytime staff was amicable, but the nighttime employees were dismissive and unprofessional, treating us more as an annoyance than customers. They whispered and laughed among themselves, noticeably making my friend feel uncomfortable. Expecting better from the management, we were further disheartened to witness the young manager partake in the disrespectful behavior. It's disheartening to note such a decline in service quality from just a year ago.

This location offers an excellent spot for hiking, biking, and running enthusiasts, boasting an array of well-maintained paths complemented by stunning views and plenty of shaded areas, providing a respite from the heat. However, the enjoyment is somewhat dampened by a notable disregard for the leash rules, as evidenced by several encounters with dogs far from their owners and off-leash. Adherence to these regulations is crucial to maintain the area's accessibility and enjoyment for everyone, including our four-legged friends.

After many recommendations, I finally decided to try this often-overlooked gem, and to my delight, it did not disappoint. The crab cake appetizer, featuring two generously sized cakes accompanied by a uniquely refreshing dill-infused sauce, was a promising start. Opting for the comfort of chicken tenders, we were met with hearty portions that embodied simplicity and wholesomeness without any pretense. The single waitress managing both tables and bar was efficient, though I anticipate potential delays during busier times. The meal excelled in both quality and value, with prices that challenge the norms of typical establishments offering similar fare. The ambiance, while unpretentious, complemented the overall pleasant dining experience marked by reasonable prices and delicious food.

This restaurant delivers consistently excellent service and delectable food, setting a high bar with its friendly staff and enticing promotions that ensure repeat visits. The standout aspect is the quality of the fish, which is nothing short of amazing. They have mastered the art of serving perfectly portioned sushi rolls, allowing diners the pleasure of sampling a diverse array of options. Without a doubt, it reigns as our favorite sushi spot in town, promising a delightful dining experience every time.

During a visit to Jesse's for the first time, a couple experienced attentive service and an overall enjoyable dining experience, even amidst a busy Saturday night setting. Despite the packed restaurant and parking lot, the couple was seated promptly beside a window with a suggestive view. Their server, Nikki, managed to greet them and attend to their needs efficiently, even in the absence of a drink menu on the table. The couple appreciated Nikki's knowledge and suggestions for drinks.

The appetizers, crab-stuffed mushrooms and French onion soup, were met with mixed reactions; the mushrooms were criticized for their disproportionate crab to mushroom ratio, but both dishes were praised for their flavor. The meal's pacing was well-received, with timely transitions between courses and constant attention from Nikki to clear empty plates and refill drinks. The main dishes, a 6 oz filet and a 16 oz Delmonico steak, were cooked to perfection, though accompanied by minor disappointments such as the scarce quantity of sautéed mushrooms and the overcooking of the steak due to the hot metal plate it was served on. Additionally, a sweet potato side did not come as requested, lacking cinnamon topping.

Even though there were minor setbacks, such as a delay in receiving their entrees compared to other tables and the less flavorful bread, the couple's overall experience was positive, largely attributed to their server's excellent service and attitude. They expressed certainty about their return to Jesse's, highlighting the significance of attentive and knowledgeable service in enhancing the dining experience.
This establishment boasts a welcoming and cordial staff, an impressive array of options, and prices that are reasonable, ensuring a satisfying experience for its customers.

During my first visit to New Orleans, I've savored incredible meals at various local establishments. Unfortunately, my experience at The Praline Connection starkly contrasted, leading me to caution others against dining here.

The ambiance may be inviting, with clean surroundings and attentive service, but the food drastically undermines the restaurant's appeal. The BBQ Oysters, served untraditionally in a soup cup, were drenched in a subpar sauce reminiscent of low-quality ketchup, and the texture was disappointingly gooey. Additionally, the garlic bread had the unmistakable taste of staleness, suggesting it might have been reheated rather than freshly prepared.

The chicken wings further solidified my dissatisfaction, being both undercooked and cold, paired with an unpleasant sauce. Feedback from my dining companions echoed my sentiments, summarizing their entrees with a blunt "This Sucks!"

While I appreciate the effort of the service staff and the cleanliness of the venue, the culinary experience at The Praline Connection was deeply disappointing. Hence, I could not in good conscience recommend this restaurant to others.

Review: My experience at the McDonald's closest to my home in Fishers, Indiana, has unfortunately been consistently disappointing, prompting me to prefer driving to further locations. While I do enjoy McDonald's occasionally, this particular branch fails to meet the mark due to several issues. The food often arrives cold or incorrect, significantly detracting from the overall experience. Additionally, the service is lacking, primarily because of a language barrier, as many employees do not speak English, which complicates the ordering process for those of us who are not Spanish speakers. Moreover, the service speed is notably slow compared to other McDonald's in the area. While I understand the value of diversity and the complexities of communication, basic understanding between staff and customers is essential for a satisfactory service experience. My recommendation would be to choose another McDonald's location unless you have extra time and are fluent in Spanish.

I had a very good breakfast experience, conveniently located within walking distance from our hotel. I opted for the crepes with fruit, a choice I would happily make again. However, I was slightly unsure about the tea; it had a surprising hint of fennel seed flavor to it.

Attended a remarkable Yelp Elite event at Holy Mole! which exceeded all expectations. The opportunity to sample an extensive array of their offerings revealed a delightful gastronomic journey, with each dish outshining the previous. A specially crafted cocktail for the event proved to be a hit, impressing even those with a usual indifference towards cocktails. The welcoming and proficient demeanor of both the manager and staff significantly enhanced the experience. This event served as a perfect prelude, eagerly setting the stage for a return visit for a complete dining experience. Highly recommend for those seeking culinary excellence coupled with top-notch service.

Visiting Dinardo's was a disappointing experience, encapsulated by an overarching sense of "ick." Despite a warm greeting from the hostess, the establishment's rundown and unclean appearance set a negative tone from the outset. Contrary to the charm often found in less polished eateries, Dinardo's fails to deliver, offering subpar food at unjustifiably high prices. Service further detracted from the experience, with our server's snarky demeanor proving more disconcerting than amusing. The menu items, from the underwhelming mussels to a too-salty soup and merely passable seafood dishes, left much to be desired. Given the myriad of superior seafood options available, such as local BYOB establishments, I cannot recommend Dinardo's. It's a mystery how it remains in operation.

For my 100th review, I decided to shine a spotlight on a personal indulgence, Starbucks. This specific location stands out for its exceptional service and quality. The baristas greet customers with warmth, crafting each drink with care and efficiency. My go-to choices, the Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate or Mocha, and occasionally the White Mocha, highlight my preference for coffee that veers away from traditional coffee flavors. Their iced teas serve as an ideal refreshment during warmer months, while their breakfast options, especially the Cranberry-Orange Scone and their breakfast sandwiches, offer unique and flavorful starts to the day. Opting to order inside rather than the drive-thru saves time, given the lengthiness of the drive-thru line. This Starbucks venue consistently delivers a delightful experience, contributing to my weekly routine.

My wife and I had a fantastic experience at this diner, with its charming decor and excellent food standing out as highlights. Personally, I found the cheese steak to be superior to Geno's, a testament to the quality of their meals. Additionally, our server provided outstanding service, contributing to a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience.

JB Dawson's may initially seem like just another chain restaurant reminiscent of Friday’s, Bennigan’s, or Ruby Tuesday’s, but it surpasses expectations and delivers an experience that sets it apart. From the moment we entered, the welcoming staff ensured a seamless and swift seating process. Our encounter with Nancy, the server who assisted us with our beverage and appetizer order, was delightful and informative. She recommended the twisted shrimp for our appetizer, which deliciously outshined Bone Fish's Bang Bang Shrimp.

Our main server, Kyle, maintained the high level of attentiveness and friendliness. The menu offered a comforting selection, with the Four Cheese Mac & Cheese and the fish tacos standing out for their flavorful composition and fresh ingredients.

However, the dining experience did encounter a hiccup with the establishment's craft beer menu. Its limited range, heavily skewed towards IPAs, showed a lack of variety that didn’t quite meet the expectations of a craft beer enthusiast. Despite this, the staff’s willingness to accommodate and suggest alternatives, like the Stoudts Scarlet, demonstrated their commitment to customer satisfaction.

While JB Dawson's excels in culinary execution and customer service, expanding and diversifying the craft beer selection could elevate the overall dining experience. I look forward to future visits, albeit with the potential of bringing along a personal selection from my craft beer collection. In all, JB Dawson’s manages to defy first impressions and deliver an enjoyable dining experience well worth exploring.

This hidden gem, tucked away on a residential street just behind a bustling business district, offers an unexpectedly delightful lunch experience. The selection was perfect for a light, yet satisfying meal, featuring a vegetarian plate paired with an extraordinary Greek salad. The salad stood out as the best ever tasted, boasting fresh, perfectly seasoned ingredients and a generous size that could easily serve as a stand-alone meal. The vegetarian plate was equally impressive, served with freshly baked, pita-like bread, seasoned vegetables, rice, and a delicious tzatziki-like sauce. The flavors were remarkable, compelling one to indulge more than intended. With ample portions at a very reasonable price, this spot is a must-visit for those seeking quality, fresh meals.

This local pho shop impresses with its great food, fresh ingredients, and very nice staff, easily garnering repeat visits. Its eclectic and loyal clientele is a testament to the quality it consistently serves up. I personally recommend the bun beef for those not in the mood for pho. Definitely worth stopping in!

The restaurant offers an outstanding dining experience with exceptional food and a wonderful atmosphere. The carne asada tacos, in particular, are highly recommended for their authentic taste that transports you back home.

This spot boasts a beer selection that is unmatched, drawing us in time and again. Unfortunately, our experiences are consistently marred by a bar staff that seems indifferent at best, treating patrons as though they're a nuisance. It's a real letdown. Despite the amazing beer variety, our latest visit ended with us having just one drink before deciding to take our business elsewhere for dinner. The consistent lack of warmth and engagement from the bartenders is a deal-breaker. No matter how appealing the beer, we won't be returning. Instead, we found solace at Brickside Grill, a few miles away. Owned by the brother of this establishment's owner, Brickside Grill offers not only good beer but also excellent food, complemented by a staff that's friendly and engaging.

Visited this spot around 2pm on a Monday, largely because other options on Main Street were unavailable. Opted for bar seating and enjoyed a few drinks before diving into the menu. I tried the pulled pork tacos and my companion went for a burrito; both of us found our meals to be average - neither disappointing nor exceptional. The establishment has a decidedly collegiate atmosphere, even midday, which might not appeal to everyone. Overall, a decent place for drinks and Mexican cuisine without any remarkable highlights.

**A Sweet Surprise for a Special Day: A Review of Delicious Designs**

Planning a wedding in just two months with a guest list that kept growing seemed like a challenge, yet Delicious Designs, under Leigh Anne's expert hands, turned it into a delightful experience. Initially, our small, intimate ceremony didn't call for a cake, but as plans evolved, so did our desire for one. With scarcely a week's notice, Leigh Anne was tasked with creating a simple yet specific cake - a two-tier lemon delight with no decorations. She exceeded expectations, not just fulfilling this last-minute request but also adding an unexpected treat of chocolate vegan cupcakes for my daughter.

The cake, a testament to Leigh Anne's skill, was not only aesthetically pleasing but also "yummy delicious", promising an equally tasty memory for our first anniversary. What's more, the inclusion of the chocolate vegan cupcakes was a thoughtful touch that showcased Delicious Designs' ability to cater to specific dietary needs without compromising on taste or presentation.

My daughter took charge of the cake table's decoration, and the result was impressive, especially considering our initial modest expectations for the decor. This backdrop only highlighted the cake's simplistic beauty and Leigh Anne's adeptness at her craft.

In conclusion, if you're in Reno and in search of a bakery that delivers both in taste and service, missing out on Delicious Designs and Leigh Anne's magic is something you'll surely regret. Their ability to accommodate last-minute requests with grace and produce a product that exceeds expectations is a rare find.

I've been a patron of this nail salon through its evolution from Tropical Nails under Tom's ownership to its current iteration as Grant Nails with owner Angela. Initially, I was satisfied with Amy, a skilled technician who consistently delivered quality service. However, since Amy's departure two months ago, my experience has significantly declined. I gave Angela a chance to do my nails, and despite her recommendation, the gel polish started chipping within days on two separate occasions. Despite her attempts to rectify the issue, the results were the same, leading me to lose trust in her ability to maintain the quality I once enjoyed here. Regretfully, I now find myself in search of a new nail salon due to this disappointing shift in service quality.

The reviewer expresses extreme dissatisfaction with their dining experience at Sake House, emphasizing the poor service and lack of attention to their needs. Despite the restaurant being nearly empty, the reviewer encountered significant delays, receiving incorrect orders, and overall inadequate service, particularly highlighted by the staff's failure to acknowledge or remedy the situation. The reviewer, a single mother, highlighted the difficulties of dining with a toddler, noting the impact of wasted time due to the restaurant's inefficiencies. The overall recommendation is to avoid Sake House due to the subpar service and lack of consideration for customers' time and expectations.

This venue boasts an impressive stage setup, including a raised platform, dynamic lighting, a quality sound system, a fog machine, and a spacious dance floor, making it an attractive spot for anyone looking to enjoy a night out with live entertainment. However, the establishment falls significantly short when it comes to food service. During my visits, the service has been consistently poor, marked by a lack of welcome upon entrance and confusing service times. On my last visit, despite inquiring about food service within the stated operating hours, I was turned away, only to witness later arrivals being seated and served adjacent to me. This inconsistency, particularly with something as simple as getting french fries, significantly marred the overall experience, casting a shadow over the otherwise excellent performance space.

Finally achieved the A-line bob of my dreams with Jenna Moore! After over a year of attempts, Jenna, recommended by a friend, was a game-changer. Her attentiveness and clear communication about the process reassured me, and she truly delivered remarkable results. Jenna has set my hair on a positive trajectory towards full healing and growth. Highly recommend her talent and approach!

This eatery offers a fast and fresh dining experience, with standout dishes including delicious carne and flavorful guacamole. However, it misses the mark by not allowing customers to customize their taco toppings. The tortilla chips could benefit from being thinner, while the dulche de leche soft serve is a must-try for its amazing taste. The limited seating and the need for more timely and thorough table cleanups are areas that could enhance the overall dining experience.

This salon seems to redefine the nail salon experience with its impeccable French-inspired style, restoration-like decor, and a color palette that transports you straight into a luxurious magazine. The highlight of their offerings includes upscale polish options like Chanel, elevating the nail-care game to new heights. The service is remarkable, particularly noting the emphasis on cleanliness with the use of sterilized or brand-new tools, a detail that significantly enhances customer comfort and safety.

The salon's ambiance is described as high-end yet classic, avoiding the flash and noise of typical VIP lounges for a more sophisticated, The Hamptons-esque vibe perfect for a low-key brunch with friends or a bridal party. Moreover, the competitive pricing adds to the appeal, making luxury accessible without compromising on quality.

A minor inconvenience mentioned is the parking situation, which seems temporary and likely to improve as the area develops. The salon's location is also advantageously close to other notable spots, making it a convenient choice for a day out.

In summary, the salon, identified here as CURED, makes a splendid addition to Nashville, offering an elevated nail salon experience that blends luxury, style, and comfort seamlessly. It's a must-visit, especially for those looking to treat their loved ones to a memorable pampering session.

This long-time patron, now residing in Colorado, remains loyal to this Philadelphia eatery, visiting frequently during work trips. The menu has been extensively explored, with many items receiving high praise for their quality, generous portions, and affordability. The standout choice is the Indian Mee Goreng, a dish so beloved that the reviewer wishes to obtain its recipe for enjoyment even while away in Colorado. This glowing endorsement highlights the consistent satisfaction and connection the customer has with the restaurant.

While the service received was commendable, the pizza itself was a letdown, failing to meet the expectations set by preferred places like Stella and Trenos. This experience has diminished my interest in making a return visit.

My stay at this hotel post-Christmas for a week was a mixed bag. The main downside was the poor insulation of the connecting doors in the rooms. This lack of soundproofing meant that every noise from adjoining rooms - conversations, coughs, throat clearing, arguments, and even dogs barking - felt uncomfortably close, as if it were happening right beside me. This issue significantly impacted my sleep, as I only managed to have two peaceful nights once the hotel emptied out after New Year's. It seems like poor materials might have been used for these doors, a problem I've never encountered to this extent in other accommodations with similar setups.

On a positive note, the staff at the hotel was outstanding. Their excellent service truly stood out, despite the considerable discomfort caused by the noise issue. It's clear that while the hotel personnel are doing their best, Starwood needs to address the insulation problem with the connecting doors to improve the overall guest experience significantly.

The sandwich experience at this establishment fell short of expectations, particularly due to the jalapeño cheese bread, which was unfortunately tasteless and dry, giving the impression of being old. The vegetables, specifically the tomatoes and cucumbers, were also a letdown as they were mushy from being overripe. While visits here are usually satisfactory, this occasion was a miss. Despite this, the friendliness of the staff was a positive note.
Absolutely delighted with this movie theater/bar/restaurant combo! They offer fantastic drinks, top-notch food, and the service couldn't be friendlier. Highly recommended for a great experience!

I recently ordered an iced mocha and an iced white chocolate mocha, but unfortunately, both beverages were extremely disappointing. They lacked any discernible coffee or chocolate flavor, tasting overly watered down. In an attempt to remedy this, I requested an additional shot of espresso, explaining the issue. While it seemed the drinks were remade, this effort was in vain as there was still a complete absence of flavor. It's baffling how these drinks were so poorly made. Ultimately, both were discarded upon leaving. It was a truly disheartening experience, as they were not even palatable.

This establishment was once at the pinnacle of its industry, renowned for its exceptional value, extensive product range, and the commendable helpfulness and friendliness of its staff. The customer service was notably outstanding; instances of returns, whether due to faulty products or unnecessary purchases, were handled efficiently and generously with immediate refunds, no questions asked. However, there has been a noticeable decline in the overall quality and service, suggesting it may not hold the esteemed position it once did. Despite this, it remains a decent place to shop, maintaining a level of respectability in its offerings and service.

This New Orleans treasure quickly rose to the top of my favorites list, offering an enchanting experience. Accessible from Peters near Elysian Fields or from Piety, this 1.25-mile path grants visitors stunning city views, a gentle breeze, and the chance to explore various art installations and a dog park, all while strolling along the majestic Mississippi River. The timing of your visit could even reward you with one of the city’s breathtaking sunsets, making for a picture-perfect conclusion to any day in NOLA. A must-visit for anyone looking to experience the charm and beauty of New Orleans.

This review details an exceedingly disappointing experience with United Van Lines during a move from New York to South California. The customer initiated contact on May 2, 2018, and received a prompt response to schedule a virtual survey on May 10. The survey was conducted efficiently and professionally, but the company's follow-up was non-existent. Despite sending an inquiry a month later and leaving a voicemail, the customer received no quote, response, or acknowledgment. This lack of communication starkly contrasts with the prompt estimates provided by four other moving companies. The reviewer expresses frustration and concern over the unprofessionalism displayed by United Van Lines, suggesting their behavior is inexplicable unless unforeseen circumstances have occurred. Overall, this experience severely diminishes the company's credibility and reliability in the eyes of the customer.

The sushi offered here presents incredible value for its price, particularly highlighted by their standout specialty menu. Two must-try options, the Snow Mountain and Volcano sushi, distinguish themselves as remarkable choices for any sushi enthusiast.

This eatery is the top choice for gyros, offering exceptional quality across their menu. Their chicken gyros come highly recommended, but they cater to a variety of tastes with a selection of delightful dishes, including burgers that are a hit with children. Their thick, perfectly seasoned steak fries steal the show, always served hot and fresh. The sole drawback is their baklava, which is made with pistachios, a choice that may not suit everyone's preference.

During a brief stay in Reno, I stumbled upon a Taiwanese restaurant that greatly surpassed my initial expectations. Despite my reservations about the locale, the quality of the cuisine here rivaled that of other cities' offerings. The standout dishes included the succulent 三杯鸡 (San Bei Ji), a flavor-packed oyster omelet, and a perfectly crispy scallion pancake. Although my visit was short and I couldn't sample as many dishes as I'd have liked, this establishment has left a lasting impression, making it a spot I'll undoubtedly long for upon departure.

The restaurant offered authentic, high-quality food in a pleasant and clean setting, accompanied by good service. Although the beer selection was somewhat limited, the overall first experience was highly positive, ensuring a definite return visit.

Visited this charming wine lounge for lunch with my fiancée and a friend. Despite its cozy size, we snagged a quaint table by the window. The place boasts an impressive and diverse wine selection, complemented by unique non-alcoholic options like Italian orange soda. For starters, we indulged in lamb sausage, potato chips, and crab-stuffed peppers, which were delightful. My main, a mozzarella sandwich with prosciutto bacon bits, struck the perfect balance of savory and light. Service was efficient and courteous, enhancing the rustic, intimate vibe of the lounge. While the atmosphere was mostly quiet, creating a relaxing backdrop, navigating the bathroom door lock proved slightly challenging. Overall, a highly recommendable spot for a satisfying lunch experience.

Fellinis of Media easily stands out as a top dining choice due to its extensive menu that caters to a wide variety of tastes, ensuring there's something for everyone. The staff’s exceptional kindness and willingness to accommodate any request only enhance the dining experience, making you feel genuinely cared for. The ambiance of the restaurant complements the culinary experience with its beautiful and serene setting, perfect for a relaxing meal. If Italian cuisine is what you crave, Fellinis of Media delivers the best in the area, making it a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy a top-notch dining experience.

This new eatery is a delightful addition to the neighborhood, serving up exquisite Southern Latin cuisine that's sure to win over locals. Our takeout experience was nothing short of delicious, confirming the buzz around their offerings. The family running the place exudes warmth and hospitality, enhancing the dining experience. It's the refreshing change our area needed, and I'm personally thrilled to have discovered my new favorite culinary delight. Highly recommended for a taste adventure!

This establishment in Lehigh Acres earns a disheartening zero stars due to its alarmingly untidy and disheveled condition, highlighted by the accumulation of aged newspapers and dust. The customer service and quality of work, specifically regarding nail services provided by Jenna, fell significantly short of acceptable standards, necessitating multiple return visits for corrections, only to be met with unprofessional and confrontational behavior. It is strongly advised to steer clear of this location to avoid disappointment and wasted resources.

Visited this Kimpton restaurant twice with mixed experiences. The first visit was for drinks at the bar and some lemon hummus with pita, which was outstanding—possibly the best hummus I've ever enjoyed. However, the brunch experience the following morning was disappointing: a 45-minute wait for cold food that unfortunately came with a hair in it. While the manager compensated our meal, the breakfast letdown was unexpected for a Kimpton establishment. The bar definitely shines, but I'd recommend skipping breakfast here.

This theater offers a very enjoyable experience with its consistently clean environment and friendly staff, earning it high marks. However, it falls short of a perfect rating due to its lack of modern updates that compete with other theaters, specifically in seating comfort and the inclusion of waitstaff services, which are becoming more common. While there is a mention of slightly upgraded seating in one or two theaters, the overall lack of these amenities, despite similar pricing to rivals like the Roadhouse theater that offers more luxury features (heated seats, wait service, chef-prepared food), is a notable shortfall. This theater could benefit from comprehensive updates to enhance its competitiveness and overall guest experience.

**Review of Thai Restaurant Visit**

Rating: ★★★★☆ (4/5)

After only one visit, I'm impressed and recommend this spot to fellow Thai cuisine enthusiasts. The initial visit is crucial to gauge the restaurant's offerings and tailor future orders to personal taste.

Utilizing a Living Social deal, my father and I explored this quaint, house-turned-restaurant, a setup charming for a quiet visit though potentially cramped when busy. Making a reservation was seamless, and the staff accommodated the use of a digital coupon effortlessly.

Our appetizers began with the shrimp spring rolls, arguably the best I've experienced, marked by fresh, crisp ingredients, and served with a delightful peanut sauce. However, traditionalists might miss the presence of Sriracha. The tom yum soup with shrimp, known for its spiciness, struck a balance with its sour notes, a rendition that I found more palatable than others, though the use of button mushrooms over straw mushrooms was noted. Future visits will likely see me opt for a veggie version, sparked by the owner's nod to authenticity.

The main courses, shrimp pad Thai and chicken pad keo mao (drunken noodles), were flavorsome, albeit with portions seemingly smaller than competitors'. The pad Thai, while a tad overdone and differing from the perceived 'standard' orange sauce, retained its flavor, and the drunken noodles catered perfectly to my spice preference, abundant in baby corn and well-coated noodles.

Post-meal, a conversation with the owner outside revealed a genuine interest in customer satisfaction—an encouraging sign for their business's future. The mention of cooking classes, affordably priced at $65, piqued my interest, suggesting an extension of their commitment to authentic and quality experiences.

Additionally, my first Thai iced tea was a pleasant discovery, reminiscent of chai tea. The meal cost, post-discount, was reasonable for the quality and quantity provided.

In sum, my visit left a positive imprint, bolstered by quality dishes and meaningful interactions. Though not local, the lure of their genuine approach and tasty offerings ensures my return when possible.

Kingsway Mall provides a refreshing alternative to larger, more crowded shopping centers, offering a variety of popular stores including lululemon, Jacob, Danier, Gap, Club Monaco, and American Eagle, among others. Its appeal extends beyond shopping, with a food area hosting an array of eateries like New York Fries, Orange Julius, and Extreme Pita, ensuring a satisfactory dining experience with ample seating that rarely fills up completely. Essential services and shops like Zellers, a dollar store, and Sears add to its convenience, although the absence of The Bay and a movie theatre is noted. Nevertheless, for a hassle-free shopping trip or a quick food fix, Kingsway stands out as a perfectly adequate choice.

Visited India's Kitchen instead of our usual Spice and Grill. Opted for goat curry, which unfortunately underwhelmed. The sauce was overwhelmingly salty with an overtone of tomato, while the goat meat was tough. Naan bread was also mediocre at best; however, the rice was a redeeming factor. Ultimately, found the experience very disappointing.

This dining experience teeters on the edge of being worth its somewhat steep price tag. Initial service hiccups, including a delay in receiving menus, eventually gave way to efficient service and prompt food delivery. The fare itself – from a quality crab cake to a surprisingly satisfying chopped salad – mostly hit the mark, with even the basics like bread and fries meeting expectations. However, the forced accommodation in a cramped bar area after 9 PM, alongside the inconvenience of juggling space for three plates, slightly marred the overall dining comfort. A concerning post-meal moment arose when a significant overcharge was discovered, attributed to a "banking glitch" by the restaurant’s management, leaving an air of financial uncertainty. With a final bill of $45 including tip, and banking issues pending, the value for money hangs in balance.

As someone who prides themselves on their discerning sushi palate, my recent experience at a sushi restaurant left much to be desired. The sushi, unexpectedly and disappointingly warm (and notably not in a tempura style), was possibly the lowest quality I have ever encountered. Additionally, the "side salad" option, priced at $3, comprised solely of iceberg lettuce - no variety, no additional vegetables, just plain iceberg. This offering was perplexing at best and felt like a mockery at worst. It's safe to say, with a bitter smile, I conceded defeat to this establishment's puzzling choices. I will not be returning. Check and Mate.

Had an amazing experience splitting a vegetarian platter with my partner; it left us absolutely stuffed! The food was delicious, complemented by the kindness and attentiveness of the staff. They offered great advice on ordering without taking advantage of us. We will definitely return.

This hotel presents a misleading facade with its classy atmosphere but fails to deliver on service quality. Despite booking a suite for a bachelorette party, we were offered two separate rooms instead and only managed to secure adjacent ones after much pleading. Although a complimentary valet service was provided to compensate, it resulted in more distress as the car was keyed under their watch. The experience was marred by poor management and inadequate staff response, making it unlikely for me to recommend or return.

My numerous visits to this location have always been delightful, never leaving me disappointed. On a trip to Puerto Rico with a friend, we aimed to satisfy my mother-in-law's craving for Tamales. The staff here surpassed our expectations with their accommodating nature. They not only provided free samples but also graciously offered to cook and package them for us. This establishment truly stands out for its excellent service and friendly staff. Highly recommend for an exceptional experience!

This dining experience was markedly disappointing. Despite a nearly empty venue and prompt ordering, a simple meal of a burger and pork tenderloin sandwich took an excruciating 50 minutes to arrive. The only distraction during the wait was the ongoing football game, which unfortunately couldn't overshadow the discomfort caused by loud, offensive behavior from patrons at the bar—a scenario poorly managed by the establishment. The food, once it arrived, was mediocre at best. Overall, the lack of ambiance and subpar service suggests this place has significant improvements to make if it wishes to endure.

This dining establishment provides a pleasing experience that guarantees a return visit. Offering a variety of vegetarian options, the meal can commence with delightful veggie spring rolls that are served hot and crispy. For mains, the duck and rice vermicelli soup stands out with its savory broth, earning praise for its flavor. Although the beef pho was less favored due to the texture of the meat and the inclusion of tripe, the restaurant's diverse beef cut options suggest a better choice could be made upon subsequent visits. Portions are generously sized, possibly too large for some. The ambiance of the restaurant is marked by a clean, quiet environment with a distinctly 80s decor, complemented by swift and attentive service.

Chickie's and Pete's sports bar offers a friendly atmosphere, especially appealing to women, with ample seating for Sunday game viewings. The establishment provides a unique touch with a sound booth that plays music and themes, especially catering to Eagles fans, during commercials, all in a smoke-free environment. However, the bar's much-hyped crab fries, despite their special seasoning, fall short due to the cheese sauce's texture and the fries not being served hot. On the upside, the beer towers with taps add a fun element to the dining experience. Overall, Chickie's and Pete's creates a vibrant setting for enjoying sports, thanks to its spacious area, engaging sound system, charming staff, and enthusiastic patrons, making it a solid choice despite some culinary shortcomings. Rating: 3.5 stars.

The Pancake Pantry in Nashville is more than just a breakfast spot; it's an iconic institution where you have a chance to rub elbows with country stars while enjoying delicious pancakes. Recognized as a must-visit destination in the city, expect to queue up, but consider it part of the experience, where engaging conversations with fellow diners make the wait worthwhile.

As a longtime patron of Magasin Cafe, my adoration for Vietnamese cuisine blossomed there. Due to renovations at the Cafe, I ventured to Magasin Kitchen for my customary pho indulgence. While the culinary and service standards were commendable, even boasting superior seasoning in the chopped dishes compared to its sibling location, the heightened prices and the less inviting ambiance somewhat marred the experience. Despite these drawbacks, the consistent quality of food and service ensures my continued loyalty to Magasin's offerings.

This dining spot, with locations in both this city and Philadelphia, has earned high praise from a frequent patron who claims a deep affection for its culinary offerings, particularly the cumin style lamb, suggesting it's delicious enough to be enjoyed daily. The review also highlights a fondness for the rabbit appetizer, indicating it as a standout choice. While there are discussions about the authenticity of the Sichuan cuisine provided, the reviewer dismisses these arguments by noting that the only other place where they've experienced Sichuan food that matched the authenticity of what's served in Sichuan Province was in Chengdu itself. This enthusiastic endorsement suggests the restaurant delivers a commendable and enjoyable dining experience, making it well worth a visit for those looking to indulge in its diverse and flavorful menu options.

This review combines a quasi-political rant with a candid critique of Kmart, juxtaposed against competitors like Target and Walgreens. The reviewer's frustration with Express Scripts and Walgreens leads them to Kmart, a choice met with low expectations and nostalgic mockery. The condition of the store is described as "harshly bright" and "dingy," with a lackluster electronic section and overpriced entertainment media. An attempt to modernize the shopping experience, notably in the men's department, is criticized as feeble compared to department stores like Macy's or Dillard's. However, a surprising find in the assortment is Joe Boxer male thongs, adding a humorous twist to the visit. The review acknowledges a useful tip for shoppers: patio furniture can be found at a bargain during clearance sales, showcasing the reviewer's balance in providing a fair assessment. The pharmacy service at Kmart is a notable exception to the overall disappointing experience, earning appreciation for efficiency and convenient hours. Despite a singular positive aspect, the iconic late '80s sentiment "K-Mart sucks" is reaffirmed, with a playful nod to an era and its fashion peculiarities. The review is a blend of critique and levity, painting a vivid picture of a shopping experience that is both underwhelming and unexpectedly amusing.

"The Tuck Special stands out as a culinary masterpiece, compelling enough to warrant a journey from Texas back to Nashville. This unique blend of brisket, egg, and pimento cheese delivers an exceptional taste experience. While the BBQ sauce may not win everyone over, the quality of the meat shines through. The venue's popularity is evident, yet with some planning and menu research, navigating the crowd is entirely feasible. Highly recommended for those seeking a distinctive flavor adventure."

Our visit to the restaurant was disappointing due to the unpleasant odor resembling a restroom. The atmosphere was intolerable, prompting us to get our meals to-go. The packaging was careless, with both orders placed in the same box, which was inconvenient given my daughter's aversion to fish—I had ordered a spicy tuna roll. While she enjoyed her California rolls, I found the spicy tuna roll to be mediocre at best. Regrettably, we won't be returning.

This dining spot nails it with delicious food, serving ample portions and boasting an evolving, interesting menu. However, it falls short on ambiance, offering cramped seating and a noise level that hampers conversation. While not matching the coffee quality found at Sabrina's, the culinary experience shines, especially with their impeccable latkes and arguably the best bacon in Philly.

Yellow Subs in Reno earns a glowing 5-star review for its exceptional subs, notably when topped with sprouts—a game-changer. The eatery outshines any other sub shop, thanks to its high-quality ingredients and down-to-earth staff who ensure each sub is generously filled. Beyond the food, Yellow Subs cultivates a welcoming environment with cozy seating that encourages conversation, enhancing the dining experience. The place also wins points for its cool merchandise; their tank tops and T-shirts are a hit, allowing patrons to show off their love for the sub shop wherever they go. Whether for the fast service, friendly people, incredible food, or the overall ambiance, Yellow Subs comes highly recommended for anyone who appreciates a good sub and a great atmosphere.

Had a mixed experience at this restaurant. Service started off a bit slow, making me unsure whether to rate it 3 or 4 stars. Tina, our waitress, was involved but the initial wait was notable. Despite the rocky start, the food impressed me, especially considering it was my first time trying it. The side salad also stood out in a good way. While the waiting time was a downside, the quality of the meal made up for it.

Love this place! It's quickly become our go-to local spot. Every visit offers a wonderful ambiance and delicious food. The drinks, especially the margaritas, are fantastic, and the homemade salsa is particularly tasty. Their salads are generous enough to be entrees, perfect for sharing. It's an ideal spot to gather with friends, especially for outdoor dining. Highly recommend!

The dining experience offered commendable service with staff exhibiting excellent hospitality. However, the meal itself was somewhat underwhelming. An improvement is desired in the temperature of the soups, which were served cooler than preferred. Additionally, the preparation of the steak did not meet expectations, as it was served well done contrary to the requested medium doneness. Despite these culinary missteps, the outstanding service greatly contributed to the overall dining experience.

Despite the rave reviews on Yelp and a personal recommendation, my experience at Nippon Tei didn't quite reach the high expectations set by others. The complimentary edamame was a pleasant surprise, providing a value seldom found in sushi restaurants. However, the mango sake, albeit interesting, did not justify its price in terms of flavor or uniqueness.

The sushi, which should have been the highlight, turned out to be somewhat underwhelming. My dining companion and I sampled the philly, tempura, tuna, and California rolls. While they were all reasonably tasty, none stood out as particularly exceptional or memorable compared to other sushi experiences I've had. Moreover, the structural integrity of the rolls was lacking, with pieces falling apart during consumption—a significant detractor from the overall dining experience.

While willing to give Nippon Tei another chance, it's not at the top of my list for future sushi outings. The average pricing does little to incentivize a return visit, especially when I have other preferred options. It appears that Nippon Tei, despite its acclaim, might not be the best fit for everyone's sushi preferences.

I recently attended a screening of "Star Wars Rogue One" in 3D, expecting a fantastic cinema experience. Initially, everything seemed promising. Ticket purchase was smooth, the venue atmosphere was welcoming, and the seats were comfortable. I even enjoyed some delicious, hot pretzel sticks before the film started. However, my anticipation quickly turned to disappointment once the movie began.

The biggest issue was the extremely dark projection. It was nearly impossible to discern the faces of actors, and raising my 3D glasses did nothing to alleviate the problem. Fellow audience members also voiced similar concerns. Initially, I wondered if it was an intentional aspect of the film's cinematography, but the visuals were so poor that shadows were doubled, and distinguishing actors became a challenge.

When I sought assistance from the manager, his response was dismissive. He claimed that due to the "closed-system" nature of their 3D setup, no improvements could be made and refused to personally assess the situation in the theater.

Previous non-3D screenings at this location had been enjoyable, but this unfortunate experience with their 3D projection has deterred me from returning for similar showings. It's disappointing that both the technical quality and customer service fell short of expectations, significantly detracting from what should have been an enjoyable viewing of a popular film.

The dining experience was disappointing, primarily due to the establishment's high pricing for what can only be described as average food served at a lukewarm temperature. Additionally, the service left much to be desired; servers struggled with pronouncing the names of the dishes and appeared eager to issue our bill despite the restaurant being considerably empty on a Saturday night. A notable incident involved a server's perplexed reaction to feedback regarding the overpriced $23 pork chop, which was mistakenly priced at $18 on the menu and criticized for its excessive fat content. Although the "ropa vieja" dish was favorable, its price did not justify the moderate portion size. The ambiance further detracted from the experience, with disarray evident through random placements of plastic container boxes and a noticeably sagging decoration where a lamp might have been expected, thereby not aligning with the menu's price points.

This review expresses disappointment in a themed restaurant designed to resemble a chicken coop. Although the layout was found to be interesting, the food was criticized for being overpriced and underwhelming. The reviewer mentions that from the Sunday brunch menu, only the chicken strips and fries presented decent value. A particular disappointment was the seasonal salad ordered by the reviewer's wife, which was small in size, low on lettuce, and overpriced. The chicken was deemed good but not superior to that of Raising Canes. Additionally, both service and food delivery were considered slow, despite the small number of patrons.

This delightful establishment has managed to impress even those who don’t typically venture into vegetarian or health-food territory. A skeptic turned enthusiast, the reviewer praises the addictive quality of the food, particularly the delicious salads. The experience is enhanced by the warm welcomes received upon each visit, hinting at the establishment's popularity among a diverse crowd. It’s a place that not only leaves a mark with its cuisine but also with the positive atmosphere and the sense of community it fosters. Clearly, a must-visit for anyone looking to be pleasantly surprised by how appealing healthy eating can be.

This review reflects an extremely dissatisfied customer who rated their experience with a 1-star due to the lack of a lower option. The customer blames Angie at Regis Hair Salon for providing a dissatisfactory haircut that significantly deviated from the reference photos provided. Despite attempts to point out discrepancies, it seems concerns were disregarded, resulting in an unwanted "man's flattop" style. The reviewer expresses regret over choosing this salon, especially due to the timing around the holidays, and vows never to return, ending with a sarcastic thank you to Angie and Regis Hair Salon.

An ideal date night destination. The standout dishes, sweet potato nachos and the uniquely named "breakfast," were absolutely divine. Each item we tried resonated with flavor, leaving us eager for a return visit. Highly recommend for a delightful culinary experience.

We recently dined at Convivio shortly after its opening and were overall pleased with the experience, marking it as a place we'll certainly revisit. Despite encountering a few minor service hiccups and an out-of-stock wine, these issues seemed understandable due to the restaurant's recent launch and efforts to smooth out initial operations. The owner made a memorable impression by personally ensuring our satisfaction, showcasing exceptional hospitality. The food stood out, especially the tortelloni pansotti, which I'd rank as the best pasta dish I've ever enjoyed. Based on this initial visit, Convivio shows promise to become a regular dining spot for us.

After a spontaneous desire for seafood at Clearwater Beach, we ended up at Crabby Bill's without prior research. Opting for the $25 steamed seafood bucket, we found it to be a decent offering, albeit not the freshest we've had. It served as a satisfying snack to tide us over until our planned dinner. The choice was more about convenience than a culinary standout experience.

---

**Review of State Street Kitchen's Grilled Chicken Sub**

Just had an incredible experience at State Street Kitchen with their Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Swiss, and Honey Mustard Sub. To add a personal touch, I threw in some Jalapeno Chips for an extra spicy crunch. The combination was simply perfect for a crisp autumn afternoon.

State Street Kitchen, under the watchful eye of Micha and her welcoming team, continues to impress with their inventive and high-quality dishes. It has fast become my go-to spot for both breakfast and lunch.

Their unique take on home cooking, infused with a delightful Korean twist, is something you truly need to experience firsthand. If you haven't had the chance to visit, I highly recommend you do. It's more than just a meal; it's like being welcomed into a family.

Definitely try it out and let yourself be charmed by the tastes and warmth of this local gem.

---

This delightful spot merits every bit of praise for its wonderful atmosphere and culinary excellence. With a menu that tantalizes the taste buds through a variety of homemade specials that rotate regularly, it ensures a fresh experience on every visit. The chicken salad, a standout offering, is particularly noteworthy, making an ideal choice for crafting delicious sandwiches at home. Paired with the establishment's commitment to quality food and the genuine warmth of the staff, it's a question of what more one could possibly ask for in a dining experience. Truly, a gem worth visiting.

This review is based solely on the service rather than the food. As a sales administrator at a hotel, I frequently recommend places to guests and expect a certain level of courtesy, given our potential to direct business. Unfortunately, my experience with this establishment was disappointing. I was informed by our front desk that they offered a hospitality discount, which prompted my call to place an order. However, the interaction was anything but hospitable. The employee on the phone, Neisha, was abrupt, cut off my sentences, and initially refused to honor the mentioned discount based on my department, despite its relevance to referrals and guest services. After a reluctant concession, her manner remained rude. While the food was satisfactory, the poor service has led me to decide against future recommendations of this establishment to our guests.
This establishment boasts exceptionally kind staff, efficient appointment handling, and minimal wait times, ensuring a pleasant and swift experience.

Disappointing dining experience with overly salted dishes. We had Brussels sprouts that were inedibly salty, even after being replaced. The burger was average, and its accompanying fries suffered from the same issue of excessive salinity. Although the flank steak was passable, it wasn't memorable enough to warrant a repeat order. On a positive note, the cocktails were enjoyable and the atmosphere was pleasant. However, due to our dissatisfaction with the food, we won't be returning.

This review expresses an enthusiastic appreciation for Phillies games and highlights how the stadium significantly enhances the fan experience. Initially not a baseball fan, the reviewer's passion was ignited a few years ago, and even an early setback (watching the team's 10,000th loss) did not dampen their spirit. They praise the open feel of the stadium, noting it never feels claustrophobic, with the exception of seats under the scoreboard which require constant looking up. The ability to wander and watch the game from various vantage points without feeling cramped, even during sold-out events, is highlighted as a positive feature. Additionally, the review commends the variety and quality of food available, as well as the cleanliness and accessibility of facilities, ensuring that waiting times are minimal. The anticipation for the baseball season is palpable, concluding with a spirited "Go Phillies!" indicating strong support for the team.

During a recent lunch visit to a Mexican restaurant, I had a delightful experience, greatly appreciating the side of beans, which were the best I've ever had from a restaurant of this cuisine. Despite the smaller portion sizes, the fresh, cilantro-forward salsa and perfectly crunchy, non-oily chips were highlights, though it's worth noting that chips and salsa are an additional purchase. The standout for me was the made-to-order, chunky guacamole which paired excellently with tortillas. The hot sauces, however, lacked the kick I was looking for, possibly due to my high spice tolerance. On the other hand, my boyfriend found his two steak tacos disappointing due to the low-quality, flavorless meat, though he remains open to giving the restaurant another try. Overall, a mixed experience with noteworthy vegetarian options but some room for improvement on the meat dishes.

This charming sandwich spot nestled in La Cumbre Plaza comes highly recommended. A long-standing gem in Santa Barbara, this deli offers a selection of sandwiches that are hard to beat. With fresh ingredients and wonderfully soft bread rolls that don't skimp on quality, it's a go-to for anyone craving a good sandwich. The reviewer, a local who has sampled more than half of their menu, finds it difficult to choose a favorite – a testament to their consistently delicious offerings. Additionally, the deli boasts an impressive selection of sodas, encouraging adventurous pairings with each visit. While you won't find extravagant items like roasted duck pastrami, Plaza Deli is perfect for anyone in search of great taste and fresh ingredients. Whether you’re a local or just passing through, it’s worth stopping by for a bite.

This Nordstrom shoe department stands out from other locations, offering an impressive variety including high-end lines. The sales staff excel in their roles, notably Erwin, who provided exceptional service by locating and price matching two pairs of shoes across the Nordstrom network to Bloomingdale's sale prices, with free shipping and handling. This exemplary customer service has solidified my loyalty to Nordstrom.

This small aquarium in Tarpon Springs primarily caters to children, offering engaging activities such as a shark feeding show and interactive stingray tanks where visitors can pet and feed the creatures. While it may not be a top attraction in the area, it holds appeal for families with young children who enjoy these up-close animal experiences.

This Chinese takeout spot may not wow with extraordinary dishes, but it stands out as the best local option for those craving simple, satisfying fare. Notably less greasy than typical offerings, the food is complemented by the exceptionally friendly staff, making it a reliable choice for a no-fuss meal.

This quaint spot offers a fantastic dining experience with its great ambience, food, and service. On my first visit, I tried the Shrimp Po Boy, which was absolutely delicious, complemented perfectly by the fries and cole slaw. This won't be my last visit!

Broussard's provided a positive dining experience overall, enhanced by its palpable old-school New Orleans charm and beautiful courtyard, which commendably bridges the gap between elegance and warmth. The service was prompt and attentive, starting with the drink attendant's adept wine recommendation, compensating for the unavailability of my first choice. The menu, rich with traditional flair, offered a delightful maytag blue cheese salad and a standout pecan crusted drum, both of which I thoroughly enjoyed. Despite these highlights, the appeal was slightly marred by the dining room's aesthetics, which felt outdated and less inviting, reminiscent of an assisted living home rather than a fine dining venue. While appreciative of the experience, this aspect dampens my enthusiasm for a return visit, resulting in a rating that falls short of perfect.

This establishment offers an excellent service and a great atmosphere, making it a delightful dining experience. The highlight is undoubtedly their raw bar, with the Alaskan crab legs being a standout dish that is highly recommended for those willing to splurge. Burger enthusiasts will also find their cravings satisfied here, with delicious, generously portioned burgers accompanied by crispy fries. However, be prepared to pay a premium for entrees beyond the burgers, which themselves are priced at $17, with other dishes typically exceeding $30.

While the setting may appear casual, the pricing aligns more with fine dining. A notable letdown was the shrimp and grits, which, despite being highly praised by the waiter, failed to meet expectations, especially considering its hefty price tag.

On a positive note, the drink selection is commendable, and the service is prompt. The restaurant also offers a warm gesture of hospitality towards visitors, evident in the complimentary appetizer provided to our table. Among the appetizers, the rabbit and chicken liver pate is particularly noteworthy for its generous portion and quality.

For an optimal experience, it's suggested to focus on the drinks, appetizers, and burgers. Following this approach should ensure a satisfying visit.

Doan's is a standout choice for those who cherish consistency in quality and enjoy having a go-to dish that never disappoints. The establishment prides itself on friendly and efficient staff, making it an ideal spot for a satisfying meal, especially when time is of the essence during a lunch break.

This incredible brick oven pizza spot in Philly impresses more with each visit. The must-try Rotolo, a delightful creation of dough encasing mortadella and ricotta, adorned with pistachios and oil, offers amazing value at $5. The prosciutto pizza is another standout, boasting sumptuous toppings and divine dough. Paired with consistently great service and a solid beer selection, this establishment ranks as a top pizza destination.

This pizza place in Indianapolis hits the mark with its wonderfully thick, chewy, cheesy, and greasy offerings that taste exactly how pizza is meant to be. The reviewer's ecstatic comparison to the famous Oprah Winfrey car giveaway meme perfectly encapsulates the joy and excitement found in every bite. Far from the crispy, thin, square-cut, or oregano-heavy variations one might find elsewhere, this establishment serves up a delightfully traditional experience that has rightfully earned its place as the reviewer's new go-to pizza spot.

During a visit with no other customers present at the time of order, we experienced an unfortunately prolonged wait of 27 minutes for three teas. This delay is excessive and unacceptable, particularly in a Chinatown locale, where expeditious service is anticipated. No tea should warrant such an extended wait time.

This eatery delivers on the genuine taste of Chicago with what might be the best beef sandwiches found outside the Windy City. While their offering is nearly flawless in authenticity and flavor, there are a few areas ripe for improvement: introducing an even larger sandwich size could cater to those with bigger appetites, and adding sweet peppers to the mix would expand their flavor options. While at it, complementing their sandwiches with fries would round out the dining experience perfectly. Additionally, maintaining their prime location off of Mass Ave open all year, alongside extended operating hours, would undoubtedly meet the high demand for their top-notch fare.

I recently visited Buff Nail Salon for an early Mother's Day celebration with family, and our experience was delightful. The salon showcased exceptional customer service by accommodating our request for 4 simultaneous pedicures, adding an extra pedicurist to their schedule just for us. This gesture was highly appreciated and exceeded our expectations. 

The salon's modern and minimalist decor provided a soothing atmosphere, making the visit all the more enjoyable. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and offered a choice of complimentary mimosas, wine, or champagne - a thoughtful touch that set the stage for a relaxing experience. The range of polish colors was impressive, and the quality was top-notch, with my polish remaining chip-free throughout its wear.

Despite its many positives, the sole drawback of Buff is its street-only parking availability. However, this is a minor inconvenience and understandable given its location, primarily serving clients from the CBD.

Overall, my visit to Buff was a fantastic experience, marked by excellent customer service, a welcoming atmosphere, and high-quality treatments. I enthusiastically look forward to returning and highly recommend it to others, albeit with a note to plan for potential parking challenges.

A fantastic spot for pho, especially notable for its delicious broth. The No. 51 (small size) proved to be satisfyingly filling. This is a place worth revisiting the next time I'm in Philadelphia. Highly recommended.

This establishment proves to be a delightful fusion of a cozy café and a vibrant bar, offering an exceptional variety of coffees, teas, breakfast items, bar snacks, salads, sandwiches, and an extensive range of beers available on tap, bottled, or canned. Its casual ambiance invites guests to linger for hours, reminiscent of carefree college days, perfectly suited for a relaxed Sunday get-together. Adding to its appeal is the pet-friendly policy, welcoming four-legged friends to join in the fun. Whether you're in the mood for a morning caffeine fix, a leisurely lunch, or an evening drink, this place caters to all tastes and times, making it a versatile hangout for friends and their furry companions.

My husband and I had pre-booked a Corolla-sized car from Avis Rent A Car at Reno airport, but upon arrival, we opted for an upgrade to a Camry-size vehicle. The staff was professional, offering us options until we were satisfied with a Camry. However, the price for this upgrade and our five-day rental came to a steep $800, not including the $150 insurance fee I unwittingly opted for, believing my personal insurance insufficient. Disappointed by these unforeseen costs, especially after learning a weekly rate would've been marginally cheaper and the upgrade costing an additional $20 per day, we've decided to explore other rental services like Hertz or Dollar for future trips and will forego unnecessary insurance fees, relying instead on our personal coverage.

Excellent customer service and highly satisfied with my new purchase! I strongly recommend this place for anyone looking to buy a well-maintained used car. Make sure to ask for Andy; he was incredibly helpful throughout the process.

I recently discovered Jungle Prada Tavern after moving to the area, and it's quickly become a favorite spot of mine, thanks mainly to its impressive selection of seafood dishes. Upon my first visit, the friendly bartender recommended a beer that perfectly suited my taste, setting a high bar for the rest of the evening. Skeptical as I am about seafood at new places, Jungle Prada Tavern blew me away with their offerings. From the scallops prosciutto appetizer to the del mar pizza topped with crab and scallops, and not forgetting the crab-stuffed portabella mushroom accompanied by a scrumptious crab and lobster bisque, every dish was a hit. They even have a delectable roasted portabella mushroom option for vegetarians, which comes highly recommended by non-vegetarians as well. Having returned multiple times for the food (and the drinks!), and even bringing my seafood-loving sister along, I can confidently say that Jungle Prada Tavern won't disappoint. Whether you're a local or just passing through, this place is a must-visit for fantastic food and drink options.

This bead store in Nashville is a favorite due to its impressive collection. The store boasts walls filled with an extensive selection of seed beads and glass strands, catering to various tastes and projects. It's a paradise for bead enthusiasts looking for quality and variety in their crafting materials.

Had an amazing dinner experience on their opening day! The atmosphere was lively, accompanied by warm and welcoming staff. The food was outstanding - from the satisfying green tea labeled as "PHO PHREE," to delicious summer rolls with spicy peanut sauce, and the phenomenal pho. Everything was top-notch, making this place a must-visit on my list as I explore Fairmount's culinary scene. Definitely turning it into one of my regular spots!
