I had an exceptional dining experience that was absolutely worth the 90-mile journey from Tahoe. The Chicken Basil stood out as a highlight, perfectly complementing the delicious Boba Tea. Contrary to any skepticism, the cuisine offered a genuine taste of Taiwan that I highly recommend trying for an authentic culinary adventure.

CRU offers a delightful experience for wine enthusiasts, seamlessly blending a charming wine store with a chic, modern wine bar. The Vina Vino wine flight and The Bold and the Beautiful flight, presented on adorable wood/chalkboard boards, showcase a thoughtful selection of wines, with the Vespucci Primitivo and Il Fauno di Arcanum standing out for their exquisite flavors.

While the fig jam and prosciutto flatbread might lean a bit heavily on the blue cheese for some tastes, it's nonetheless a tasty choice. The Farmers Platter is a standout feature, allowing guests to customize their selection from an array of high-quality cheeses and meats, complemented by jam, mustard, caramelized nuts, and crostini, making it a truly memorable part of the CRU experience.

In summary, CRU's cozy and welcoming atmosphere, combined with its superior wine selection and delectable food offerings, make it a must-visit destination. I eagerly anticipate my next visit.

This longtime favorite spot continues to impress, earning its place among the top three steakhouses in the city. Despite undergoing a name change, the quality and experience remain unchanged. For those looking to try something unique, the chicken cheesesteak comes highly recommended.

Pina's shines as an underrated gem in Roxborough, particularly for its oversized, delectable Stromboli and unparalleled Sicilian pie—easily the best around. While their sandwiches and pizza are average, the standout is the generous chicken parm, covered in cheese and sauce, leaving diners satisfied and full from a sit-down experience. A must-visit for those in search of hearty, delicious meals.

This cafe and grocery store might lean towards the pricier side, but it compensates with delicious food and a broad selection. Highlights include the vegan sandwich and tofu melt, complemented by an impressive array of vegan sweets. A great spot for those willing to splurge a bit for quality offerings.

This restaurant in New Orleans earns top marks for delivering an exceptional dining experience. Renowned for being the best burger joint in the area, it doesn't disappoint, from the quality of the food, which is praised for its freshness, to the attentive service ensuring meals are served promptly. Visitors from Atlanta found their visit here to be a memorable first stop, with plans to return before their departure. The menu's diversity, including unique options like the Gator and deer burgers, alongside delicious buffalo wings, caters to a variety of tastes. Satisfied customers also give a shout-out to the impressive drink selections. This spot comes highly recommended for those seeking happy dining moments.

My boyfriend and I have visited this restaurant on multiple occasions and it never fails to impress us. The establishment oozes an appealing old-school charm, spread out over three spacious floors, creating a cozy yet vibrant atmosphere.

Each visit has been a delightful experience, with the culinary offerings being a significant highlight. From the highly recommended veal to the succulent clams casino, tender mussels, and perfectly seasoned pasta with oil and garlic - every dish we've tried has been a hit. Not to forget the homemade garlic bread, which is simply out of this world.

The staff here deserve a special mention for their friendly and attentive service, always making us feel welcomed and well cared for.

On our most recent visit, I was blown away by a new addition to their menu - the gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce. It was absolutely divine and has quickly become my favorite dish at this restaurant.

For anyone looking for a memorable dining experience with delicious food, this is a must-visit spot. Highly recommended!

Home Wine Kitchen's "No Menu Monday" offers a unique and intriguing dining experience perfectly suited for those looking to explore the St. Louis fine dining landscape. With a reservation in hand, my visit proved to be more intimate than anticipated, thanks to the spacious seating. The concept of a no-menu evening, priced at $30 for a three-course meal plus an optional $12 for wine pairings, is both innovative and delightful. Diners communicate any dietary restrictions or preferences, and the kitchen curates a personalized culinary journey.

The meal began with lamb meatballs and goat cheese-stuffed poblano peppers, both of which set a high standard for the courses to follow. The meatballs were particularly noteworthy, while the poblano peppers struck a balance between spicy and creamy flavors. As for the main courses, the corvina fish, though a tad rare for my taste, was elegantly prepared, whereas the robust flavors of the swordfish steak left a lasting impression, easily becoming a highlight of the Missouri seafood scene. Desserts, including champagne gelatin and a chocolate tart topped with homemade whipped cream, provided a sweet and satisfying end to the meal.

Service throughout the evening was commendably casual yet professional, contributing to the overall pleasantness of the dining experience. Despite the unique concept, I noticed a lack of variation in the dishes served to different tables, a minor drawback considering the ambitious nature of the no-menu approach. The ambiance of the restaurant, characterized by its well-thought-out interior, lighting, and noise level, further enhanced the meal.

Home Wine Kitchen's No Menu Monday is an adventurous culinary venture not meant for the cautious diner, as exemplified by the varied reactions to the presentation of a whole fish to one of the tables. Although left curious about the regular menu offerings, my experience suggests that a return visit could be just as rewarding, if not more so, given the chef's capability to surprise and delight.

I recently visited a swanky restaurant for a special reunion dinner with old elementary school friends, reconnecting after years through Facebook. The setting was perfect for our much-anticipated gathering, encapsulating a high-end atmosphere, though this was reflected in the menu prices. My lobster bake, while delicious, wasn't quite as spectacular as I had hoped and the seafood portion could have been more generous. Yet, the Neapolitan Old Fashion I ordered was faultless. My friends enjoyed their dishes - from fritters to crab cakes, though we all acknowledged the steep prices. Our bill came to $170, slightly surprising a few of us, considering the portions and selection.

What truly stood out was the service. Our waiter, whose name escapes me, was outstanding; his attentiveness, kindness, and the surprise dessert for my friend's birthday added a memorable touch to our experience.

In summary, my ratings are as follows:
- Service: 5/5
- Food: 3/5
- Ambience: 4/5
- Price: 2/5

Despite the prices, I left satisfied, owing largely to the excellent service and the special nature of our gathering.

Having been a patron of Susanna Foo since childhood, my relationship with the restaurant stretches back to its initial days as a modest takeout spot, managed by Susanna's parents. Over the years, it has been a backdrop to many cherished memories, notably Susanna's personal interactions, like crafting napkin dolls and preparing Chicken with Cashew Nuts, a childhood favorite. While the cuisine has consistently been dependable and the service excellent, as an adult, I find the menu lacks the excitement it once held for me. The ambience and decor have perpetually impressed, yet there's a longing for a refreshed approach in the kitchen. I yearn for Susanna to invigorate her traditional offerings with innovative flavors or delve deeper into her Chinese heritage for culinary inspiration. It's my hope that a revitalization of the menu will reignite my affection for Susanna Foo, reminiscent of my childhood admiration.

During my search for dining options beyond the usual hotel fare in California, I sought the aid of the Yellow Pages. Despite its modest advertisement, Spiro's caught my eye with the promise of Greek cuisine. My decision did not disappoint. The Greek lemon soup was a standout, and the Moussaka, recommended over the Sea Bass by the waiter, met all expectations. The overall dining experience at Spiro's was exceptional, punctuated by Neil's commendable service. It's a place I eagerly anticipate returning to on my next visit to the area.

This establishment falls dramatically short of delivering an authentic barbecue experience, according to a seasoned barbecue judge. The critique centers on the brisket, described as a disappointing departure from traditional preparations found in renowned barbecue regions like Texas, the Southeast, or Kansas City. The meat, likened to a fatty pot roast, lacked any discernible smoky flavor, presenting instead with a mushy texture akin to over-braised meat. Alarmingly, the brisket consisted mostly of fat, with sandwiches served containing up to 75 percent inedible fat chunks. This lapse in quality suggests a possible lack of attention or expertise from the management or staff. In conclusion, customers seeking genuine barbecue craftsmanship are advised to look elsewhere.

This delightful spot, nestled far north of Tampa, ranks as our second favorite destination for sunset viewing. The journey might be lengthy, but the experience is unparalleled, offering a unique tradition where everyone gathers to applaud the day's end, encapsulating a sense of community and shared joy. Although not suitable for swimming due to its rocky terrain, this location makes up for it with its lively ambiance and music, alongside patrons who add to its vibrancy.

Having been a family tradition since our boys were infants – who are now fifteen – this place holds a special place in our hearts. While the food and beverages are unremarkable, it's the breathtaking views and the atmosphere that truly captivate and draw people back time and time again. It's a place that consistently lives up to expectations, providing a wonderful way to conclude the day amidst an enthusiastic and welcoming crowd.

This ice cream spot, thriving since 1958, evidently masters its craft with an enticing selection of soft serve and scooped ice cream. Their menu extends to include delightful cones, boats, floats, and sundaes, all priced affordably. Definitely a must-visit for a sweet treat. Highly recommended!

I recently visited this restaurant on a quiet Tuesday afternoon, eager to indulge in some authentic Mexican cuisine. Opting for a late lunch, I found myself alone but excited to try their pozole, which did not disappoint. Though my experience with pozole was limited, this hearty stew, with its savory pork, hominy, and fresh garnish of lettuce, radishes, and onions, along with a side of dried oregano, offered a comforting and fulfilling meal. I wasn't a fan of the wilted lettuce in the stew but found that a dash of hot sauce elevated the dish beautifully. 

Additionally, I opted for the taco lunch special, featuring two pork tacos accompanied by rice. The meal was enjoyable, and the service I received from the kindly staff added to the overall positive experience. However, I found the salsa to be unexpectedly sweet, which wasn't to my liking, although it was clearly made from fresh ingredients. A standout surprise was the pineapple water—despite my usual aversion to pineapples, trying it on the recommendation of reviews was a delightful choice.

I'm already planning my next visit to explore their burritos, especially since the restaurant's proximity to my routine Costco trips presents a tempting convenience. Despite my usual discipline, discovering such a culinary gem makes resisting future cravings challenging. I wholeheartedly recommend this establishment to fellow food lovers looking for authentic, fresh Mexican cuisine with a side of exceptional service.

**Review: 3.5/5 Stars - A Charming Setting with a Dash of Disappointment**

Nestled in an ambiance characterized by white brick walls and cool, rustic furniture, the establishment immediately draws you in with its aesthetically pleasing decor and perfect lighting, making it an ideal spot for a blind date. The staff is seasoned and attractive, enhancing the overall dining experience with their good and timely service.

However, while the atmosphere is almost faultless, the dining experience falters slightly when it comes to value for money and kitchen flexibility. The prices are on the higher side, which wouldn't be an issue if the portion sizes and accommodating nature of the kitchen matched up. An example being charged $11-13 for a mere 3 to 5 pieces of ravioli, which leaves much to be desired in terms of quantity.

Another point of contention is the kitchen's inflexibility to accommodate simple requests, such as substituting fries with a salad. A request that many would consider to be rather basic was denied, leading to a surprisingly rigid and disappointing interaction for a place that otherwise prides itself on service.

While the setting might be perfect, these shortcomings in flexibility and value prevent the restaurant from achieving a solid four-star rating. The inability to substitute items, coupled with the steep prices for what is being offered, are issues that, if addressed, could greatly enhance the overall dining experience. As it stands, the charm of the environment is slightly overshadowed by these drawbacks, leaving room for improvement.

This restaurant stands out as an intriguing spot in an area plagued by less appealing dining options, drawing patrons in with its excellent decor, vibrant atmosphere, and distinctive funky vibe. While the hip servers add to the ambiance, their inattention can lead to a rushed dining experience, making it prudent to request the check whenever possible due to their sporadic appearance. Gluten-free diners should be warned that the establishment is not fully accommodating, with notably subpar GF buns and non-gluten-free house ketchup. Furthermore, those arriving by car should be prepared for challenging parking. In a nutshell, while the restaurant offers a unique experience worthy of a revisit, it falls short in service and gluten-free options.

This place offers delightful drinks and tasty food, with standout dishes like the pulled pork and fried chicken po' boy. The mac and cheese is particularly remarkable and everything is priced reasonably. They also boast an impressive draft list. Plus, serving food until 1am is a definite bonus. Highly recommended for a satisfying meal and drink selection.

This restaurant disappoints on multiple levels, offering a lackluster dining experience that falls short of expectations. Despite the availability of several open tables, patrons can anticipate a wait, compounded by subpar service. The cleanliness of the establishment leaves much to be desired, detracting from the overall ambiance. The food itself is mediocre at best, failing to justify the premium prices charged for breakfast items. In comparison, nearby alternatives like First Watch and Pinky's present themselves as superior options, debunking any misconceptions about their cost relative to value. Given the numerous drawbacks, this venue is described as an "old broken down dump" unworthy of your time or money, especially when seeking a satisfactory breakfast experience.

El Arado, a spot often overlooked, surprisingly caters well to groups, offering quick accommodation even to the surprise of a six-person gathering at 6 pm. Initial impressions were marred by a poorly sanitized table, emitting an unpleasant odor, but the ambiance improved significantly once drinks were served. The margaritas came recommended, and beer prices were notably affordable at $2.95 for Mexican varieties.

The service shone through with efficiency and quiet attentiveness, seamlessly handling special dietary requests from the party, such as no beans or light cheese options. Food quality was commendable - dishes arrived promptly, hot, and flavorful, ensuring a satisfying dining experience for the entire group.

Despite a rocky start, El Arado proved to be a worthy choice for those seeking an affordable and enjoyable meal in the Fountain Square area, setting a solid foundation for a night out. Whether you're kicking off an evening with friends or simply in search of tasty and well-priced Mexican fare, El Arado delivers on both counts.

The Loew's Hotel offers an exceptional stay with its immaculate cleanliness, visually appealing design, and outstanding service. It provides such a comfortable and enjoyable experience that it made a lasting impression on a family who wished their visit could extend to a month. The breakfast quality is notably superb, impressing even the younger guests with its 'futuristic' appeal. Accommodations are spacious, and the convenience of parking adds to the overall positive experience. It's no wonder it earns a flawless 5-star rating from satisfied guests.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at honeygrow, and I'm thrilled to share my experience. Located conveniently in the same complex as my gym, I had been eyeing this spot for a while before finally deciding to give it a try. On my first visit this past Tuesday, I was highly impressed and have since found a new favorite spot for a healthy meal.

I opted for the Sour Cherry BBQ stir fry, customizing it with chicken instead of pork and parsley instead of shallots. To my delight, the dish was not only low in calories but also incredibly satisfying and flavorful. Despite the long line, the service was remarkably fast, and I appreciated the efficiency of ordering and paying through a kiosk.

The staff was friendly and ensured a smooth experience throughout my visit. Given the quality of the food and the excellent service, I am eager to return to honeygrow and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delicious, healthy meal option.

This restaurant presents a delightful dining experience, boasting a superb cheeseburger that hits almost all the right notes with its thick, evenly cooked patty, pleasant sauce, and soft bun. The complimentary zucchini bread adds a tasty touch to the meal, and the service lived up to expectations. Gin and tonic enthusiasts will appreciate the good selection, and the cool ambiance enhances the overall experience. Its location downstairs from an apartment adds convenience. However, it's worth noting that the prices are on the higher side. A slight hiccup in service was observed - a perception of disappointment from the waitress for only ordering cheeseburgers, though this is subject to interpretation and has not significantly impacted the overall positive review. The prospect of returning is high, indicating a satisfying and memorable dining encounter.

This venue offers a mixed bag of experiences catering to various interests, albeit with a notable caveat for non-smokers and those with allergies due to its smoky atmosphere, meriting a slight demerit. Dining options abound with a range of prices, ensuring there’s something for everyone’s budget. Beverages are available at a nominal fee, offering a wide selection to choose from. While the hotel on-site tips towards the pricier side, the offer of free parking is a definite plus. Entertainment is varied, providing something for everyone, from live shows to more passive forms of amusement. The presence of ATMs might be a concern for visitors with less self-control, especially around the gambling areas. Speaking of which, the venue provides a straightforward piece of advice: only gamble what you’re willing to lose. This place seems to understand that not everyone will partake in gambling, encouraging guests to enjoy the atmosphere and entertainment as mere observers. All in all, it promises an enjoyable experience, even for those who prefer to watch the action from the sidelines.

Despite its promising 4.5-star rating, this establishment falls short of expectations. The burgers were mediocre at best, and the overall ambiance closely resembled that of a typical chain restaurant akin to Red Robin. Our visit on a Tuesday night may not have showcased the place at its best, but the underwhelming experience has deterred us from planning a return visit.

This review enthusiastically endorses a brewery, which is claimed as the reviewer's favorite worldwide. Highlighted experiences include participating in a "Beer School" and a recommendation for first-timers to take the brewery tour, emphasizing the allure of seeing the Clydesdales and gaining insight into the brewery's operations. The review conveys eagerness for a future visit to undertake the "Brew Master" experience, signing off with a fond farewell to Budweiser. The tone is extremely positive, suggesting an exceptional experience for visitors.

Our experience at this restaurant started on the wrong foot when our 7pm reservation, made earlier that day, was not recorded due to an oversight by a new employee. Upon arrival, the hostesses seemed disorganized and indifferent, failing to acknowledge us promptly and showing a clear lack of professionalism. An attempt to address the issue resulted in a dismissive response and an additional wait time with no attempt at amending the situation, such as offering a place to sit or a simple apology. The staff's approach to customer service was lacking, as they chose to blame the mishap on the new employee instead of finding a satisfactory solution. This experience left us feeling undervalued as customers, leading to our decision not to return.

The dining experience was marred by the establishment's refusal to honor their Yelp offer of a 10% discount for checking in and reviewing, insisting it would only apply on a subsequent visit despite the allocated 4-hour redemption window. Although the food was exceptional, this disappointing oversight in customer service significantly tainted our overall impression, highlighting a disconnect between advertised incentives and their actual application. Great culinary experience overshadowed by questionable business ethics.

This post office, though visited only occasionally for mailing packages, stands out for its convenient automated machine, a feature lacking in my closest branch. However, the true gem of this location is the exceptional customer service, particularly highlighted during a visit for passport applications with my husband. The representative we encountered was not only fast and friendly but also impressively knowledgeable, ensuring our process was swift and seamless. She went above and beyond by providing follow-up forms and clear instructions for a name change procedure, setting a high standard for future visits. Her expertise suggests she would be an excellent trainer for others, making every experience at this facility as commendable as ours.

This health store is a perfect starting point for anyone looking to embark on a journey towards a healthier lifestyle. Boasting an expansive selection of vitamins, dietary supplements, beauty products, and homeopathic remedies, it caters to various health and wellness needs. The staff is notably helpful, assisting customers in finding specific items and offering alternatives for those not in stock. The inclusion of a rewards program and acceptance of digital coupons adds great value, making it an appealing choice for health-conscious shoppers.

This shop is highly recommended for its fantastic atmosphere, excellent staff, and delicious selection of healthy treats, croissants, and meals for both lunch and breakfast. Every visit has been a consistently wonderful experience, making it a regular destination for those who have discovered its charm.

Enjoyed a delightful start to my Saturday with a great cranberry orange muffin paired perfectly with a caffe latte. The café offered a welcoming ambience and notably fast service. Highly recommend for a cozy morning bite.

This sushi spot stands as a personal favorite, boasting not only an exceptional menu but also the friendliest staff one could encounter. It consistently surpasses expectations, ensuring it remains my top dining choice. The harmonious blend of delicious cuisine and warm hospitality makes every visit memorable.

This coffee shop stands as a personal favorite, distinguished by its exceptional food quality. Every dish I've tried here impresses with its freshness, taste, and overall enjoyment. Beyond its culinary offerings, the shop boasts a cool, edgy atmosphere with ample comfortable seating, including inviting outdoor options for pleasant weather days. It's a must-visit destination, particularly for those seeking both great coffee and delectable food.

This burrito shop is a local gem, earning its title as the best in town thanks to its combination of delicious food, great ambiance, and excellent service. The highlight is their delectable burritos, with the chicken and chorizo combo standing out, though the smoked brisket is also noteworthy. With generous portions, a relaxed atmosphere, and the charm of a family-owned establishment, it's a must-visit for anyone after tasty, reasonably priced meals. Their commitment to flavor and quality shines through, making it highly recommended for a satisfying, healthy (in moderation) dining experience.

This review focuses on the lunch menu of a restaurant, particularly praising the quality of their sandwiches available between 11-2. The reviewer highly recommends the grinder and the southwesterner, noting their deliciousness and ability to satisfy all taste buds. Although they mention the sandwiches are slightly expensive and small, the overall experience is deemed well worth the cost. The reviewer looks forward to trying the steaks, reflecting anticipation for future visits. They rate the food and service as excellent, with a slightly lower score for price due to the high costs, yet acknowledge the great quality provided.

Overall Ratings:
- Food: 5/5
- Service: 5/5
- Price: 4/5

This delightful spot offers a tasty selection that will surely impress with its preppy vibe. The What's Up Doc omelet stands out as a can't-miss option, despite some inconsistency in portion sizes. For those craving sweetness, the French toast selections won't disappoint, and the Fancy Breakfast Sandwich is a hit, especially when swapping prosciutto for bacon. Don't forget to round off your meal with their great mimosas!
This store is a fantastic find for fans of 50's-Midcentury modern aesthetics! Though its prices are somewhat higher than those of my go-to shops in STL, its unique offerings make it stand out.

In a disheartening experience at a Hampton location, despite being a loyal gold member and giving the hotel another chance amidst ongoing construction issues from past stays, the reviewer faced significant disappointments. The room provided was unclean, and shockingly, upon arrival for a four-night reservation, they were turned away due to overbooking, only being offered accommodation for the subsequent nights. This lack of reliability and concern for guest satisfaction has led the reviewer to decide against returning in the future.

This place offers the best fried rice and Pho I've had in Nashville, rivaling even my experiences in Seattle, a city known for its fantastic Vietnamese cuisine. Whether you're a first-timer or a seasoned aficionado seeking out quality Vietnamese dishes, this restaurant is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Discovered a hidden gem during a leisurely walk from our condo, this place dazzled us with its delicious sliders, irresistible donuts, and unique selection of drinks. The vibrant atmosphere, coupled with the exceptionally friendly staff, made our experience unforgettable. Already looking forward to our next visit!

This video rental store is highly acclaimed as possibly the best of its kind, distinguishing itself with an exceptional selection that caters to diverse tastes—from the newest releases to niche classics like the best hockey fights of the 1970s, all offered at enticingly low prices. The knowledgeable and welcoming staff further enhance the shopping experience, making it a cherished establishment. The review expresses a desire for a similar store in Chicago, indicating its unique appeal and the regret of its absence in other locations.

This spot perfectly solves the dreaded sushi dilemma: craving it without the willingness to splurge on an all-you-can-eat experience or drop a hefty sum for a meal. Opting for an a la carte selection on a leisurely weekend late lunch proved to be a smart choice. For just under $20, including tip, I got myself a satisfying combination of a long roll, a hand roll, a drink, and a chocolate mochi, which was an unexpected delight and has since claimed a piece of my heart. The rolls were fresh and flavorful, but it was the creamy, delicious mochi that stole the show. I flirted with the idea of adding another roll, which would've aligned with the cost of an all-you-can-eat deal but decided against overstuffing myself. This place strikes a perfect balance for those in-between sushi cravings.

This review suggests a positive personal experience contrary to many negative reviews. The reviewer appreciated the quick service, obtaining what was needed within 5 minutes, and highlighted the courteous staff and the store's organized, clean, and well-stocked state. However, the reviewer expresses concern for the store's future viability, noting the closure of other nearby businesses.

This pizza place stands out as the quintessential spot for pizza lovers, acclaimed for its unparalleled pizza quality combined with excellent service. The staff is beloved for their friendliness, enhancing the dining experience. A notable highlight is the consistently cold beer, owing to impeccably maintained taps, ensuring that both pizza and beer enthusiasts are satisfied. Additionally, the offering of a fresh beer and slice for an unbeatable price of $5 underscores the establishment's value. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch pizza and a refreshing pint in a welcoming atmosphere.

Federal Donuts truly lives up to its reputation, effortlessly quelling any initial skepticism with its exceptional offerings. As a vegetarian, I can vouch for the donuts and coffee, which, when paired together, create a delightful experience. The quality of their vegetarian-friendly options is commendable. My husband, on the other hand, can't get enough of their chicken, with the buttermilk ranch flavor standing out as his top pick. Moreover, the kindness and efficiency of the staff, regardless of the rush, further elevate the overall dining experience. Federal Donuts is a must-visit for both sweet tooth aficionados and fried chicken enthusiasts alike.

Despite giving it three chances due to its ideal location and inviting bar, this restaurant failed to impress. Friendly staff aside, the menu offerings consistently disappointed, with dishes ranging from overly sweet Asian shrimp to a lackluster, bun-less turkey burger that was compensated for by the management. The final straw came with a subpar fish and chips and a chicken salad more fitting for an auto shop than a dining table. Regrettably, we've decided not to return.

Sapore delivers a slice of Italian charm and culinary delight, comfortably nestled in an unassuming strip mall location. Upon entering, the welcoming, cool darkness of the interior provides an immediate respite from the relentless summer heat, setting the stage for a memorable dining experience. With a reservation, our party of three was promptly seated, beginning our meal with an interesting mix of drinks, including a uniquely customized martini that left a lasting impression and sparked a new fascination for me.

Choosing to focus on the main course and desserts, we bypassed appetizers. The food, from the shared Caprese salad to the hearty Chicken Marsala, was satisfying without being overly remarkable, though the option to add interesting ingredients like anchovy to my martini was a standout feature. The generous portions left enough for a fulfilling leftover meal, an added bonus to the dining experience.

The highlight of the meal was undoubtedly the dessert, with the tiramisu proving to be a decadent finale to our culinary journey. The mention of another tempting dessert option yet to be tried, the cannoli, leaves room for future visits.

In all, Sapore serves as a testament to the fact that great Italian dining can be found in the most unexpected places. It's a spot I'm excited to return to, if not for the entire menu, then at least for another one of their excellent martinis and a deeper exploration of their dessert offerings.

Located in a less trendy strip mall near Cool Springs, this Burger Up location might not boast the hipster vibe of its Twelve South counterpart, but it compensates with its culinary offerings. The burgers are exceptional—tasty and messy with fresh ingredients—proving that a sublime burger needs nothing more than quality meat and toppings. While the regular fries are enjoyable, the truffle fries elevate the experience to a new level with their outstanding flavor, non-greasy texture, and perfect finish of Parmesan cheese. The unpretentious chocolate milkshake, creamy and balanced in sweetness, serves as the ideal complement to the meal, despite lacking an actual cherry on top. For those seeking an upscale burger dining experience without forsaking the classic burger-fries-shake combination, this Burger Up venue is a must-visit.

This service experience was deeply disappointing. Despite scheduling an early appointment for a "check engine" light, my car was not even examined on the day of drop-off, nullifying the purpose of making an appointment. Further frustration ensued when, upon being informed it was ready the next day, I endured an unnecessary hour-long wait due to poor vehicle organization. Astonishingly, after two full days at the facility, my car required no repairs or maintenance. Although a staff member kindly offered amends, the inefficiency and mismanagement encountered have dissuaded me from future visits.

RH&B was once a beloved destination in South Jersey, known for its combination of tasty BBQ and vibrant live blues. However, following its recent sale, the establishment has made the disappointing decision to discontinue all live music events. Although the food remains passable, it's the loss of the musical atmosphere that notably diminishes the appeal of RH&B. Despite decent offerings on the menu, the absence of live entertainment significantly impacts the overall experience, making it difficult to recommend. The memorable aspect of RH&B now resides in its friendly and welcoming staff, whose presence will be truly missed.

This sandwich spot, once known for reliable eats, has recently faltered in quality. The cheesesteak I received was disappointingly light on meat, and the choice of roll—critical in the Philly area—was subpar and stale. While I hope this experience was an anomaly, I'm hesitant to return anytime soon.

The reviewer, a SPG gold member approaching platinum status, expressed disappointment with their stay at a specific property. Despite paying a significant amount for their room, their request for a larger room was denied with the explanation that all rooms were the same size and featured adjoining doors. The reviewer complained about the lack of soundproofing, which allowed them to overhear everything from the adjacent room. Upon reporting this, they were instructed to relocate to a quieter room but were not offered assistance, and faced a long wait due to inadequate staffing at the front desk. Ultimately, they endured the noise until it ceased a few hours later. The reviewer concluded that the hotel lacked sophistication and highlighted a need for better service.

The food offered was fresh and pleasing to the palate, though not exceptionally outstanding. The pricing was reasonable, aligning well with the quality provided. The staff stood out for their helpfulness and pleasant demeanor, making the dining experience notably positive.

This hotel presents itself as a practical choice, especially geared towards business travelers rather than tourists. The accommodations provide the fundamental necessities for a comfortable stay, with an emphasis on comfortable bedding which is a definite plus. The on-site café offers a reasonable deal of one entrée and a beverage included with the room, although the specifics might be a bit murky at times.

On the downside, the hotel's hallways could use some attention, as they appear to be somewhat neglected. However, this might not be a major issue for guests since the hallways are not their primary space. A noteworthy concern arose during my last visit when room cleaning services seemed to drop in quality, evidenced by a leftover bag from Burger King found in my mini-fridge, compromising the cleanliness and overall experience.

In summary, while the hotel serves its purpose and offers a fairly comfortable stay with essential amenities, it would benefit from improvements in clarity regarding meal deals and a more rigorous approach to housekeeping to ensure a consistently pleasant experience for all guests.

Upon visiting Henry's, a neighborhood coffee spot just blocks from my new home, I was eager to discover whether it would become my go-to coffee haven. With expectations high on a humid August morning, here's a concise take on my experience:

**Atmosphere:** Henry's presents a very standard coffee shop layout with no unique ambiance to set it apart. The open space features a mix of ordinary tables and chairs without the cozy college coffee shop vibes nor an industrial-chic aesthetic. This lack of uniqueness left the atmosphere feeling somewhat lackluster.

**Coffee Quality:** Unfortunately, the coffee failed to impress. I opted for an iced coffee, which turned out to be overly bitter, detracting significantly from the overall experience. While the ice ratio was reasonable, it wasn't enough to save the beverage. I plan to give their hot coffee or espresso a shot on a cooler day, but my first impression has me feeling let down.

**Quirky Note:** The name 'Henry' sparked an unexpected train of thought, reminiscent of "Thomas the Tank Engine" and a character named Henry within the series. While this association brought a nostalgic smile to my face, it wasn't enough to elevate my review based on the coffee quality.

In summary, Henry's didn't quite live up to my hopes for a neighborhood coffee gem. However, I'm willing to give it another chance, perhaps when the weather calls for a warmer drink, hoping for a better experience next time around.

We had an exceptional stay at this hotel, which provided a warm and inviting atmosphere from the moment we arrived. The scent of fresh-baked cookies welcomed us, a small detail that set a delightful tone for our visit. The front desk, managed by the friendly Valorie, offered complimentary cookies and water, a gentle gesture that made us feel at home.

The hotel boasts a fascinating "Read it and Return" book program, featuring a selection of books from renowned authors, allowing guests to borrow a book during their stay and return it on their next visit to any Carlson hotel. This unique offering, along with the complimentary fresh-baked cookies, was a pleasant surprise that enhanced our experience.

Our room was impeccably clean, equipped with essential amenities such as a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and an efficient air conditioner. The bathroom was stocked with high-quality toiletries, adding a touch of luxury to our stay.

The hotel's consideration for smokers was notable, providing a comfortable smoking area with swinging benches, a respectful distance from guest rooms. Additionally, the option for smoking rooms caters well to guests who smoke, ensuring their comfort without compromising the experience for others.

The breakfast exceeded our expectations with a variety of hot and fresh options beyond the typical continental offerings, complemented by 24/7 coffee availability. Facilities like the well-maintained pool and hot tub added to the recreational amenities available to guests.

A later checkout time of 12:00 PM was a considerate touch that allowed for a more relaxed departure. At checkout, the genuine interest in our feedback and the willingness to consider suggestions for improvement impressed us, reflecting the hotel's commitment to guest satisfaction.

Overall, our stay was outstanding, marked by thoughtful amenities, attentive service, and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. We rarely write reviews, but our experience at this hotel was so compelling that we felt inspired to share. We highly recommend this hotel for travelers seeking comfort and a touch of home away from home. Safe travels! - J & Niki

The car buying experience, traditionally fraught with intimidation and a palpable sense of disadvantage, was notably prevalent in this reviewer's journey to purchasing a pre-owned vehicle. Despite feeling outmatched, thorough preparation and diligent research through platforms like KBB.com and Edmunds.com seemed to arm the buyer sufficiently to secure a deal that, optimistically, will be deemed fair in retrospect. The engagement with Toyota of Santa Barbara was marked by an extensive test-driving phase, facilitated by the courteous Sam Ladd who offered a wide range of vehicles from subcompacts to full-sized SUVs. This dealership was ultimately chosen for having the desired vehicle that was believed to meet the family's needs. The negotiation phase, described as businesslike, saw Frank Flores, the sales manager, participating in a manner perceived as upfront and responsive to the buyer's concerns. The takeaway from this experience underscores the importance of being prepared and resolute in one's position throughout the car buying process.

This bar boasts a fantastic atmosphere with its friendly bartenders and the owner, creating a welcoming space for a diverse crowd and staff. The presence of an excellent BBQ truck parked outside enhances the experience, making it a must-visit for a comfortable, homey vibe paired with great food.

The restaurant boasts a friendly and accommodating staff, making it a decent choice for large group gatherings, especially around festive times like Christmas due to its BYOB policy and flexibility with group menus. However, despite these positives, the culinary experience falls short of expectations. The meal kicks off with a selection of appetizers including fried gnocchi, calamari, garlic pizza bread, and fried zucchini, which, unfortunately, only reach a level of mediocrity at best. The main courses fail to excite as well, offering a selection of unadventurous Italian-American dishes with uninspired sauces that struggle to impress. An example of this disappointment is observed with three different chicken dishes ordered by the group, which, surprisingly, all arrived smothered in the identical, lackluster sauce. While the service quality may tempt a return, the overall culinary experience, particularly the execution and presentation of the otherwise promising menu, leaves too much to be desired.
This Chinese restaurant stands out as one of the best and most welcoming spots to enjoy a delicious meal. A must-try is the double treasure, sure to satisfy your cravings.

Reno Vulcanizing has been our go-to automotive service provider for several years, and we remain loyal customers due to their exceptional service. Ken, Bruce, and the entire team consistently deliver honesty, courtesy, and helpfulness that stands out in the industry. Their dedication to customer satisfaction ensures that we wouldn't consider taking our vehicles anywhere else.

This combined review offers insights into three distinct tour experiences:

**City Tour:** Awarding this tour only **1 star**, it seems to fall short of expectations on multiple fronts. From booking issues, such as not receiving a confirmation email, to payment hassles and uncomfortable seating arrangements that lead to carsickness, the experience leaves much to be desired. The tour's limited visibility through tinted windows and brief stops at uninteresting locations further detract from its value. The highlight, albeit not enough to redeem the overall experience, is the insight provided into the history of Katrina in the 9th ward. This tour is not recommended, especially when alternatives like taking the green street cars or opting for a walking or red bus tour might offer a more satisfying exploration of the city.

**Plantation Tour:** This experience is highly praised with **5 stars**, largely thanks to the informative and engaging storytelling by the driver, Stacie, and the guide, Ethan. The visit to Laura Creole Plantation stands out for providing a balanced historical narrative, incorporating both the landowners' and slaves' perspectives. Oak Alley Plantation impresses with its grounds, though the focus there leans more toward the landowners, somewhat lacking the balanced approach seen at Laura Plantation. Comfortable bus transportation is a plus, making this tour both educational and enjoyable.

**Swamp Tour:** Despite not spotting any alligators, this tour secures a solid **4 stars** thanks to the knowledgeable guide, Henry. The tour provides an opportunity to encounter wildlife such as boars, raccoons, and birds, offering a rich natural experience. Weather conditions are a significant factor, as cold or stormy weather can hamper the chance of seeing alligators. Like the plantation tour, the comfortable bus transportation adds to the positive aspects of the experience, ensuring comfort even when the weather does not cooperate.

Overall, while the city tour may not meet expectations, the plantation and swamp tours offer engaging and valuable experiences, showcasing different facets of the region's rich history and natural beauty.

This review expresses extreme dissatisfaction with a pizza dining experience, emphasizing poor quality ingredients and preparation. Specifically, the thin crust pizza lacked the desired crunchiness, the olives and salad were of substandard quality, with the salad described as overpriced and unappetizing. The reviewer found the only redeemable item to be the knots, though still criticizes their healthiness. The comparison to higher-quality pizza from other establishments underlines the disappointment. The reviewer, who generally prefers organic options, was left with this choice due to late hours and vows never to patronize the establishment again, citing a preference for quality over what they perceived as harmful preservatives in corporate chain offerings. They conclude with an intent to seek a refund, summarizing the experience as a total waste of money.

Visited this brewery in February and was surprised to find no dark beer offerings at that time. The venue itself is appealing and the staff is friendly. However, the choice to serve summer-themed beers during a typically cold month was somewhat disappointing.

This place, Buddy Brew, is a gem in Tampa, offering much more than just great coffee. Despite the challenges with parking and the occasional crowd, it remains a fantastic spot to visit. The expansion plans are promising for alleviating the parking woes. The baristas stand out for their friendliness, knowledge, and efficiency. Both breakfast and lunch menus deliver in terms of taste, and the coffee roasting is done with commendable care. Overall, it's one of the top favorite spots, highly recommended for anyone in Tampa.

"This spot was somewhat overrated for our tastes, particularly due to the often burned crust on their main dishes, which might appeal to some more sophisticated palates but didn't quite hit the mark for us. However, the cauliflower salad was a pleasant surprise, and the fried dough ball dessert was truly delicious. Mixed feelings overall."

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this delightful spot for lunch, after having received a gift certificate over six months ago. The experience was undoubtedly worth the wait. I absolutely fell in love with their mixed salad sandwich – a unique and crave-worthy choice. Additionally, their homemade ice cream was irresistibly delicious, leaving me wanting more. I'm eagerly looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommended for a memorable lunch experience!

As an avid lover of Italian cuisine, I was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional quality and generous portions of the meals offered by this local gem. Whether opting for dining in or pick-up, the service is consistently outstanding, with a special shout-out to Alexa for her remarkable hospitality. This place has truly exceeded my expectations, and I'm grateful for the fantastic experience. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic Italian flavors with top-notch service.

Enjoyed a delightful Friday night at the bar, where the bartender's charm matched the unparalleled quality of the Manhattans made with Carpano Antica Formula vermouth. The dining experience featured decent lamb meatballs and exceptional spring rolls. This spot stands out in the Quarter as an ideal respite for those seeking a touch of elegance and superb cocktails, albeit at a premium price. The professionalism and friendliness of the manager, Eric, further cement our decision to return. Highly recommended for a special night out.

I've been a regular patron here primarily for the lunch special, which was an unbeatable deal and a significant draw. Recently, my visits have become less frequent due to my husband's preferences, though I personally remain fond of it. It's worth noting that prices have seen a noticeable increase lately. Despite this, the quality and satisfaction derived from meals here have consistently remained high, ensuring that each visit, though less frequent, is still quite enjoyable.

I recently had a delightful dining experience, opting for the classic burger and fries combo. The burger impressed me with its seasoning, striking a harmonious balance of flavors. The fries complemented the meal, being notably tasty. Service throughout the meal was efficient and attentive, rounding off the visit on a high note. I indulged in a Bananas Foster spiked milkshake, which proved to be an excellent choice, adding a unique twist to the meal. Overall, I left very satisfied with my experience.

Visited a new location for the first time and encountered an unusual experience. The restaurant wasn't overly crowded, with a few tables available upon entry, and we were promptly seated and had our drink orders taken. However, the service began to falter as we waited approximately 15 minutes before our food order was taken, with some confusion over who our designated waitress was due to multiple staff interactions.

Subsequently, our food was significantly delayed—so much so that a customer seated after us received her meal first. Despite inquiries and visible frustration, the explanation given for the delay was an "overwhelmed" kitchen, though observation did not corroborate this claim. After a 40-minute wait without receiving our food, we opted to leave, only offering to pay for our drinks. Our waitress waived the drink charges without offering an apology for the inconvenience. The lack of clarity on the cause of the delay—whether a forgotten order or kitchen inefficiency—was disappointing. Given this experience, we have decided not to return, as it felt like a waste of our time.

An absolutely delightful experience at the bakery today! The tres leche cake brought back nostalgic memories, closely mimicking the flavors of my grandmother's recipe, albeit without the Malibu liquor. The chocolate-dipped cannoli, filled with the original creamy filling, did not disappoint and was thoroughly enjoyed. The Italian wedding cookies struck a fine balance, being slightly crunchy yet tender, with just the right touch of Anise to elevate the flavor. Surprisingly, the dark chocolate florentine cookies were a hit, despite my usual aversion to coconut; the perfect chocolate to coconut ratio made them irresistible. Overall, it was a remarkable visit that guarantees our return.

Durante unas vacaciones y sin ánimos de cocinar, optamos por pedir pizzas en este establecimiento, ubicado a 500 metros de nuestro alojamiento. La experiencia un jueves de verano, cerca de las 21.30 horas, fue notablemente positiva. El local nos recibió con un ambiente ameno, limpio y confortable, aunque decidimos llevarnos las pizzas para comer en nuestro hospedaje. La atención, cortesía de un hombre muy amable, fue excepcional.

Optamos por una variedad de sabores: prosciutto, jamón cocido, pepperoni, cebolla, hongos, anchoas, y albahaca con tomate. Las pizzas, deliciosas y perfectamente preparadas al estilo a la piedra con una proporción ideal de salsa de tomate y queso mozzarella, estuvieron listas en un tiempo razonable de 25 a 30 minutos.

La experiencia no solo destaca por una excelente relación precio-calidad, sino también por la calidez en el trato recibido, lo que sugiere que cenar en el lugar hubiera sido igualmente placentero. Sin dudarlo, califico a este lugar con cinco estrellas, respaldado por la alta calidad de su oferta y el amable servicio.

Celebrated a friend's birthday at a cozy, less-crowded spot that boasts a welcoming, homey atmosphere. The service impressed with its promptness and friendliness, contributing positively to our experience. However, while the ambiance and company were top-notch, the food, specifically my burger, didn't quite hit the mark. Despite the menu's promise of a charbroiled delight, the reality leaned closer to pan-fried and unfortunately, overdone. Nonetheless, the camaraderie and a pleasant discovery by the river ensured the day on Paradise Road remains a cherished memory. Good times indeed, even if the burger left a bit to be desired.

Despite high hopes fueled by numerous positive reviews, my dining experience fell short of expectations. The standout was the raw oysters, which were indeed delightful. However, the remainder of our meal, including the two half and half baskets my partner and I shared, proved disappointing due to their dryness and lack of flavor, hardly justifying the $60 spent. Additionally, the cramped space and proximity to other patrons, who were uncomfortably close to the point of coughing on us at the bar, further detracted from our enjoyment.

Village Whiskey in Philadelphia not only lives up to the hype but also exceeds expectations, especially when it comes to serving the city's best burger. From the moment I stepped in, the wide array of whiskeys and bourbons caught my eye, a selection so vast it could convert anyone into a whiskey aficionado. Guided by the expertise of the bartenders, I embarked on my whiskey journey with a unique concoction that was as delightful as it was surprising. The drinks, albeit on the pricey side at around $11 or $12, were worth every penny.

Our dining experience was further amplified when we were seated outside and I had the pleasure of tasting both the village burger and the short-rib and cheddar duck-fat fries. The burger was an epicurean delight, with its high-quality meat enhanced by applewood bacon and a perfect touch of homemade thousand island dressing. While the duck-fat fries were pleasing, the plain version stood out for its superior crispiness. 

However, potential visitors should be advised: the popularity of this place can lead to long waits. Despite this minor inconvenience, the exceptional cocktails, mouthwatering food, and the welcoming, knowledgeable staff left us eager for a return visit. Village Whiskey is unequivocally a must-visit spot for both foodies and whiskey lovers alike. 

- Chris M.

This neighborhood sushi spot offers a decent experience for those looking for a quick sushi fix close to home. While the roll menu may be somewhat limited, the establishment appears willing to accommodate special requests, and the service stands out for its speed and eagerness to please, aligning with other reviews praising its thoughtful and attentive nature. The sushi rolls, including Mariner, Rose #1, and San Francisco, are satisfactory without being particularly exceptional. Though not the most memorable sushi one might find, the quality is competent and acceptable. This place is a solid choice for those nearby seeking a convenient sushi outing, despite not offering a 'wow' factor.

During a delightful vacation in the French Quarter, we discovered Flanagan's Pub - a gem beyond the usual tourist-packed spots. On our initial visit at 11am, the welcoming atmosphere, marked by the warm greetings between the bartender and a handful of patrons, immediately endeared us to the place. So much so, that we found ourselves returning three times in a single day!

Flanagan's offered an eclectic mix of punk rock tunes and an engaging mix of people ranging from locals to tourists, all gathering in a convivial environment. Conversations with bartenders and fellow patrons alike added a personal touch to our experience, setting Flanagan's apart from the more ostentatious offerings on Bourbon Street. It was a refreshing embrace of authentic community spirit and laid-back enjoyment.

The Daily Bread presents itself as an alternative to St. Louis Bread Co/Panera Bread but falls short in delivering a comparably satisfactory experience. Initially, my concerns are not with the food itself, which I find to be basic and simple—neither bad nor remarkable—highlighting the unexceptional flavors in their sandwiches and an "okay" BBQ Chicken pizza. 

However, the fundamental flaws lie in the service and cleanliness of the establishment. The staff's apparent disinterest and slow response times to customer needs, coupled with a lack of urgency even during busy periods, are significant detriments. Furthermore, the condition of the dining area, marked by unclean tables and unchecked litter, compounds the lackluster experience.

Despite multiple visits, the inability of the food's mediocrity to counterbalance the poor service and untidy environment has led me to decide against returning. For those seeking a similar culinary offering but with a more attentive and cleaner dining experience, I advise considering alternatives like the St. Louis Bread Co.

I had a positive experience ordering through Yelp for delivery, despite a 45-minute wait. The delivery driver was friendly, adding a pleasant touch to the service. The BBQ chicken pizza exceeded expectations with its generous toppings spread across the crust, delivering on both flavor and satisfaction. The mozzarella sticks, however, were a surprise; instead of the anticipated breading, they were deep-fried. Although different from what I expected, they were still enjoyable. A delightful bonus to my order was the inclusion of two complimentary cookies, which were deliciously chewy, almost stealing the spotlight from the meal. The overall value for the price paid was fair, and despite the slightly lengthy delivery time, the quality of the food and the service would encourage me to order from here again.

This gym stands out for its exceptional value, offering a wide range of fitness classes that easily accommodate varying schedules, a key feature for those with fluctuating work hours. The trainers, especially in spin and rowing classes, are highlighted for their excellence. A notable mention is the We-Fit class, recommended for those seeking a formidable challenge. Impressively, the facility maintains high standards of cleanliness, though being a new establishment, it remains to be seen if these standards will be upheld. Thoughtful amenities like blow dryers and extra hair ties in the women's locker room are a testament to the gym's attention to detail, enhancing the overall experience.

Prestigious Auto Body exceeded expectations with their exceptional service and quality repairs. The facility's cleanliness and professionalism set it apart, offering a more refined experience than a typical body shop. From start to finish, advisor Juan Mendez provided detailed, knowledgeable guidance, tackling the unique challenges presented by two separate accidents with a methodical and fair approach. The communication throughout the process was proactive and informative, significantly reducing the stress of having a car repaired. Most notably, the quality of the work was outstanding, with a perfect paint match and impeccable attention to detail that satisfied even the most discerning of clients. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch auto body work and a seamless customer service experience.

Visiting from Colorado, I had the pleasure of dining in Santa Barbara and was thoroughly impressed. The food quality was excellent, complemented by even more remarkable customer service. Offering good value, the portions were generous without being overpriced, and the food was served quickly. For anyone in Santa Barbara looking for a great breakfast spot, this place is definitely worth checking out.

After years of anticipation, I finally visited the long-awaited restaurant and was pleasantly surprised by its inviting layout, offering a mix of uncrowded booths, tables, and an engaging lunch counter that overlooks the bustling cooking area. The vibrant kitchen scene and friendly staff interactions added to the charm. Despite the business, the service remained commendable with a notably sweet waitress attending to me.

I opted for the fried shrimp po'boy with a side of red beans, veering away from my initial temptation towards the tantalizing burgers being prepared upfront. While the meal was satisfactory, aligning with typical expectations for a tourist locale in the Quarter, it didn't surpass the ordinary. However, the lure of those grilled burgers might just earn the place an additional star, pending a future visit.

Having interacted with numerous doctors over the years, I can confidently say that this team is genuinely dedicated to animals. They are not just professionals but true animal enthusiasts at heart. Their consistent excellent service proves you can rely on them for nothing but the best care for your animals. In short, they're outstanding in their field.

This restaurant offers a wonderful family-friendly atmosphere, complemented by an exceptional selection of po' boys. Each variant we tried was delicious, served on perfect bread that truly elevated the experience. The mac 'n cheese was notably good, with a hint of spice that added an enjoyable kick. Service here is top-notch, adding to the overall fabulous dining experience.

During a week-long trip to New Orleans, my highlight dining experience occurred at Mr. B's during their Sunday Jazz Brunch. Despite arriving without a reservation, my husband and I enjoyed the vibrant music and atmosphere during our 40-minute wait. The bustling environment didn't hamper the exceptional service we received; our server was remarkably friendly and attentive, encouraging us to relax and enjoy our meal at our own pace.

The cuisine at Mr. B's was nothing short of spectacular, starting with a delightful serving of complimentary bread and butter, followed by a flavorful seafood gumbo. The main course, a sea bass entree accompanied by green beans and a sublime sauce, was the best fish dish I've ever enjoyed. Dessert was equally memorable, with both chocolate orange ice cream and crème brûlée ending our meal on a high note. Observations of neighboring diners suggested that dessert here is consistently excellent, with the bread pudding also receiving high praise.

An intriguing personal touch to our visit was discovering we were seated in the same spot as Ronald Reagan during his visits, coincidentally on my birthday. Although the final bill exceeded $100, the exceptional food, service, and ambiance made it a worthwhile expenditure. Mr. B's is definitely on my revisit list for any future trips to New Orleans.

This hotel in Indianapolis comes highly recommended for anyone seeking a unique and artsy accommodation experience. My partner and I enjoyed a brief but memorable stay, taking advantage of a AAA discount that offered significant savings. The hotel boasts an attached parking structure for convenience, priced at $20 a night. 

From the moment we entered the parking garage, we were greeted by vibrant urban art, a theme that continued throughout the property. Check-in was smooth, and the customer service was exemplary. The hotel doubles as an art lover's paradise, with captivating pieces adorning every corner.

Our room was outfitted with thoughtful amenities including a Keurig coffee machine, a large, luxurious shower, comfy robes, and a comfortable California king bed. Our stay coincided with a Pacers game, which, due to the hotel's proximity to Bankers Field House (only a minute walk away), was incredibly convenient.

We dined at Plat 99, the hotel's bar and restaurant, before the game and were impressed by the chic decor, innovative cocktail timeline, and delicious complimentary truffle popcorn. Although it was too chilly to enjoy the rooftop seating area, it appeared to be a charming spot for warmer days.

Post-game, Plat 99 provided a lively atmosphere for drinks. The next morning, we enjoyed a bountiful buffet breakfast at the Market Place, which offered a good selection for a set price.

Check-out was as seamless as check-in, with the concierge being particularly friendly and helpful. Prior to departure, we dedicated time to appreciate the hotel's extensive art collection, reminiscent of a modern art museum. 

For anyone planning a trip to Indianapolis, especially if attending a Pacers or Colts game, this hotel is an excellent choice. It made our quick getaway unforgettable, and we look forward to staying here again on our next visit.

Visited a seemingly popular spot with a nice setting, equipped with TV's, a bar, varied table sizes, and a heated patio. Unfortunately, my experience didn't match the ambiance. My order was mishandled – a beer was wrongly added and my fish taco was missing. Instead, I received a sonoran dog and two beef tacos, none of which I ordered. The sonoran dog was soggy and unimpressive when compared to street food variants. The beef tacos were underwhelming, just bits of beef with cilantro and onion. The bustling environment and the depleted food stocks by the time I ordered might have contributed to this disappointing experience. However, the chaos of the crowd isn't an excuse for the substandard food and service mistakes.

**Review of Sam's Sports Bar**

Sam's stands out as one of Nashville's superior sports bar experiences, particularly commendable for its enjoyable patio setting during the warmer months. However, when placed in the broader context of sports bars across similar-sized American cities, Sam's settles into a more mediocre standing. This assessment comes despite its position as a beacon for sports enthusiasts in a city with a relatively underwhelming sports bar scene.

The service at Sam's can be hit or miss, and the choice of attire for the staff, particularly those donning referee-themed outfits, can feel dated and out of touch. On a more positive note, the food offered leans towards the superior spectrum of typical bar fare, though the establishment falls short in providing a diverse and high-quality beer selection. The mixed drinks might also leave something to be desired in terms of strength.

Nonetheless, Sam's delivers where it counts for fans: ample TVs and game commentary broadcasting throughout the venue, making it a recommendable spot for those looking to immerse themselves in a sports viewing experience in Nashville.

This place is a gem with its fantastic location, delicious food, and amiable staff. Though seating is limited and it tends to get crowded, especially during the weekday lunch rush, opting for an online order seems to be a wise choice to avoid the wait. With varied options that satisfy both vegetarians and meat lovers, it's a hit among diverse groups. Grabbing your food and enjoying it in Rittenhouse Square across the street makes for an ideal experience, weather permitting. A favorite for both friends and coworkers, this spot comes highly recommended for anyone looking for great eats in a friendly atmosphere.

This company's service from Indy to Chicago is highly disappointing. The bus was over an hour late with no prior notification of the delay, leaving me and about 20 other passengers stranded and frustrated at the bus stop. Upon reviewing their customer policy, it's clear they absolve themselves of any responsibility, offering customers no recourse for situations like this. Their approach to customer service and reliability is severely lacking.

Michael and Lucy have successfully opened a charming family restaurant in the midst of Santa Claus Lane's revival, following their departure from Tony's on Linden due to family conflicts. The establishment impresses with its reasonably priced, delightful food (don't miss the slice and salad special), and a cozy Tuscany-themed ambiance. The couple's warmth, particularly Lucy's friendly demeanor, enhances the dining experience. The restaurant caters to diverse tastes and interests, offering local beer selections like Figueroa and Island Brew, accommodating sports enthusiasts with multiple HD TVs, and ensuring family-friendly entertainment with dedicated surf video and kids' shows channels, alongside an engaging Ms. Pac-Man arcade game. Despite its challenging location, this eatery holds promise for a bright future, contributing to the area's rejuvenation from its previous reputation for dated attractions.

Located inconspicuously within a shopping center, this gem of a dining spot is a must-visit, largely thanks to its phenomenal staff, with Curtis shining as the epitome of exceptional service. His genuine passion for ensuring guests have an unparalleled dining experience truly sets this place apart. Although the scallops small plate comes highly recommended and will surely delight, the entire dining experience here is nothing short of top-notch.

Absolutely fantastic breakfast spot located conveniently south of route 90, a stone's throw from the French Quarter. The ambiance captures the vibrancy of New Orleans perfectly, with great decorations and a colorful setting. The bananas foster is a must-try – truly incredible. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a delightful culinary experience in the area.

This bakery excels at making exceptional birthday cakes that truly stand out. However, it falls short with its cupcakes and cookies displayed up front, which can sometimes be stale. Positively, the staff are responsive and rectify issues when complaints are made. Despite this downside, the quality of the birthday cakes is enough reason to plan a return visit.

The restaurant's service at Loco shows promise but has room for improvement, particularly during busy times such as Saturday lunches where it can get somewhat slow. This seems forgivable for a new establishment still finding its bearings. An attempt to visit on a Friday night was thwarted by chaotic management of the waiting line, leading to a decision to leave. However, the food and drinks, including a notable margarita and delicious cilantro chicken enchiladas, stand out positively. The ambiance, especially the outdoor seating area, adds a pleasant touch to the dining experience with its lovely setup under umbrellas. The pricing is another positive aspect, offering affordability without succumbing to the pretentious "casual fancy" vibe of its predecessors. There's optimism for Loco's future success in the neighborhood, with anticipation for its growth and resolution of initial teething problems.

I've been a regular at this nail salon for a few months and have never been more delighted with my nails. Nary, along with the entire staff, are incredibly welcoming, making each visit a lively and enjoyable experience. The salon stands out for its innovative designs and exclusive jewels, setting it apart from your average nail place. While walk-ins are accepted, securing an appointment is highly recommended due to their popularity. It's worth noting that while they can bring any nail dream to life, prices can be steep, especially for the more extravagant designs. Be clear about your budget upfront to avoid surprises. Certainly looking forward to my next visit in two weeks!

This spot in Treasure Island is a must-visit, particularly for its char-grilled oysters and stellar service. The vast outdoor seating area is a major plus, making it an ideal choice for those who love dining al fresco. What sets it apart even further is its pet-friendly policy, a delightful perk for pet owners reminiscent of Austin's inclusive vibe. Highly recommended for a memorable dining experience with your furry friend by your side.

This establishment offers an extensive selection of primarily fried seafood, with pricing unexpectedly steep for a venue that seems oriented toward a working-class clientele. It's an environment where a dock worker might bring their family for a special meal, feeling perfectly at ease within its New Orleans atmosphere. However, the culinary experience falls short of expectations, leaving something to be desired in terms of flavor and quality.

This restaurant lives up to its family recommendations with fast and friendly service, even during busy times. The menu offers tasty, basic breakfast options. The Cajun tasso omelet was particularly fantastic, striking a perfect spice balance. Fluffy, delicious hash browns, French toast, and perfectly cooked eggs over medium also stood out. Everyone left full and satisfied. Definitely worth a return visit.

Visited with a group of four and enjoyed a fantastic experience. The menu boasts numerous unique appetizers, including noteworthy dumplings with corn and mushrooms, wings, and several specials. Each of us indulged in an order of noodles, which, while not as hefty as typical Chinatown noodle house servings, compensated with superior, fresh ingredients offering a delightful taste. The value for money is excellent, and the BYO option is a pleasant bonus. A splendid new gem on 10th street!

**Stellar Sandwich Spot in St. Louis**

If you're on the hunt for the best sandwiches St. Louis has to offer, look no further! This place could easily become your daily go-to, thanks to its mouthwatering selection. Not only is the food top-notch, but there's also always a friendly crowd to mingle with. It's the perfect combination of great eats and great company. Highly recommended!

This establishment in Reno, NV, offers a delightful dining experience perfect for lunch or dinner. Under the adept management of Tyler, the staff excels in delivering top-notch service, contributing to the overall dining satisfaction. Adding to its appeal is a commendable selection of beers and wines, making it more than just a restaurant but a great pub too. Highly recommended for anyone looking for quality meals and a diverse drink menu.

Title: Enjoyable Experience at Chuck E Cheese, Even for a Childless Adult

Review:
Despite being a childless woman, I had quite a pleasant experience at Chuck E Cheese. The establishment is well managed, with an abundance of staff ensuring that whether you're in need of a food order or dealing with a token mishap, assistance is readily available. The child safety measures, such as stamping children upon entry to prevent them from leaving unattended, were particularly impressive.

The variety of games, all priced at one token, from arcade classics to games of chance, caters to a wide range of interests. This does, however, mean that the game area can encourage significant spending. Our birthday party was well catered for with ample food, although the birthday area felt crowded at times, leading to minor inconveniences with neighboring tables.

The attentive and caring nature of the staff towards the birthday children was commendable. While I might not have frequent occasions to visit Chuck E Cheese, the experience was enjoyable and brought back fond childhood memories. It's a venue that successfully bridges the gap between nostalgic adult visitors and the new generation of children eager for fun and games.

This restaurant offers a refreshing change with its focus on simple, fresh organic food, accompanied by a comprehensive selection of coffee, lattes, and the standout Sasquatch brew. The ambiance is casual, relaxed, and comfortable, making it a perfect setting to enjoy a meal. The owners add to the experience with their amazing and friendly demeanor. Highly recommended for those seeking a delightful dining experience.

This ice cream spot is a gem, offering the tastiest options around. Their commitment to freshness is evident, as all their ice cream comes from cows untreated with hormones or antibiotics. The cash-only policy is a small hurdle, but the quality of their offerings makes it worth the extra step of visiting an ATM. Highly recommended for a delightful treat.

During Mardi Gras week, finding an alternative to our first choice, Rio Mar, led us to this remarkable dining experience, albeit after a challenging trek across parade lines. Despite the inconvenience, the meal and service far exceeded our expectations. The staff managed to strike a perfect balance between professionalism and discretion. Although a minor setback was encountered with the unavailability of ingredients for one of their signature cocktails, it was understandable given the festive season. Every dish, from the excellently textured bread and butter to the uniquely fresh beets salad, was a delight. The main courses, including a richly satisfying Choucroute and exquisitely prepared crab ravioli with Meyer lemon sauce, were highlights of the evening. Ending on a high note, the bread pudding, happily without raisins, sealed the deal on a truly memorable dining experience. This establishment certainly sets a high standard, outshining many hotel-based restaurants.
Discovered 51st Deli through Uber Eats and it exceeded expectations! Eagerly looking forward to visiting in person.

The Honey Apple grilled cheese at Meltdown is an unparalleled delight, offering an unrivaled culinary experience for grilled cheese aficionados. The exceptional quality of food, coupled with the warm and welcoming staff, makes every visit memorable. Unlike its Montgomeryville competitor, which falls short in both ambiance and customer service, Meltdown shines with its cool, hip decor and engaging atmosphere. The poor service and off-putting futuristic decor witnessed at the Montgomeryville location, including instances of disrespect towards customers, starkly contrast with the exceptional experience at Meltdown. For any cheese lover, Meltdown stands out as a must-visit destination, successfully elevating the simple grilled cheese sandwich to a sublime gastronomic delight.

This eatery offers excellent combination deals, making their rolls and sushi an affordable indulgence. However, note that the rolls are somewhat small, so you might find yourself ordering more to feel satisfied. Surprisingly, despite the low prices, the sashimi is quite fresh. The venue itself is rather compact, and service can be on the slower side. Yet, the place is accommodating with its BYO policy, allowing guests to enjoy a drink of their choice from downstairs while awaiting their meal. Overall, a decent spot for budget-friendly sushi with the added perk of BYO.
