The dining experience offered good food but was marred by notably poor service, including a considerable delay in serving simple orders like orange juice for children. It's important for potential visitors to note that the establishment only accepts cash or checks. Overall, while the meal was satisfactory, there's a definite room for improvement in the service department to match the quality of their cuisine.

This long-time patron expresses deep disappointment following their latest visit, pinpointing a significant drop in food quality as the root cause of their dissatisfaction. The critique focuses on the restaurant's noticeable cost-cutting measures, particularly in the preparation and quality of the salsas and the formerly beloved #15 menu item. The salsas were described as watery, with inconsistent and poor chopping quality, significantly detracting from their enjoyment. Moreover, the customer noted a stark decline in the once-favored chicken quesadilla, now overwhelmed by cheese and lacking in flavor. The review concludes with a plea for the restaurant to reconsider its cost-saving strategies and prioritize food quality as it had in the past.

Recently visited Stigma for two new tattoos and I'm beyond thrilled with the experience! Chose this spot based on its stellar reviews and professional website. My artist, Eddie, was a true gem - friendly, attentive, and an incredibly talented artist. His precision in line work and ability to bring my floral shoulder design to life was remarkable. As someone with back issues, Eddie's accommodations made the session far more comfortable than expected. The entire Stigma team exuded warmth and professionalism, creating a welcoming atmosphere throughout my visit.

An unexpected bonus was the $10 discount for a Yelp check-in, a nice touch for sure. Additionally, I was impressed by the owner, Chino’s initiative to create a unique tattoo ointment. With natural ingredients like sunflower oil, lavender, and cocoa butter, it's a soothing alternative to other products on the market.

For anyone considering a tattoo, Stigma is the place to go. Not only are you guaranteed exceptional artistry from artists like Eddie, but you'll also enjoy a friendly, supportive environment and innovative care products. Highly recommended!

This venue offers an entertaining and dynamic experience, boasting both an outdoor patio with appealing hip hop beats and an indoor dance area where salsa rhythms take center stage. The flexibility to roam between these distinct musical settings adds a delightful layer of variety, making it a standout choice for those seeking a fun and versatile night out.

After years without a visit, we decided to give this restaurant another try for lunch. The establishment impressed us with its great decor and a wait staff that was both personable and attentive. My companion enjoyed the fish special, despite its small portion, while I opted for the fattoush salad with chicken. Although the spicing was spot-on, the salad was let down by limp lettuce and pita, and a noticeable lack of olives. Although the quality of food was generally good, we found the pricing to be on the higher side for a lunch outing. Given these mixed experiences, we're not in a hurry to return.

The Animal Clinic proves to be a standout facility for pet boarding, grooming, and medical examinations, treating pets with the same love and care as if they were their own. This level of compassionate service makes it an easy recommendation. However, the clinic's inconvenient location slightly mars the overall experience, leading to a nearly perfect rating.

This Taco Bell location fails to meet basic expectations in cleanliness, service quality, and order accuracy, making it the worst experience for the reviewer. They strongly recommend seeking alternatives.

The Neuvo-Latino-Americano cuisine at this establishment garners praise for its flavorfulness, especially noted is the fresh and tasty quality of their chips and salsa. Despite the restaurant having relocated to a more spacious setting, the reviewer refrains from a detailed assessment due to the passage of time since their last visit, which was at the original location.

Stumbled upon Player's during a drive and what a find! The staff exudes friendliness and the service is top-notch, making for a very relaxed atmosphere. Had an excellent experience with a great shave and haircut, all offered at a fantastic price. Highly recommend it!

I had an extremely disappointing experience at this restaurant, primarily due to the quality of food and staff behavior. I ordered the frog's legs, which turned out to be rubbery and tasted terrible. But what compounded the issue was the manager's shockingly rude response when I attempted to return my meal. The treatment I received was appalling, marking the worst dining experience I've ever had, courtesy of both the food and the staff's attitude.

This hotel is tucked away at the end of a secluded, winding road, surrounded by other hotels off the highway, notable for its lack of nearby dining options. The property visibly shows its age, with an appearance rooted in the 1970s that leaves much to be desired both inside and out. My room presented several cleanliness issues, including an unclean floor, torn wallpaper, dusty bathroom vents, and noticeable water spots in the bathroom. The hallways had an eerie vibe, reminiscent of unsettling movie scenes. Despite these drawbacks, the bed provided a comfortable night's sleep, and the room was functional. However, the overall experience fell short of the higher standards I've come to expect from my stays at Doubletree hotels across the country.

This hotel stands out with its boutique ambiance, offering a refreshing alternative to mainstream options like the Hilton. Celebrating a birthday party at their restaurant proved to be a delightful experience, thanks to the exceptional service and the aesthetically pleasing rooms. A minor gripe was the loud air conditioner in our room, but it didn't significantly mar the overall experience. Its proximity to Printers Alley is a notable perk, adding to its appeal. I am looking forward to staying here again.

This cozy spot boasts an enviable location that's perfect for an early visit to avoid the crowds. The bartenders stood out with their exceptional skills, crafting a memorable Perfect Rye Manhattan on the rocks that has left me craving for more. Alongside the drinks, the burger was unparalleled, easily taking the title of the best I've ever tasted. This place has assured its spot on my must-return list.

The restaurant has quickly become my top choice for breakfast, offering an unbeatable combination of excellent food and superb service. The biscuits and gravy, extra crispy bacon, sausage links, and challah French toast were all standout dishes that left a lasting impression. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a new breakfast spot.

We had a positive experience hiring Terra as our wedding florist. She was thorough in understanding our needs by taking a tour of the venue with us and was accommodating towards our budget. The florals and draping she provided for both ceremony and reception were stunning. The only drawback was the slight wilting of some flowers in the bridal and bridesmaids' bouquets, likely due to the flowers being in full bloom and the day's heat. Despite this, we were satisfied with Terra's work for our wedding.

This dining spot in New Orleans offers a fantastic selection of healthy options, perfect for those looking for nutritious meals on the go. I opted for the turkey meatballs and spaghetti, which turned out to be a delightful choice for lunch. It's a great spot for anyone seeking delicious, healthy meals in a convenient setup.

This takeout spot in Northern Liberties truly hits the mark, delivering exactly what one could wish for: fresh, delicious, and reasonably healthy options. Its convenience is a notable plus in an area that's in dire need of more to-go venues. An excellent choice for quick and satisfying meals.

Had a fantastic experience at this venue during an alumni event. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between cozy and elegant, reminiscent of an old library with its dim lighting and comfortable setting. It's an ideal location for those seeking a low-key atmosphere to enjoy some quality drinks. The selection of beers and wines cater to diverse tastes, but the happy hour cocktails, including Moscow mules and old fashioneds, were the highlights of the evening. Everyone in our group was impressed with their choices, making it a complaint-free gathering. Highly recommend for a quiet, casual outing.
The burgers are outstanding and highly recommended! While the French fries are passable, opting for the onion rings instead would enhance your meal experience.

I've dined at this establishment twice, experiencing consistently poor quality meals and service on both occasions. The steak was overly salty, the fish unpleasantly dry, and the salad appeared to be served straight from the freezer, indicating a lack of attention to food quality. Furthermore, the service was far below acceptable standards. It's puzzling how this restaurant manages to receive any positive reviews given the subpar dining experience it offers.

Modesto stands out as a treasured Spanish restaurant, maintaining its position as a personal favorite despite numerous culinary adventures across Spanish eateries, particularly in NYC. Its exceptional offerings leave a longing impression, especially notable as it endures as a missed gem for those no longer in St. Louis. A true testament to its remarkable dining experience.

This review describes a significantly disappointing experience at Spa Aria, particularly focusing on a manicure/pedicure service. The spa is criticized for its uncleanliness, small size, and poor customer service starting from the reception. The staff's neglect and unprofessional behavior, including failure to offer basic courtesies such as water or refreshments, contribute to a negative impression. The reviewer's encounter with a sick nail technician who proceeded to work in a condition that compromised hygiene further marred the experience. Additionally, the lack of skill during the service, including a rushed job that resulted in physical harm and a subpar massage, compounded the dissatisfaction. The commentary on the spa's tactlessness regarding gratuity preferences and the overall lackluster experience concludes with a recommendation to avoid this spa. The gel nail polish's poor durability serves as a final testament to the substandard quality of service received.

I experienced the hot shave service, and it was outstanding. The process included six towels and an invigorating facial massage with oils, contributing to a remarkably smooth shave and a luxurious experience. The environment further enhanced the enjoyment, making it a top-notch experience overall.

Taco del Mar offers a delightful dining experience, particularly for those who appreciate quickly served, fresh meals. A notable aspect is its ownership by Subway, yet it manages to surpass Subway in quality, especially with its build-your-own burrito and taco concept. The ingredients always appear fresh and plentiful, supporting a wide range of dietary preferences, including vegetarian options. The veggie burrito, loaded with a variety of vegetables, stands out as a personal favorite, alongside their flavorful chips and medium salsa. If you find yourself near Delgado, Taco del Mar is definitely worth a visit for a fast, yet satisfying meal.
This place is seen as a last resort for items unavailable at Trader Joe's due to its high prices and insufficient staff, leading to a less satisfactory shopping experience. Not highly recommended.

For those looking for an authentic barbecue experience, this spot is a must-visit. Here, the ribs celebrate the true essence of smoking technique—it's about the flavor and a bit of chew, not fall-off-the-bone mushiness. If your preference leans toward overly tender ribs, you might want to adjust your expectations or explore other venues. This establishment prides itself on delivering smoked ribs that are slightly tough, embodying the integrity of traditional barbecue.

This spot is a real gem for lovers of lassi and chaat. While their chaat, boasting an elegant presentation and flavors reminiscent of traditional Karachi fare, is delightful, it is the lassi that truly steals the show. Its soft, creamy texture paired with perfect sweetness leaves an indelible mark, ensuring a return visit is a must. Highly recommended for a genuine taste experience.

My husband and I chose Hendel's Cafe for our wedding reception, and it turned out to be an absolutely beautiful setting for our special night. The ambiance was perfect for gathering with our closest friends and family, making it a truly memorable experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a gorgeous venue.

My stay was marred by the presence of a cockroach in my room, excruciatingly slow wifi reminiscent of 1996-era AOL, and an unexpected $10 charge per chair for access to the so-called private beach. Overall, my experience was deeply disappointing, leading me to firmly decide against returning.

Our visit to El Sol to celebrate my daughter's birthday was an absolute delight. The waiter's attentive and polite service stood out from the moment we arrived. The drinks, including piña coladas and margaritas, were exceptional, and the food simply divine. The highlight of the evening was the staff's extraordinary effort in celebrating my daughter's birthday – bringing out a large cake along with a special dessert, donning sombreros, and even setting off fireworks, all amidst festive birthday songs playing on the televisions. This place is a gem, conveniently located for regular visits. Not to mention, the generous portion of fajitas is enough to cover dinner and next day's lunch. Kudos to the El Sol team for such a memorable experience!

Taco Son is an undiscovered culinary treasure offering a delightful alternative to the popular Taco Bus. Here, patrons can indulge in exceptional food that rivals its more crowded counterpart, minus the wait. The restaurant prides itself on its scratch-made dishes, where the freshness of the ingredients unmistakably shines through. Generous portions ensure great value for money. Particularly noteworthy are their breakfast burritos, an absolute must-try for a satisfying start after a late night.

I recently purchased a used 2006 car from Conicelli for my son, assuming it would at least be safe to drive despite having no warranty due to its age. It came with a fresh PA state inspection and oil change sticker, signaling that it had been properly checked. However, the very next day, the front left tire blew out due to severe dry rotting on the backside, unnoticed during the inspection. This prompted an immediate need to replace both front tires, costing us $450. The state of the tire posed a significant risk to our safety, especially considering the potential consequences had it occurred on a busy road like I95. Based on this experience, I cannot recommend Conicelli due to the oversight in ensuring the vehicle's safety before sale.

The food at this establishment is excellent. However, I have to deduct one star due to the unacceptable condition of the bathrooms during my visit on a Friday night. Issues included a non-functional toilet, a lack of toilet paper and paper towels, and an overall lack of cleanliness.

The restaurant delivered excellent food but was significantly let down by its service. Despite placing an online order at 6:20 PM for a 6:40 PM pickup, my order wasn't initiated until my arrival at 6:37 PM, resulting in an unnecessary wait until 7:00 PM. The handling of the situation was disappointing, with no acknowledgment or compensation for the inconvenience, leaving me to pay in full. The lack of customer service in managing online orders and time commitments was a major drawback.

This charming Japanese restaurant nestled in Old City is a gem for sushi and ramen aficionados. With its offering of fresh sushi and amazing ramen, it promises a delightful dining experience. The exceptional customer service only elevates the entire visit, making it a new favorite spot for enthusiasts. With a diverse and enticing menu, it's a must-visit for anyone looking to indulge in quality Japanese cuisine.

I had a wonderful experience enjoying the ambiance at this establishment, feeling thoroughly pampered and relaxed. However, the only drawback was the difficulty I faced in placing a drink order. It took asking four different staff members before I was directed to use the white phone for room service, which prevented me from giving a perfect score.

Dr. Jeffers comes highly recommended as an exceptional veterinarian, praised for her compassion towards animals and her remarkable diagnostic skills. Her services are not only cost-effective but also inclusive, catering to a variety of pets including reptiles, making her practice a valuable local resource. The practice is well-equipped with the necessary technology to accurately diagnose and treat pets, setting it apart from others in the area that might charge exorbitantly for basic services. Additionally, Dr. Jeffers demonstrates her commitment to animal welfare by offering animals for adoption. Her dedication and service quality are compared to the renowned Dr. Pol, emphasizing her outstanding capabilities and care in the veterinary field.

The Mahi Mahi at this establishment is excellent, offering a generous portion size that could easily be shared. Ideal for fans of smoked fish, the flavor is notable. Service is commendable, with a notably pleasant server.

Melissa comes highly recommended as the best lash artist, surpassing others in the craft. Unlike others, she avoids the practice of stacking lashes, ensuring efficiency in her appointments. If you're looking for unparalleled expertise in lash services, Melissa is the go-to professional. 100% recommend.

This Reno casino is a standout choice for anyone looking to indulge in top-tier gaming and relaxation. Offering 4 deck and 2 deck blackjack tables, it caters to those who appreciate the nuances of the game. The experience is heightened by the use of real drink glasses instead of basic plastic cups, adding a touch of sophistication to your stay. The decor is strikingly vivid, promising an unforgettable visual experience that complements the high-quality service and amenities.

Beyond gaming, the casino impresses with its dining options, which surpass those of the bigger casinos on the strip by leaps and bounds, both in terms of quality and variety. Accommodations are exceptional for the price, with rooms that are both luxurious and inviting. Opting for a room with a hot tub is highly recommended for the ultimate relaxation experience. Overall, this Reno casino is a brilliant choice for both seasoned and casual visitors seeking excellence across the board.

During our visit, my wife and I had an enjoyable dining experience with some excellent dishes that packed a punch in terms of flavor. I opted for the fish and chips, which did not disappoint. The batter was light and crispy, perfectly complementing the moist and juicy cod. The portion was satisfactory—three cod pieces accompanied by a plentiful serving of fries, and the homemade tartar sauce added a delightful touch. If fish and chips are your go-to, this place is a must-try; despite smaller portions compared to Great Basin, the taste is superior.

My wife chose the salmon tacos, which were flavorful, though the salmon was slightly overcooked. Accompanying her main was the chicken tortilla soup, which ended up being a highlight due to its rich taste. Despite the modest serving sizes, both dishes were quite pleasurable.

For those looking for a hearty meal with the chance of leftovers, this might not be the spot. However, if you're in search of a satisfying culinary experience with well-sized servings, this establishment hits the mark.

The Lemon Cake at Cake Life was a delightful indulgence, perfectly balancing its rich taste with a surprising heaviness. My second visit to the bakery was just as memorable as the first, opting for the cake over cupcakes in a bid to temper my indulgence. Cake Life continues to impress, ensuring that I'll be returning for more of their delicious offerings. They truly rock!

During a recent visit to Beef's on our honeymoon, our dining experience was profoundly disappointing. Despite being seated promptly within 5 minutes, our wait for service extended to an unacceptable 40 minutes for just our drinks. Observing that a neighboring table managed to receive their meal before any beverages, we raised our concerns with a manager. It was revealed that our order hadn't even been processed. Our only served dish, a set of decent boneless wings, could not compensate for the overall dismal and slow service. Even after the manager's attempt to rectify the situation by offering our meal for free, the damage to our evening was irrevocable, impacting subsequent plans. This visit, intended as a special occasion, was marred by delays that seemed endless, underscoring our decision to never return. For those considering Beef's, I strongly advise looking elsewhere for a dining experience that values your time and occasion.

Wildflower, a quaint and delightful restaurant, has proven itself as a gem for lunch outings, despite my recurring tardiness for their breakfast offerings. My experiences, including a memorable birthday lunch with my mother, have been thoroughly pleasing due to their delicious and heartfelt cuisine. Transitioning to a new diet due to health reasons presented a challenge in dining out, but Wildflower accommodated my vegetarian needs amidst their meat-centric menu. Although I yearn for broader selections, the quality, freshness, and local sourcing of their ingredients are undeniable.

My mother's Vermonter salad and my tuna plate were standout dishes, highlighted by homemade touches and an evident commitment to quality and satisfaction. Wildflower's ambiance, with its charming patio and attentive service, enhances the dining experience, making it feel truly special. The gesture of presenting a homemade cupcake for my mother’s birthday exemplifies their dedication to customer delight. Despite dietary restrictions and a personal preference for larger menus, Wildflower remains a favorite, and I anticipate the opportunity to explore their breakfast fare in the future.

This roast pork sandwich was an utter disappointment, possibly the worst I've ever encountered. The broccoli rabe was shockingly lifeless and seemed to have been forgotten in the freezer, contributing to a sandwich temperature so low it left the cheese completely unmelted. To make matters worse, the bread was a soggy, wet mess. An overall horrible experience, and had I not been confined to an airport, I would have definitely returned it.

This restaurant, which I had passed by many times before deciding to visit based on its compelling reviews and affordability, somewhat failed to live up to its promise. Echoing previous sentiments, the appetizers proved to be the highlight of the dining experience. The Indian pancakes and chicken satay were particularly delightful, showcasing a level of taste and quality sadly not mirrored in the main courses. I opted for the Pad Thai, expecting a harmonious blend of sweet and spicy, only to be met with an overly sugary dish devoid of any heat. Similarly, the Seafood Crispy Noodles, Pearl Noodles, and a Beef rice dish were underwhelming, bordering on mediocre. While the entrees were priced reasonably—around $8 each—the adage "you get what you pay for" felt particularly apt here. Despite the affordability contributing to a cost-effective evening out, the lackluster entrees left a void that the delicious appetizers could not entirely fill. It was a mixed experience, with a tinge of disappointment for what could have been a more enjoyable meal.

This sandwich spot comes highly recommended, especially highlighting that each order is made fresh and justifies any wait time involved. A self-proclaimed sandwich enthusiast from Chicago awards the location a perfect five-star rating, indicating exceptional quality and satisfaction. Clearly, this establishment stands out for its superb offerings and has earned its accolades.

Absolutely sublime birthday cake experience! We opted for a Devil's Food Cake adorned with vanilla buttercream icing, which was nothing short of heavenly. Despite being a group of 12 adults who usually avoid high-calorie indulgences, we found ourselves irresistibly drawn to finish every morsel. The staff were notably cordial and flexible, enhancing our experience even though our order was somewhat last-minute. The discovery of a more conveniently located branch in Old City was an added delight. Left with a fervent wish for just one more taste of that extraordinary cake!

Visited Perfect Arch on 3/23/18, hoping for their reputed great talent. Despite their supposed 11am opening, found myself among 5 customers waiting without service by 11:28am. A clear indication that, irrespective of skill, valuing customers' time doesn't seem a priority here. Disappointing experience.

Had an excellent dinner experience at Spasso, enhanced by our exceptional server, Oana, who is knowledgeable and helpful. Despite a quoted hour wait, we were seated immediately at a high-top in the bar area. Spasso stands out with its unique take on Italian cuisine, offering more than just the typical dishes. The complementary bread served with a delightful eggplant/pepper topping was a refreshing start. Their Caesar salad impressed with its freshness and perfect dressing balance, topped with shaved Parmesan. The highlight of the meal was the pappardelle porcini: a delectable combination of thick pasta, sundried tomatoes, mushrooms, and chicken in a light sauce, so good I had leftovers. Highly recommend Spasso for a top-notch dining experience in Media.

This review reflects a highly positive experience with the credit union over a four-year period, highlighting the involvement of multiple family members and a business across several accounts. Despite occasional errors, the approach of addressing issues directly at the branch has resulted in satisfactory resolutions. Overall, the reviewer conveys satisfaction with the services provided.

Disappointing experiences have been consistent across multiple visits to this establishment, prompting us to advise against it. Despite efforts to enjoy the ambiance, the atmosphere consistently leans toward the rowdy, leading to uncomfortable situations such as drinks being spilled. Service, whether sought indoors, outdoors, at a table, or at the bar, invariably suffers from undue delays. The quality of food does not justify its price point, with preparation times often exceeding initial estimates. Encounters with management regarding these delays were met with indifference. The staff's demeanor is generally unhelpful and inattentive, a surprising observation given the seemingly abundant workforce. This pattern of poor customer service, underwhelming food quality, and overall neglect by management has led us to decide against further patronage and to recommend our friends and family to do the same. The inconsistency in experience makes it an unreliable choice for a pleasant outing.

This spot boasts the best Mexican fare in St Pete, offering a simple yet authentic dining experience. Ideal for those craving quality food and a casual beer, it's a standout option. To avoid the weekend rush, consider a weekday visit. Notably, the chorizo and fish tacos come highly recommended for meat and seafood enthusiasts, respectively.

Chatham Tap in Indianapolis comes highly recommended for not just their exceptional wings, which are both meaty and deliciously sauced, but also for their broad menu offerings, including recommended onion rings, and an extensive selection of beers. Despite its reputation as a "soccer bar," the ambiance is welcoming to fans of all sports, with a staff ready to accommodate any game request. The excellent service ensures a seamless dining experience, making it an ideal venue for large groups or a fun outing with friends. Chatham Tap stands out for both its food and atmosphere, promising a great time.

This sushi spot offers a delightful dining experience with its very tasty sushi that doesn't only captivate with authentic flavors but also appeals to those seeking ultra-healthy options. Impressively, the prices are very reasonable, ensuring that quality dining doesn't break the bank. Service efficiency is commendable, with quick serving times enhancing the overall experience. One area for improvement, however, would be the inclusion of photos in the menu, which could greatly assist guests in making more informed choices, particularly those new to sushi. Overall, a highly recommended venue for sushi enthusiasts and health-conscious diners alike.

Had an exceptional first visit with wonderful service from our server, Alison, who made our dining experience smooth by guiding us through the menu. Enjoyed a leisurely evening catching up with friends, without feeling rushed. The food, ranging from steaks to meatloaf, was delicious and cooked perfectly to our liking. Looking forward to returning and hoping for a repeat of this great experience.

Jonny's Dive Bar offers a laid-back atmosphere that's perfect for enjoying happy hour or grabbing good deals on delicious food. The exceptional quality of the menu, including scratch-made dough and noteworthy naked wings, sets this place apart from your typical dive bar expectations. The addition of favorite dishes like Jon's salad with grilled chicken and their pizzas only adds to its appeal. Beyond the food, Jonny's provides engaging entertainment like trivia and bingo, with enticing rewards such as gift certificates and practically free pitchers of beer. While it's a smoking venue, which might not suit everyone, especially when crowded, the draw of social games, affordable drinks, and half-price pizza specials makes it a compelling destination for a casual outing with friends.

This restaurant delivers a delightful culinary experience for all palates, offering delicious food with an accommodating touch for vegans. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, thanks to the friendly staff and its spacious design featuring a bar and a stage area, making it a great venue for events like work holiday parties, which have been consistently great over the years. A standout favorite is their awesome guacamole. Overall, a highly recommended dining spot for both casual outings and special occasions.

West Ave. Grill in Jenkintown offers a vibrant, local atmosphere perfect for both family outings and solo visits. With outdoor seating that accommodates pets and provides a view of the town square, it's a welcoming spot. The interior boasts a cozy setup with a bar area offering sights beyond the parking lot. The staff's friendliness and the owner's presence add a personal touch, enhancing the dining experience. Complimentary treats like dum dum lollipops and newspapers for solo diners or sports fans underscore their attention to customer care. The menu shines with standout breakfast options, including fluffy, crispy-edged pancakes and the notable Kansas City breakfast. While their salads could benefit from a more generous mix of ingredients, feedback is met with a positive response, underlining their commitment to customer satisfaction. West Ave. Grill is a recommendation worth considering for a mix of good food and a congenial atmosphere.
Visited for the first time recently and was blown away by the amazing hot chicken - truly the best! It's definitely going to be a staple for every Nashville visit.

Absolutely stellar experience! The tuna melt served here is unparalleled - easily the best I've ever enjoyed. Alongside the immaculate meal, the service was top-notch, surpassing any I've encountered in other cafes. Remarkably, this exceptional cafe is nestled within a grocery store, a surprising but delightful find. The quality of both food and service strongly suggests that this cafe deserves its own standalone establishment. A truly amazing spot!

This eatery in St. Louis offers an exciting dining experience with its sautéed seafood served uniquely in plastic bags, adding a fun twist to the meal. The sauce accompanying the seafood is a standout feature, elevating the flavors beautifully. The establishment is also praised for its good service, ensuring a pleasant visit. A great addition for seafood lovers looking for something different.

Disappointingly, this drive-thru experience fell dramatically short of expectations. Despite the items being prominently displayed on the menu, virtually everything requested was unavailable. This situation understandably leads to apprehension about the quality and safety of any order placed, reminiscent of the unease depicted in the movie "Waiting". The inability to fulfill even a simple beverage order underlines the extent of the operational shortcomings. It's advisable to avoid this establishment to save oneself from a similarly frustrating experience.

This spot is a hidden gem, especially for those who haven't yet experienced the culinary delight of their really good gravy fries - a must-try that borders on life-altering. Beyond the food, the ambiance is boosted by a friendly and entertaining staff, whose occasional lover's quarrels only seem to add to the unique character of the place. It's also the ultimate haven for Philly sports fans, providing an electrifying atmosphere to catch a Phillies game. The cherry on top? A pretty good beer selection that perfectly complements every aspect of the experience. Worth a visit for an authentic and memorable time.

My wife and I enjoyed a leisurely visit to this bar, savoring a couple of glasses of wine in a festively spirited atmosphere, highlighted by a charming cameo from Santa and Mrs. Claus. Although service was on the slower side, it complemented our desire to unwind and soak in the ambiance. Overall, it's a delightful spot for a relaxed drink or two.

Discovered a hidden gem in South Tucson, thanks to Yelp recommendations. This unique spot, a reimagined 1960s A & W fast food stand, served us an exceptional meal at a fair price. I savored a perfectly cooked catfish smothered in a rich poblano sauce and cheese, reminiscent of childhood lake catches, despite being told it was farm-raised. My wife's chile relleno featured fresh peppers, highlighting the chef's attention to ingredients. The younger members of our group were equally pleased with their enchiladas and chimichangas. Highly recommend for anyone looking for authentic and delicious dining away from the usual chain offerings.

My recent visit to this restaurant with my husband and a friend was a delightful experience marked by the taste of authentic Indian cuisine. We started with the vegetable pakora, a perfect fusion of veggies and hushpuppies, which was an absolute hit. Moving on to the entrees, we indulged in the chicken tikka masala, lamb roganjosh, and lamb vindaloo - each dish surpassing our expectations with its authenticity and rich, flavorful sauces that were so good, they left us wishing we had saved more room to enjoy them further.

Price-wise, the restaurant falls into the reasonably priced category, providing good value for the quality of food served. While the service was just okay, it didn't detract from the overall positive dining experience. This place is a welcome addition to Media's dining scene, offering variety and quality. Additionally, the lunch buffet caught my eye; priced at only $9.95 on weekdays and $10.95 on weekends, it promises to be a great deal. This spot is definitely worth a visit for anyone looking to enjoy great Indian food in a casual yet satisfying setting.

Howard is the go-to expert for Volkswagen services, showcasing thoroughness, reliability, and efficiency in his work. While securing an appointment may require patience due to high demand, his deep knowledge and meticulous approach make the wait worthwhile.
Absolutely delighted by the desserts, with a particular shoutout to the Dark and Sinister—it's a standout! Any dessert incorporating their chocolate ice cream comes highly recommended in my book.

Enjoyed an excellent oyster happy hour from 5-7pm, finding remarkable value. My boyfriend and I indulged in a dozen oysters and champagne for just $24, tip included. Although we overlooked their famed to-go cups, the experience was enhanced by the welcoming and attentive staff. Despite our casual attire, we felt perfectly at ease. This spot is a definite return for us. Highly recommend.

If you're planning a weekend brunch at Prep & Pastry, timing is key – aim for opening or just before closing to dodge the lengthy waits this popular spot is known for. Trust me, the patience required is more than rewarded by their exceptional fare. Their menu, featuring standouts like green eggs & ham, alongside stellar bloody marys and mimosas, consistently impresses. The generosity shown with a complimentary pastry (memorable despite the forgotten name) on my birthday only added to the charm. A notable mention must go to their serving of EXO coffee, a local delight that perfectly complements the exquisite breakfast offerings. Prep & Pastry has earned its reputation, ensuring every visit is a memorable dining experience.

This coffee shop stands out for its excellent variety of coffees and teas, with the iced dirty chai being a personal favorite. The staff is welcoming, striking the perfect balance between attentiveness and giving customers their space, ensuring a comfortable and unrushed experience. The establishment caters to different needs by providing a variety of table sizes. Additionally, it supports and showcases local artists by featuring their art for purchase, adding to the shop's unique and enjoyable vibe.

The worker provided great service, demonstrating commitment and efficiency. However, the overall cost of the service seemed disproportionate to the value received, leaning on the expensive side. The payment model, being hourly, indeed motivates the worker but might not align with the best interests of the consumer seeking cost-effective solutions. A more viable alternative might be hiring directly from platforms like Craigslist for a fixed-price service, offering a better balance between cost and quality.

The new Bacon-Bleu cheeseburger impressively stands out as an exceptional choice for fast food lovers. It's a top-tier burger that delivers on taste, likely making Dave Thomas proud of this delightful addition to the menu. Highly recommended for its superior flavor profile.

I visited this establishment once a few months ago and had a mixed experience. The highlight was the ambient charm of the place; it's quite unique and appealing, especially for a gathering with friends. I ordered a slice of carrot cake which was satisfactory but not exceptional, and found both the packaging and the $10 price tag to be excessive. The ambiance seems designed to attract those looking for a stylish outing, which does add to its appeal.

However, the service experience detracted from the overall enjoyment. Despite the shop not being busy and ordering from a seemingly attentive young staff member, there was a noticeable delay in receiving my order. Though I could see my cake ready on the counter, it took too long to be served and required my intervention to finally get it boxed up. The staff did apologize for the wait, which was appreciated, but the service inefficiency was disappointing.

In sum, while the cake and the venue's aesthetics were fine, the lackluster service would make me hesitant to return. My overall rating reflects the good quality of the dessert and the ambiance, but the service leaves room for improvement.
"Exceptional dining experience with top-notch service. Offers the best burgers and pulled pork in the Reno/Sparks area, making it our new go-to spot."

The Smoked Salmon Frittata at this particular venue lives up to its appetizing description, featuring a harmonious blend of smoked salmon, egg, potato, and red bell peppers, enriched with the tangy touch of goat cheese. The horseradish-dill crema adds a delightful kick, while the side of fresh fruit offers a refreshing contrast. This dish is a testament to the venue's culinary prowess, making it a standout choice for brunch, dinner, or private dining experiences. Indeed, it's as satisfying to the palate as it promises on the menu.

The dinner experience for a group of nine, celebrating a 70th birthday, was outstanding, offering first-class treatment throughout. While priced on the higher side, the quality of the steaks and entrees justified the cost. The combination of excellent service, delicious food, and a great ambiance made for a memorable celebration.
The food, especially the fried pickles and smash fries, is outstanding and highly recommended. However, the customer service significantly detracts from the overall experience.

Despite high expectations set by positive word-of-mouth, my experience at this taco establishment fell disappointingly short. The initial challenge presented itself with parking, requiring several minutes to locate a spot. Our order of five tacos took an unexpectedly lengthy 30 minutes to arrive, only to be served at a lukewarm temperature. Although the taste was passable, none of the flavors - including buffalo chicken, BBQ, Korean, and shrimp - stood out as particularly memorable or exceptional. The inefficiency and mediocrity of both service and culinary offerings lead me to conclude that this venture was not worth the effort. Regrettably, I find myself disinclined to return.

**City Fitness Gym & MBSC Program Review**

The gym at City Fitness (CF) stands out for its high-quality equipment, cleanliness, and the variety it offers, making it an enjoyable place for a workout. Rates are reasonable, and as a long-standing member, I find it offers good value for money. However, my rating for the gym itself is a modest 3.5 stars.

Moving onto the MBSC Thrive program at CF's South Street location, my experience over three months was less positive. The program’s one-size-fits-all approach, with its pre-set routines and lack of genuine personal trainer interaction, was disappointing. Sessions, often shared with multiple clients, felt impersonal and rushed, focusing more on completing the routine within the hour than on individual progress or preferences. The variety in sessions could appeal to some, but the lack of consistency in exercises made it hard to master any. The environment, heavily skewed towards a younger demographic with its choice of music and intense, varied workouts, may not suit everyone. With a steep price tag of over $200 per month and a rigid cancellation policy, it's advisable to try their introductory program first. Ultimately, the MBSC program earned a mere 1.5 stars from me.

Overall, combining my experiences at both the gym and the MBSC program gives an average rating of 2.5 stars. While City Fitness's gym facility is commendable, the MBSC program's approach and value for money were underwhelming.

This BBQ spot receives a mixed review from a seasoned truck driver accustomed to sampling BBQ across America. While the establishment's prices earn it four stars, the food experience doesn't quite reach the same level, averaging more around 2.5 stars. Highlights include a sizable, tasty cheeseburger, though a word of caution – it comes with mayonnaise unless specified otherwise. The pork BBQ sandwich, on the other hand, suffers from a soggy bottom and lackluster meat, despite the sauce being decent. The accompanying Mac & Cheese is passable in flavor, but the overcooked noodles leave much to be desired. Despite these shortcomings, this place is considered an occasional go-to if one lived nearby, indicating it has its merits amidst the critiques.

This Indian buffet offers a satisfactory variety of dishes at an affordable price. Although it lacks standout items that amaze, its decent selection ensures a pleasant dining experience. Worth revisiting.

During our initial visit to the gym, we encountered a staff member who was unwilling to allow us the use of a guest pass, insisting instead that we purchase a one-day pass for $15 per person. Disappointed, we opted to try Retro Fitness, where we were pleasantly surprised by a free trial offer which not only showcased superior equipment but also provided a more inviting atmosphere. Overall, our experience greatly favored Retro Fitness for both value and environment.

Brixx impresses even the choosiest of pizza connoisseurs with its consistently satisfying offerings. The availability of gluten-free options and well-portioned lunch selections caters to varied dietary preferences and needs. Its inviting wraparound bar ambiance makes it an ideal spot to relax post-work, though a heads-up: the popular patio area gets crowded fast. A definite go-to for those in search of quality pizza and a pleasant dining experience.

This establishment consistently impresses with its offerings for meat lovers, vegetarians, and vegans alike. A go-to spot for those seeking healthy options, it has yet to disappoint across multiple visits.

This frozen yogurt spot in Central Bucks originally earned top marks for being the best in the area, thanks to its delicious flavors and exceptionally friendly staff. However, the reviewer has since discovered another location that stands as a strong competitor, hinting at an ongoing quest for the ultimate frozen yogurt experience.

This apartment complex in St. Petersburg, FL, is simply awesome, offering a serene atmosphere surrounded by lakes. The leasing office staff are not only helpful and friendly but ensure a pleasant experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a peaceful stay.

If you find yourself in New Orleans, make sure to carve out time for this hidden gem of a bar that seemingly transports you straight back to the Prohibition era. Despite its modest size, the atmosphere is rich with the spirit of the past, particularly when an amazing Jazz band takes the stage, adding to the authenticity and vibrancy of the experience. For those seeking a more intimate setting, a cozy side room offers the perfect nook to relax on a couch while enjoying a cocktail. And speaking of drinks, do not leave without trying the Vieux Carre – it's exceptional here and perfectly encapsulates the essence of NOLA in a glass.

My recent visit to the newly opened sushirito spot, intrigued by the concept, resulted in mixed feelings. Opting for the Slammin' Salmon and The Crunch, it was evident that freshness wasn't compromised, with every ingredient tasting crisp. Unfortunately, the Slammin' Salmon was burdened with an excessive amount of sauce, overshadowing the delicate balance of salmon and vegetables. 

We also sampled the Japanese fried chicken, which, while promising in flavor with its sweet and sour sauce, fell short due to its dryness. The beverages, green tea and lemonade, were refreshing yet hardly the highlight of a dining experience that's pitched more on its novelty than its drinks.

Priced on the higher end, the meal felt more like paying for the gimmick rather than a compelling dining experience. Situated near Penn's campus, the location is poised for foot traffic, likely ensuring a steady stream of curious newcomers. However, with a price point of $34 for an experience that didn't fully satisfy, it's unlikely I'll be returning. The concept has potential but seems to prioritize novelty over nuanced flavor balance.

This review highlights a preference for the pizza from Nabruzzi, but still considers Enzo's a solid takeout alternative in the area. It particularly recommends Enzo's meatball sub and garlic knots, citing the homemade taste and good quality of the meatballs. Despite a continued patronage, there's a note of nostalgia for the pizzas once offered during its Nabruzzi era, indicating a minor drawback in the culinary transition.

"During a recent visit to Philly after performing at a nearby Prince tribute show, I found myself at Bareburger, courtesy of Alya & company. As a pro session and touring guitarist from Los Angeles, I'm always on the hunt for nutritious meals that don't compromise on flavor. Let me tell you, Bareburger hit the mark, serving up what I'd consider one of the finest burgers globally. A huge shoutout to the team for providing such a delightful dining experience. Bareburger is not to be missed!"

- Andrew von Gregor

I've visited Cosi multiple times during my travels, mainly attracted by their flavorful flatbreads and salads. The BBQ chicken flatbread, in particular, stands out for its taste and generous portion size. Overall, Cosi consistently delivers satisfying meals that keep me coming back.

This establishment has experienced a noticeable decline in quality since its expansion from its original location on Lindbergh. Initially, the food was exceptional, attributed largely to the direct involvement of the owner. However, post-expansion, both the service and the food have failed to meet previous standards, leading to dissatisfaction and the loss of my patronage.

My visit to this restaurant was deeply disappointing. I tried an egg roll and a sushi roll, both of which were subpar. The egg roll was dreadful, and the sushi had an off-putting chewy texture. The emptiness of the place should have been a warning sign. I wouldn't recommend it.

This hotel offers a prime location on Bourbon Street, boasting exceptionally hospitable staff and solid food recommendations. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed; however, a word of caution if you're a light sleeper: my stay in room 263, while seemingly perfect for its location away from the main street (Conti), was marred by its proximity to the vending and ice machines, coupled with thin walls that failed to block out conversations from the hallway. This drawback makes me lean towards a 3-star rating, as the noise level compromised what could have otherwise been a near-perfect stay.

Visited O'Charley's on a Sunday afternoon. The establishment wasn't overly crowded, yet our server seemed overwhelmed. He overlooked our bread and butter and repeatedly forgot my fries, which arrived when I was nearly finished with my sandwich. We resorted to getting a Sprite refill for my son at the bar due to lengthy waits. There was also a mishap with a coupon on our bill, requiring managerial intervention to correct. Despite these service issues, I'm open to giving O'Charley's another chance, perhaps opting for lunch next time.

This establishment falls significantly short of expectations, delivering both lackluster service and overpriced, mediocre fare. Despite giving it a second chance, hoping the initial visit was an anomaly, the disappointing experience was consistently replicated. The ambiance and approach suggest a disregard for diners' experience and value for money, especially when spending upwards of $150 for two. It appears to cater more to transient customers than those seeking a memorable dining experience. It might be best reserved for uninformed tourists rather than discerning locals or repeat visitors.

As of my last update in 2023, there isn’t a specific 12-step program tailored for managing a Reanimator Coffee problem or any coffee-related issue. While the 12-step framework is renowned for its effectiveness in addressing various addictions, its application to coffee or specific brands like Reanimator Coffee hasn't been formally established within mainstream recovery programs.

However, individuals seeking to moderate their coffee intake can adapt the principles of general 12-step programs to their situation. This involves acknowledging the problem, seeking support, and making a conscious effort to change consumption habits. Moreover, for those significantly struggling, seeking guidance from professionals or support groups focused on broader addiction issues can provide helpful strategies and support.

If you're facing a serious issue with coffee consumption, consider exploring general addiction support groups or speak with a healthcare provider for advice tailored to your circumstances. Remember, moderation is key, and making small, manageable changes to your habits can lead to significant improvements in your health and well-being.

The newly opened meadery, already marking its territory as a local gem, brings a refreshing diversity to the area's beverage scene, situating itself conveniently close to another meadery and creating a mini-haven for mead enthusiasts. This fermented honey drink, with an ABV akin to wine, presents an inviting range of flavors, from the unique Goober Vitis to the delightful Suzy's Cherry Pie, and a robust coffee variant - each offering a testament to the meadery's commitment to quality and flavor creativity.

The venue itself is as welcoming as its beverages, boasting spacious arrangements with large tables, a thoughtfully designed L-shaped bar, and additional standing space around the fermentation tanks, ensuring comfort and an engaging experience for visitors. The outdoor picnic tables add a touch of casual charm, inviting guests to enjoy their mead under the open sky.

Overall, this meadery emerges not just as a new spot for drinks but as a destination offering a perfect blend of remarkable flavors and a cozy atmosphere, distinguishing itself as a must-visit for both mead connoisseurs and curious newcomers alike.

I frequent Pina's about once a month, indulging in their diverse menu that ranges from dinner specials to cheesesteaks, calzones, and seafood delights. Their shrimp scampi appetizer—served without linguini—and the steamed clams stand out for both their quality and affordability. The service at Pina's never misses a beat, ensuring a pleasant experience each time. For those in search of a reliable spot for casual dining, Pina's earns a hearty recommendation.

I had a fantastic experience at Chatham while in town for work. On a mission to find a spot to watch my team, the Blues, play against Barcelona, I stumbled upon this gem. Not only did they offer $4 Guinness and Black and Tans on a Tuesday, but I also indulged in their fish and chips. The fish, surprisingly soft and almost doughnut-like despite being fried, was a delightful new experience for me. Watching my team clinch a victory added to the enjoyment of my visit. Chatham proved to be a great venue for both footy fans and foodies alike.

Absolutely thrilled with this gem of a nail salon in Tampa! After a long search and several disappointments elsewhere, my friend and I stumbled upon this place via Instagram and it's been a game-changer. Despite the nearly hour-long drive to get there, it's entirely worth it. I've had the pleasure of experiencing the talents of both Pamela and Steven on different occasions, and they've consistently nailed (pun intended) the designs and styles I've wanted. Their exceptional skills and attention to detail are why we'll be loyal patrons from here on out. Huge thanks to Pamela, Steven, and the team for their amazing work!

Belinda and Jerry provided exceptional service during my storage experience in Boise. As a travel nurse, I was anxious about leaving my car over the winter, but their kindness and assistance, from waiting for me on a snowy evening to helping with my luggage, went above and beyond. Highly recommend their services for anyone in need of reliable and friendly storage support.

Unique exemplifies professionalism, integrity, and excellence in service. Their team, notable for efficiency and courteousness, displays a commendable commitment to transparency and honesty. The pricing is notably fair, reflecting the company's ethical standards. Direct interactions with staff members, including salesperson Mike P and manager Chris, underscore their dedication to high-quality customer service. The meticulous attention to leaving the work area spotless and adhering to the highest standards of work underscores their reliability. Highly recommended, Unique stands out not just for their exceptional service but also for their competitive pricing, inviting customers to make informed comparisons with similar companies.

This takeout spot is a gem with its outstanding food quality and remarkably swift service. Conveniently located for residents like myself at 2601 Parkway, they offer the rare service of delivering directly to my condo door - a feature not commonly found with other delivery options. Their staff is cordially amicable, crafting some of the best pizzas around and exemplifying top-notch business operation. Definitely our go-to choice for takeout.

This spot offers an exceptional street taco experience with standout, delicious options. Coupled with their attentive service and authentic, handmade horchata, it's a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts.

I visited for a mani-pedi session and was attended to by a student who was very friendly, but the service left much to be desired. The session took an unusually long time, about 3 hours, with the outcome being extremely disappointing. While my feet felt great initially, my hands looked terrible, and my positive impression of my pedicure was spoiled when the polish was ruined upon putting my shoes on, despite being assured it was dry. No staff checked the quality of the work done, and I believe I should not have been charged for the subpar manicure, or at least offered a redo. Even with a nice student, the poor service and outcome, especially considering the $34 cost, cannot be overlooked. I've shared pictures taken just 15 minutes post-service for reference. Regrettably, I can only give this experience 2 stars, solely for the student's pleasant demeanor, but the service itself deserves none.

This charming spot offers a delightful dining experience with its serene and dimly-lit ambiance, perfect for enjoying a fusion of Chinese cuisine and sushi. The menu features a variety of dishes, and we opted for the Szechuan chicken with hot and sour soup and steamed rice, while the prime rib and shrimp hot pot was a hit for my partner. Portion sizes were generous, leaving us perfectly satisfied without the need for leftovers. The service stood out for its attentiveness and efficiency, adding to the overall excellent dining experience. Highly recommend for those seeking quality Asian fare in a cozy setting.

Frank stands out not only as an exceptional dentist but also as a genuinely caring individual. His gentle approach, coupled with a sincere interest in his patients, marks him as a top-tier choice for anyone seeking dental care. Having been a patient of his for years, and knowing many others who share this sentiment, I can confidently recommend Frank as an excellent choice for those in need of dental services.

This charming venue offers a delightful dining experience, complemented by its sidewalk lounge seating that adds a unique touch. The atmosphere is further elevated on Fridays with an outdoor DJ, creating an engaging ambiance. Additionally, an outdoor walk-up bar enhances the casual, yet sophisticated vibe of the place. The interior boasts tasteful decor, contributing to the overall appealing environment. We sampled a couple of appetizers, which were both tasty and well-prepared. Situated in a trendy waterfront area, this spot successfully combines a great location with enjoyable dining and entertainment options.

Our office outing to the Friday happy hour special was a delightful surprise. The deals were fantastic, and contrary to expectations, the venue wasn't overcrowded. Both the food and drinks included in the specials exceeded our usual expectations for happy hour quality, with the pork sliders and beignets standing out as must-tries. The atmosphere was fun and lively, perfectly complemented by the friendly staff. Highly recommended for an enjoyable and affordable outing.

Had an excellent dining experience with a light bite to eat. Impressed by the great service, fresh food, and charming atmosphere, especially while seated outside on a warm October evening. Lisa, our host, was exceptionally hospitable—she thoughtfully explained the menu and checked in with us often, adding to our evening with delightful conversations. This wonderful place left a lasting impression, and we're eagerly looking forward to our next visit.

I've visited various Lush stores across the US, from Arizona to Maui, but the Lush store in New Orleans holds a special place in my heart, standing out as my absolute favorite. There's something enticing about being able to detect the fragrant aroma of Lush products even before you see the store, a delightful quirk that heightens the anticipation. My visits, always coinciding with Halloween, amplify the fun atmosphere, making each experience memorable. It's a tradition I treasure, combining the festive spirit of the season with the unique charm and offerings of Lush New Orleans.

This place shines for its Happy Hour (HH) and dinner, offering a robust selection of dishes that won't disappoint, particularly their standout Asian Nachos - a hearty and must-try entree. While their brunch receives mixed reviews, not living up to the hype for some, their dessert lineup, especially the crème brûlée, and unique drink options like the blueberry mojito and mango sling, are highly praised. It's a fantastic spot for celebrating special occasions, thanks to its pleasant ambiance. However, the bar area can become quite crowded during later HH hours. One downside is the typical parking challenge nearby, a common inconvenience around the mall area.

This bakery delivers delicious top-shelf pastries that defy its underserved poor ratings. It's a haven for those who prioritize flavor over cost, setting itself apart from places like Panera. The service is exceptionally pleasant, even to customers with high demands. The bakery has also earned personal trust, as evidenced by the excitement in having them make macaroons for a wedding. A genuine gem for those who appreciate quality both in product and service.

Despite the draw of fresh ingredients and commendable service, the pizzeria falls short on delivering a satisfying pizza experience. The excessively thin crust not only leads to a quick cool-down but also results in a disappointingly floppy and bland outcome. In an area abundant with alternatives, this particular aspect significantly dampens the desire for a return visit, even for someone with a craving walking by.

This review acknowledges the appeal of Bier's tap room in Indianapolis, noting its vibrant atmosphere and the unique approach of rotating beer taps weekly, which hints at a commitment to innovation and variety in their beer selection. The reviewer appreciates this constant quest for better beer, suggesting a dynamic and engaging beer tasting experience. However, their initial visit fell short of expectations, with only two beers appealing to their taste, and just one standing out as memorable. The reviewer also mentions a challenge in aligning their visits with the business hours. Despite these hurdles, there is an evident willingness to revisit, drawn by the potential for a diverse and evolving beer lineup, and the fun, communal space the tap room offers. The experience currently earns three stars, with hope expressed for improved future visits.

After a delightful lunch at Cochon, my friends and I were lucky to discover Sweet Confections on Magazine St, just around the corner from Julia St's art galleries. Ending our trip to NOLA on a sweet note, we indulged in a variety of treats including a chocolate cupcake with a rich mocha filling and an assortment of truffles - raspberry, creme brulee, and orange. The raspberry truffle, encased in dark chocolate, stood out for not being overly sweet. Their coffee was also a highlight, well-balanced and smooth enough to enjoy without milk and sugar. The cafe provided enough seating for our group of six and the service was commendable, with the staff offering helpful flavor recommendations. My only critique would be the potential need for an additional staff member to maintain their high level of service. Overall, I'd rate Sweet Confections a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

The pulled pork sandwich was a delight, showcasing culinary expertise. However, the experience dipped with the "lucky bun" burger. Despite the appealing Asian fusion concept, quality bread, and tantalizing toppings and sauces, the burger faltered significantly due to the use of a frozen beef patty. This choice compromised the taste, overshadowing the potential of what could have been a standout gourmet burger. Opting for fresh ground meat could dramatically elevate this dish, aligning it with the higher standards glimpsed in other menu items.

This charming spot is a delightful find for those looking to enjoy a day out with kids. It masterfully channels the whimsy of a tea party, offering a range of treats that cater to the young and the young at heart. From refreshing juice to enticing slices of cake and homemade popsicles, there's something to put a smile on every face. The menu boasts an eclectic mix, with standout favorites including indulgent homemade doughnuts filled with red bean, refreshing popsicles, creamy patbingsu, and a classic hit - the coffee with cream and sugar. It's a place that invites you to try everything at least once, likely finding a favorite in the process. Perfect for a family outing, it guarantees a memorable experience for both kids and adults alike.

This pizza spot truly stands out with its exceptional crust and remarkably fresh ingredients, backed by a friendly and welcoming staff. Its unique selection of delicious toppings not found elsewhere, complemented by great salads, elevates the dining experience. The patio offers a delightful ambience to relax with a beer or wine while enjoying what can confidently be called the best pizza in town.

This gas station on Clearwater Beach is an absolute gem! As someone who works at a beachfront hotel, I confidently recommend it to guests daily. Notably, it stands out as the only station in the area that offers 24/7 service, making it a reliable pit stop for travelers and locals alike. A truly indispensable convenience for the Clearwater Beach community.

This spot in St. Pete is an absolute must-visit, leaving an unforgettable impression. Every item on the menu promises to deliver, ensuring you're in for a divine feast that might just end in a blissful food coma. Highly recommended!

This Chipotle location shines for its efficient service and fresh, flavorful food. They deserve extra praise for their thoughtful recognition of teachers during Teacher Appreciation Week. Unlike other locations, where lines can become daunting, this spot keeps the queue minimal, ensuring a swift and pleasant ordering experience. The steak bowl, complete with white cilantro lime rice, black beans, and a variety of toppings, is a standout choice, perfectly complemented by a bag of fresh tortilla chips. A must-visit for anyone seeking a quick, satisfying meal.
This Jimmy John's location delivers the brand's standard fare without any notable highs or lows. The cleanliness of the restaurant stands out, making for a pleasant dining environment.

Recently vacationed in St. Petersburg with my family and had a standout dining experience at Dooners. The food was exceptional, easily becoming the highlight meal of our trip. What elevated the experience further was the incredibly helpful and friendly staff, making us feel genuinely welcomed. I would wholeheartedly recommend Dooners to anyone visiting the area and look forward to returning on my next trip.

Situated beside the Alexander Hotel, this bar impresses with its selection of vintage pre-prohibition cocktails, among which "The Elephant in the Room" stands out. This unique bourbon cocktail, presented in a decanter filled with cherrywood smoke, offers a bespoke infusion experience. The establishment provides ample, comfortable seating and features a spacious deck with heaters, perfect for cooler evenings. Overlooking vibrant street scenes and the CityWay YMCA, it presents an interesting view. A highlight is the complimentary truffle oil and sea salt popcorn—a treat that pairs wonderfully with their beverages. This bar is a must-visit for an exceptional drinking experience.

Nestled in the bustling heart of Philadelphia, this hidden gem of a hotel offers a cozy, quaint, and modern stay that feels more like a friend’s upscale apartment than a traditional hotel. With its spacious and beautifully appointed rooms featuring chic decor, hardwood floors, and all the comforts of home, guests are treated to a remarkably stylish and comfortable environment. 

The hotel's thoughtful touches, such as door-delivered continental breakfasts that punctually await outside your door, and a 24/7 lobby stocked with refreshments, speak to its commitment to guest convenience and satisfaction. Highlights include the exceptional politeness and helpfulness of the staff, emphasizing a personalized and caring approach to guest service that is often missing in larger establishments. 

While there are some considerations such as limited parking and the compact shower dimensions, these are minor when compared to the overall experience. The hotel's serene atmosphere, despite its central location, ensures a peaceful stay, making it an excellent choice for light sleepers and those seeking a quiet retreat in the city.

Minor drawbacks, such as the absence of extensive views and the peculiarities of its urban setting, do little to diminish the hotel’s appeal. Instead, they remind visitors that the vibrant city of Philadelphia awaits exploration right outside their doorstep.

In summary, this hotel represents a fantastic option for travelers seeking charm, comfort, and a touch of luxury during their stay in Philadelphia. It’s highly recommended for anyone looking to experience the city from a welcoming and stylish base.

"Visited a fantastic spot in NE Philly today, guided by a Colombian friend with a hankering for something affordable yet immensely satisfying. The restaurant, reminiscent of the highly-rated Nanzhou on Yelp, spoils its patrons with generous portions at minimal cost. I indulged in the Sancocho, an oxtail soup boosted with extra rice and plantains, curious to compare it to the Korean oxtail soup I'm familiar with. The richer, stew-like consistency and the hearty potatoes made it a comforting and delectable meal, keeping up with its Korean counterpart. My friend's choice of Carne Asada vanished off his plate in lightning speed, attesting to its deliciousness. For those in search of culinary treasures, a trip to this NE Philly gem is a must. Yelp enthusiasts, take note — you're truly missing out."

This venue offers an exciting variety of donut flavors that are sure to delight anyone looking to indulge in some sweet treats. However, the true standout at this spot is their fried chicken. The chicken sandwich, in particular, is highly recommended for its delicious taste. A great place for both donut aficionados and fried chicken enthusiasts.

This spot in Santa Barbara, although on the pricier side (a ham and cheese croissant at $5.50, for example), proves worth the cost with its delectable offerings. The locale is charming, if somewhat elusive. Standouts include the must-try green eggs and ham breakfast biscuit (around $10) and an excellent Santa Barbara tri-tip sandwich. The cold brew coffee hits the mark, and the grab-and-go section is filled with appealing options, like the delightful salami and pesto sammy. Despite the prices, it's a place I'd happily revisit.

The cuisine is commendable for its deliciousness, yet the dining experience is marred by consistently slow and underwhelming service, an issue that cannot be excused by busy periods as it occurs even during quieter times.

This restaurant quickly became one of my favorite spots for Indian cuisine, offering a no-frills dining experience that prioritizes flavor above everything. The establishment ensures prompt seating, offering a casual ambiance that's simple yet sufficient for a pleasant meal. Service here is friendly, making up for the somewhat lackluster decor. 

But the heart of the matter is the food, which is nothing short of stellar. Their naan, both garlic-infused and original, is consistently soft and flavorful—a perfect companion to any entree. Speaking of entrees, you can't really go wrong here, whether it's the Masala, Vindaloo, or any meat preference of your choosing. Although it might not hit the highest notes for those who favor extremely spicy food, the dishes are undeniably rich in flavor and cater well to the average palette. 

For those with a sweet tooth, the dessert duo of Rice Pudding and Gulab Jaman is a must-try. Mixing these two creates a creamy, sugary delight that perfectly rounds off a meal here. In summary, if delicious meals served with a smile in a casual setting are what you're after, this Indian restaurant should be at the top of your list.

Located in the unassuming surroundings of Goleta on Holester Avenue, this place might not catch your eye at first glance. However, don't let the modest exterior fool you. The burger served here is nothing short of extraordinary. It’s a delightful surprise in a simple setting, leading me to declare it the best burger experience of my life. The outdoor seating adds to the casual ambiance, making each bite of their exceptional burger even more enjoyable.

The experience at this stadium leaves much to be desired, both in terms of amenities and atmosphere. The food options are disappointing - from subpar hoagies that fail to live up to Philadelphia's renowned standards, to french fries that are more grease than crunch, the culinary offerings are a letdown. Additionally, finding food means missing parts of the game due to an inadequate number of vendors.

Watching the game should be a seamless experience, yet the small, blurry TVs scattered throughout the venue make it nearly impossible to catch the action while queuing for food or drinks. Moreover, the cleanliness of the stadium is questionable with empty beer containers littering the stands early into the games.

While visiting a stadium should be about enjoying the game and soaking in the local culture, prospective visitors should brace themselves for interactions with Philly fans. Described as rude and inconsiderate, their behavior can significantly dampen the overall experience, regardless of one’s team allegiance.

In summary, while ticking off a visit to this stadium might be on a sports fan's bucket list, it’s advisable to come prepared. Bring your own food to avoid disappointment and approach interactions with local fans with caution. The stadium itself, though designed favorably for hitters, fails to offer a memorable experience beyond the game.

This diner offers a fantastic experience with its charming old-school vibe and incredibly friendly staff. The cuisine, especially the made-to-order gumbo, was a delightful surprise, tasting superb even to someone who's usually not a fan of shrimp. Their selection, including grits, fried chicken, and the best split pea soup ever experienced, speaks volumes about the quality of food served. Additionally, the affordability is remarkable, with an extensive order for two, including beers, totaling only $25. This place is a rare find that combines great food, atmosphere, and value.

This hidden gem in Tampa is an absolute must-visit for anyone with a love for unique and stunning jewelry. Owned by the delightful Ali and Albisia, their store offers an incredible selection of handmade pieces that truly stand out, making it nearly impossible to choose just one. I personally treasure a necklace, two bracelets, and a ring from their collection and am eagerly looking forward to expanding it. The store's atmosphere is further enhanced by great music and the lovely touch of being offered wine as you explore their creations. Can't wait to return to Tampa and revisit this charming spot!

This establishment offers a promising menu with impressive ingredients but falls short in execution, particularly in the art of sandwich-making. The Turkey and Brie Wrap and the Spinach Florentine Wrap, rather than being neatly assembled, were haphazardly prepared, resembling crumples more than wraps. Observations of the sandwich line suggested a lack of skill or urgency among the staff, raising concerns about their capacity to handle more complex orders. The ambiance is marred by ambiguous service direction, lacking clear signage for ordering, pick-up, and payment processes, contributing to a somewhat unwelcoming atmosphere. Improvements in both sandwich crafting and customer navigation would greatly enhance the dining experience.

This bakery is an absolute find, offering a delightful and attentive customer experience alongside a selection of mouth-watering desserts. Their generosity with samples allows for an informed choice - a welcomed approach that sets them apart from many. Their banana puddings, particularly the salted caramel banana and strawberry banana, are revelations even for those who don't typically crave the dessert. These treats are meticulously layered with pudding, luscious cream, and other components like nilla wafers or pound cake, creating a perfect harmony of flavors and textures.

The upside pineapple cake is another hit, with its ideal density and perfectly balanced pineapple flavor, though the caramelized bottom was noted to be slightly hard to chew. The only downside mentioned was the inability to leave a tip through their iPad payment system, despite wishing to reward the excellent service. This place comes highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in exquisite desserts.

Visited the new Paoli donut spot and was blown away by the vast selection of genuinely tasty donuts, a refreshing change from the disappointing offerings at Dunkin. The Salted Caramel, Bacon Maple, and Lemon donuts were standout delights. Beyond the impressive donut lineup, they also serve up delicious breakfast sandwiches, muffins, and bagels. Highly recommended for anyone craving real flavor and quality.

After an initially disappointing visit, our experience at Hermitage O'Charley's took a remarkable turn for the better following a proactive outreach from their guest service and a personal apology from the manager, Chris. Skeptical but willing, we returned without announcing ourselves to experience the genuine quality of service. Despite it being a busy night and being seated in the bar area, our expectations were exceeded. The server's attentiveness and delightful personality, along with timely, delicious food, transformed our view of the restaurant. We've returned several times since and are pleased to report that the excellent service has consistently remained.

Absolutely thrilled with my haircut! Prices are incredibly affordable. My second visit did not disappoint, replicating the outstanding cut and style of my first visit, though initially, the color wasn't exactly what I hoped for, it still turned out pleasantly. This hasn't deterred me; I'm eager to remain a loyal customer.

This restaurant stands out for its commitment to healthy and delicious dining, substituting common ingredients like white potatoes with healthier alternatives like Japanese squash in their curry. The attention to detail is evident from the presentation of welcome snacks to creatively presented straw wrappers.
