With an impressive variety of options, their menu caters to diverse tastes and dietary requirements, all thanks to their made-from-scratch approach. The sauces are particularly noteworthy, and the desserts, featuring a unique combination of white and black sticky rice, add a delightful finishing touch. This place has become our definitive choice for Thai cuisine.

Located in the heart of the Mid-city neighborhood, this fantastic grocery store is a local treasure that rivals even Whole Foods in both selection and price. Offering an impressive array of options including a deli, soup, hot bar, and salad bar, there's always something delicious to discover. A standout feature is their weekend crawfish or lobster boils sold by the pound, adding a unique touch that sets it apart from the typical grocery experience. It's the kind of place that would quickly become your go-to for all your food needs if you lived in the area. A notable highlight is their fried chicken, which is absolutely BOMBlicious! With its commitment to quality, variety, and great value, all while supporting the local community, it's a must-visit for anyone in the vicinity.

This review reflects a highly positive experience at a quaint local cafe/coffee shop, so compelling that the author was motivated to create a Yelp account specifically to share their thoughts. Highlighted were the excellent food and coffee, a friendly and casual atmosphere, and a unique Victorian architectural design that added charm to the dining experience. Although service was noted to be slow, it was attributed to the barista being the sole person managing the counter, who was also praised for being personable. The café's ambiance was deemed perfect for relaxing activities such as reading or sketching, with comfortable seating options both indoors and outdoors, including a booth and a counter. The dog-friendly policy and the prime location in the French Quarter were additional perks mentioned. The sole lament was the inability to visit more than once during a trip to New Orleans, underlining the reviewer's overall satisfaction and desire to return.
The tea being sold is of good quality but comes with an excessively high price tag. It's recommended to explore alternatives such as Republic of Tea or the well-established Twinings for better value.

Millers seemed promising with its convenient location, spacious seating, and warm ambiance highlighted by a fireplace. However, the reality fell short of the expectations. Despite its popularity, evidenced by consistent wait times of 30-60 minutes, the dining experience was underwhelming. Contrary to initial perceptions, Millers is not budget-friendly, and the quality of food does not justify the price. While the guacamole served was copious, its taste was lackluster. The Zinger boneless wings received a more favorable review, though it's debatable what was more appreciated, the food or the attire of the hostesses.

Service was a high point, with attentive and responsive staff, yet this could not compensate for the culinary disappointments. From a wilted side salad to flavorless main dishes and the use of plastic dishes, Millers missed the mark on delivering a satisfactory dining experience. The possibility of dessert was forfeited, not wanting to risk further disappointment. This visit transformed the anticipation into a resolve not to return, with the exception perhaps of a takeout order for wings, as per my husband's preference. In summary, Millers' allure was marred by subpar food, misleading pricing, and an overall experience that strongly underdelivered.

This review expresses disappointment with a service location, stemming from mandatory continued patronage due to a pre-purchased membership. Despite appreciating the facility's amenities, the reviewer consistently encounters unsatisfactory cleaning jobs, including overlooked areas like cup holders and door kick panels, necessitating repeat cleanings. Communication barriers with some staff exacerbate these issues. The reviewer finds the situation frustrating, especially given the establishment's convenient location. The overall sentiment is one of regret, wishing for improved service quality to match the facility's potential.

As someone who typically doesn't frequent liquor bars, my visits to The Libertine were pleasantly surprising. The establishment makes a strong impression with its commitment to quality, utilizing fresh ingredients in their drinks, even going so far as to crush ice with a mallet right at the bar, adding a unique touch to the entire experience. However, navigating the restrooms can be a bit challenging due to the dim lighting and ambiguous gender indicators on the doors, requiring close attention to the hair details in the pictures to discern which is which. Overall, the minor inconvenience does little to overshadow the quality experience The Libertine offers.

Following a recommendation, my family and I visited this establishment and were thoroughly impressed. As a self-proclaimed pizza expert, I found their offerings to be exceptional. The staff was welcoming, ensuring prompt service that greatly enhanced our dining experience. Overall, it provided a uniformly positive experience, warranting a future visit and my recommendation to others seeking quality pizza.

I sampled these battered and fried light cheddar curds at the Collingswood Art Festival and was thoroughly impressed. Despite being on the pricier side, their flawless flavor justifies the cost. Remarkably, they manage to avoid the greasiness typically associated with fried foods. The cheese itself is the star, offering a deliciously stringy and melty experience, with the batter not overpowering but rather enhancing its taste. The accompanying sauces delicately complement the curds, making the entire dish well worth the indulgence. These curds are a must-try; their memorable taste will leave you craving more.

Yats provides a unique and delightful dining experience, combining the vibrant essence of a New Orleans eatery with a casual, friendly atmosphere. Upon entering, patrons are greeted with 4-6 cauldrons brimming with a variety of choices, all artfully listed on a chalkboard menu that includes vegetarian options. The pricing is incredibly reasonable, with a hearty plate available for $5.50, or for an additional dollar, guests can opt for a split plate, allowing them to savor two Cajun specialties served with rice. A standout feature is the irresistibly mouthwatering garlic bread, generously offered at the steal of a dollar for a bowl.

Moreover, Yats doesn't just excel in its culinary offerings. The owner, Joe Vuskovich, enriches the establishment's charm with his renowned background as a celebrated restaurateur from New Orleans, known for his secret spice blend that's sought after by restaurants far and wide. Joe's persona adds a layer of authenticity and community engagement, setting Yats apart not only for its food but also as a local hangout that supports local bands and the youth, carving its niche as a beloved local gem despite having two other locations. Yats undoubtedly captures the essence of Cajun cuisine and hospitality, making it a must-visit for both locals and visitors alike.

Following a disappointing experience at another restaurant, our swift visit to Pi turned the night around. Immediately welcomed and sympathized by the hostess, we were quickly seated and even received complimentary garlic bread, a gesture that was both unexpected and appreciated. We ordered two pizzas, and as always, Pi did not disappoint. Their deep dish and thin crust pizzas were, once again, exceptional. Pi has consistently delivered not only delicious food but also outstanding service on every visit. This spot remains a reliable favorite in STL.

This dental clinic provided a commendable service, especially with the extraction of wisdom teeth, showcasing their proficiency in dental procedures. However, a point of concern is the lack of consistency in the dental staff, with no opportunity to see the same dentist over a span of five years, which might affect the continuity of care and personal connection with the practitioners.

After receiving a recommendation from a fellow Yelp Elite, my significant other and I decided to give this establishment a try, fully prepared for the possible wait by arriving at 10:45 on a Saturday, only to find a queue already forming.

Starting with appetizers, the takoyaki stood out - a serving of five perfectly cooked balls, filled with squid and tastefully dressed with sauces and squid flakes, presenting a delightful introduction to our meal. The fried octopus, although adequately prepared, was served somewhat plainly with insufficient mayo on the side for dipping, marking our only qualm with the starters.

The main course comprised two variations of ramen - the red spicy tonkotsu ramen for myself and the black garlic tonkotsu ramen for my partner. Unfortunately, both dishes were marred by the use of mushy, overcooked thin noodles that failed to complement the otherwise flavorful broths. The red chili broth in mine was overpoweringly spicy, overshadowing the complexity of flavors one might seek in a good bowl of ramen. The black garlic tonkotsu ramen proved more balanced and enjoyable in comparison.

Pricing and decor were both reasonable and pleasing, respectively. However, our dining experience was somewhat diminished by the presence of disruptive children in the establishment.

In summary, while the restaurant offered some culinary delights, particularly in its appetizers, the main courses were let down by poorly executed noodles, and the ambiance could have benefited from better management of the dining environment.

This cozy café in Philadelphia has earned the title of the best breakfast spot, according to a self-proclaimed breakfast fanatic who has extensively sampled the city’s top-rated establishments. Despite its modest size, the café impresses with its ability to deliver dishes brimming with incredible flavor, all while maintaining a fresh and simplistic approach to their creations. The quality and appeal of their menu are suggested to rival that of much larger, well-known eateries such as Parc, showcasing their capability to satisfy a wide range of patrons with their exceptional offerings.

This diner exceeds expectations with its exceptional fare, meriting a rare 6-star rating if possible. Despite its unassuming appearance, it serves outstanding diner cuisine. The biscuits and gravy, in particular, stand out for their incredible taste. Moreover, the generous portions ensure a satisfying meal that might even be too much for some. A must-visit for hearty, delicious dining.

This eatery presents itself as a modern, perhaps excessively trendy spot that may not appeal to everyone, particularly those over 35 due to its youthful and vibrant atmosphere. The clientele's casual attire, dominated by skinny jeans and T-shirts carrying bold statements, sets a specific tone, though the high-quality food and attentive service make up for any potential discomfort with the ambiance.

Despite its popularity, I managed to secure a reservation just a day prior and was pleasantly accommodated ahead of my booking to avoid the rain. My dining experience kicked off with the standout crispy Brussels sprouts, which are a must-try regardless of your usual preference for the vegetable. The dish's unique preparation and flavors make it a delightful surprise.

For the main course, the pork schnitzel paired with shoestring fries was tasty and well-prepared. Opting for a squeeze of lemon over the provided gravy, I found the meal to be both satisfying and executed with care. Accompanied by excellent decaf and a glass of Kahlua to round off the experience, the service was attentive without being intrusive, adding to the meal's enjoyment.

The only drawbacks to an otherwise delightful dining experience were the crowded space and high noise levels, which detracted from the overall ambiance. As such, I'm giving it a 4 out of 5 stars. The food and service are beyond reproach, but the bustling environment may not suit everyone's taste.

The beers here are exceptional, with the porter, double IPA, and table gutt standing out as particularly fantastic options. The food is also outstanding, especially for fans of Russian cuisine. The sausage and sauerkraut special was delicious, and the pickled everything appetizer is a great choice. Overall, this place is exceptional and highly recommended.

I've explored numerous sushi spots in Reno, but Rickshaw stands out for its unparalleled freshness, especially for a purist like me who prefers Nigiri or sashimi over elaborate rolls or sauces. For those who appreciate sushi in its most authentic form, focusing on the quality of fish, Rickshaw delivers the best experience in town.

Visited for the first time and was left underwhelmed. Challenges started with poor parking options. On the upside, they offer a good variety of draft beers. The food was mediocre overall; we shared several appetizers. The standout was the unique and delicious fried olives, while the blue cheese chips, calamari, and meat/cheese platter were just average. Despite the lackluster experience, I'm open to giving it another try but wasn’t particularly impressed on this visit.

The restaurant, amidst significant hype at its opening, delivers an experience that can be described as passable at best. The ambiance does present a welcoming aspect, and its prime location compensates slightly for what the visit might lack, offering a scenic wait. However, the limited menu and unremarkable food leave much to be desired, failing to live up to the initial excitement it stirred.

This delightful spot offers a truly memorable ice cream experience, making a strong impression on any sweet tooth. The reviewer expressed immense satisfaction with their visit, particularly praising the diverse and unique ice cream flavors available. The standout choice, a pumpkin cake flavor, was described as delicious and smooth, while the pralines and cream were noted to surpass other similar flavors in quality. Though the Tennessee fudge flavor didn't wow as much, it was still enjoyable. A special mention went to the nutter butter ice cream, enhanced by a hot fudge topping, for its excellent taste and texture.

Beyond the ice cream itself, the service played a significant role in the overall positive experience. The staff was highlighted for their patience, humor, and welcoming attitude towards sampling and indecisiveness, adding a personal touch that made the experience even more enjoyable. The lack of judgment for indulging in a brownie sundae alone was a cherry on top of this delightful visit. While the reviewer regretted missing out on trying the hot chocolate, their glowing recommendation is based firmly on the high-quality ice cream and exceptional service they encountered.

During a lunch outing to a restaurant that took over a former O'Henry's location, the experience was mixed. The setting, described as underwhelming and uncomfortably warm, particularly on the upstairs level, somewhat detracted from the dining experience. Despite this, the culinary offerings were largely positive. The Catfish Acadian, a dish featuring catfish topped with crawfish and a delectable sauce, alongside fresh, well-prepared vegetables, was highly praised for its flavor and presentation. However, the pork chop dish did not meet the same standard, suggesting a potential inconsistency in the menu's appeal, particularly outside of its seafood selections.

Service was a standout positive aspect, with Bria, the waitress, noted for her attentive, personable service that enhanced the overall dining experience. Despite the enjoyable food and excellent service, the ambiance and setting may not be compelling enough for a return visit, especially considering the accessibility of similar quality dishes elsewhere. The possibility of dining on the balcony during cooler weather suggests that a different experience might be worth exploring, adding a conditional consideration for future visits.

This review recounts a disappointing dining experience at a restaurant, particularly noting subpar service and food quality encountered on a visit. Upon arrival on a notably slow evening, the reviewers were met with an inattentive and seemingly prejudiced waitress, who provided lackluster service in stark contrast to the treatment of other patrons. Mistakes with drink orders and a long wait for food, coupled with the presentation of undercooked and poor-quality appetizers and main courses, marred the experience further. A significant issue arose when one of the wings was found to have a feather, highlighting the lack of care in food preparation. The management's handling of the complaints did little to redeem the situation, though the meal was comped after some resistance. The reviewers, a same-sex couple, felt distinctly unwelcomed and discriminated against, a sentiment that played a significant role in their overall negative experience. Despite the meal being comped, this experience received a low rating for both the food and the evident lack of inclusivity, warranting caution to potential diners, especially those from the LGBTQ+ community. **Rating: 1/5**

This review expresses strong dissatisfaction with the local K-Mart, criticizing its outdated appearance and comparing it unfavorably to a more modern retailer, such as Target. The reviewer finds the attempts at updating the store insufficient, likening it to an old, tired entity that refuses to close despite expectations. They detail frustrating experiences with inaccurate sale pricing and price adjustments that inconvenienced them, particularly an incident involving a beach chair. The sentiment is clear: the reviewer longs for a better shopping experience, ideally provided by a new Target store, and is exasperated with the current state and practices of their K-Mart.

This hidden gem surpasses expectations with its deceiving exterior, revealing a charming ambiance once inside. The cuisine is both tasty and affordable, featuring dishes like papaya salad, triple flavor duck, and king tofu soup. Although the salad could use less fish sauce, the triple flavor duck does not disappoint. The standout is undoubtedly the king soup, customizable with your choice of protein. Plus, the option to BYO adds a delightful touch. A must-visit for those seeking good food in a cozy setting.

The Mazzoni Center stands out as a comforting haven, particularly praised for its inclusive and respectful approach towards individuals facing diverse life challenges and identity specifics. The sensitivity and understanding displayed by the staff, alongside their expertise in catering to unique health needs such as gynecology for non-female patients, play a huge role in creating a supportive environment. This aspect is especially highlighted and appreciated by many who have felt marginalized or misunderstood in other healthcare settings.

However, the review also touches upon areas where the Mazzoni Center could improve. The physical layout of the clinic, especially the exposed waiting room, raises concerns about privacy and comfort, indicating a need for a more thoughtfully designed space. Additionally, the waiting times can be significantly long, especially during youth drop-in hours, though this is somewhat mitigated by the possibility of calling ahead for time estimates.

Communication within the clinic occasionally shows lapses, such as extended, unexplained waiting periods in the exam rooms. Yet, these are described as rare occurrences, and the overall level of attentive care and service is considered superior to other clinics. The limitation in direct telephone access to doctors is mitigated by an efficient messaging system through reception, ensuring that queries and concerns are addressed promptly.

In summary, the Mazzoni Center is highly valued for its empathetic and specialized care, making it a crucial resource for those it serves. While there is room for improvement in facility layout and certain operational aspects, the positive impact it has on its community is undeniable.

This BBQ restaurant falls significantly short of expectations, notably for someone from Texas. The sample platter was deeply disappointing - the chicken resembled and tasted like low-quality processed meat, the ribs were mostly cartilage, and the sausage lacked any distinctive flavor. Further, the BBQ sauce came off as a basic, overly sweetened concoction you might find at a discount retailer. Considering the high prices for what seemed equivalent to a child's portion, this establishment is not recommendable under any circumstances.

This venue dazzles with its excellent wine happy hour, offering a diverse selection at just $5 per glass or $5 off any bottle, perfect for group indulgence. The cheese plates stand out for culinary exploration, complemented by delectable sandwiches that come highly recommended. Its ambiance strikes a cozy balance, particularly the enclosed patio that shines during winter, providing a romantic backdrop. Coupled with commendable service, this place is a must-visit for wine enthusiasts and foodies alike.

Disappointing dining experience due to rude staff and incompetent service, with even a simple salad order proving too challenging to fulfill correctly. The long wait time for our food was surprising and unjustified given we were the sole patrons. Furthermore, prices, especially for pizza slices, are exorbitant. Overall, it's advisable to invest your money and dining expectations elsewhere.

This Mexican restaurant offers an incredibly authentic dining experience, rivaling some of the best Mexican cuisine reminiscent of traditional family cooking. Particularly for someone hailing from California, the quality and authenticity stand out. The enchiladas draped in rich, flavorful mole are a highlight, and the carne asada tacos bring a taste of Rosarito Beach to the table. Highly recommended for anyone seeking truly excellent Mexican fare.

The bake house's Cinnamon Rolls are an absolute must-try—so delightful, you'd likely find yourself craving a second. Their absence would certainly dim the light of happiness in life, emphasizing their deliciousness. Beyond the pastry delights, their coffee and salads also stand out, making for an excellent Saturday morning breakfast treat.

I tried the carrot cake, expecting something delightful but ended up quite disappointed. Surprisingly, it had an overpowering taste of licorice and baking soda, rather than the expected sweet and spicy carrot cake flavor. Additionally, the inclusion of chocolate chips in the cake didn't align with my preferences, further detracting from the experience. Despite the appealing appearance of the desserts on offer, this particular choice fell short of expectations.

This restaurant offers unbeatable prices for unlimited food, making it a great value. The sushi impresses with its deliciousness, standing out as a highlight of the dining experience. However, the salad falls short, failing to meet expectations in terms of quality and taste. Particularly disappointing is the crab Rangoon, which was notably the worst I've experienced. Despite these mixed experiences with the food quality, the overall value has led me to dine here twice, and I would certainly visit again.

This place on Bourbon Street offers some of the best chicken you could ever hope to find. The chicken itself is delicious, perfectly complemented by a flavorful sauce. In short, everything about it is excellent.

The burger and fries combo, priced at $16, initially seems steep, but the quality and taste of the Lama burger justifies the cost. The patty is notably high-quality, and the unique choice of ingredients, such as gruyere stuffed in a pepper, elevates the burger's flavor profile. The fries are served crispy, avoiding common pitfalls of sogginess, and the bun complements the burger well. Customers order inside by the Nook, with ample seating available. The selection of craft beer is impressive, hinting at the venue's potential popularity during weekends. Overall, despite the initial hesitation over price, the culinary experience provided makes it worth it.

Visited for breakfast on 12/2/17, a place I used to enjoy. Disappointingly, the service was sluggish, the coffee lukewarm, and the grits were not heated properly. Experiencing a twenty-minute wait for a cinnamon biscuit post-breakfast and an additional delay of ten minutes just to pay at the counter, I was reminded that superior breakfast options are available nearby. Regrettably, I disregarded my initial preference, resulting in a less than satisfactory dining experience.

A stellar review for Termini Brothers, hailed as simply the best by someone with strong Italian family ties, indicating a deep appreciation for authentic flavors. The consistent choice of Termini Brothers' dessert trays for family events speaks volumes about their quality. The special mention of their amazing cannolis comes with a high recommendation, suggesting an exceptional culinary experience worth trying.

The hotel stands out for its exceptional hospitality, featuring top-notch service and a selection of impressive restaurants. The cleanliness of the rooms further enhances the overall comfort and pleasant experience. Highly recommended for a delightful stay.

My recent trip to New Orleans left me with an even stronger appreciation for the culinary delights back home in Reno. Specifically, the shrimp po'boy has captured my heart as my all-time favorite dish on the menu. Complementing this savory treat, the cornbread stands out as a truly amazing accompaniment. Both items showcase the quality and flavor that keep me coming back for more.

The community here is warm and welcoming; however, my experience with Katie at the salon was disappointing. Her approach was hasty and careless, reminiscent of a bulldozer through my hair, applying color and executing a cut rapidly and with little care. Given it was late, perhaps taking on a client was not the best decision, especially for the steep price of nearly $200. This experience left me unsettled and dissatisfied.

This Nashville eatery close to Vanderbilt University stands out as an exceptional breakfast spot, a choice that simply can't be missed. The charm of this location is matched by the convenience of having a back lot for parking—just remember to grab a ticket from the machine to enjoy free parking for a limited time. Among their delightful offerings, the banana pancakes are a standout; imagine the essence of banana bread, but reimagined as fluffy pancakes. They're so enticing that they've become a must-have treat before leaving Nashville. A bustling atmosphere underscores its popularity, making it a top recommendation for anyone visiting the city.

MexiCali in University City offers a variety of delicious vegan options that cater well to the plant-based community. Their marinated tofu burrito stands out for its chewy texture and protein-rich content, ensuring a satisfying meal. Another highlight is the sweet potato and plantain burrito, a dairy-free delight, alongside the spicier veggie tacos that offer a lighter yet flavorful option. Not to be overlooked, the guacamole burrito with its homemade guac is a must-try. Despite its popularity and potential lines, MexiCali's efficient system ensures you'll enjoy your meal without a long wait. As a long-time patron, I highly recommend visiting MexiCali for anyone searching for substantial and tasty vegan meals in the area.

This restaurant offers a commendable breakfast selection, highlighted by the flavorful Eggs provençale and remarkably well-prepared omelets, complemented by impressive pastries. However, the inconsistency in the cooking of some dishes and particularly bad coffee significantly dampen the dining experience. Furthermore, credibility is undermined by misspellings on the menu, regardless of their linguistic origin, detracting from the overall quality and attention to detail one might expect.

This lively and crowded eatery, boasting a cool location and an impressive beer selection, is not your typical sports bar, despite the presence of big screen TVs. The food is delicious and eclectic, straying from traditional pub grub, making it an excellent choice for those seeking a vibrant dining experience with flavorful dishes. However, if you're looking for a quiet spot to enjoy a burger and a beer while watching a hockey game, this may not be the venue for you. Perfect for those in search of a bustling atmosphere and tasty, unique eats, but not ideal for those desiring a classic sports bar vibe.

This company offers an outstanding, efficient, and stress-free windshield repair service at no out-of-pocket cost. Highly recommendable for anyone in need, and I would definitely use their services again.

This dining experience in New Orleans was nothing short of fantastic, prompting an immediate review. The service was top-notch, and the food ranked among the best in the city. Highlighted by freshly made, piping hot bread, the meal began with tantalizing fried oysters enhanced by bearnaise sauce and Benton's bacon - an essential choice. Following this was the equally impressive main course of scallops accompanied by a butternut squash purée and balsamic vinegar, a dish so enticing, both diners chose it over other appealing options. Dessert was the crowning glory, featuring café au lait panna cotta with mini glazed donuts reminiscent of Café du Monde's famous beignets. The meal concluded with a sampling of house-made 'cellos, including inventive ginger and lime flavors, adding a unique finish to an unforgettable dining experience.

My girlfriend and I had an extraordinary dining experience at BARRA during Restaurant Week. Opting for blood orange margaritas, the robust and delectable flavor set a high bar right from the start. Our appetizers, extraordinary veal and beef meatballs, and an exceptional grilled cheese, surpassed the usual expectations. The fishermen stew entree impressed with its rich, well-balanced flavors, a delightful surprise that I initially doubted. My girlfriend's choice, a steak served with cauliflower puree and a vegetable medley, was equally memorable. Its juice, tenderness, and exquisite seasoning introduced us to the revelation of ordering steak medium-well. The service matched the food in quality - attentive, knowledgeable, and consistently checking in on us. BARRA stands out for its compelling combination of superb cuisine, excellent service, and a cozy atmosphere, all at a reasonable price. Without a doubt, BARRA is a top recommendation for anyone seeking a remarkable meal.

My visit to this breakfast spot on Valentine's Day was marked by a high expectation for a quality meal, which was indeed met despite the circumstances. Anticipating a lengthy wait due to the holiday, the hour and a half delay was manageable and somewhat expected, hinting at the popularity of the place. The bustling atmosphere, with servers and busboys moving swiftly, contributed to the vibrant feeling, although the closely packed tables around the room's edges made seating quite tight.

Service was remarkably efficient given the busy state of the restaurant. The culinary highlight was undoubtedly the famed cornmeal pancakes, accompanied by hash browns and a fried egg, which lived up to their reputation with a perfect blend of flavors including bacon, peppers, salsa, sour cream, and syrup. My girlfriend's banana pancakes, served with a side of bacon that, despite being only three pieces, was perfectly cooked to her liking, were equally delightful. However, the coffee did not meet our expectations, which was a surprising drawback in an otherwise excellent dining experience. The dilemma of choosing between homemade or maple syrup (or indulging in both) added a playful twist to our meal decisions. Despite the minor setbacks, the quality and flavors of the food made for a memorable breakfast outing.

Visited on a Monday with the intent to enjoy a daiquiri and watch some NBA basketball. Despite the reasonable request, the staff member declined to change the channel from Netflix to the game, indicating a lack of interest in accommodating customer preferences. This experience suggests a notable decline in customer service standards at this location. As a result, I will not be returning.

The Pearl is truly beyond compare, meriting more stars than available for its remarkable food, exemplary service, and enchanting ambiance. Every visit transforms a mere dinner into an authentic dining experience, making every moment enjoyable. It's a lavish treat one must indulge in. Highly recommended for those looking to pamper themselves in an unparalleled dining affair.

The bagel shop offers pretty good bagels and it's advisable to request extra cream cheese for those who prefer it. The staff is notably pleasant, a distinct positive in Dunedin. However, a significant concern is hygiene, as observed with an employee not washing hands or wearing gloves after handling money, using a phone, and wiping his nose before preparing food. This lapse in sanitation overshadows the experience, making it difficult to recommend returning despite the quality of the bagels. If hygiene issues don't deter you, the bagels themselves are commendable.
I ventured out based on glowing reviews and decided to try a new place for haircuts. While my husband's haircut turned out great, unfortunately, my son's did not meet the same standard.

The dining experience was a mix of highs and lows. The steak we enjoyed was undoubtedly delightful, showcasing a level of culinary skill that was appreciated. However, the price point felt steep, which detracted slightly from the overall experience. A notable disappointment was the guacamole; despite the theatrics of being prepared tableside, it failed to impress and deviated too far from what we considered to be a proper recipe. In summary, good food, but evaluate the costs and skip the guacamole.

New Day Meadery in Fountain Square continues to affirm its place as a must-visit destination, consistently delighting with its diverse array of meads and ciders. My usual picks, the South Cider or Shelby Blue Ribbon, embody the perfect balance of sweetness for a sugar aficionado like myself. However, a venture into their seasonal offerings with the Paulding Light—a unique blend of cranberry, honey, and lime—offered a refreshing twist, albeit less sweet. What stands out at New Day is their commitment to variety, ensuring there's something for every palate. Coupled with prompt service and a welcoming staff, it's easily one of my favorite spots.
This reviewer prefers the discussed establishment over the Philadelphia location but believes that Szechuan House in Hamilton, NJ, remains the top choice.
Fantastic food and service with fresh, flavorful dishes. Definitely planning a return visit.

I recently visited the Make Up For Ever store at King of Prussia (KOP) and initially purchased products worth $75, attracted by their range. However, after testing them for five days, I was dissatisfied and opted to return them. To my disappointment, I was informed that opened items were non-returnable. The store did allow an exchange, but it required an additional outlay, and the new purchase was labelled as FINAL SALE.

Despite finding their products lackluster, my experience shed light on a better alternative. The Sephora store in KOP also stocks Make Up For Ever products and offers a more flexible return policy that accepts items whether unopened or gently used. Henceforth, I'll be directing my purchases there instead.

This beloved happy hour spot, discovered during the summer of 2011's Center City Sips, remains a top recommendation for its delightful appetizers and exceptional mac & cheese. Boasting an impressive selection of beers, both on tap and bottled, the venue impresses with its consistently superb food quality. For those considering private events, the cozy basement features a personal bar, providing an intimate setting. However, be mindful of occasional unwanted guests attempting to use the facilities. Overall, this venue promises an enjoyable experience, ensuring patrons leave satisfied and eager to return.

I've experienced repeated issues with order accuracy at this establishment. On three separate occasions, I've ordered a green tea lemonade, only to receive a peach tea lemonade instead. Each time, I've had to return and request the correct beverage, which is inconvenient and disappointing.

My fiancé and I visited this new pizza place for the first time, enticed by a coupon for a free pizza. While the service was fast and the staff preparing the pizza were friendly, the experience and the pizza itself were somewhat underwhelming. The cashier, in contrast, lacked enthusiasm. Though we wouldn't make a special trip back, we might consider stopping by again if we're in the area and craving pizza.

Visited for dinner last Friday, greeted warmly by the hostess, but immediately noticed a strong, unpleasant odor resembling dirty mop water in the entryway. Fortunately, this smell didn’t permeate the dining area, which showcased an impressive remodel. Seated at a booth, we found the menu surprisingly limited, though we held out hope that the quality of food would make up for it. I opted for a mushroom swiss burger and a beer, my husband chose the “knuckle sandwich” (a tri-tip served French dip style), and our son went with chicken strips, all accompanied by fries. 

Our server, Jesse, was pleasant but struggled to communicate in the noisy dining room without raising his voice, which was a minor annoyance. The beer, while tasty, wasn’t served cold enough. Our meals arrived in good time; the “Knuckle Sandwich” stood out for its deliciousness, earning the experience the two stars. Conversely, my burger was underwhelming in size and flavor, and my son’s chicken strips appeared under-seasoned. The fries were standard fare, nothing noteworthy.

In summary, despite the friendly staff and the potential suggested by the setting and certain dishes, the overall experience was disappointing due to lackluster food and a couple of service and ambiance glitches. Hopefully, with some improvements, this place can fully capitalize on its positives.

I experienced a disappointing service disparity between visits at Tuttini. Initially captivated by a delectable breakfast, my excitement for their lunch offerings turned sour upon my recent visit. Despite arriving well within the advertised lunch hours, specifically before 2 PM for a service purported to last till 2:30 PM, I found myself unjustly denied service. After an unnecessary wait, I was informed of their premature kitchen closure, contradicting their "offer" to prepare a takeout option. Opting for a more welcoming experience, I redirected my patronage to North Star Coffee, where my business—and appetite—were appreciated. This inconsistency not only marred my impression but also highlighted a lack of commitment to advertised service hours at Tuttini.
The service was quick and friendly, offering great value in portion size for the price. The pancakes ordered had the perfect consistency, enhancing the overall dining experience.

This charming spot consistently delivers an exceptional dining experience, marked by its delicious food and welcoming atmosphere. The crepes, in particular, are unparalleled and have been described as the best by both the reviewer and their recommended friends. Its calm and quiet ambiance, coupled with the friendliness of the staff, makes it a highly recommended destination for a delightful meal.

I've patronized Tires Plus in Flourtown for tire purchases on at least four occasions. For my most recent visit, I brought in my own set of Michelin tires for mounting. True to form, their service was prompt and efficient. My appointment was scheduled for 9:00 AM, and they began working on my car immediately upon my arrival. Impressively, the entire process was completed, and my car was ready to go in just one hour.

This spot proved to be an outstanding choice for brunch. We were particularly impressed with the Wildflower Triple, which offers the flexibility to swap any of its three items for alternatives like sausage or biscuit—a convenient feature given our indecision. Both the quality of the food and the friendliness of the service were remarkable. Given our positive experience and remaining time in the area, we're strongly considering a return visit within the next couple of days.

"We had an outstanding happy hour experience! Vaughn and Mark's exceptional kindness made our visit one of a kind. The complimentary appetizer was a delightful bonus, and the lucky slot machines added to the fun. Their amazing service guarantees our return. Highly recommend for a must-try happy hour!"
The enthusiasm for the yogurt finally hits its stride here! Additionally, the inclusion of crepes adds a delightful twist. Definitely worth trying out - both offerings come highly recommended.

This event, arriving halfway through its start, was uncomfortably crowded, detracting significantly from the experience. Contrary to expectations, the offerings were predominantly non-wine-related, such as advertisements, beer, and additional-cost food options. By midafternoon, availability was starkly diminished, calling into question the event's promised duration and overall value. Given these shortcomings, reconsideration is likely for any future attendance.

This restaurant delivers a great overall experience, particularly notable for their committed and genuinely caring service. Despite a bumpy start when they first opened, they've quickly ironed out initial issues, showing improvement on a subsequent visit. The attentiveness and dedication of the staff are commendable, with servers going out of their way to fulfill requests promptly.

While the seafood quality is passable, it's acknowledged that in a location like Tucson, the freshness of seafood is naturally limited; this slightly impacts the dining experience but not to the restaurant's fault. The restaurant offers a unique sauce with an Asian twist for their seafood, which is a pleasant addition to their menu and well-received by patrons.

The ambiance is enhanced by an interesting choice of movies, adding to the dining experience. Prices are deemed expensive but not overpriced, aligning with similar seafood establishments and justified by the quality and service provided. A helpful tip for future visits is to share the Dungeness crab due to its size and pricing, or opt for other seafood options that can be more precisely portioned.

Given its unique sauce offerings, remarkable service, and solid management improvements, this restaurant comes highly recommended for those seeking a seafood dining experience that promises more than just great food.

This eatery offers well-prepared and fresh options, like the homemade oso bucco ravioli, albeit with a caveat— the filling is scant, impacting the flavor. The service shines despite the challenge of high noise levels that complicate communication. Though cozy to the point of cramped, its BYOB policy is a notable draw. Given the competitive dining scene in its locality, the noise, space, and taste balance may deter repeat visits unless the BYOB aspect is a significant lure. It's not the ideal spot for a quiet date night, but for those prioritizing the bring-your-own-bottle feature, it remains an option amidst many.

Title: A Memorable Brew: Yuengling Lager and Brewery Experience

Review:

Venturing from the Midwest to Philadelphia at 19, I found a piece of home I didn’t know I was missing in Yuengling Lager – a beer that quickly claimed its spot in my top five favorites. Embodying smoothness, sweetness, and affordability, it resonates with me on a personal level. The rustic charm of its occasionally rusty bottlecaps, the slight variance in taste with each batch, and its modest alcohol content only add to its unique appeal.

The brewery tour itself added layers to my appreciation. Guided by a British woman whose humor felt refreshingly genuine, the experience felt personal and engaging. Her playful banter with my grandpa over his hat and the surprisingly close access to the brewing equipment added a unique touch to the visit. It felt like stepping back in time, with the facility's vintage vibe echoing that of a 1950s high school yet marked with the industry's hard work.

The tasting was, without a doubt, the highlight. Despite the absence of Lord Chesterfield (arguably no great loss), the lager was more than enough to satisfy. My enthusiasm might have been too evident, considering my multiple rounds of tastings which perfectly segued into a slight shopping spree in the adjacent gift shop.

What truly elevates Yuengling in my estimation is the ethos behind the brand. Hearing about Dick Yuengling's commitment to rehiring laid-off workers reinforces the sense of community and integrity that seems increasingly rare in today’s business landscape, especially against the backdrop of giants like Inbev.

In conclusion, my visit to the Yuengling Brewery was more than just a tour; it was an experience that deepened my connection to a brand that stands for quality, authenticity, and familial loyalty. Yuengling Lager isn’t just a beer to me; it’s a reminder of where I’ve been, and the values I admire and aspire to embody. Highly recommended.

Visited this venue with friends during Mardi Gras, benefiting from its prime location near the parade route and appreciating its outdoor seating and convenient Port-O-Potty facilities. Despite these advantages, the experience was significantly marred by poor service. The bartenders were notably inefficient and often ignored customers or skipped their turn, even when the venue wasn't overcrowded. Their lack of knowledge about basic beer terminology, such as 'microbrew' and 'IPA', was disappointingly surprising. Additionally, the pizza offered fell short of expectations, failing to enhance the overall dining experience.

This establishment offers a standout pedicure experience, notable for its amiable staff and tranquil atmosphere. It stands out for its cleanliness, making it a top recommendation for anyone seeking a superb spot to pamper their feet.

This new downtown burger spot, part of the Harry & Izzy's chain, offers a promising dining experience. The burgers are commendable, but it's worth noting that sides must be ordered separately, aligning with a common trend. The ability to make reservations adds convenience for diners. However, if you're seeking variety beyond burgers, this may not be the ideal venue. An introduction of lunch specials could potentially enhance its appeal for the weekday lunch crowd by offering more value. Despite these suggestions, the overall experience and service are impressive, making it a must-visit for burger enthusiasts.

The salad was favorable, but the pizza proved to be unsatisfactory on multiple levels: boring, tasteless, and overall disappointing. Additionally, the interior was uncomfortably cold, particularly on a chilly night. After giving this establishment three chances, my decision is not to return.

Unimpressive experience. With the sandwich bar closed, I opted for a burrito, only to be disappointed by a microwaved, $8 mess. Displeased with the taste of what seemed to be cream of chicken paired with stale cheese. Surprised this passes as food when even Taco Bell offers better quality.

This brewpub offers an appealing old-school ambiance punctuated by numerous games suitable for children, making it a family-friendly option. The beer menu, though satisfactory, could benefit from more creative variations to entice the adventurous beer aficionado. While the food quality varies, from the overly salty scotch egg offerings to a pizza that struggled under the weight of its toppings, there are definite highlights. The burgers are commendable, and the desserts, especially the frangipane, are a must-try. Opting for the ploughman's plate paired with a beer provides a relaxed dining experience. Overall, this brewpub strikes a chord with its atmosphere and certain menu items, though there's room for improvement in culinary execution.

Zen Yai presents a balanced dining experience with both its highs and lows. Priced under $12, their curry offerings represent excellent value for money. The restaurant's petite size contributes to a cozy ambiance when not overcrowded, but be prepared for potential wait times during peak hours due to limited seating. The vibrant decor and colorful table settings add a refreshing touch to the dining experience. Service is satisfactory, ensuring that food arrives promptly. The innovative presentation of rice in the shape of a pyramid alongside a delicious Pineapple curry highlights the kitchen's commitment to both quality and creativity. However, it's worth noting that not all dishes meet such high standards; a case in point is the underwhelming green curry, which failed to impress a seasoned aficionado. Overall, Zen Yai merits a solid 3.5 stars, striking a reasonable balance between quality, value, and atmosphere.

This hotel consistently ranks as my favorite choice for its outstanding staff and exceptional service, from housekeeping to valets. Each visit is made special by the immaculate rooms, quiet heating/AC, and the utmost comfort of the beds. A standout mention is Special K, whose helpfulness truly enhances the experience. 

The hotel pays attention to delightful details, such as the Sucre chocolates provided during turn-down service. The valet service proved efficient and convenient, adding to the seamless experience. Additionally, the hotel's effort to engage guests through events like the Gold Status reception is commendable, although our stay was primarily for a Mardi Gras ball.

While there was a minor hiccup with a mistaken mini-bar charge, the issue was quickly and amicably resolved by the staff. A note for future improvement would be reinstating Louis in the elevator, which has evidently been missed.

In summary, the blend of exceptional service, comfort, and attention to detail ensures my return to this hotel. It’s a place that consistently goes above and beyond, making each stay memorable.

The dining experience at this location was enhanced by their exceptional rolls and sake selection, enjoyed in the unique ambiance of the bamboo room. This setting contributes significantly to the overall experience, particularly for those who are physically able to navigate it comfortably.

This place offers an excellent food delivery service, which is a major plus. Their gyro is outstanding in both size and taste; it's so generously portioned that I couldn't finish it in one sitting, even without touching the accompanying fries. Both the gyro and fries were delicious, with the tzatziki being particularly noteworthy and the meat tender and flavorful. I'll definitely be returning for more!

During a recent visit for takeout, I opted to try a drink during happy hour, diverging from my usual beer preference to enjoy a dragonberry iced tea. This choice proved delightful, offering a refreshing experience without veering too much into cocktail territory. Accompanying my drink, I indulged in lemongrass chicken with rice and crab rangoon. The lemongrass chicken was nothing short of fantastic, perfectly complementing the rice. Although the crab rangoon left me wishing for a bit more filling, the accompanying dipping sauce was a hit. My experiences here have consistently been positive, marked by both exceptional food and service.

This establishment consistently delivers high-quality products and service. The #1 Deluxe is a particular favorite, providing an exemplary dining experience. Special commendation to Amanda for her exceptional customer service, demonstrating commitment that goes above and beyond expectations.

I had high hopes for this charming hotel due to its appealing aesthetics and prime location. However, my experience was marred by an unwelcome discovery on our final morning: bed bugs. Waking up at 5:30 AM, we spotted these pests, which led to the unfortunate necessity of discarding roughly $300 worth of belongings and meticulously sealing the rest, fearing further infestation at home.

While the management was accommodating, allowing us extended time to manage the aftermath, it did little to alleviate the distress and inconvenience caused. Due to this unsettling incident, I strongly advise potential guests to reconsider their stay here. The risk of bed bugs and the lack of assurance that all carpets and mattresses have been replaced to eradicate the issue makes it a place I'd unfortunately recommend avoiding.

Visited a restaurant at 8:30 AM on a Saturday, pleasantly surprised with no wait for seating or service. Opted for the sweet potato pancakes paired with cinnamon cream syrup—a delightful combination, though marred by subpar hash browns. Despite the enticing syrup, the overall experience, including lack of basic amenities like restroom paper towels and a total bill of $24.43 pre-tip, doesn't beckon a return visit. Would rather savor the syrup at home than endure the shortcomings again.

This Marsh store generally offers a hassle-free shopping experience with its consistently low crowds, allowing for easy entrance and exit. However, there's a notable concern regarding the cleanliness of the red baskets, echoing previous customer feedback which suggests a need for improvement in this area. On a positive note, the layout has been commendably adjusted to enhance accessibility within aisles, a change that, albeit not recent, improves the shopping experience. Selection-wise, the store maintains its reputation for offering a wide range of products. The only recurrent issue appears to be the availability of cashiers, often seeming understaffed by one, which could slightly hinder the checkout process.

This dining spot dazzles with its creative and delicious food offerings, making every visit an adventure. From the complimentary coffee or tea provided while waiting for a seat, which impresses in quality, to their exceptional Bloody Marys, the experience is consistently top-notch. Highly recommended for those seeking culinary imagination and excellence.

This place boasts a wonderful atmosphere paired with an impressive selection of beers, enhancing the dining experience. The Asian chicken salads and the Cajun pasta both stood out, delivering on flavor and quality. Their excellence has us looking forward to our next visit.

This review speaks volumes of a longstanding affection for a place discovered 25 years ago during the reviewer's university days at UD, highlighting the establishment's journey from a local Delaware gem to its widespread presence today. The reviewer eagerly anticipates its arrival in the Huntsville, AL area, suggesting a consistent quality across locations. Specifically, the establishment is praised for ample seating, cleanliness, and a pleasant atmosphere enhanced by good music. The only minor critique mentioned is the absence of Herrs chips, a feature fondly remembered from the Delaware locations, though this is not deemed significant. Overall, the review is highly positive, emphasizing the reviewer's enduring love and expectation of excellence.

This restaurant initially seemed to offer reasonable prices until it became apparent that they charge extra for every side dish, including chips and salsa, rice, and beans. Unfortunately, the food quality does not justify these additional costs. On two separate visits, the rice served was hard and dry, and the burritos were disappointing. Service was also lacking, with our waitress displaying a poor attitude on both occasions. The redeeming qualities of this establishment are its excellent guacamole and strong margaritas, suggesting a strategy to compensate for mediocre food and service.

My boyfriend and I recently discovered a charming Italian restaurant near Trolley Square, and it was a delightful experience from start to finish. The waiter was incredibly welcoming, sharing the eatery's history and providing excellent dish recommendations. Everything appeared to be freshly made, from the scrumptious bread (a new recipe from Sicily) to our main courses. We enjoyed the prosciutto-wrapped shrimp appetizer, followed by Penne Alla Vodka and spaghetti with meatballs — both dishes boasted flavorful sauces and generous portions. The highlight was undoubtedly the cannoli, possibly the best we've ever had, and even comparable to those in Italy, according to my boyfriend. With great food, friendly service, and a special offer that night (a free appetizer with two entrees), I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking an authentic Italian meal at a reasonable price.

This establishment earns a solid 3.5 stars. While it unfortunately doesn't serve alcohol – a notable drawback after a long week – the food inarguably compensates. The margherita pie stands out with its delightful freshness, making it a must-try. The Greek salad, a chosen appetizer, impresses as well, packed with delicious veggies. A tasty experience, albeit missing the option for a much-needed drink.

I'm a big fan of Mr. Wizard's for their focus on frozen yogurt, a healthier alternative to frozen custard. The flexibility to choose from pre-selected combinations or create your own mix is a plus. However, the lack of indoor seating is a drawback, especially in colder weather, leaving the car as the only option for enjoying their treats.

The restaurant's name and logo leave its significance to the imagination, possibly alluding to a partnership among three individuals. Despite this minor curiosity, the establishment shines with its culinary offerings and service. The menu impressively spans from breakfast through dinner to dessert, ensuring options for every palate at any hour, given its 24/7 operation. Both the quality of the food and the friendliness of the staff contribute to a memorable dining experience. This place promises a welcome return for anyone finding themselves in town again.

I recently enjoyed an outstanding dining experience at Spasso with friends. The diversity of our selections, including the evening's special - a delectable seafood dish featuring jumbo shrimp and crab over pappardelle, enhanced by tomato and asparagus - left us all immensely satisfied. Notably, the flavors were just as captivating in the leftovers. The service was exemplary, and the wine selection perfect. Residing on State Street, I eagerly anticipate my next visit. Highly recommend for a memorable meal.

Visited the salon for a fill and considered adding a pedicure but decided against it upon learning the total would exceed $85. Initially, the owner was welcoming and attentive. However, once I declined the pricier service, her demeanor shifted markedly, and she diverted her focus away from me, even reallocating my nail technician to another customer without explanation. Despite my inquiries, I received no response regarding this change. Observing the owner's preferential treatment toward new arrivals confirmed my discomfort with their customer service approach. Ultimately, I left the salon without receiving any services. The experience highlighted a stark disregard from the owner, particularly towards patrons unwilling to pay exorbitantly. Regardless of the salon's claim to high-end status and use of quality products, such customer service is unacceptable.

This quaint spot in Belmawr offers a charming atmosphere with friendly service, though a tad slow. The ice cream doesn't stand out, especially considering the price, but it's a nice option for a quick sweet treat if you're in the area. It's not a destination spot, but it holds appeal for locals or those passing through seeking a bit of charm and a sugar fix.

Devlin's Auto Body Shop in Philadelphia has earned my highest recommendation for their exceptional work. My Honda Fit, marred by various nicks, dents, and ugly lime deposits, was expertly restored by them to a condition indistinguishable from new. Ed Devlin, the proprietor, is a true miracle worker, delivering top-notch results at surprisingly affordable prices. If you're in need of auto body repairs, look no further for unparalleled craftsmanship and value.

45 is the epitome of a neighborhood dive bar where the community vibe overshadows the haze of cigarette smoke that might deter some. It's a place where regulars are greeted by name, suggesting a welcoming, if slightly smoky, atmosphere that's reminiscent of the iconic "Cheers" bar. Despite the lack of distinctive features, this spot has carved out a niche for itself, thanks to its laid-back ambiance and friendly clientele.

The bar becomes a haven for sports enthusiasts during game days, offering a spread of complimentary food that adds a touch of homeliness rarely found in contemporary bars. Baseball fans, especially those cheering for the Red Sox, will find themselves in good company, though others might prefer to keep their team preferences under wraps. Additionally, the presence of a food truck parked outside provides a convenient option for a bite to eat, enhancing the establishment's appeal as a casual hangout spot.

Located conveniently near Tipitinas, 45 serves as an excellent choice for pre or post-concert gatherings, adding to its charm and utility for locals and visitors alike. While the smoke might be a point of contention for some, those looking for a relaxed and friendly atmosphere will find much to appreciate here.

The coffee here is undoubtedly excellent, offering rich flavors that might satisfy enthusiasts. However, be aware that if you're someone who prefers cream and sugar in your coffee, it isn't readily available; you're required to ask for it specifically. This approach can come across as somewhat pretentious and might be intimidating for those who simply want to enjoy their coffee their way without added hassle. While the quality of the coffee itself is not in question, the service style could be seen as unnecessarily complicated for those looking for a straightforward cup of joe.

Certainly! Here's a concise review based on your experience:

"This brunch spot has quickly become my favorite, primarily for their exceptional grits. It's challenging to venture into their other menu items when their grits are so perfectly crafted - not too grainy, not too watery, just absolute perfection. The portion sizes are generous, often shared unless I decide to indulge by myself. What elevates the experience is the customizable toppings ranging from avocados to mushrooms, each adding a unique touch to the dish at a minimal cost ($.50 to $1.00). Though I've yet to explore beyond this dish, the quality of the grits alone convinces me the rest of the menu must be equally amazing. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy a hearty, customizable brunch option!"

This establishment impresses with its outstanding staff and consistently delightful offerings, particularly the highly recommended chili cheese etoufee, which is an absolute standout. However, it falls just short of perfection, receiving a 4 out of 5 stars due to its cash-only policy, which may inconvenience some patrons. On the upside, the option to dine outdoors on pleasant evenings adds a charming touch to the experience. A pro tip for visitors: don’t miss out on the garlic sauce for an extra flavor kick.

This establishment boasts an impressive view from its outside tables, making it an appealing spot for those looking to enjoy the scenery. While it offers typical beach fare and service, which may not stand out, it remains a pleasant place to enjoy a drink while taking in the surroundings.

This review enthusiastically praises "All About Hair," with the author expressing a desire to award it beyond the maximum Yelp! rating, hinting at a truly exceptional experience. After enduring three years of disappointing haircuts elsewhere, the reviewer finally discovered this salon, highlighting its extraordinary service and quality. The barber, Lou, is commended not only for his excellent haircutting skills but also for providing engaging conversation and creating a welcoming atmosphere. The author, reinvigorated to write a review after a long hiatus, emphatically recommends All About Hair, indicating they have found their go-to barber and intend to remain a loyal customer for the long haul.

The updated visit maintains the destination as a suitable choice for children, despite a negative experience with derma bond leading to a scar on a young, active child. The reviewer expresses a desire for a flawless experience, highlighting a mix of satisfaction with the location but frustration with certain outcomes.

This hotel provides a unique experience with its spectacular views of the airport and the exclusive revolving rooftop restaurant. Being connected to the airport, guests have the convenience of easy access to a variety of restaurants and shops. Dining in the revolving rooftop restaurant offers a remarkable perspective, including clear sights of the runways and the control tower, enriching the stay with unforgettable vistas.
Absolutely love this place! Their turkey, beans, and biscuits are top-notch, though the pecan pie wasn't the best I've had. Despite that, I'm definitely coming back!

Visited this family-style restaurant and bar for the first time midday and found it bustling yet maintained cleanliness in both dining and restroom areas. The staff was welcoming and friendly. Although the large menu promises variety, my experience was limited to trying just a sandwich - solid but not enough for a full rating. The establishment boasts a respectable draft beer selection alongside wine and mixed drinks. A thoughtful touch for families includes crayons and large sheets of white paper on tables for children to draw on, enhancing the family-friendly atmosphere. A promising spot that invites a more extensive taste test in the future.

The restaurant offers delicious seafood, with the crab cocktail being particularly delightful and the steamers earning high praise from my husband. However, the dining experience was somewhat marred by the restaurant's pervasive humidity. The addition of a fan or better ventilation would greatly enhance comfort levels.

Freddy's offers an exceptional fast-food dining experience, boasting the finest burgers complemented by a wide array of fresh toppings and quality meat. The fries are standout delicious, especially when paired with their unique "fry" sauce. Not to be overlooked, their custard is a creamy, rich treat that rivals the excellence of their savory offerings. A visit to Freddy's is a delightful indulgence in both their meals and desserts.
This place offers fantastic donuts at great prices, with the blueberry cake donut and apple fritter standing out for their softness. Definitely worth a return visit.

I had previously enjoyed a fantastic visit to the Nashville location, so I was excited to try the New Orleans branch. Unfortunately, my experience fell short of expectations. Arriving around 10pm, my party and I were not welcomed or attended to for over ten minutes. Seeking information at the bar, we were informed about delays in the kitchen, but offered no further assistance or apology. After a 25-minute wait without service, we reluctantly decided to leave, especially disheartening after a three-hour drive for a weekend outing. This lack of hospitality and service was surprising and disappointing, particularly from a well-known establishment that caters to both adults and children. I hope this incident is not indicative of a broader issue within the chain and that steps will be taken to improve customer service.

Allegro's stands out for its superb offerings, especially for pizza aficionados on a budget. The joint serves up delicious, wallet-friendly slices at an impressive speed, making it a popular go-to for quick bites. Among the favorites, the Sicilian pizza takes the crown, closely followed by a hearty meat variety, and any of their stuffed options, despite occasional cold centers. While I can't vouch for their beer selection due to age restrictions during my time in Philadelphia, it's worth noting that Allegro's does cater to those looking to enjoy a drink with their meal. However, the experience might be slightly marred by the occasional rude service and the presence of unsettling individuals frequently seen loitering outside the establishment.

The Peppermill in Reno consistently impresses with its exceptional service, elevating each stay to a memorable experience. My loyalty to this casino is rewarded with remarkable perks such as complimentary nights and generous free play credits. It boasts the "loosest slots" according to casino ratings, enhancing the gaming experience. The accommodations are spotless, the bathrooms are refreshingly scented, and the beds are free of pests, ensuring a comfortable stay. The casino's ambiance, reminiscent of classic establishments with its dazzling array of lights and neon signs, coupled with the nostalgic scent of argon, adds to its unique charm. Their daily happy hour at the Fireside Lounge, offering affordable mini appetizers and martinis, is not to be missed. The Fish Bar, with its stunning 40-foot aquarium, provides a tranquil dining environment. The Peppermill's diverse culinary options within the casino mean guests are spoilt for choice without needing to step outside. A standout aspect is the exceptionally friendly staff, a key factor in my repeated returns. However, newcomers should be wary of the potentially disorienting casino lights; thankfully, the casino-provided map on the key sleeve is a handy navigational aid. Overall, the Peppermill remains my top preference in Reno for its unparalleled service, engaging atmosphere, and delightful amenities.

My dining experience here was outstanding, marked by two impressive meals. The burger was excellent, and the pulled pork did not disappoint. My wife was very pleased with her egg white and goat cheese omelette. The beer selection was solid, complemented by a good spicy Bloody Mary. Moreover, the service was top-notch, and the eclectic playlist added to the ambiance. Highly recommend for a great dining experience.

During a concerning incident at Peppermill where a guest began assaulting others, I intervened to protect those around me. Despite my non-violent efforts to restrain the assailant until security arrived, my actions were met with a lack of gratitude. Subsequently, I was dismissed and threatened with trespassing. Follow-up attempts to address the situation with the establishment were ignored, leaving me disillusioned with their handling of the incident and customer service. This experience has dissuaded me from returning to Peppermill.

Review: Attending a conference at a vast convention center, which spans 5 miles and has up to 2,000 guestrooms, was an experience catered to varying budgets. Despite its size and the grandeur, finding affordable accommodations is feasible, particularly for students or those unwilling to splurge over $200/night on lodging. I opted for a budget-friendly hotel across the street, which, despite its lack of luxury at $55/night, was conveniently located near shuttle services and food outlets like Cracker Barrel and McDonald's.

The convention center itself is immaculately maintained, staffed by an impressively efficient team, and offers a broad array of services, including a well-coordinated shuttle service. Food and drink options within the center, like Wasabi and Paisano, although pricy (expect around $25 for a bento box), offer convenience and quality. However, for those looking to save, alternatives are available outside the convention center.

With a staggering attendance of 6,000 people, the event's organization, including lodging, shuttle service, and meal provisions, was noteworthy. Inside, the variety of eateries like Finleys Pub and STAX burger ensures that there's something for every palate, albeit at a convention center price. For entertainment and nightlife, options like FUSE and Jack Daniels are readily accessible within the convention grounds.

Overall, this convention center is a solid choice for both the budget-conscious and those looking to indulge, provided you plan adequately for lodging and meals. Its expansive layout, variety of services, and excellent maintenance make it a commendable venue for large-scale gatherings.

During our latest visit to a restaurant we've frequented for its lunch special pizzas, a disappointing change in service led us elsewhere. Previously, the kids enjoyed personalizing their pizzas, specifically requesting BBQ sauce instead of tomato sauce—a request that had been accommodated on multiple occasions. This time, however, we were inflexibly informed that only tomato sauce was available, despite BBQ sauce being listed as an option on the menu for other pizzas. Even after offering to pay extra, our request was denied. Regretfully, this has dissuaded us from returning, as we had to seek out another restaurant to satisfy our lunch plans.

This charming spot boasts incredibly friendly staff and delicious cookie dough that's a must-try. A delightful find, especially when lost in town. Highly recommended for its inviting ambiance and tasty treats.
The dining experience left much to be desired, particularly with underwhelming chips and salsa. The tacos were merely passable, failing to stand out as anything special.

This new spot in Reno is a delightful addition, especially for lovers of matcha and ube. They nail the authenticity of these flavors, offering a range of treats from soft serve to cake, all balanced perfectly without being too sweet. The friendly staff shows promise of growth and improvement, which is exciting. Here’s to hoping for an expanded flavor menu in the future!

This hidden gem, discovered via Yelp, offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere with a hip hop vibe. Despite its small menu, the offerings are impactful. The Duck Fries, a delightful mix of fries, smoked gouda, shredded duck, and scallions for $8, is a generously served must-try. The scallop and foie gras tacos are a standout, delivering an unforgettable taste experience, despite the ethical concerns around foie gras. The pork roll burger also impresses with its juiciness and perfect cooking. A place worthy of repeat visits for sure.

During my first night in New Orleans, I visited Three Muses, a spot renowned for its tapas-style dining perfectly suited for sharing. Amongst the delightful variety, my group and I indulged in blue cheese-stuffed dates, crawfish egg rolls, steak and cake, lamb sliders, feta fries, and fish tacos. While the overall culinary experience was commendable, the fish tacos were somewhat underwhelming. Conversely, the lamb sliders and steak and cake stood out as exceptional; the combination of goat cheese with lamb was particularly noteworthy, elevating the dish to a memorable delight. Similarly, the crab cake was unparalleled, easily the best I've ever savored.

This spot boasts a fantastic ambiance with its trendy and modern decor, creating a welcoming atmosphere for any diner. The presentation of each dish is thoughtfully crafted, adding to the overall dining experience. While the ambiance and presentation shine, the food itself falls a bit short; the potatoes were undercooked, and the pancakes were disappointingly greasy. Despite this, the potential in other dishes, like the promising French toast and omelette, warrants a return visit. Additionally, the prospect of trying their lunch menu is enticing. The service is another high point, with staff providing excellent encounters through and through. Overall, it's a place worth giving another shot, especially for those who appreciate a beautiful dining environment and superb service.

This dining spot dazzles with its exceptional offerings, serving up dynamite dishes complemented by super friendly service. The homemade flan stands out as a pièce de résistance, unmatched in its excellence. Prices align perfectly with the quality provided. Elevating this stellar experience further with a liquor license could skyrocket its appeal, making it an uncontested choice for enthusiasts seeking a remarkable culinary journey.

Enjoyed a delightful family breakfast at this gem of a spot after a brief stopover. The service was commendable, with a special shoutout to Jonathan for his outstanding hospitality. Despite its bustling ambiance on a Saturday, we were pleasantly surprised by the absence of any waiting time. Definitely a place worth visiting for its excellent food and service.

During a family visit, we ventured out for some Southern cuisine initially eyeing Willie Mae's but were deterred by the long line and the neighborhood's ambiance. Instead, we ended up at The Praline Connection, a decision that quickly proved to be a culinary delight, especially for my dad. He was thoroughly impressed with the Taste of Soul platter, proclaiming the fried chicken as unparalleled and the red beans and rice nostalgically reminiscent of his mother’s cooking. My mom enjoyed her meatloaf, paired with cabbage and lima beans, while I opted for the ribs, potato salad, and mac and cheese. While the ribs were a challenge to eat neatly, the effort was worth it, though I found my mac and cheese lacking in flavor. The cornbread, however, was a unanimous hit. The visit left a lasting impression, particularly on my dad, who hasn't stopped praising the meal since. I'm looking forward to returning for the fried chicken that I missed out on this time around.

Buddy Brew in Tampa's Hyde Park Village stands out both for its trendy atmosphere and its flavorful coffee, complete with beautiful latte art reminiscent of New York-style coffee shops. The modern design of the store adds to its charm, making it a visually appealing place to enjoy a cup. However, the limited seating and overly cold interior might make longer visits less comfortable, suggesting that grabbing your coffee to go and exploring the surrounding area could be a more enjoyable experience. Plus, the benefit of free parking adds convenience to your visit.

**V Vegaz Salon Review**

Nestled in the East Loop, directly across from the Pageant, lies V Vegaz - a gem of a salon that arguably deserves more spotlight. As a male client with notably difficult hair, my quest for the perfect stylist ended here. From my first encounter as a walk-in to becoming a regular, the satisfaction level has never dipped.

The salon itself boasts a spacious interior that strikes a balance between modern and baroque design elements, creating a welcoming and stylish atmosphere. The positive ambiance is noticeable among the stylists too, which, in my experience, often translates to better service and results.

My go-to stylist, Callie, combines friendliness with exceptional skill. Despite my indecisive tendencies, she consistently delivers cuts that understand the nature of my hair and meet my style aspirations. The ultimate testament to her expertise is the compliments I receive weeks post-appointment, affording a clear indicator of the quality and longevity of her work.

Although I haven't explored their coloring services, V Vegaz positions itself as a full-service salon far from the typical 'turn and burn' establishment. Based on my experiences and the overall vibe of the place, I wholeheartedly recommend giving this salon a try. Whether you're after a straightforward trim or something edgier, V Vegaz seems to cover all bases with aplomb.

The service provided by the lady at this establishment is nothing short of exceptional.
