Faced with a tight deadline, needing multiple complex alterations, including hemming pants and shortening the sleeves of a lined suit jacket, she delivered outstanding work within a day. Not only were the alterations completed swiftly, but they were also executed with a high level of craftsmanship, resulting in a perfectly fitting suit. Additionally, the convenience of accepting all credit cards, including Amex, and maintaining reasonable hours further enhances the customer experience. An unequivocal recommendation for anyone in need of professional tailoring services. A guaranteed return customer here.

**Review of The Irish Pol**

**Initial Discovery:** On a quest for a late-night spot after an unsatisfactory attempt at Plough and the Stars, my friends and I stumbled upon The Irish Pol, an unmarked gem that caught our eye. Our first visit was marked by a great selection of beers on tap and a lively crowd, making for an unexpectedly fun Saturday night. After some effort, we managed to locate it again on Yelp, thrilled to rediscover our accidental find.

**Return Visit - Happy Hour:** My recent return to The Irish Pol during happy hour painted a different picture. The ambiance felt darker and less inviting than remembered, with a noticeably older and sparse crowd, contributing to an odd vibe overall. Despite the exceptional beer quality, the happy hour deal of $3 drafts was a bit of a letdown since many of my preferred options weren't included in the special.

**Final Thoughts:** While my happy hour experience didn’t live up to the initial visit's spontaneous charm, The Irish Pol remains a solid choice for a Saturday night out, thanks to its impressive beer selection and livelier atmosphere during weekends. However, I might skip the happy hour in the future and return when it's more bustling.

This Italian restaurant has just become my top choice, thanks to what is undoubtedly the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever enjoyed. Its cozy and welcoming atmosphere only enhances the dining experience, making it a standout favorite.

Our outing at Happy Hour was a delightful culinary adventure, highlighted by the irresistible offer of 50 cent oysters and half-price drinks. We indulged in these bargains before moving on to the main course. The beet salad was divine, an opinion shared by all. We also savored the mussels and flammenkuchen, the latter of which I had the pleasure of enjoying as my entree. Having first experienced flammenkuchen (or tarte flambe) in Strasbourg, I found this rendition to supremely surpass that initial encounter. The combination of caramelized onions and generous chunks of bacon atop the cheese was exceptionally delicious. Overall, an excellent dining experience.

I've dined at this restaurant three times and each visit was thoroughly enjoyable for both myself and the kids. The ambiance is perfect—no smoke, no noise—coupled with good food and service. Our visits have all been on late Tuesday afternoons, which might contribute to the pleasant experience. Every time, I've tried something new from the menu and have never been disappointed with my choice. I'm definitely planning on returning for more delightful meals.

This pizza place delivers a fantastic experience with its delicious pizzas, beautiful setting, and inviting atmosphere. Coupled with very nice and swift service, it comes highly recommended for a great dining experience.

Had a fantastic dining experience at Richard's downtown. The meal began with a fresh Caesar salad and lovely bread, setting a high standard. The cheese ravioli served with a pesto cream sauce was a highlight; the sauce complemented the delicate pasta beautifully without overwhelming it. Pairing the meal with the Dunham cabernet was an excellent choice, enhancing the overall enjoyment. Richard's has certainly made a splendid entrance to the downtown dining scene. Delicious and highly recommended.

Enjoyed a delightful breakfast experience here last weekend. The ordering process was straightforward, with meals brought directly to the table. I indulged in delectable French toast accompanied by fruit and an à la carte fried egg, which was quickly replaced after an accidental drop. The vanilla latte was perfectly sweetened, eliminating the need for additional sugar. Opting to sit on the charming patio enhanced the meal further, although the interior also promises a pleasant ambiance with its openness to fresh breezes, reminiscent of other venues in the French Quarter. Overall, a truly pleasant visit.

My visit to this cafe proved to be a delightful start before church, welcomed by a cozy atmosphere and attentive staff who ensured we felt acknowledged throughout. The menu offered classics and my choice of quiche, alongside my guest's croque madame, promised a hearty meal. However, the execution fell slightly short with an underdone quiche crust and lackluster bread diminishing the potential of our dishes. On a brighter note, the freshness of the fruit and the quality of the coffee contributed to an overall positive dining experience. Despite the minor setbacks with the main courses, the ambience and service have cemented my decision to return.

Our visit to Salty's was thoroughly enjoyable, marking it as a must-return destination for future visits. The restaurant caters well to families, evidenced by its extensive kid's menu offering a variety of child-friendly dishes, including burgers, Alfredo pasta, chicken, shrimp, and quesadillas. Our dining experience began with the Crabby Dip, which, despite being a bit pricy at $14, was a hit with the whole family. The highlights of our meal were the Salty Burger and the macadamia-crusted grouper - both of which we highly recommend. Coupled with flawless service, Salty's delivered a five-star dining experience that we look forward to repeating.

During our recent visit, we experienced some unfortunate health issues after consuming chili beef nachos and a chicken burrito, leading to considerable discomfort. Normally, we are repeat customers, primarily due to the excellent shredded beef, which prompted us to try different menu items this time. We hope this incident was an isolated issue and look forward to better experiences in the future.

"This venue delivers an impressive throwback ambiance with an excellent music selection, making it a fantastic place. However, it falls short of a perfect score, earning 4 stars due to its limited seating arrangement, accommodating only the first 15 attendees in line."

This brief review suggests a strong dissatisfaction with the experience at the establishment in question, advising potential customers to consider dining at either Blue Fin or Masamoto instead. The lack of detail hints at an encounter that significantly failed expectations, prompting the reviewer to recommend alternatives without elaboration.

Title: Adequate Stay for a Bachelorette Party in Santa Barbara

I recently stayed at the BW Pepper Tree Inn for a bachelorette party. Given the high accommodation prices in Santa Barbara, this hotel offered a reasonably priced option at $250 per night, significantly lower than many others charging $400+.

**Pros:**
- The pricing was competitive for the area.
- Rooms were clean, cozy, and featured charming exteriors and well-maintained grounds.
- Beds were relatively comfortable.
- Amenities included Bath and Body Works products and complimentary water bottles and fruit.

**Cons:**
- The hotel's decor felt outdated.
- We experienced issues with the toilet, which required a temporary fix and could have necessitated maintenance.
- Opening the room's door required a special technique, which was inconvenient.
- The absence of a hairdryer and complimentary breakfast was noted.
- Some morning noise was present, potentially due to an open bathroom window for ventilation, but it wasn't overly disturbing.

In retrospect, despite some minor inconveniences, the BW Pepper Tree Inn was a suitable choice for our needs. It balanced affordability with comfort and convenience, aligning well with our location preferences and budget for the bachelorette party.

At Johnny Rockets, the nostalgic charm of a good old-fashioned meal never disappoints, and my recent experience with their barbecued pulled pork burger promo only reaffirmed this belief. The dish itself was a delightful overload of both portion and taste, perfectly complemented by their offer of endless fries, ensuring a heartily satisfying dining experience. Despite several visits, I've consistently enjoyed great service at this location, which maintains its high standards even after the move from the casino floor to the shopping level. Although the relocation meant an end to the entertaining singing and dancing performances once characteristic of the ambiance here, the quality and enjoyment of the meals stand unaffected, keeping Johnny Rockets a favorite spot for a reliably good meal.

This salon is in unacceptable condition, being both dirty and poorly maintained, with visible dust and cobwebs throughout. The equipment used is outdated and not properly cared for. Furthermore, the professionalism is deeply lacking, as my nail technician was distracted by YouTube videos during my appointment. It's baffling that this establishment has not been closed by health authorities for these glaring issues.

I wholeheartedly support local businesses and this place is a prime example of why. They boast a large selection that rivals even the big players in the industry. Plus, the free popcorn really sets them apart. It's a no-brainer – why pay for popcorn elsewhere when you can come here, enjoy a vast variety, and get your popcorn for free? Highly recommend for a truly enjoyable and supportive local shopping experience.

This beloved tea spot continues to impress with its super friendly and knowledgeable staff, spacious seating perfect for mid-sized gatherings, and of course, its fantastic selection of delicious teas. The "Awake" Fizz Tea remains a favorite, though venturing into the world of bubble teas with the taro flavor proved to be an unexpectedly thrilling experience, despite the mini anxiety attacks caused by the suspense of encountering a pearl. The only drawback is the mismatched music, which, although distracting, is easily remedied by bringing your own headphones. Overall, still a highly recommended spot for tea enthusiasts and group meet-ups alike.

Yah Man truly delivers an exceptional dining experience with its vibrant atmosphere, attentive personal service, and mouth-watering Caribbean cuisine. From the beef pie and chicken to the island sampler plates, every dish is a flavor-packed delight, with the bread pudding being an absolute must-try. This place is a treasure for both locals in the Tampa area and visitors alike, promising a meal that leaves you both full and immensely satisfied. The commendation from a customer who felt compelled to share their positive experience on Yelp for the third time speaks volumes. Yah Man is a standout recommendation for anyone craving authentic Caribbean fare accompanied by a genuinely welcoming vibe.

**Review of a Hidden Gem in New Orleans**

If you're ever in New Orleans and looking for a cozy yet vibrant spot away from the crowded tourist scenes, this backyard bar is a must-visit. It's a sanctuary for those who appreciate good wine, great cheese, and the soulful sound of local music. Ideal for smaller groups, as seating is somewhat limited, this place offers an intimate atmosphere that's hard to find.

At the front, there's a wine and cheese bar where the magic begins. You can select from three or more cheeses to have a personalized cheese tray crafted for you, complete with delightful accompaniments. The selection of wines is impressive, boasting a breadth that caters to various palates, all within a mid-range price point (expect most bottles to be in the $10-20 range).

The live music venue tucked in the back is where this place truly shines. It serves as a great escape and a perfect spot to unwind and enjoy the night enveloped in excellent music.

This spot has a reputation for being a local favorite, so while it escapes the frenzy of more prominent tourist locales, it has its own buzz. For a night of relaxation, great tunes, and fine wine, this venue stands out as a favorite in the heart of New Orleans.

Enjoyed a delightful lunch experience. The chicken Caesar I selected was excellent, and my friend's custom salad met their expectations. Our waitress was notably friendly and accommodating, providing us ample time to dine without feeling rushed. This restaurant offers a wonderfully secluded ambiance, making it a hidden gem. A highly recommended spot for both food quality and service.

Disappointment tinges our latest experience at a venue we've previously held in high regard, due to a significant lapse in reservation management. Despite making a reservation over a week in advance with a specific request to be seated near the band, we were greeted with no record of our booking upon arrival. As a result, we found ourselves relegated to a less desirable spot next to the bathroom, a stark contrast to our expectations. The oversight was attributed to an admission by the staff that the person who took the reservation was new. This incident highlights a critical breakdown in communication and organization within the establishment.

On a positive note, the aspects that have consistently drawn us back remained impeccable. The cocktails, food, band, and overall atmosphere maintained their excellence, deserving of a five-star rating. These elements, true to the establishment's reputation, provided some consolation for the evening's earlier disappointments.

This experience serves as a cautionary tale about the importance of confirming reservations, especially when special requests are involved. While the venue continues to shine in its culinary and entertainment offerings, the unfortunate neglect in reservation handling has slightly marred our otherwise fantastic experiences here. We hope this is an isolated incident that will be rectified moving forward, allowing the establishment to fully embody the high standards it's known for.

My husband and I had a fantastic experience at this professional tattoo shop and are thrilled with our new ink. Bryan was exceptional in his work, and I highly recommend him for anyone looking to get a tattoo. The staff were all incredibly friendly, further solidifying this place's status as the city's top tattoo parlor. If you're visiting, remember they've moved to a new location at 1418 N. Clairborne, Suite 5, upstairs.

This reviewer expresses deep appreciation for a wine tasting venue in Santa Barbara, highlighting its unparalleled views and exceptional wines as major attractions. They emphasize the hospitability and generosity of hosts Tom and Gillian, suggesting that these qualities contribute significantly to the overall pleasant experience. The reviewer, along with their spouse who is employed at Carr Winery, frequently recommends this place to others, underscoring the exceptional quality of Conway cabs as the best in Santa Barbara. A specific instance of generosity detailed involves a gift of Conway 13 reserve Syrah from a tasting room employee, further showcasing the personalized and thoughtful service received. The reviewer also mentions "Rolos red" as a wine that appeals both to connoisseurs and those new to wine tasting, indicating the venue's ability to cater to a wide range of palates. The family-friendly aspect of this venue is subtly hinted at through the mention of their son's eagerness to visit, suggesting a welcoming atmosphere for all ages. Overall, the review is glowingly positive, encapsulating the venue's exceptional wine, service, and hospitality.

This draft latte exceeds expectations with its exceptional taste, meriting high praise. Additionally, the friendly interaction, including a compliment on my tie from the staff, made the experience even more delightful. Overall, a perfect score of 10/10 for both product quality and service.

This establishment earns high praise for its exceptional cuisine, with the BBQ shrimp highlighted as a standout dish. Fans of truffle will delight in the generous portions of truffle fries and the sumptuous truffle butter filet mignon. For those with a sweet tooth, both the bread pudding and white chocolate brownie come highly recommended, rounding off a truly exquisite dining experience.

This establishment offers an unparalleled atmosphere, truly unique compared to any other wine and cheese experiences. Upon entry, guests are invited to choose their own wine along with a selection of cheeses and meats from a thoughtfully arranged refrigerator. After purchase, the selected items are transformed into an exquisite cheese board complete with nuts, spreads, and artisan bread, all served at your chosen seating area, which is adaptable to weather conditions. The quality and presentation are commendable, and additional menu options are available for those seeking more. For an intimate, satisfying experience, this venue comes highly recommended. The concept of selecting your ingredients for a custom cheese board elevates the dining experience, making it memorable and fulfilling.

"This restaurant offers an incredibly pleasant dining experience, truly one of the best in recent memory. The proprietor, Smiley, adds a delightful touch with his warm and inviting presence. The food is outstanding - so good, in fact, that leftovers are eagerly anticipated for lunch the following day. Highly recommend to anyone in the Manayunk area; this is a gem we must support and keep!"

This dining spot offers above average steaks that delight the palate, complemented by great service that enhances the overall experience. Its wine list is notable for its excellence, providing a perfect pairing for the meal. It stands commendably alongside prestigious establishments like Ocean Prime and Ruth's Chris, making it a sterling choice for those seeking quality dining.

I dined at this restaurant on a Sunday with a friend and had a mixed experience. The seating arrangement was unexpected, as we were placed next to another party with only a small partition for separation, which seems to be the norm for smaller parties. The compact size of the restaurant contributed to a louder atmosphere. On a positive note, the service was commendable. As for the food, it was satisfactory but didn't particularly stand out. We ordered the Kale Caesar and the Fried Chicken with mac n' cheese. Unfortunately, they were out of watermelon, so we had to substitute the accompanying salad for the chicken dish. The highlight of the meal was the creatively presented soft egg in the Kale Caesar, encased in a crispy shell with a perfectly runny yolk inside.

This establishment fell short of expectations primarily due to unsatisfactory service and lackluster beer selection. Despite following instructions to find our own table, the wait staff repeatedly ignored our presence. The service was slow, notably when waiting for a flight of their beers, which ultimately failed to impress. One of the beers even had a displeasing soapy taste. Compared to other breweries where trying a flight is a delightful way to discover a favorite, this experience was decidedly underwhelming.

Visited this breakfast spot twice and encountered a series of disappointments on both occasions. The establishment seems to struggle with a coherent service protocol, particularly on Saturday mornings. Staff appeared disorganized and stressed, frequently engaging in unprofessional behavior, including cursing and yelling at the line cook, which contributed to an uncomfortable atmosphere.

The ordering system is inconsistent, oscillating between counter service and random tableside service. Self-serve options for beverages are limited to subpar coffee and bottled drinks, further diminishing the dining experience. While awaiting food under the discomfort of direct sunlight due to a lack of window shades, expectations for a pleasant meal dwindled.

The quality of food was a mixed bag; the pulled pork Texas wrap was marred by grizzle, though the cornbread pancakes did offer a redeeming taste. The payment process, oddly structured post-meal, unnecessarily extended interactions with the seemingly inexperienced staff.

Regrettably, I recommended this place to a visiting relative for brunch, only to apologize later for the overall lackluster experience. Although the prices are low, it hardly compensates for the subpar service and average food quality. This establishment might appeal to those on a tight budget, but it's advisable to temper expectations, especially for those accustomed to traditional breakfast service.

This Greek diner is a classic gem offering delicious options, with the Greek omelette being a standout choice. Featuring a flavorful combination of feta, gyro meat, tomato, and spinach, it's a must-try. The classic griddle home fries complement the meal perfectly, and the outstanding service only enhances the dining experience. It's definitely a place we plan to visit again when back in the area.

Visited for a meal and underwent a disappointing service experience. Seated for over half an hour, the only items served were miso soup and drinks. Faced significant delays in the arrival of the ordered food, with no one attending to cook or serve the meal. The long wait without updates or main dishes was frustrating.

This doctor is exceptional in every aspect of their practice, blending professionalism with a genuinely friendly approach. Their attentiveness ensures that patients feel thoroughly heard and cared for, while their sense of humor adds a comforting, light-hearted atmosphere to consultations. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a great medical experience.

Discovered this delightful spot while craving Ramen, but surprisingly, it wasn't the Ramen that stole my heart. Comparatively, the Ramen didn't shine as brightly next to those I've savored in NY. However, the real star of the show was the Steven roll - an exquisite recommendation that left me utterly impressed. Among the best rolls I've ever indulged in, it turned my meal into a memorable experience. Eagerly looking forward to returning on my next Philly visit.

This dining experience was deeply disappointing, particularly due to the biased service seemingly based on age and appearance. Despite spending $80, the service received was lackluster; our waitress prioritized older, seemingly wealthier patrons in suits, engaging with them frequently while neglecting to check on us, with intervals as long as 30 to 40 minutes. Our steaks were served without any follow-up on their preparation, and management failed to inquire about our meal satisfaction - a courtesy extended to other tables. This preferential treatment marred the overall dining experience, underscoring a need for the establishment to address and rectify its approach to customer service.

The Paris Hair Salon offers a warm and inviting experience with a team that truly excels in handling all hair types, especially thick and unruly hair. Their dedication to taking the time to get it right shines through in the impeccable results they deliver - from cuts to color and highlights, everything is perfect every time. Moreover, the pricing is very reasonable. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch hair services. -Maureen Kerfoot

This review captures a blend of excitement and frustration experienced by a Chick-Fil-A enthusiast. The initial enthusiasm of having a new Chick-Fil-A location nearby quickly fades due to operational inefficiencies observed at the Nashville location. The reviewer highlights a particularly perplexing issue with the drive-thru setup, noting both its unusual positioning around the front of the restaurant and the local patrons' confusing interactions with the double-lane system. Despite these frustrations, the reviewer gives credit for the provision of free WiFi, which serves as a small consolation for the extended wait times they endure. Ultimately, the reviewer decides to forego visiting this location, preferring to wait until they can visit other locations where they presumably encounter fewer inconveniences. This narrative underscores the importance of efficient service and thoughtful architectural planning in ensuring customer satisfaction, even for beloved brands.

I had a very satisfying experience at this restaurant, highlighted by efficient service and the convenience of pre-paying for the meal, allowing for a relaxed dining atmosphere. The food impressed with its freshness and flavor, particularly the chicken taco salad and the plantains. The mojito was a standout among the drinks. I look forward to returning and exploring more of their offerings.

Last week, I had the pleasure of working with Sultans of Schlep for a small move within center city and I couldn't be happier with the experience. Tom, who is remarkably attentive and easy to engage with, ensures a smooth process from start to finish. Their pricing is fair, reflecting genuine value for the service provided. The moving team was punctual and showed great efficiency in their work, plus the addition of wardrobe boxes at no extra charge was a thoughtful touch. Moreover, their unique and humorous name adds a fun aspect to the moving experience. Based on my extremely positive experience, I would not hesitate to enlist their services again.

Had an amazing pedicure experience here; the place is clean, elegant, and efficient, with no wait time. The staff are knowledgeable and skilled, making for a fantastic visit. Can't speak to the massage services, but would highly recommend their pedicures.

Yats stands out as the pinnacle of Cajun cuisine we've had the pleasure to experience, offering not only exceptional flavors but also great value for money. The ever-changing menu, whimsically decided daily and presented on a chalkboard, ensures a delightful culinary surprise with every visit. This unpredictability adds charm and excitement, making Yats a cherished dining spot for my wife and me.

I had a pleasant experience at this pizza place, initially drawn in by the extensive menu. Opting for a quick meal, I chose a roast beef sandwich, which turned out to be incredibly tasty. Although the preparation time was a tad lengthy, about 15 to 20 minutes, the quality made up for the wait. The lack of in-house seating was a drawback, but the nearby community patio offered a decent alternative. Though I haven't yet sampled their pizza, its reputation certainly piqued my interest for a future visit.

Visited on July 4th holiday and had a fantastic experience at this medical facility. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful throughout. My daughter suffered from ear pain, and the nurse showed tremendous compassion and patience, making multiple attempts to alleviate the issue. Despite his efforts, it was the doctor who successfully removed a sizable wax blockage. We were prescribed antibiotics, which we conveniently filled at a cheaper price at Target located in the same shopping center. This place proved to be an excellent choice for immediate care while on a beach vacation. Highly grateful for their service!

Absolutely outstanding veggie wings, arguably the best I've ever had, making them an unforgettable choice. The fried pickles also stand out as a delicious option. However, their drinks tend to be on the weaker side, leading me to prefer a Mexican coke during my visits. A must-visit for their standout vegetarian options.

This quaint diner offers a distinct ambiance that sets it apart from the usual, providing a good atmosphere for dining. While the Yankee pot roast and mashed potatoes were just average, lacking in flavor, the vegetables impressed with their freshness, clearly not sourced from a can. On the other hand, the omelette was well-received, deemed good by my wife. Adding to the positive experience was the excellent service, which contributed to the overall enjoyment of our visit.
Unsatisfactory experience with the Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box, marked notably by the absence of rice - a surprising lapse for a bento. Zero stars.

The critique suggests a strong desire for a significant change in Brooke's musical direction, specifically calling for an end to her current pop EDM style. This sentiment implies a request for freshness or diversity in her music.

The hotel offers great value for its price, boasting an excellent location and satisfactory accommodations, including decently sized rooms. However, the bed's firmness and the roughness of the sheets were minor drawbacks. Despite these issues, the overall experience was positive enough to warrant a return stay.

The restaurant impresses with its culinary offerings – from perfectly cooked pasta, delicious chicken parm, to good pizza. What stands out even more is the exceptional service. Despite the bustling environment, a single cashier/waitress manages everything seamlessly, leaving a lasting impression of efficiency and dedication.

"An absolute gem for first-timers, this spot offers not only delicious food but an unbeatable beachfront ambience that truly sets it apart. Dining outside with the serenade of waves and an icy beer in hand is an experience not to be missed. Whether you're local or a drive away, it's worth the journey. Already looking forward to my next visit!"

I recently attended a party that showcased their new private room, complete with its own bar and bathroom, which I found exceptionally convenient. The ambiance was perfect for socializing, as it was possible to actually hear one another without the usual struggle. The buffet provided was satisfying, and the no-wait access to drinks was a significant plus. Based on my experience, I would wholeheartedly recommend hosting a party there.

My first visit to LF exceeded my expectations, thanks to Tori. As a first-timer, I was apprehensive but Tori instantly put me at ease. She skillfully transformed the hairstyle I desired from a picture into reality, demonstrating her attention to detail and expertise. Beyond just styling, she generously shared tailored advice for my fine and thin hair, including a list of the products she used. The salon itself was spotless and contemporary, enhancing the overall experience. Additionally, finding parking was surprisingly easy, even on a Saturday. Highly recommend for a seamless and satisfying salon experience.

This dining experience was a delightful surprise, highlighted by an exceptional burger that boasted terrific flavor, expert cooking, and an excellent seasoning. Accompanied by generous servings of homemade potato chips along with sweet potatoes and waffle fries, the meal was both satisfying and impressive. The ambiance of the outdoor patio added to the enjoyment, although the presence of smoking in the vicinity was a detractor. Our waiter, Jesse, provided outstanding service, making our visit even more enjoyable. Recommended by a friend, this gem is slightly off the beaten path but proves to be entirely worth the journey for its delicious offerings. We will definitely be returning.

I've been a loyal client of Mark's for over two years, having transitioned from upscale salons like Dominic Michael where I was accustomed to paying $35 plus tip per haircut. My initial visit to Blades was influenced by knowing the owner had prior salon experience, which reassured me of the quality I could expect. Without fail, Mark has proven himself to be not only a fantastic stylist but also a genuinely great person. Each visit leaves me thoroughly satisfied with my cut. Highly recommend!

This restaurant boasts a modern decor that appears particularly appealing to a younger demographic, making it an excellent spot for people in their 20s. The culinary experience, specifically the mahi mahi served with pita chips and hummus, did not disappoint; the dish was delightful, featuring tender and well-seasoned fish. Furthermore, the service quality was commendable, ensuring an overall satisfying dining experience.

This establishment stands out as the premier destination for dim sum in Reno, offering an exceptional dining experience that leaves patrons craving for more. The quality of the dim sum here is unparalleled, feeling fresh and meticulously prepared, as opposed to the pre-frozen offerings at places like CaiE's Oriental Cafe. The menu, while desired to be broader, boasts signature favorites like chicken feet and siu mai that keep diners returning. For those unable to journey to Sacramento for their dim sum fix, this locale is the unequivocal choice.

Moreover, the restaurant offers delightful combo meals that cater to a variety of tastes. The sesame chicken paired with fried rice is a personal favorite, while options like beef and broccoli or shrimp and vegetables satisfy a diverse range of palates. Each combo is thoughtfully complemented with an appetizer and/or a warming hot cup of soup, making for a thoroughly enjoyable dining experience. Whether you're a dim sum aficionado or simply in search of a hearty meal, this place promises satisfaction with its quality offerings and inviting atmosphere.

Despite arriving with a sizeable group of eight, our dining experience was surprisingly swift and seamless, debunking the widely reported crowd issue. Fortuitously, we encountered no wait, diving straight into our meals amidst a surprisingly vacant parking lot - save for a minor mishap with a car door that left me nursing my pancreas.

Our server, whose name regrettably escapes me, navigated our rowdy demands with commendable grace and efficiency, earning her high praise. Opting for the ever-tempting cheeseburger and fries combo, I was not disappointed. The burger was flawlessly cooked to satisfaction, the fries perfected to an ideal crispiness, and my glass consistently refilled without prompt.

The collective satisfaction of us eight diners spoke volumes, with not a single complaint surfacing. Reflecting on the visit, it was unequivocally a delightful dining experience, marked by exceptional service and culinary merit.
The Bayou Burger impresses as the best burger experience ever encountered, complemented by exceptional service. Highly recommended.

I had an exceptional experience hosting a corporate event in a private dining room, which offered a limited yet impressive food menu and bar. The service was impeccable - professional, attentive, and discreet. The culinary offerings, from the inventive hors d'oeuvres to the divine lobster consommé and the perfectly cooked and seasoned filet, were nothing short of extraordinary. Each dish was a delight, with portions that were both satisfying and luxurious. Additionally, the breathtaking view from our private room elevated the experience, surpassing even that of the main dining area. This venue had previously left me wanting during a crowded happy hour, but this private event completely changed my perspective. I wholeheartedly recommend it for any special event and look forward to returning for a personal celebration.

Lazos shines as a top choice for pizza in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area, standing out among at least five other tried options. The pepperoni pizza impresses with its slightly crispy texture, a definite highlight. Equally surprising are the wings, which manage to avoid the common pitfall of sogginess, presenting a satisfying crispiness instead. Although there was a minor mix-up with the beverage, receiving Sprite instead of Coke, this did little to detract from the overall high-quality pizza and wings experience. Definitely a combo worth reordering!

This dining spot takes you back with its old-school decor, featuring dark woods and what may be a genuine copper tile ceiling, adding to its charm. The express lunch is an exceptional value, offering a choice of soup followed by the entree of the day. The gumbo and crab bisque, both standout options, were executed perfectly. The gumbo was rich, with andouille sausage that provided a subtle kick, while the crab bisque was delicately seasoned with what appeared to be an old bay-style mixture, containing just the right amount of shredded crab without being overly salty. The main course, a garganelli with roast pork ragu, mushrooms, and Creole tomatoes, was delightful. The sauce was light yet flavorful, marrying the ingredients seamlessly. The roast pork was the star, being fork-tender and caramelized to perfection, leaving a lasting impression and a desire for more. In short, this restaurant delivers on both atmosphere and culinary delight, making it a must-visit for those in search of quality dining with a nostalgic twist.

This hotel offers an excellent stay with its prime location. It's perfectly placed within walking distance to popular spots, being just a 1-2 minute walk to Bourbon Street bars, 7-8 min to Harrah's, and a 10 min stroll to Jackson Square. The friendly staff adds to the experience, providing great assistance throughout the stay. However, the notable downside is the steep parking fee of $38 per night.

This store left a great impression with its wide selection of notable brands like Chloe, Marc Jacobs, and Chanel, highlighted by the find of Chanel pumps for an exceptional $87, although the size was not a perfect fit. The store currently offers summer sales, enhancing its already appealing price range and reinforcing the value for money it provides. It caters well to those who prioritize quality over price, willing to invest $100 in a silky blouse that could typically retail for over $300, making it a highly recommended go-to store for quality fashion purchases. The shopping experience is further elevated by the friendly and welcoming staff, adding a personal touch to every visit.

My experience at this venue has been mixed, primarily due to organizational and service issues. Despite winning a free happy hour, communication with the management was frustratingly poor; my attempts to confirm details were met with unhelpful responses, and ultimately, my reservation was forgotten upon arrival, leading to unnecessary hassle. Although the issue was resolved, the process was irritating.

As for the venue policies and environment, the strict dress code wasn't a drawback for me personally. However, the overall atmosphere is hampered by unfriendly staff, including bouncers and bartenders, and a less-than-welcoming crowd that seems focused on drinking heavily before moving on. I did not try the food, so I can't comment on that aspect.

While the prospect of free alcohol is a plus, it's not enough to compensate for the negatives encountered. I would likely only return for similar complimentary events and would hesitate to recommend this place based on my experiences.

Based on a recent visit to a 7 Eleven, the reviewer had mixed feelings. They praised the store for its cleanliness, spaciousness, and visually appealing selection of prepared meals. However, their experience took a negative turn at checkout due to a pricing dispute. The customer found the pricing of plastic cups to be incorrectly high and was initially overcharged. Despite a correction attempt made by the cashier after consulting with a manager, the revised price was still viewed as unreasonable by the customer. This incident led the reviewer to question the integrity of the store's management and left them with an overall unfavorable impression. The racial undertones expressed by the customer in their recounting add an unnecessary and inappropriate dimension to the critique, detracting from the valid consumer concern regarding pricing transparency and fairness.

This nail salon delivers a profoundly disappointing customer experience. Staff behavior is shockingly unprofessional; one customer received a rude remark for a simple accident, while another was disrespectfully told to file her own nails upon seeking specific service. The service quality is as poor as the attitude, characterized by hasty and inept work. Despite numerous negative reviews, this establishment has failed to make any improvements, indicating a concerning disregard for customer satisfaction.

"Amidst a week of scorching heat, this gelateria proves to be a haven of delicious relief, expertly ignoring the health-conscious whispers of calories and diabetes. Their frozen delights, particularly noteworthy on these brutal days, offer a cool respite that is immensely appreciated. Exceptional service combined with their icy treats earns them a well-deserved five-star rating. Don't forget to check out their website for a sprinkle of Vanilla Ice-themed fun!"

This brunch spot is a must-visit for anyone looking to elevate their weekend experience with a delightful twist. Offering an all-you-can-drink option that includes unlimited Bloody Marys or mimosas for just $20, it's the perfect setting for a Sunday Funday. Available on both Saturdays and Sundays, this deal is coupled with delicious brunch items, making it an unbeatable offer for anyone looking to indulge in a leisurely weekend feast. Highly recommended for a fun and fulfilling outing!

This establishment offers good Chinese cuisine complemented by an impressive selection of beers. While I haven't sampled their sushi to provide a judgment, the culinary experience was positive. Patrons should note that the staff may not exude warmth, but their service is satisfactory, especially for a takeout experience. It's not a high-end dining venue, so it's wise to set expectations accordingly. In summary, a decent spot for those seeking tasty Chinese fare without the frills.

Visiting Andres Richard Salon turned out to be a phenomenal experience. The stylist, Stephanie, showcased her exceptional skills and attentiveness from the moment I walked in. Entrusting her with the task of transforming my washed-out, brassy ombre into a stunning balayage, she did not disappoint. Stephanie's ability to listen, understand, and execute my vision was unparalleled, marking the end of a year filled with disappointing salon visits. Andres Richard Salon is the epitome of technical expertise, creativity, and personalized care in hairdressing. Stephanie has undoubtedly become the only stylist I will ever trust with my hair. For anyone in need of expert hair care, this salon is a must-visit.

This establishment offers a festive atmosphere complemented by an appealing variety of Spanish music, ensuring an engaging dining experience. The service is commendable, with staff showing an admirable attention to detail, even with complex orders. While the salad option might disappoint—with its uninspired use of iceberg lettuce suggesting room for improvement—the chicken soup comes highly recommended by a discerning diner, signaling a must-try dish for visitors. For those seeking a cheesy indulgence, the queso fundido is notable, though it's advisable to ask for chorizo on the side to avoid excess grease. Overall, this spot is worth a visit, especially for those with a preference for attentive service, vibrant surroundings, and certain standout dishes.

Visited Starbucks expecting a satisfying tea latte experience but ended up greatly disappointed. Despite a staff count of four and a 15-minute wait, the initial order resembled flavored water rather than the rich tea latte anticipated. Attempts to rectify the issue through replacement orders yielded no improvement, with alternatives equally lacking in quality. The experience underscored a critical need for barista training in beverage preparation. Overall, a disheartening visit marked by unmet expectations.

After moving from Brooklyn, we discovered incredible pizza that truly satisfied our cravings. The thin, crispy crust was perfection, matched by exceptional service. Highly recommended for pizza enthusiasts and those who appreciate top-notch customer service. We'll definitely be returning customers.

Visited just before closing at 9:50 PM and was initially apologetic for the late arrival, but was warmly greeted by an employee named Jules. Despite the impending closing time, Jules was exceptionally friendly, taking the time to explain menu items I was unfamiliar with. I opted for the steak shawarma with rice, accompanied by all the available sauces, and was pleasantly surprised when offered a sample of the Baba ganoush, which turned out to be quite tasty. The food was nothing short of delicious - it had a wholesome quality, satisfying without being overly heavy. This spot might just edge out my previous go-to, Halal Guys. I'm certainly looking forward to returning.

This charming establishment strikes the perfect balance between tranquility and warmth, ensuring a memorable dining experience. The ambiance invites a sense of calm, enhanced by the attentive yet unintrusive staff who skillfully maintain an engaging atmosphere. Despite its modest size, the space is thoughtfully arranged to accommodate comfortably. The team’s eagerness to assist and their pleasant demeanor contribute significantly to the overall positive vibe. Culinary delights like the Crabby Wife and the innovatively served chicken & waffles leave an indelible mark, highlighting the kitchen's prowess in delivering both taste and originality. Highly recommended for those seeking a cozy dining spot where excellent food and friendly service are in perfect harmony.

Surrey's deserves notable praise and is worth detouring from the bustling city center for a memorable brunch experience. Their shrimp and grits stand out as the best in the city, complemented by freshly squeezed juices. Even those who are typically hesitant about omelettes will find themselves converted, particularly by the lump crab omelette, which serves as the perfect antidote to a gray, rainy morning. A word of caution: its popularity means it's consistently busy. Arrive at least 30 minutes early to avoid a wait, tempting as it may be to linger over the delightful aromas emanating from the kitchen.

This store boasts a large, clean space with an extensive selection of products, which initially impresses. However, the customer service significantly detracts from the shopping experience. Despite the store being empty except for one customer, four employees failed to offer assistance, even when it was visibly needed as the customer, who was 27 weeks pregnant, struggled to fit sweaters on her uniquely shaped French Bulldog. An incident involving a store cat and the dog did not prompt any aid from the staff. It appears that assistance might be available upon request, but the lack of proactive support left the customer feeling neglected and resulted in a decision to not purchase anything and doubts about returning. This incident underscores the importance of attentive and proactive customer service, especially in a retail setting.

This review praises a local automotive repair shop, emphasizing the team's honesty, hard work, and excellent communication. The reviewer, new to the area and owning older vehicles, appreciates the shop's attention to detail and highly recommends their services for any car needs. Their positive experience highlights the shop's ability to handle the quirks that come with older cars effectively.

This fro yo bar offers a pleasant, clean, and bright atmosphere perfect for enjoying a variety of frozen yogurt options along with a generous topping station. The service is particularly commendable, with friendly staff willing to accommodate payment methods even when not meeting the minimum requirement. It's a great spot for families, as evidenced by the enjoyable experience of a visiting son. Overall, a delightful destination for frozen yogurt enthusiasts.

Recently visited this cafe for Sunday brunch and had a very pleasant experience. The food was both delicious and satisfying, complemented by nice drinks. Our server was friendly, adding to the overall positive atmosphere of the cool cafe space. Definitely recommend for a good dining experience.

Visited for the first time tonight. The restaurant boasts a clean environment, fair pricing, and welcoming staff. However, the food, though well-presented, was disappointingly bland and mediocre. The chicken fajitas I ordered arrived on a barely warm platter; the meat was at room temperature, and the accompaniments (pico, cheese, sour cream, tortillas) failed to impress. Overall, the experience left me underwhelmed, and I am not inclined to return.

Gelateria, nestled in the heart of St. Louis, stands as my top destination for relishing delightful gelato, offering an unbeatable combination of flavors and experience. Beyond its exquisite selection of gelato and tempting baked goods, its ambiance elevates the enjoyment to another level. The establishment echoes a cozy coffee house feel, providing a warm and inviting atmosphere that makes every visit special.

What truly sets it apart is its expansive outdoor patio, adorned with a charming fountain and lush foliage, creating a serene escape within the city. Whether you're indulging in their creamy gelato or savoring their freshly baked goods, the setting ensures a memorable visit. Everything at Gelateria exudes pleasure, making it a must-visit for anyone looking to satisfy their sweet tooth in a delightful setting.

I recently discovered an intimate sushi spot near Dale Mabry, a hidden gem with a cozy setting featuring less than a dozen tables and a lively sushi bar. While the bar is the prime spot for engaging with the friendly and welcoming sushi chefs—including the owner—I found myself seated at a table due to its popularity. My dining experience was delightful, focusing on classic choices like a spicy tuna roll, a rainbow roll, a couple of pieces of yellowtail, and notably, the Wahoo. Each dish was impressively fresh and delicious, although the sticky rice was slightly less cohesive than I'd hoped, leading to an unexpected soy sauce mixture by meal's end. Yet, the standout was indeed the Wahoo, a must-try that left a lasting impression. At about $30 for dinner, the quality and experience were well worth the cost. This charming place has earned a spot on my go-to list, and I'm eager to return.

This eatery offers an affordable menu with a wide variety of choices. However, our experience was marred by poor service; our order was overlooked, leading to a 15-minute wait without any apology or acknowledgment of the mistake from the staff.

Larry's Steaks reignited my love for authentic Philly cheesesteaks after a disappointing experience with Dallesandro's post-ownership change. Situated near St. Joe's University, Larry's perfectly mimics the original Dallesandro's recipe, which had been my benchmark. The finely minced meat and expertly melted cheese create a sublime consistency and flavor, complemented by just the right amount of onions and mushrooms. It strikes an ideal balance of being satisfactorily greasy without being overly messy. Though I haven't ventured into other menu items, for those seeking a genuine Philly cheesesteak experience, Larry's unapologetically outshines the likes of Pat's and Geno's. Skip the whiz and head straight for a Larry's steak to rekindle your own passion for this iconic sandwich.

This venue regrettably falls short of providing a satisfactory dining experience. Echoing existing sentiments, my visit was marred by exceptionally poor service and subpar meal quality. The food, initially served cold, necessitated a return, escalating into an unnecessary complication. A significant overhaul in management's approach towards staff performance and service standards is imperative. Until noticeable improvements are made, I recommend steering clear of this establishment.

This review reflects an overall positive past experience at a dining establishment, unfortunately marred by subsequent health and safety concerns stemming from an E. coli/Coliform scare. The visit, occurring a year prior to the mentioned health alert, left the diner with fond memories of the establishment. However, the safety incident has significantly impacted their confidence in the restaurant's food handling and preparation practices. The reviewer has yet to return due to these concerns. They suggest that the restaurant could regain customer trust by implementing stricter food safety measures, such as cooking meat to a minimum of 165°F, serving hot food to kill off any lingering bacteria, and sourcing produce exclusively from the U.S. to avoid contamination issues associated with imports from Mexico. This feedback underscores the importance of maintaining rigorous health standards in retaining and reassuring customers.

This review reflects a deeply dissatisfying experience at a fast-food outlet, marked by a significant discrepancy between what was ordered and what was received. Despite the clear and specific nature of the order—which included a variety of items without certain condiments, alongside specific drink and side choices—the actual items served were incorrect in multiple aspects, from added bacon to completely wrong children's meals.

The customer's frustration is compounded by the perceived lack of understanding from the staff, as noted by a "blank look" from an employee upon the request for no ketchup. This indicates not only an issue with order accuracy but also suggests a gap in effective communication or attention to detail among the staff. The requirement to give even a single star as a rating underscores the customer's dissatisfaction with the entire experience, emphasizing that the service and accuracy fell far below expectations.

This review serves as a cautionary tale for both potential customers and the management of the establishment, highlighting a need for improved training, better communication, and a stronger commitment to getting orders right the first time.

I recently tried this spot for breakfast on the recommendation of a friend and was not disappointed. Despite a busy Saturday morning, the service was quick, and we were seated immediately. The veggie omelette paired with fruit and rye toast was delicious, and the menu offered a diverse selection to suit various tastes. Prices were reasonable, especially considering the portion sizes. I'll definitely return.

Wells Fargo presents a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere suitable for visitors of all ages. The Flyers ensure an entertaining experience at every game, providing a fantastic view and engagement regardless of seating position. Highly recommended for everyone, including those who may not typically be hockey fans.

This spot is a great find for those late-night cravings, especially if you're in a rush thanks to its convenient drive-through. The menu keeps things fresh with new additions and even includes some veggie options, catering to a wider range of dietary preferences. However, there was a letdown when they forgot to include my dessert order in the bag, which was quite disappointing, especially since I realized too late to turn back.

I had a delightful experience trying the spinach and feta hummus, which I found to be truly amazing. Equally impressive was the chicken caesar pita, bursting with the flavors of a remarkably savory caesar dressing and high-quality, flavorful greens - a definite step up from the usual fare. Despite initial skepticism due to its unconventional location in an old garage, I wholeheartedly recommend giving this place a try. It's well worth the visit.

This place is an absolute gem for vegan food lovers! Their vast menu is impressively accommodating, as nearly every dish can be tailored to a vegan diet, showcasing their expertise in crafting delicious plant-based meals. The Pad Thai, adorned with tofu, fresh veggies, and crunchy cashews, stands out as a flavorful masterpiece. Equally noteworthy are the avocado egg rolls, which have quickly become a beloved favorite. Highly recommended for anyone seeking top-notch vegan cuisine.

NOM NOMS strikes as a chic downtown eatery buzzing with the city's well-heeled professionals. Its culinary offerings, although not substantial in size, are sheer palatable masterpieces. The mussels and clams bowl was notably generous, pairing perfectly with the delectable, subtly spiced broth and a breadstick. The Tuna Tartare and Coconut Shrimp stood out for their innovative flavor profiles and exceptional presentation. However, the cocktail named "The Tryst" fell short, leaving an unwelcome watery aftertaste that will quickly be forgotten.

The service at NOM NOMS deserves a shoutout for its promptness and helpfulness, especially after getting seated. The server’s recommendation on the "vegetable" beer was particularly appreciated, showcasing their knowledge and ability to ease customers into trying something new.

In conclusion, NOM NOMS with its trendy vibe and bold, beautifully plated dishes makes an excellent spot for social gatherings or impressing guests—if you're willing to splurge. The disappointing cocktail experience notwithstanding, the restaurant offers a memorable culinary journey, albeit at a price point that may encourage visits during happy hour for those mindful of their budget.

This Asian/Thai to-go restaurant stands out for its exceptional customer service, truly setting it apart in its category. The food, particularly the curry, impresses with its flavor and consistency. While the shrimp fried rice may lack visual appeal, it more than makes up for it with taste and texture. However, my experience wasn’t without flaws. A charge for additional egg that wasn't fulfilled and a wait time that doubled from the promised 30 minutes to an actual hour slightly marred the experience, leading to a 4-star rating. Despite these hiccups, the staff's evident dedication to customer satisfaction and their passion for service shone through, leaving a positive lasting impression.

Had an exceptional pizza experience with fresh-made pies in Philly, definitely not your average reheated slices. The crust was notably tasteful and perfectly crunchy, a highlight that set it apart. The generous topping distribution only added to the quality. I was particularly taken with the Cowboy steak pizza, first trying it without BBQ sauce and finding it irresistible, easily downing more than two slices. Curiosity led me to order it again, this time with BBQ sauce, and the flavor profile was just as impressive. Now, my go-to is a half and half version to get the best of both worlds. This place serves some of the best pizza in the city, hands down.

This mail service provides a convenient and secure option for receiving mail, especially for those who travel frequently. At $250 per year, customers get a private box and after-hours access, ensuring privacy and ease of collection. The service includes personal notifications and secure storage for larger parcels, adding an extra layer of convenience. While the owner prefers using Fed-ex for shipping parcels due to cost and reliability, the in-store printing services meet their needs effectively. Despite a preference for Canada Post for packaging and stationary goods, the staff's cheerful and helpful demeanor positively enhances the experience. The only downside is the strip mall's location, which sometimes attracts unsavory characters, though this doesn't seem to impact the service quality directly. Overall, it's a practical solution for those needing a reliable mail handling service amidst a hectic travel schedule.

Visited Heads and Tails for a bikini wax and was blown away by the experience, thanks to Jenne. Despite my initial apprehension, Jenne eased my nerves by thoroughly explaining the process, leading to a surprisingly comfortable experience. For those with sensitive skin seeking a hygienic facility and stellar staff, I highly recommend this place. Will definitely return!

Ordered food at 11:47 pm after a day of travel issues, leaving me famished. Despite two follow-up calls, my order arrived 2.5 hours late, lacking utensils and napkins, forcing me to eat my salad with my hands. While the food quality was satisfactory, the service was abysmal. I won't be repeating this experience.

Our recent visit to J Sushi offered an exceptional dining experience. Both the J Sushi and Fire Roll were delicious and beautifully presented, surpassing our expectations. The service was excellent, contributing to a pleasant atmosphere. Additionally, the great value for the quality and quantity of food provided made our meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommended for anyone looking for superb sushi in a welcoming environment.

My wife and I recently moved to town and were eager to find a local Mexican restaurant to fill the void left by our departure from a beloved spot. Upon visiting this restaurant, we were immediately struck by its authentic ambiance and exceptional service. A personal highlight for me was their serving of glass bottle sodas - a nostalgic touch. We ordered the Taco Sombrero and the Chimichanga, both of which were outstanding. If it were possible, this place deserves a 6-star rating for its remarkable food and experience.

This restaurant experience was profoundly disappointing, warranting a rare one-star review from a typically forgiving diner. The service was abysmal with the server/chef preoccupied with her cell phone throughout the visit, compromising both the attention and quality one would expect. The only redeeming feature was a tender pork leg, hardly enough to offset the overall negative experience. Overpriced and undersized dishes, like the $18.99 shrimp and minuscule plantains, added to the frustration. Efforts to salvage the meal with additional orders were thwarted by the inattentive service. Concluding, this dining experience was a complete letdown, with advice to future patrons to avoid this establishment altogether.
An exceptional car rental experience marked by excellent customer service. It outshines other car rental services, leaving me wishing I could rent from them more frequently. Highly recommended!

Cafe Piazza offers an exceptional dining experience in the heart of St. Louis, taking the place of the original Benton Park Cafe. The ambiance is quintessentially St. Louis, complemented by a stunningly eclectic mural that sprawls across the ceiling - a piece of art worth inquiring about. The menu deviates from typical breakfast offerings, presenting creative and slightly upscale options that remain approachable. The decor, prime location, and the quality of inventive dishes for the price make Cafe Piazza a must-visit. Highly recommended for those seeking a unique and enjoyable meal experience.

Absolutely enthralled by the incredible culinary talents of the chef in question, this review is penned by an ardent admirer—truly a groupie in foodie terms. Their experience with the chef's cuisine was love at first bite, leaving a lasting impression that borders on a flavorful craving. Unfortunately, a singular encounter with the chef's culinary creations—described as having the most tender and smoky chicken ever tasted, accompanied by equally creative and awesome side dishes—left the reviewer yearning for more. Dishearteningly, due to ongoing market constructions, locating the chef has become a gourmand's quest, turning the reviewer's delight into a tale of longing. Anxiously, they hope for a swift and triumphant return of the chef, so that their palate may once again revel in the exquisite tastes that have so deeply touched their heart and appetite.

I recently had the pleasure of attending a corporate holiday party with over 2,000 attendees in the Tuscany Ballroom, followed by an overnight stay in the Tuscan Tower. The experience was unparalleled, resembling a first-class cruise ship journey, setting this resort apart as the finest in the area. Notably, despite my sensitivity to smoke, the usual casino smoke was nowhere to be found, enhancing my enjoyment significantly.

An unexpected highlight was sharing breakfast at the coffee shop with Peppermill's CEO/GM, John Hanson. He spontaneously joined me, engaging in genuine, friendly conversation about my stay while he too enjoyed his meal. Encounters like these truly elevate the guest experience, making it exceptional. In essence, the Peppermill Resort not only excels in its offerings but also champions unparalleled guest interactions, setting a high bar for hospitality.

Title: A Pleasant Surprise Beyond First Impressions

Review: Don't let the unassuming exterior of this restaurant fool you; what lies within is a delightful culinary experience wrapped in a traditional Indian/Thai ambiance. Initially skeptical due to its location, our adventure was driven by a craving for crispy duck, and this establishment did not disappoint, standing tall on its rave reviews.

Upon entry, the setting immediately transported us to a cozy and authentic environment. The service was commendably prompt and discreet, enhancing our dining experience without intrusion. We commenced our meal with a mussel appetizer, which was notably tasty. However, the stars of the evening were undoubtedly the Tamarind Duck and the Panang Curry with calamari. Both dishes were exceptional, marrying flavor with finesse, and leaving us eager to return for more.

The portions are generous, ensuring good value for the price - a rare attribute that adds to the appeal of this hidden gem. While we initially visited for the duck, the promise of sushi and other duck variants on the menu has us planning our next visit. This restaurant has succeeded in turning our "meh" into a resounding "wow," proving that sometimes, the most remarkable experiences come from the most unexpected places. Happy tastebuds, indeed!

Corropolese stands as an undisputed champion in the realm of tomato pies, making it a staple establishment that commands loyalty from locals and visitors alike. While they do offer a variety of other items, their tomato pie overshadows all, hailed as sacrilegious to consider any alternatives. It's the go-to spot for any event requiring the iconic dish, firmly holding its ground as the best in the business, according to devoted family traditions and widespread acclaim.

Visited this venue for a birthday celebration and found it to be quite commendable, especially for my first visit. The ambiance benefitted from being a quiet Tuesday, with the attentive service presumably reflective of the establishment's usual standards given its size.

The main course, consisting of beef and lobster, was thoroughly enjoyable, perfectly cooked to satisfaction. The accompanying mashed potatoes and asparagus were equally delightful.

However, the appetizer, a crab and cheese ball dish, was underwhelming due to its lack of flavor and discernible crab presence - not something I'd recommend.

The meal was rounded off nicely with a Creme Brulee, which proved to be a hit and would be a definite re-order for me.

Rating this experience at four stars, with minor deductions for the lackluster appetizer and an inconveniently shaky table - an oversight in an otherwise impressive setting.

Despite these hiccups, I'm keen on returning and would encourage friends to explore this place too.

I rarely award five stars, but this visit warranted it. My wife and I had a wonderful experience, thanks in large part to our waitress, Debbie. Her service was outstanding; she explained the menu and specials thoroughly and answered all our questions. The food was very good, arriving quickly and hot, and prepared just as we ordered. The mac n cheese burger was particularly exceptional, and the drinks, including a great whisky sour, were perfect. We'll definitely return.
This independent store is a fantastic spot for unique holiday gifts, featuring a welcoming and pleasant staff. Highly recommended for a joyful shopping experience.

This unique spot melds an art house, coffee house, and Animal House vibe into a very enjoyable atmosphere. Service here is relaxed yet attentive, contributing to the overall positive experience. The drink selection is commendable, and the menu piques interest with its creativity. While the food, including specialties like the Bird and Pig and a grilled cheese, was good, it didn't quite hit the mark of greatness I had hoped for based on previous Yelp reviews. If I were rating on the culinary experience alone, it would earn three stars. However, the exceptional atmosphere and staff elevate it to four stars. Despite the food not fully meeting my expectations, I'm drawn back by the overall vibe and am eager to explore more of the menu on a future visit.

Joyce provides an outstanding service that is absolutely pain-free, making the journey from Palm Harbor to her location entirely worth it. Her high-tech equipment ensures a superior experience, a stark contrast to the harrowing tales of disappointment shared by friends with other services. Highly recommended and truly loved!

During my recent travels, I stumbled upon The Quarter Stitch, a local yarn store in NOLA, conveniently located within walking distance from my hotel. Their unique offering of a special Mardi Gras yarn caught my eye, compelling me to visit not once but twice during my stay. The store boasts a tempting selection of yarns that can satisfy any knitter's palette, making it hard to leave empty-handed. What truly sets this store apart, however, is its incredible staff—knowledgeable, friendly, and immensely helpful. My experience at The Quarter Stitch was nothing short of delightful, ensuring it's a must-visit for any yarn enthusiast passing through NOLA.

Visited this ice cream parlor for a sweet treat with my son on a Sunday afternoon, hoping for a delightful experience but was met with profoundly disappointing service. While the ice cream itself was excellent, the staff's behavior significantly tarnished our visit. Upon entry, it seemed as if we were invisible to the two attendants behind the counter. One, who appeared inebriated, was preoccupied with throwing napkins around, one of which hit me without a hint of an apology, only met with raucous laughter. The other sharply reprimanded my curious son for merely looking at the candy, without him having touched anything. When it came to serving us, the level of disregard continued; we received our ice cream from a server who didn’t care to make eye contact, offer a greeting, or even feign a smile. Instead, she chose to revert to her previous distractions, leaving us feeling more like an inconvenience than guests. While I value a fun and lively atmosphere in establishments, the rudeness and lack of professionalism we experienced here utterly crossed the line.

My husband and I visited a quaint seafood spot located on the wharf, drawn in by its promising location and my husband's love for seafood. Despite its small size, which contributed to a slightly noisy atmosphere, we were seated promptly at the bar on a Tuesday evening, avoiding a longer wait for the coveted outdoor tables. The service we experienced was commendable. 

However, our dining experience was a mixed bag. My husband's crab sandwich left much to be desired, mainly due to the lackluster white bread it was served on. In contrast, I found my fried shrimp delightfully light, non-greasy, and flavorful, which was a pleasant surprise given my usual ambivalence towards seafood. Accompanied by tasty onion rings, my meal was unexpectedly satisfying. It's worth noting the menu exclusively caters to shellfish lovers, limiting options for those with different tastes. 

Though my husband's specific dish was a letdown, the quality of my meal and the charming location would make us consider giving this restaurant another chance, with hopes of a more universally appealing selection next time. For shellfish enthusiasts, this place could offer a delightful dining experience, but it might be hit or miss depending on your menu choices.

This brunch experience at a Tucson restaurant was deeply disappointing from start to finish. Initial attempts to inquire about the brunch details over the phone were met with poor customer service, as the call was placed on an extended hold, never to be returned to. Despite having a reservation for brunch organized by a friend, our group was relegated to outdoor seating due to inadequate planning for the number of guests, which posed a significant problem for members with bee allergies.

The presence of bees around our table, especially targeting our food, made it impossible for me to eat comfortably. Requests to move indoors were dismissed rudely by both the waitress and the management, demonstrating a shocking lack of concern for guest safety and comfort. The situation was further exacerbated by the waitress's disrespectful behavior towards both management and guests, effectively isolating us from our party and failing to provide the basic level of service expected.

The management and staff's handling of the situation was appalling, leading to a decision not to patronize the establishment any further. It was so off-putting that it resulted in an inability to enjoy the meal, to the extent of forgoing food altogether. The experience was so negative that I strongly advise against dining at this location.

This establishment stands out for its innovative sandwich selections, making it an ideal spot for those seeking nutritious choices or accommodating vegan preferences. Highly recommended for a distinct and health-focused dining experience.

Took on the Brew Bros. Burger challenge expecting a fun dare but underestimated its severity. Despite nearly completing the 4lbs mega-meal, I earned a consolation shirt rather than victory, thanks to a supportive server and the stomach ache of a lifetime. While the challenge might overshadow the experience, the food quality and exceptional staff deserve praise. Sadly, I missed out on their reputed beer selections, advised against mixing with the challenge. At $24, the challenge offers value, predicated on adhering to its solitary rules. Next time in Reno, redemption is on my menu, but perhaps with a lighter appetite and an eye on their drinks.

I had a fantastic breakfast experience, highlighted by the delightful Sunny Side Skillet, which was a steal at under $8, and came with a delicious pancake. Not only was the food and service top-notch, but the atmosphere and store selections were also superior to any other place I've visited. Highly recommend!

Excellent service and notably quick, this food truck serves exceptionally juicy meat paired with delicious BBQ sauce. Their prices are sensible, making it a must-try spot if you come across it. You won't be disappointed.

I recently had the opportunity to dine at a highly recommended restaurant, buoyed by the anticipation of exploring its widely acclaimed menu. Eager to sample a variety of offerings, I opted for the special, which included a selection of chicken, the touted modern BBQ sauce, their signature mac&cheese, a bananas foster pie for dessert, and a New Hope birch beer to drink. My experience, unfortunately, turned out to be underwhelming, prompting this review.

**Chicken:** Disappointingly average, the chicken barely rose above mediocrity. Although it wasn't dry, the lack of flavor was palpable. 

**Sauce:** As someone unable to consume mayo, my options were limited, thus I tried the modern BBQ sauce. It encapsulated the sharp tanginess of a North Carolina mustard and vinegar base, which was satisfactory but not extraordinary.

**Mac&Cheese:** Despite being a component the staff takes pride in, the dish fell short of expectations. Its overwhelming saltiness overshadowed the potentially comforting blend of cheese and bacon. 

**Bananas Foster Pie:** The pie boasted an impeccable crust, yet its filling was a letdown. A scanty layer of bananas at the bottom of an otherwise hollow pie did not meet the expectations set by its appetizing appearance.

**New Hope Birch Beer:** A refreshing highlight within an otherwise mediocre meal. It delivered the classic taste expected from a Pennsylvania birch beer, surprisingly outshining its fountain soda counterparts.

After careful consideration, I awarded the establishment 2 stars. While there were no catastrophic failures, the quality of the food did not justify the price point. The concept, ambiance, and menu have potential, yet significant improvements in culinary execution are imperative for a better dining experience.

The service at this establishment is markedly slow, even when the venue isn't busy, making it an unsuitable choice for larger groups on a tight schedule. The quality of the food is passable but doesn't compensate for the prolonged wait times. During my visit with a group, we observed a noticeable lack of teamwork among the staff, with multiple servers neglecting to assist a clearly overwhelmed colleague. While the lone server tried her best to manage all tasks, the overall experience was disappointing due to the sluggish service.

This establishment, though pricey, delivers exceptional service and delectable cuisine. The ribeye is notably succulent, effortlessly melting in the mouth, while the generously sized burger satisfies with every bite. The bread pudding lives up to its acclaim, ensuring a memorable dining experience. It's highly recommended to visit at least once, ideally sharing meals among friends to fully enjoy the gastronomic offerings.

This restaurant offers an excellent, ever-changing menu featuring locally sourced ingredients, ensuring a delightful culinary experience for your taste buds. However, due to its popularity, securing a reservation requires planning ahead.

Spot on! This place delivers an unexpectedly delightful dining experience, especially with its standout dish, "the veg." A portobella burger that redefines the genre, it combines grilled mozzarella, pickled vegetables, arugula, and a touch of guacamole, achieving a rich harmony of flavors. The mozzarella, reminiscent of halloumi due to its perfect level of melt, pairs superbly with the citrusy bite of the pickled veggies and the creaminess of the guac, all balanced by the peppery arugula. The potato bun serves as the ideal vessel, ensuring a satisfying bun-to-contents ratio.

The spicy fries were another pleasant surprise, veering away from the expected into a tasteful crab-fries territory with a modest portion size that hits the spot without overwhelming.

The ambiance, akin to a cozy dive bar, might not be for everyone, especially for dine-in experiences due to its compact size. Nevertheless, the quality of the food more than compensates, making it a must-try for those willing to overlook the space constraints for a memorable meal.

Navigating the vegetarian dining scene in New Orleans can be challenging, but there are usually some good finds. Tomasito's, unfortunately, falls slightly short of expectations. The options for vegetarians are somewhat limited; even the rice is not vegetarian-friendly. While the chips and bean and cheese burrito were decent, they did not surpass mediocrity. Service was adequate, though nothing remarkable. The highlight of the meal was the flan, which, despite the promise of being served "with berries," disappointingly came with a single raspberry. Nevertheless, finding a place with vegetarian options in New Orleans is worthy of note, and for that, Tomasito's does provide a valuable service.

This Mexican restaurant stands out as the best I have experienced in a long while. With delicious food, exceptional drinks, and reasonable prices, it delivers an outstanding dining experience. Highly recommended for anyone craving authentic Mexican cuisine.

The venue offers a sharp contrast in atmospheres across its two floors, catering to different preferences. The ground floor pulses with really loud live music, buzzing with energy and perfect for those seeking a vibrant music scene.
