The staff, especially a particularly attentive assistant, made my shopping journey seamless and enjoyable. With her help, navigating through about 20 different pairs of jeans became an informative session on the nuances of fits and washes, rather than an overwhelming ordeal. Her patience with my indecision was commendable. I discovered and purchased two pairs of Sebastian McCalls, which I find to be both stylish and comfortable. My affection for Charlie's has been reignited—I absolutely love this place!

I recently visited a car wash on what turned out to be Senior Discount Day and had a disappointingly poor experience. Despite opting for the Super wash, which advertised wax among other services, my car was returned with significant dirt smudges on the side and a lackluster interior cleaning. The third-row seats, which I expected to be cleaned, were untouched due to a policy not disclosed at the time of purchase. When I addressed my concerns with the manager, his response lacked any semblance of customer service, simply stating their long-standing policy without any attempt to accommodate or understand my perspective as a new customer in the area. The encounter left much to be desired, prompting me to share this review as a caution to potential future customers.

The seafood combo at this spot, featuring a generous serving of catfish alongside red beans and rice and coleslaw, truly hits the mark with its delicious taste. The stand-out happy hour deal, running from Monday to Saturday, 4pm-7pm with 2 for 1 offers, initially drew us in, promising a great bargain. While the margarita didn't entirely meet my high Californian standards, falling somewhere between average and not quite impressive, the food quality and generous portions more than compensated for the beverage experience. Overall, a worthwhile visit for the food and deals.

I've visited this place numerous times and consistently had fantastic experiences. Since relocating to Rita Ranch six months ago, my husband and I, engaged in extensive rehab work on our new home, found ourselves seeking recovery here almost weekly. The facility always presents itself clean, they honor your time fully without cutting corners, and they pay special attention to any problem areas you might have. Felicia, in particular, is phenomenal. Whether it's for a regular visit or something specific like the incredible therapeutic massage I received from Felicia for my troubling neck, I cannot recommend them enough. She has a real gift.

The Sunrise Family Restaurant offers a cozy, small-town diner atmosphere with prompt and super friendly service. Despite the disappointing Monte Cristo sandwich, which seemed hastily prepared with microwaved ingredients, the accompanying salad and perfectly cooked steak fries were satisfying. It seems likely that there are more appealing options available on the menu, particularly for breakfast, warranting a return visit.

Visited Butcher & Bee for the first time alongside my husband and co-workers for a lunch outing. The establishment boasts a charming farmhouse ambiance, with its spacious interior and adorable, somewhat private booths. Despite our group of seven feeling slightly cramped, seating was prompt. My choice of pork belly gnocchi was satisfactory, yet it missed an opportunity for greatness due to its uniform texture; a crunchier pork belly could have elevated the dish. My husband's trout sandwich fell short of expectations, resembling more a mundane 'tuna salad' sandwich, which didn't hit the mark for him. The coconut macaroons for dessert, however, were quite pleasing. While co-worker opinions varied, the Korean Fried Chicken sandwich received favorable feedback. The quirky practice of using books to present bills was a delightful touch. Despite some culinary shortcomings, Butcher & Bee certainly merits another visit.

This event is a haven for beer enthusiasts, offering a vast variety of options from local, national, and international brewers at a reasonable price for samples ($2-$4 for a 4 oz. sample). The accessibility of purchasing favored beers on-site is a convenient feature, complemented by promotional specials. However, the event is marred by overpriced food options and the questionable value of VIP tickets, which offer marginal benefits not justified by their cost for most attendees. Additionally, logistical considerations such as parking fees can add up, making the overall experience potentially expensive. While the event excels in celebrating beer culture, visitors should weigh the costs and benefits of extras like VIP access and plan for additional expenses.

This reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with Kiwi Nail, a salon they've visited multiple times due to convenience, yet always preferred another salon (VN Nails near Costco) for superior service. They describe their final visit as particularly disappointing, noting that the salon frequently takes shortcuts and delivers subpar work. The breaking point came when, after receiving a poorly done fill with French tips, they smudged two nails. Despite offering to pay extra for repairs, the response was unsatisfactory; the technician simply attempted to smooth out the damaged polish and carelessly applied more, resulting in an untidy finish that was far from the requested correction. The reviewer also highlights an issue with the salon's tipping policy, which apparently requires cash tips without prior notice. Frustrated by the overall experience and lack of professionalism, they vow never to return and advise others to avoid the salon altogether.

I usually steer clear of fast food, but Chick-fil-A has proven to be an exceptional exception. Its high-quality offerings are a breath of fresh air, making me feel like I'm indulging in real food rather than being bogged down by fillers. Definitely a cut above the rest in the fast food world.

Square 1682 consistently offers a top-notch dining and drinking experience that caters to a variety of occasions, whether it's for lunch, brunch, dinner, or happy hour. The establishment prides itself on great food, exceptional service, and an upscale ambiance. It attracts a friendly and diverse crowd, making it an ideal spot for socializing. The highlight of Square 1682 is undoubtedly the bartender, Dan, who works on Mondays. His exceptional service, ability to remember returning customers' preferences, and overall charisma render him a favorite among patrons, including myself. Dan's presence alone is a compelling reason to visit, elevating the overall experience and making Square 1682 a standout venue in the city.

This spot is a consistent hit for frequent visitors, praised for its quality and service. Arriving early is recommended to avoid waiting. While the menu, including a decent selection of coffees like French press, is not extensive, it allows for quick decisions and timely service. The highlighting dish, the Wilburt Skillet, is a testament to the freshness and deliciousness of the food. The friendly staff contributes to a dining experience that guarantees satisfaction and leaves patrons full and happy.

**Review of EWC**

I truly wanted to give EWC a fair shot, returning even after a mediocre first experience, but unfortunately, it didn't improve. My initial appointment with Despina started off on the wrong foot with a 15-minute wait past the scheduled time, despite their strict policy on tardiness. The interaction—or lack thereof—was cold and uninviting, leaving me feeling awkward throughout the service. Furthermore, several spots were missed, detracting from the overall quality of the wax.

Hoping for a better outcome, I booked a second appointment with Amy Jo, swayed by positive reviews. Although she was indeed friendlier, the wax itself was hurried and grossly inadequate, especially considering it was right before Valentine's Day. The quick, 8-minute session resulted in a job half-done, compelling me to seek additional products to complete the wax adequately at home. For the price paid, the service quality was deeply disappointing.

The front desk staff only added to the negative experience with their general indifference and uncomfortable approach to tipping, lacking the basic tenets of good customer service.

In search of a satisfactory Brazilian wax in Philly, my journey continues. The quest for professionalism, quality, and a welcoming environment goes on, as EWC sadly fell short in meeting these expectations.

This brunch spot stands out for its amazing and comfortable atmosphere, paired with the uniqueness of its flavor combinations. The Cuban Lamb Frita, especially with an added egg, is highlighted as a must-try. All side dishes are praised for their deliciousness, ensuring no wrong choices. Complementing the food, the staff's friendliness and efficiency with coffee refills are notable. It has quickly earned its status as a new regular go-to for brunch.

This dining spot offers a pleasing experience with its excellent service and the charming addition of a piano. While the portions might appear small considering the higher prices, the affordability of the drinks compensates nicely. Notably, their cheesecake is a standout, highly recommended for its remarkable taste. A visit here ensures a mix of delight and satisfaction, especially for those with a penchant for desserts.

This charming spot may be on the smaller side, but it's well worth beating the crowd to experience. The menu, including delightful vegetarian and vegan options, is consistently impressive across the board. Their French toast specials are a must-try and have become a tradition for me, especially during Mardi Gras season. I make it a point to bring my guests here for breakfast before enjoying the parades. It's an all-around amazing dining experience!

Had an excellent experience with Butch as our tour guide - he struck a perfect balance between relaxation and informative content. The tour included two noteworthy stops: a delightful place to eat and an interesting visit to the cemetery. Butch's engaging and fun demeanor added to the enjoyment. I recommend taking this tour early in your stay to gain valuable insights into places worth visiting during your trip.

This food truck is a hidden gem, offering a delightful array of street foods that are as inventive as they are delicious. The standout Captain Crunch Tilapia Burrito is a marvel; its flaky fried fish is perfectly complemented by fresh cabbage, tomatoes, avocado, and a tangy Sriracha mayo, making for an unexpectedly scrumptious combination. Further exploring the menu, the katsu and curry chicken impress with their depth of flavor, and the Thai tea is a refreshing accompaniment. Despite its compact size, this food truck packs a punch with its culinary offerings. The friendly service and affordable prices make the drive to Jersey well worth it for anyone in search of extraordinary street food experiences.

Had a terrible day with a migraine and sinus infection, making it urgent for me to get a massage. After facing rejections from several places due to no availability, I lucked out with Massage Envy. They accommodated not just me but also my father at the same time. My therapist, Jen, was empathetic, attentive, and even shared helpful home techniques. She provided a thorough, unrushed service. My father had a foot massage from Carrie and was impressed enough to recommend it. The highlight was learning about their membership program, which is both affordable and flexible, leading me to sign up instantly. The staff’s friendliness, the serene ambiance, and the comfortable facilities all contributed to an excellent experience. I’ve significantly improved and have already planned a return visit for a 90-minute session. Highly recommend Massage Envy for anyone in need of a quality massage experience.

This eatery delivers a standout roast chicken experience with its moist meat, crispy skin, and delightful smokey flavor, making it a top contender in the realm of chicken dishes. The enticing aroma of smokey BBQ is irresistible, setting the stage for a truly mouthwatering meal. Opting for the double chicken family option offers excellent value, providing a generous serving of two whole chickens atop a hefty portion of wedge fries, complemented by coleslaw. The inclusion of uniquely flavored dipping sauces, notably a mustard-based one with a chipotle twist and a refreshing green salsa, adds an extra layer of enjoyment. The abundance of food ensures leftovers, enhancing the overall value. This place quite literally outshines popular fast-food options like Popeyes or KFC, not just in quantity and healthiness but also in the quality of service, credited to the welcoming and amiable owners. This eatery has certainly earned a repeat visit, especially for those inevitable chicken cravings.

This establishment offers a delightful taste of Japanese cuisine, especially for those who may shy away from the traditional sushi, sashimi, or maki. The rice bowls and tempura are particularly noteworthy, providing a satisfying dining experience without the long wait often associated with busier locations. Adding to its appeal, the restaurant caters to various functions with sushi and maki platters, ensuring a touch of Japanese flavor to any event. The service is commendably efficient, suitable for the fast-food setting, making it an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain their eating plan without sacrificing time. Whether you're looking for a quick lunch or dinner, this place stands out as a convenient and tasty option.

As a newcomer to the Westchase area in need of dental care, I chose to make an appointment with a local dentist after noticing its convenient location only 0.5 miles away from my place, buoyed by positive reviews. The experience exceeded my expectations, thanks in large part to the exceptional staff. Both Dr. Creech-Gionis and Dr. Stern, with whom I had the pleasure of consulting, were outstanding. Their professionalism and approach to dental care made my visits far less daunting than I anticipated. I am thoroughly impressed with their service and can honestly say I am 100% satisfied with my choice.

Visited Amigos for our 40th anniversary, lured by the rave reviews. The atmosphere was lacking, the food underwhelmed, and it felt overpriced for the quality received. Surprisingly, their highly praised salsa didn't impress, seeming no better than store-bought options. While the establishment was cleaner than our old favorite, Gloria's, the cuisine didn't compare in taste. Despite spending $47 with drinks and tip, we left feeling that local taco trucks would have offered a more gratifying and flavorful experience. In search of good Mexican food in Boise, Amigos fell short of expectations.

I had an excellent experience at this venue, largely thanks to Heather, who excelled in her dual role as bartender and waitress. The tenderloin sliders paired with French fries were simply perfection. I’m absolutely planning on becoming a regular here. Highly recommend trying it out — it's a decision you won't regret.

The review highlights a significant dissatisfaction with the bouncers at LEX, attributing their unappealing demeanor to personal issues rather than professional conduct. It paints a starkly negative picture of the venue, suggesting that it embodies values contrary to what the reviewer believes Reno stands for. The comparison made between choosing LEX and undergoing waterboarding during Thanksgiving dinner strongly implies that visiting this establishment should be a last resort, underscoring an overall disappointing experience.

This beachside sandwich spot between St Pete Beach & Clearwater Beach offers an exceptional dining experience that could easily rival any upscale deli, and it comes with a five-star recommendation for its food. Every order is freshly prepared, boasting super-sized, gourmet servings at prices comparable to Subway, making it a culinary steal. The owner's warm and friendly service adds to its charm, while the quality of cooking, with well-seasoned sauces and inventive dips, ensures a memorable meal. The highlight was their daily special — three perfectly cooked shrimp tacos for $6, served on fresh corn tortillas with a unique kiwi sauce and fresh peppers, striking a perfect balance of spice and fruit with the shrimp. Despite its limited walk-up and bench-only seating arrangement, the quality of the food more than compensates. It's particularly convenient for those staying at nearby hotels, and with plans to start delivering, it promises even more accessibility. The only hiccup to a full five-star rating is the potential seating issue for some guests. Nonetheless, it remains a top-notch local favorite.

This modern and aesthetically pleasing establishment boasts a lovely view, adding to its appeal. The presence of a nearby train means that noise can be an issue for those situated on that side of the building. Nonetheless, its great features, including a convenient Yolk at the corner, make it a highly recommendable place.

During my latest visit for a full set, despite requesting long nails and providing a picture for reference, my nails were cut short. While this was initially not a concern, the main issue arose when I noticed one of my nails was crooked. On pointing this out, I was informed it was due to the filing not being done yet. However, even after the application of acrylic, the nail remained visibly crooked. Multiple attempts to file it only made the nail shorter, straying further from what I had asked for. Though this wasn't my first visit to the salon, it has unfortunately led me to decide that it will be my last.

An outstanding Tuesday night deal, offering a delightful selection of 1/2 price tapas accompanied by Sangria and margaritas at just $5.00. The Fried Manchego, Hot Cauliflower, and Camarones stand out as must-try dishes, delivering unique and incredibly tasty experiences. Highly recommended for a memorable and budget-friendly outing.

This unique venue offers an incredible live Jazz experience, putting the spotlight solely on the music. With no distractions from alcohol or food, it immerses you deeply into the heart of NOLA's vibrant city culture. At only $15 for a ticket, it's an affordable and pure way to enjoy some of the best Jazz music around.

For those seeking a peaceful shopping expedition away from the hustle and bustle, this mall offers a tranquil retreat. Its quiet atmosphere is a rare find, perfect for shoppers who prefer to browse at their own pace without the stress of crowds.

After a long day at the convention center, we visited H & I for dinner, seeking a serene dining experience. The staff was accommodating, offering us a quiet table in a side room. Professional and attentive service marked our evening. At the recommendation of our waiter, we shared the acclaimed 18-ounce aged ribeye steak, cooked to a perfect medium rare, which lived up to its "best steak ever" reputation, amply serving both of us. Our meal was complemented by their signature shrimp cocktail with horseradish and a well-prepared iceberg lettuce wedge with crumbled bacon, reminiscent of pancetta, proving that even simple dishes can shine with the right execution.

The only shortfall was the wine list, which offered a limited selection of medium-priced bottles, making our selection process somewhat tedious. Despite this minor issue, the overall experience at H & I was outstanding, deserving of a 4.5-star rating for their superb food and service.

During a recent visit to an Italian restaurant with high expectations, I was profoundly disappointed by both the service and food quality. Despite a lengthy 45-minute wait with a hungry family, including two young children, our experience did not improve upon being seated. While the waitress was polite, she was sometimes forgetful, affecting our overall dining experience. The limited beverage options and stale garlic bread did little to enhance our meal, prompting a request for fresher bread out of sheer hunger.

Opting for what should have been safe choices, the stuffed shells and chicken parmigiana, I found the dishes severely lacking. The stuffed shells were overcooked and hard, while the chicken was notably bland. Even the marinara sauce did not meet expectations, tasting as if it had spoiled. Although the salad was enjoyable, the absence of various dressings was disappointing.

After sending back my initial order, I chose to try the salmon based on nearby recommendations, which thankfully proved to be a satisfactory choice. However, this did little to salvage the overall dining experience. Given the quality of food and service, I felt the meal was not worth the expense and left feeling regretful about not choosing a previously frequented and highly recommended restaurant, Contessa, known for its authentic and freshly prepared Italian cuisine.

In conclusion, despite the unfortunate experience at this establishment, it highlighted the superior quality and consistency of Contessa, reaffirming it as my top choice for Italian dining in Tucson. Based on this visit, my family and I do not plan to return to Caruso.

Despite my usual reluctance to visit strip mall bars, a friend's recommendation led me to this particular establishment. Surprisingly, the experience exceeded my expectations. The food served was of commendable quality, piquing my interest to return for their pizza. Additionally, the recent introduction of a craft bar added a unique appeal, showcasing an impressive selection at very reasonable prices. Overall, this bar is a hidden gem worth exploring.

I had my first take-out experience from a local spot just around the corner, and it was a game-changer. Opting for the Buffalo chicken salad, I was pleasantly surprised. The dish boasted crisp, fresh greens, perfectly balanced blue cheese dressing without overwhelming chunks, and utterly delicious chicken. This salad alone has convinced me to return and explore more of their menu. Highly recommended for a satisfying and flavorful meal.

**Luke Restaurant: A Mixed Experience with Stellar French-German Cuisine**

Luke Restaurant in New Orleans' Central Business District promises an intriguing dive into French-German cuisine, housed in a building brimming with history next to the Hilton. Though initially met with a reservation hiccup, which seemed unnecessary given the visibly empty tables, the meal itself turned around the evening.

Cocktails started the night on a high note despite a minor setback with availability, presenting a refreshing Riverbend that, though slightly overpowered by ginger ale, was still enjoyable. The meal kicked off with varied starters, from a satisfying albeit slightly sour Crawfish Bisque to bypassing appetizers for a hearty Luke Burger that delivered in both size and taste.

Entrees didn't disappoint, with standout dishes like the Jumbo Louisiana Shrimp "En Cocotte" and a Moules et Frites that excelled in delivering bold flavors with minimalistic seasoning—a testament to the kitchen's prowess. The house-made fries accompanying the mussels were a highlight, deemed "the best kind" by a discerning palate.

Desserts of Bread Pudding and a Bourbon Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee ended the meal on a high note, especially the latter, which found the perfect balance of sweetness. Despite an excess of sauce on the pudding, the flavors still pleased the palate.

Service throughout the meal was exceptional, with an attentive and engaging server who significantly improved the dining experience, making up for the initial reception's discomfort.

Luke Restaurant, while initially presenting a rocky start due to reservation policies, ultimately delivers an impressive culinary journey through French-German cuisine, buoyed by excellent service and a historic ambiance. The approach might benefit from a touch more accessibility and coherence in seating policies, but the food and staff service carry the day.

This dental clinic offers a unique feature with little TVs in their exam rooms, aiming to enhance patient experience. However, this novelty is overshadowed by the realization that watching TV is impractical during dental procedures and might serve as a distraction from their high pricing. Despite returning after years, the impression that services might be overpriced persists, exemplified by a recommendation for several expensive inlays not covered by insurance during a routine visit. While the quality of dental work is commendable, the necessity and cost of procedures remain concerns, suggesting a potential compromise between quality care and affordability.

Visiting Paris Parker for the first time was a leap of faith for me, as I ventured without a prior recommendation, compelled by the convenience of its proximity. My apprehensive choice led me to Stacey for a full highlight appointment, and I'm thrilled to report it exceeded my expectations. Stacey was nothing short of amazing, skillfully eliminating the brassy tones from my blonde, leaving it looking both natural and brilliantly vibrant. Achieving the perfect blonde is no small feat, yet Stacey achieved it in one go, debunking my expectation of needing multiple visits to fine-tune the color. Beyond her technical prowess, Stacey's pleasant demeanor made the lengthy process enjoyable. I wholeheartedly recommend her services, albeit with a hint of reluctance, fearing her increased popularity might make booking my next appointment a challenge!

This tea shop offers an extensive and intriguing selection of ready-made teas, with the delightful option to mix your own concoctions, ensuring a perfect blend every visit. Although the loose tea can lean towards the pricey side, the quality and variety justify the expense. The staff enhances the experience significantly with their friendliness and personal touch, remembering returning customers and their preferences, making each visit feel special and welcomed.

Searching for the perfect engagement ring without prior jewelry knowledge led me through a series of unimpressive mall shops until a co-worker recommended Gemological Resources Inc (GRI). This local shop offered a refreshing and educational experience that was leaps and bounds above the rest. Terry, an expert in the field, provided a comprehensive lesson on diamonds and rings, setting the stage for a truly custom-designed engagement ring experience.

Working with both Terry and Nirali, I was presented with exceptional CAD designs and a high-quality diamond that far exceeded any I had found in my own search, all at a very reasonable price. The final product was beyond breathtaking, surpassing anything I had seen before.

The joy the engagement ring brings my wife daily led us to also commission GRI for our wedding bands, with equally stunning results. The entire experience felt more like engaging with friends than a purely transactional business dealing, making it not only stress-free but genuinely enjoyable.

For anyone considering a jewelry purchase, especially an engagement ring, I can't recommend GRI enough. Their craftsmanship, customer service, and unique designs are unmatched.

This bar offers an unparalleled cocktail experience, with a selection of delicious and unique drinks like Dragon's Tear and Blackmail, served in cool, unique glassware. Although the prices lean towards the higher side, the quality and creativity of the cocktails justify the cost. The ambiance is enhanced by music that complements the relaxed, eclectic decor perfectly. While the food options may not impress everyone, the standout cocktail menu ensures a return visit is in order.

I recently tried Pizzaville after hearing great things about it and craving some quality carry-out. Despite the prices being slightly high, the quality of the food justified every penny. The pizza, with its perfect blend of crunchy and chewy crust, topped generously with high-quality cheese, tangy sauce, and loads of mushrooms, was a delightful experience. The highlight, surprisingly, might have been the "breadsticks," which were more akin to delicious, buttery garlic bread strips that I couldn't stop eating. Additionally, the service was commendable - friendly staff and a clean store environment. Pizzaville delivered not just on the food but on the overall experience. Can't wait to go back for their lunch buffet!

The restaurant offers commendable service with polite staff, and adequate drinks typical of a chain establishment. However, it falls short with its bland, lackluster food. If you're seeking a quick lunch spot with no culinary expectations, this could suit your needs.

This dining experience seems to balance positives with a few noticeable drawbacks. The ambiance is described as modern and cozy, with decor and lighting that create a pleasant atmosphere for dining, although not for taking selfies. Service was experienced as hurried and somewhat impersonal, which detracted from the overall experience. The food, including Shrimp Breaux Bridge, Balsamic Salmon, and Pesto Crusted Idaho Trout, was good but not exceptional. The Zangria White sangria, although enjoyable, did not live up to expectations due to a lack of advertised fruits, highlighting a need for clearer menu descriptions regarding seasonal availability. Despite these issues, the overall impression is favorable enough to warrant a return visit, buoyed by the establishment's reputation and the potential for a better dining experience.

This spin-off from Rouge defies expectations, serving up burgers that arguably eclipse those of its flagship counterpart. The establishment prides itself on continually expanding its menu in an innovative manner, using a placard system for updates rather than revamping the entire menu board — a testament to their commitment to variety and freshness. My personal favorites have been the '500' burger, a delightful blend of lettuce, bacon, cheddar, and a special sauce, and custom creations featuring Kobe Beef, which I find justifies its higher price tag. The option to add luxurious touches like truffle cheese and grilled onions, coupled with a brioche bun, elevates these burgers to a new level of excellence.

The fries, especially when drenched in truffle oil, are an outright sensation, offering a taste experience unmatched by anything I've encountered. Furthermore, the late weekend hours are a godsend for nocturnal food enthusiasts. In sum, this burger haven is more than just a spin-off — it's a culinary destination in its own right, pushing the boundaries of what a burger can be.

"Tried this pizza spot recently and was disappointed. The quality fell short compared to a previous restaurant I visited which offered fantastic homemade dishes. Wished the prior place had remained my go-to."
Had a brief but enjoyable lunch experience. The jalapeno burger was impressive and the patio seating added to the ambiance. Will definitely return.

This hotel in Reno offers an exceptional experience, making it the reviewer's top choice for stays in the area. Highlighting its stunning beauty, the hotel appears to excel in various aspects that contribute to a pleasant and comfortable stay. 

Pros include an outstanding spa that boasts not only impeccable cleanliness but also extremely friendly and helpful staff, enhancing the relaxation experience. The rooms receive praise for their tidiness and organization, showcasing the hotel's commitment to guest comfort. Additionally, the front desk staff is commended for their accommodating nature, particularly in addressing room location preferences without hesitation. The hotel also offers the convenience of a 24-hour diner on the premises, which, despite being a bit pricey, is appreciated for its good quality food.

However, the hotel isn't without its flaws. A notable issue is the lack of exhaust fans in the bathroom, which leads to excessive steam buildup during showers, potentially affecting guest comfort. Another point of contention involves room service, specifically an oversight in not providing creamer with ordered coffee, which might be a minor inconvenience for some guests.

Overall, the review paints a largely positive picture of the hotel, with its strengths far outweighing the minor drawbacks. The combination of exceptional services, cleanliness, and attentive staff ensures a highly recommended stay in Reno according to the reviewer.

The experience was outstanding, making for a fantastic visit. Particularly appealing to tour enthusiasts, the guided tours offered were engaging. The beer quality met expectations, complementing the overall experience. What set this spot apart, however, was its vibrant atmosphere, enriched with multiple TVs showcasing sports, an array of board games, compelling live music, and regularly scheduled tours. Despite the bustling activity, everything was well-organized, ensuring a seamless experience. This venue is highly recommended for a delightful outing, whether you're looking to enjoy a good time with friends or planning a memorable date.

This establishment fails to meet even basic standards, marred by appalling service, subpar food, and concerning levels of uncleanliness. Patrons may worry about the safety of their meals, leaving a lot to be desired from the overall dining experience.

This Nashville wine and liquor store stands out as a personal favorite, notable for its affable and non-pretentious staff that readily offers commendable wine recommendations, even for budget-friendly $10 options. The store boasts a commendable selection and prices on par with competitors, ensuring a satisfying shopping experience. The only caveat is a notably high curb at the entrance, cautioning drivers against speeding in to avoid undercarriage damage.

The reviewer shares a positive experience with Circle of Friends daycare, highlighting the personal and academic growth of their children under the care of Linda, the owner, and her staff. Initially drawn to the daycare several years ago when Linda accommodated a drop-in request for their daughter, the reviewer found themselves returning despite relocating to a new school district and exploring other daycare options, which were either fully booked for infants and toddlers or did not feel right. Emphasizing the importance of low staff turnover as a marker of a good daycare environment, they note their satisfaction with the consistency of care their children have received. The review addresses the reality that not every child in care will have behavior that aligns with their own values, but stresses the importance of discussing these differences with children as educational opportunities. The reviewer praises the daycare for fostering an environment where their child has flourished both emotionally and academically, sharing anecdotes of surprising academic facts learned there. While acknowledging potential mixed reviews from others, the reviewer expresses contentment and gratitude for the support and fit Circle of Friends has provided for their family.
The new venue on Central has truly outdone itself, offering an exceptional atmosphere complemented by wonderful staff. It's clear this spot is set for success.

This restaurant boasts a great location and exceptionally friendly service, creating an atmosphere reminiscent of dining in Ethiopia itself. However, when it comes to the culinary experience, it falls short, earning a 6/10 when compared to other Ethiopian eateries. The dishes lack the vibrant flavors and tastes one might expect, rendering the overall dining experience quite average and nothing out of the ordinary.

Visited for the first time and left satisfied. The seafood, particularly the oysters, and the $45 combo, accompanied by garlic chicken wings, offered generous portions for our family of six. The seasoning was notably impressive. The only downside was a mix-up with our order. Despite this, the experience was positive.

I ordered a 1/2 chicken with rice and plantains for lunch, totaling over $8. Unfortunately, the chicken was overly salty, and the portion of plantains disappointingly comprised just two pieces. Despite the restaurant's positive reviews, my experience fell short of expectations. Considering the value and my experience, I'm hesitant about returning.

Initially regarded as a pretty average take-out Chinese spot, this establishment didn't particularly stand out but was deemed decent enough for a repeat visit. On a subsequent order, however, they impressively managed a complex delivery flawlessly, serving up excellent food that significantly elevated the overall experience. This remarkable improvement has warranted a jump to a full 5-star rating.

The Rib Cook-Off is an eagerly anticipated event that we've attended for several years, and it's high time it received a proper review. Our preparation for the day is meticuluous, starting with a convenient and budget-friendly bus ride directly to the Sparks bus station, eliminating the hassles of parking and driving through crowds.

Upon arrival, our first stop is invariably Great Basin, where we indulge in the essential large Icky and Bitchin' Berry beers - a tasty strategy for navigating the bustling event. The JA Nugget mobile app is a valuable tool, providing a vendor map that makes locating favorites or exploring new options a breeze, based on recommendations from friends and coworkers.

While some vendors accept cards, carrying sufficient cash is a wise move. The event is not just about ribs; the non-rib vendors offer unique finds, like the fantastic hats we picked up this year, perfect for beach outings next year.

The event's dynamic shifts with the day of the week; Saturdays are lively and packed, often ending with a cab ride home due to the full-day affair. In contrast, Mondays offer a more laid-back experience, allowing for leisurely enjoyment of the food and drinks and using our bus transfer for the return trip. Vendors stop serving food at 5:00 pm on Monday, presenting an opportunity to snag amazing deals on extra food.

The Rib Cook-Off is a well-organized, enjoyable event that offers something for everyone, from beer aficionados and food lovers to bargain hunters. It's a testament to good food, great times, and the art of planning.

This restaurant offers a blend of French and English menu options, catering mainly to locals or those familiar with French. While the extensive drink selection and bustling bar atmosphere stand out, it is the high-quality food, including standout dishes like crab bisque and Poulet Grand-Mère, that truly shines. However, the dining experience is slightly marred by slow service, attributed to the seemingly inexperienced, though friendly, staff. Overall, a commendable option for food enthusiasts, but the service might deter immediate return visits. Rating: 4/5.

Upon a friend's recommendation, shortly after relocating to Nashville, I ventured to a local eatery renowned for its brisk service and delectable offerings. Despite initial reservations as a newcomer—effectively still a tourist—the experience did not disappoint. Arriving at a modest 9:15, I was pleasantly surprised by the minimal wait time of about 5-10 minutes before being seated.

The highlight of my meal was undoubtedly the chocolate chip pancakes, which were nothing short of sensational. A side of sausage, although not as impressive, didn’t detract from the overall dining pleasure. The establishment’s unique checkout process at the door, meant to expedite customer flow, proved efficient; a testament to the establishment's approach to handling its consistent patronage.

A pro tip for prospective visitors: aiming for a visit at opening or slightly thereafter, around 7:15, significantly diminishes wait times, a handy piece of advice I gleaned from my daily commutes past the diner. This place is certainly a must-try for anyone looking to dive into Nashville's culinary scene, offering a blend of remarkable food and fast service that captures the essence of the city's vibrant food culture.

Visited for Sunday brunch and experienced an indulgent spread that leaves both your belly full and spirits high. The buffet lineup impresses with an array of seafood, an omelet station, pasta and carving stations, custom sushi rolls, fresh fruits, salads, conventional breakfast offerings, and a vast selection of desserts—including a chocolate fountain. The inclusion of bottomless mimosas, generously topped up by attentive staff, ensures a joyful buzz throughout the meal.

Beyond the buffet, the a la carte menu tempts with additional treats like Belgian waffles, french toast, blintzes, and savory dishes, with the option to reorder to your heart’s content. Our server was encouraging of our indulgent selections, adding to the enjoyable atmosphere.

Our visit coincided with Tropical Storm Debby, which, rather than detracting from the experience, lent a cozy ambiance with its fireplace and wood interiors, and the reduced crowd was a plus. Priced at $35 per person, this brunch might seem steep, but it promises value through culinary variety and the satisfaction of both appetite and taste for bubbly. A memorable brunch spot that shines even on the stormiest of days.

On a return journey from a camping trip, we decided to indulge in some fish tacos in Santa Barbara and stumbled upon this gem, ranked #2 for Baja fish tacos. Our expectations were exceeded by the delightful flavors of our dishes. We ventured to try the shrimp fish tacos, and the accommodating kitchen staff provided us with a generous platter of delectable battered shrimp. Dining on the veranda allowed us to enjoy our scrumptious meal amidst pleasant December weather. The friendliness of the staff added to the pleasant experience. This spot has earned a definitive revisit from us whenever we're back in Santa Barbara.

I've frequented On the Border in Mount Laurel over 50 visits, initially attracted by their irresistible and slightly spicier chips and salsa, transitioning from my previous spot, Don Pablo's. My usual routine involves enjoying beer specials at the bar, complemented by their standout chips and salsa during both their regular and late night happy hours. The beer specials are decent, though there's room for improvement.

On occasions when I opt for a meal, I lean towards their vegetarian sides, with their cheese enchiladas recently winning me over for their taste. Overall, dining service is commendably great.

However, experiences with bartenders fluctuate greatly. Joann shines as a beacon of excellent service, making my visits memorable with her friendly and attentive demeanor. Conversely, interactions with Nikki dramatically dip in service quality, marked by negligence and a seemingly unfriendly attitude, significantly detracting from the overall experience.

In summation, On the Border in Mount Laurel offers enjoyable appetizers, satisfying beer, and generally good service with moderate pricing, though the variance in bartender service quality can impact the visiting experience.

Visited a highly recommended spot in St. Louis and it lived up to its reputation. Despite its bustling nature, the wait, albeit lengthy on a sweltering day, was worth it for the exceptional peach shake I savored. My companions were equally pleased with their diverse selections. Affordable pricing added to the satisfaction, though the window ordering system could benefit from clearer instructions to streamline the process. Overall, it's a must-visit locale when in the vicinity.

Title: Great Desserts, Needs Service Improvement

I recently visited a dessert bar renowned for its delicious offerings. True to its reputation, the desserts didn't disappoint; I indulged in two slices of cake—marshmallow chocolate and cheesecake—which were both absolutely delightful. However, the service didn't match the high quality of the food. Despite the staff’s eagerness to help, their delivery was lacking. My order took an unreasonably long time to prepare, and the presentation, though cute, was impractical. The to-go boxes were awkwardly tied together with a string, without a bag, making it cumbersome to carry.

The most disappointing part of my experience was the interaction with the barista. When I ordered an iced coffee with milk and sugar, the preparation process felt unnecessarily complicated and ended with me, essentially, concocting my own beverage. The barista's approach to adding sugar—by making me choose and add my own—followed by a less-than-ideal mix of coffee and an overly generous portion of milk, resulted in a drink far from what I wanted. The coffee ended up being discarded as it didn't meet my expectations.

Despite these setbacks, I am hopeful. The desserts alone make a return visit tempting. I'm optimistic that this new business is still finding its feet and will soon make necessary adjustments to match the quality of its service with that of its exquisite desserts.

The JW's accommodations are truly noteworthy, particularly for their support towards working moms. During a trade show in the Grand Ballroom, I needed a private space to pump, and the staff, with special mention to Nathan, were incredibly understanding and swift in their response. They provided access to a clean, locked boardroom, ensuring privacy and comfort. This gesture of thoughtfulness wasn't just extended to me but to another mom as well. The facilities and the boardroom were in impeccable condition, reflecting the high standards of cleanliness at the JW. The kindness and efficiency of the staff made a significant positive impact on my day, highlighting the JW's commitment to accommodating the needs of all guests. A huge thank you to the JW and its staff for making such considerate arrangements and supporting working moms.

Joe's offers an appealing dining experience highlighted by a menu that boasts both quality and variety. The beef tacos, a highlight on the appetizer list, stand out for their flavor and value, promising a return order on subsequent visits. The comfort of well-prepared meatloaf and mashed potatoes, alongside a cold, crisp salad generously topped with bleu cheese crumbles, further cements Joe's as a go-to for those seeking satisfying, no-frills comfort food.

However, the service detracts from the overall experience. An inconsistency in staff knowledge and attentiveness was noted across two visits, with missed opportunities to inform diners of specials, mistaken orders, and delays in service - even during off-peak hours. Despite the restaurant's appealing decor and meticulously maintained cleanliness, the service inconsistencies are a notable blemish.

In summary, while Joe's culinary offerings are a strong draw, the service aspect requires improvement to fully realize its potential as a dining destination.

This establishment offers an excellent dining experience with its outstanding food quality. The staff is incredibly welcoming, creating a warm atmosphere for all patrons. The menu boasts a wide variety of choices, ensuring there's something for everyone. Particularly noteworthy are the sandwiches, which are loaded with delicious, high-quality meat, setting them apart from the competition. Furthermore, the handmade toasted ravioli is a standout dish, arguably the best in town. This place is definitely worth a visit for anyone looking for top-notch food and a friendly environment.

Upon visiting St. Louis, intrigued by the local buzz about its BBQ, I decided to give one of its revered spots a try right after landing. The customer service encountered was noteworthy, setting a pleasant tone for the meal. A standout was their homemade BBQ sauce, striking a balance between sweet, tangy, and a spicy kick—though newcomers to such bold flavors might find it a bit overwhelming. The pulled pork sandwich, a recommended dish, alongside beans and coleslaw, provided a comprehensive taste of the locale's offerings. However, for those not accustomed to or who don't regularly indulge in such rich, flavorful fare, it might prove to be an intense culinary experience.

The dining experience was underwhelming, particularly with the chicken salad sandwich which disappointingly comprised merely two cubes of chicken with mayo, and the "salad" turned out to be just a bowl of lettuce. Left the place feeling hungry, indicating the portions and preparation were far from satisfying.

We enjoyed a delightful brunch with consistently good food and efficient, courteous service. The omelets were sumptuous, and the beverage selection, highlighted by a bloody mary bar, was enjoyable, though we noted a need for fresher bacon at one point. Opting for the budget breakfast, I was satisfied with scrambled eggs, roasted potatoes, and a sweet muffin. The fish tacos also did not disappoint. The al fresco dining experience on the patio added a nice touch to our meal.

This eatery delivers a remarkable dining experience, convincing even before trying their pancakes. The common sight of a queue stretching out the door and along the sidewalk speaks volumes of its popularity. Their fundamental offerings such as hash browns, eggs, and bacon are prepared to perfection, complemented by superb service. Despite minor parking challenges, the overall quality and atmosphere make a return visit an easy decision. A must-visit for a satisfying meal.

I recently tried C & B's via Order Up Delivery Svc for a cozy winter dinner at home, and it was a delightful experience. I opted for the Swanky Frank with fries; the hot dog was deliciously loaded, and the fries were nicely seasoned, adding an extra zing to the meal. Not wanting to miss out, I also ordered a large bowl of beef chili, which is a must-try from a chili house. The chili came perfectly packaged, making it ideal for a comforting late-night snack. I especially appreciated being able to request sour cream and crackers on the side, which is great for warming up. If you're looking for a snug chili meal at home this winter, I highly recommend using Order Up Delivery Svc. A solid choice for a satisfying, warm meal.

This eatery offers an impressive selection of rich, delightful food, although at a premium price. The ever-changing menu ensures a novel experience with each visit, making it hard to savor the same dish twice. Notably, it serves some of the most unique donuts around, making it a must-visit for food enthusiasts looking for an extraordinary culinary adventure.

My recent dining adventure at Livery undoubtedly left a lasting impression, guiding me towards enthusiastically recommending a few must-haves for anyone considering a visit. Kicking things off with the Carriage House Margarita, a classic with a delightful brandy twist, sets the stage for what's to come. Embrace indulgence and opt for all of the empanadas. Trust me, you'll want every flavor all to yourself. The Red Drum emerged as a standout entree, not just for its exquisitely cooked fish but for the accompanying yuca fries that add a delightful texture contrast. And whatever you do, heed my advice on the churros: they're too splendid to share. So, for a culinary escapade that'll tantalize from start to finish, consider my order as your blueprint at Livery.

After a long day's drive back to Nashville, my son and I ventured into a bustling burger joint in dire need of a hearty meal. To our delight, despite the crowd, the restaurant operated smoothly, seating us promptly and serving us with both efficiency and courtesy. The pricing was reasonable—a welcome bonus. 

We kicked things off with a couple of Highland stouts; they were exactly what we needed and didn't break the bank. A shared large garden salad served as our appetizer. It was fresh and tasty, though the vinaigrette dressing was somewhat heavier than preferred. 

The main event, however, did not disappoint. My Black and Blue burger, accompanied by crisp, lightly salted fries and an unexpectedly pleasing homemade ketchup, was nothing short of incredible. The blue cheese added just the right kick without overwhelming the palate, and the bun was soft and fresh. My son opted for a classic burger with sweet potato fries, which might just be the best we've ever tasted. 

Our meal was devoured in silence—a testament to its quality. We’re already planning our return. This place is a must-visit for anyone in search of a satisfying burger experience in Nashville.

"This donut spot stands unrivaled as the BEST place for donuts, leaving a lasting impression long after moving away from New Orleans. The longing for their unmatched deliciousness is palpable, sparking a wish they offered shipping to places like Florida. Truly a gem exclusive to New Orleans!"

Katie's, a longstanding neighborhood gem, marries classic New Orleans cuisine with an Italian-American twist. Its enduring presence for several generations has made it a local staple. Noteworthy for its exceptional meatballs, Katie's offers a glimpse into traditional New Orleans dining culture, especially noticeable with the older generations dining before 8pm. While its charm and quality are consistent, aligning expectations to its homey, unfussy standards promises an enjoyable experience. A visit to Katie's won't disappoint those in search of authentic, comforting fare.
"Outstanding experience! The service was exceptionally speedy, coupled with a friendly and professional demeanor. It has quickly become my preferred choice for oil changes. Highly recommend!"

This establishment offers a disappointing experience, particularly for Latino customers. The staff, particularly one hairdresser, showcases unprofessional and rude behavior, making it an unwelcoming environment for a diverse clientele. Overall, it falls short in providing the respectful and inclusive service that is expected.

This restaurant seriously needs an overhaul, reminiscent of a scenario straight out of "Restaurant Impossible." With its run-down atmosphere, tacky and mismatched decor, it appears as if the establishment's darkness serves more to conceal its dinginess than add ambiance. Every surface seemed unpleasantly sticky. Culinary experiences were far from salvaging the situation; a requested medium burger arrived as a charred, flavorless remnant, while the misheard “baked crab soup” turned out to be aptly described by our initial misunderstanding. The crab stuffed mushrooms also disappointed, offering more filler than actual crab. The saving grace, if any, was the exceptionally kind service from the servers.

This New American restaurant is a must-visit for food lovers. The owner's passion for cuisine shines through both the service and the delectable dishes. From the mixed berry waffle to the huevo rancho and the traditional breakfast bagel accompanied by satisfying grits, every item on the menu seems meticulously prepared. The huevo rancho and the brilliantly named 'best sandwich,' served with fresh fruits, stood out as favorites. The impeccable service further enhances the dining experience. Make sure to greet the owner when you visit; his enthusiasm and kindness add a special touch to the meal. Highly recommended for a memorable dining experience.

Had an excellent happy hour experience at this place with superb oysters - we savored 2 dozen of them! The cocktails, especially the Riverbend and Champagne au Poir, were delightfully tasty. Also tried a side of fries and the best grits ever, according to my friend. Planning a return visit thanks to the great service that struck the perfect balance of attentiveness. Highly recommend!

Bella Vista Designs comes highly recommended for their exceptional service, from their professionalism to their innovative designs, all offered at an affordable price. Their can-do attitude and creative flair consistently impress at events, particularly those held at the Santa Barbara Historical Museum and Goleta Valley Historical Society, leaving guests and generous donors alike in awe. Their contribution to numerous successful events has not only created magical moments but has also garnered heartfelt gratitude for their outstanding work.
"Recently moved to Tucson and found myself in need of a new dentist. The visit went wonderfully! Highly recommend."

This dining spot on State Street comes with a strong warning: avoid at all costs. Described as highly overrated, the food barely scrapes a pass with a C minus rating. However, it's not just the lackluster meals that disappoint; the service, or lack thereof, transforms dining here into a regrettable experience. Incorrect orders with no apologies seem to be the norm, making a return visit an unlikely choice when there are numerous other eateries in the vicinity to explore.

This gem, taking over the location of the former Mugshots, boasts not only excellent food but stellar service and friendly pricing. A colleague's high praise, especially for the falafel and the amiable owner, led me to visit with my partner. We indulged in a perfectly carved beef gyro pita, a falafel pita bursting with flavor, and a hummus plate that screamed freshness. The portions were generous, complemented by the unexpected delight of complimentary baklava. It's the kind of place where the quality compels you to savor every last bite, even packing the smallest leftovers to enjoy later. Beyond the culinary delights, it's the kind of spot that leaves you cheering for its success, both for the deserving owner's sake and for the selfish desire to frequent a place that consistently brings joy. A rare find in Manayunk, this establishment is a must-visit, promising a departure with a satisfying smile. Highly recommended, and certainly a place I'll be encouraging friends to support.

Had a wonderful dining experience, marked by delicious food and top-notch service. The only minor issue was the timing between courses; our entrees arrived just 10 minutes after our appetizers, leaving us rushing through the starters. Despite this, it was a great experience overall.

The establishment reviewed falls into the category of distinctly average. Situated in a neglected strip mall next to Mozzarella Pizza, its ambiance reflects a lack of concern for aesthetic appeal, presenting an appearance that's neither overtly dirty nor appealingly clean, with a general air of disrepair. The clientele seemingly consists of suburbanites in search of a typical Chinese culinary experience, which the venue manages to deliver, albeit in a decidedly unremarkable fashion. The food, while edible and satisfactory to a degree, fails to impress, hovering around the realm of mediocrity. It's not a place to actively avoid, but neither does it offer any compelling reasons for a visit.
This place is exceptional! Tried the Hickory burger and it was incredibly delicious. Definitely planning a return visit!

This restaurant offers a unique culinary experience that tantalizes the taste buds with flavors that are both outstanding and different. Our server, Brian, added to the experience with his infectious passion and in-depth knowledge of the food. It's a paradise for foodies, thanks to the extraordinary and annually rotating menu crafted by highly skilled chefs who are part of a successful restaurant group including the Red Pony and two others on the same street. However, despite the excellent food, the portions were on the smaller side, and the restaurant's ambiance, particularly the lack of booths, was a letdown for me. While it was an interesting visit, the complexity of the dishes means I might limit my visits to once a year.

My latest visit to this restaurant showcased a notable improvement across the board. The standout was the service, significantly enhanced by an attentive staff member named Dillon. The establishment maintains a very casual ambiance where you order and then take a seat, with food brought directly to you. The menu is impressively diverse and satisfying without being overpriced or pretentious, fitting perfectly into the fast, casual dining category. Remarkably, we fed a family of four for about $30, which is exceptional value in today's market. If you're in the hunt for an affordable and quick Asian dining option, this place is definitely worth a try.

My experience at this breakfast spot proved quite enjoyable, particularly due to the conveniences offered by technology and the variety available on the menu. Utilizing the Yelp app to join the waiting list on a bustling Saturday morning significantly streamlined our entry process. The menu's vast selection was impressive, with the cinnamon French toast standing out as a highlight. While the standard breakfast options were comparable to other establishments, the unique additions to the menu promise numerous return visits. The strawberry orange juice is a must-try, offering a refreshing twist. Though the atmosphere was marred slightly by the warmer-than-preferred interior temperature, the excellent service and efficient checkout process, facilitated by dual payment stations, rounded out a largely positive dining experience.

Visited Shaving Grace on a Friday and immediately felt at home, reminiscent of my old barber shop in Philly. The ambiance is welcoming with a large TV, a comfortable couch, and even a refreshing beverage offered upon check-in—yes, beer included. The haircut was top-notch, delivered amidst engaging conversations about current events, sports, and local happenings. It's clear I've found my new go-to spot. Will definitely return.

My visit to this establishment was nothing short of delightful, marked by both excellent food and outstanding service. The eggs Benedict featured perfectly poached eggs, but it was the exceptional quality of the toast that truly stood out. Our server, Tina, exemplified the genuine and amiable nature of the staff by offering us a taste test of cream pancakes. These pancakes proved to be the highlight, infused with a rich vanilla flavor, and so tender they melted in the mouth without any need for syrup. Easily the best pancake experience I've ever had. An overall stellar dining experience!

We experienced excellent service at this restaurant. My husband's choice of a cheese and bacon burger and my selection of the crawfish sausage po' boy were both skillfully prepared and delicious. Highly recommended for their quality dishes.
I had an outstanding experience at the Ashley Furniture store, thanks to JT. He was incredibly supportive, especially accommodating when I needed to adjust my order. Highly recommend!

Venturing away from the typical food truck offerings, my girlfriend and I decided to give Cucina Zapata at Drexel University a try, enticed by its consistent lunchtime crowd and a friend's recommendation. Nestled at the end of the food truck row, its vibrant graffiti style immediately sets it apart.

I indulged in the Thai short rib tacos, which surpassed my expectations in both taste and quality, distinctly outperforming standard fast-food options despite the unexpected addition of hot sauce. Meanwhile, my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed her Cap'n Crunch tilapia burrito, both of us appreciating the appealing presentation of our meals.

Cucina Zapata stands out as a remarkable find, offering delicious, well-priced meals. It's an essential stop for anyone on campus seeking a satisfying and unique lunch experience. Highly recommended.

I recently had my first haircut at this salon with Jessie Becker and couldn't be happier with the experience. Jessie skillfully trimmed the damaged ends, perfectly following my instructions. Beyond her professionalism, she exudes a warm and sweet personality, making the visit truly enjoyable. Impressively, she's also fantastic with kids, ensuring a welcoming environment for all ages. I highly recommend visiting this place and specifically seeking out Jessie for your next haircut.
Fantastic ramen experience! Delighted to have discovered this gem where both the service and food exceed expectations. Highly recommend for an authentic and enjoyable meal.

This charming spot offers a pleasing ambiance, friendly service, and tasty cuisine. However, its significantly small portion sizes leave much to be desired, resulting in an overall unsatisfying dining experience, especially disappointing for a neighborhood restaurant where generous servings are anticipated.

Recently dined here for the first time and it lived up to the hype. Opted for the Chickpea Vegetarian Pita, with the staff accommodating some substitutions, while my girlfriend enjoyed the Greek Salad. Both dishes were delicious and portions generous. Impressed by the friendly staff and pleasant ambiance. Definitely planning a return visit!

Visited for the first time and was thoroughly impressed with the bar and restaurant, boasting an open floor plan and plenty of TVs for game-watching. Located in Maryland Heights, Missouri, this place is conveniently attached to the O'Fallon brewery, famous for being the 2nd top-selling microbrewery in the St. Louis area. Sampled the House Special IPA and found it perfectly balanced, not overly bitter. A special shoutout to Troy for his excellent service behind the bar. The only downside is the lack of desserts, hence a 4-star rating. Highly recommend a visit!

Tucked away on the eastern stretch of Whyte Avenue, nestled in a strip mall along a one-way street, lies a dive bar that seems to aim for no frills charm. Visiting on a bustling Saturday night, the bar presents a very average aesthetic with its couple of pool tables, a foosball table, and a smattering of TV screens. It's clear the venue caters to a younger clientele, complete with live band entertainment and a doorman to manage the nighttime crowd.

The pricing of drinks comes across as reasonable, offering a welcoming respite for those looking for a night out without breaking the bank. A standout feature appears to be the food specials – particularly the wings, which are not only budget-friendly but are also served with a traditional side of carrot and celery sticks. Though I didn't sample the pizzas, they seemed to promise a cheesy delight by appearance alone.

Service was delivered with a youthful energy, with pleasant servers moving about the space. The owner, taking her place behind the bar, contributed to the overall fine experience. Despite its unpretentious and possibly predictable dive bar feel, this spot earns a slightly elevated rating from me, partly as a counterbalance to a previously unduly critical review. For those in the area looking for a laid-back evening with affordable drinks, a bit of casual gaming, and the potential for live music, this neighbourhood dive on Whyte Avenue could very well be worth the visit.

This establishment, located a short walk from the Peppermill and nestled among auto repair shops, failed to deliver a satisfactory dining experience. Venturing away from the buffet scene, expectations were unfortunately met with disappointment. The restaurant, which seems to primarily serve a clientele from nearby businesses, offered food that was described as low-quality Chinese cuisine. Not only were initial orders incorrect, but even a subsequent attempt with a simpler dish resulted in an unpleasant taste, further solidifying an unsatisfactory visit.

I experienced a minor hiccup with the Yelp coupon initially, but once resolved, the dining experience was superb. The chicken Caesar salad impressed with its generous chicken serving, while the subs were both fresh and flavorful. Additionally, the availability of beer and a variety of Dr. Brown's cream soda flavors added a delightful touch. Conveniently situated just a mile from the Wagon Wheel flea market, this place is definitely worth a visit for those in the area.

Had an excellent visit at Dr. Neel's office. Both Dr. Neel and Robin were welcoming and demonstrated extensive knowledge, making my experience exceptionally positive. They were patient and responsive, ensuring all my questions were answered. Their assistance in selecting stylish Lucky Brand frames and fitting me for contact lenses was greatly appreciated. Undoubtedly, this is the best optometry experience I've had, and I highly recommend their services.

This breakfast spot is a newfound favorite, boasting the best morning meal in recent memory. The pancakes are notably huge, while the home fries keep it deliciously simple, steering clear of unnecessary extras. Adding to the charm is the owner, whose sweetness and generosity enhance the dining experience. Highly recommended for a delightful breakfast.

During a six-night family trip to New Orleans, we stayed at this charming and beautiful hotel. The staff, from the doorman to the brunch waitstaff, were exceptionally friendly and helpful. A highlight of our stay was the Carousel Bar, which is a must-visit. The hotel's location is fantastic, and we're already planning to return on our next visit to the Big Easy.

I had an unsatisfactory experience with the chicken stew I ordered. It seemed to be made from tasteless, possibly leftover fried chicken hastily repurposed into a stew. This was disappointing as it lacked the freshness and flavor one would expect from a restaurant meal. Frankly, it was a letdown and left me feeling nauseated. If I had wanted leftovers, I would have opted for a home meal. Overall, a displeasing dining experience.

Review of Wei Hong:

I recently visited Wei Hong in St. Louis, hoping it would end my search for a decent Chinese restaurant in the area. Unfortunately, it fell significantly short of expectations. Despite the quick takeout service on a Saturday night, which seemed promising at first, the quality of the food was disappointing.

The steamed dumplings showed potential, with a homemade feel and tasty filling, but were let down by an overly thick and doughy wrapper. This issue of compromise in texture and quality permeated through the rest of our order. The beef in the beef and broccoli dish had a peculiar, gelatinous texture that made it inedible. The sauces on both the General Tao's chicken and the orange beef, while potentially good in flavor, were ruined by their gloopy consistency and the meat's off-putting mushiness. The fried rice was passable, but ultimately forgettable.

Given the empty dining room on what should have been a bustling Saturday night, it seems others may have come to similar conclusions. We've decided that we won't be returning to Wei Hong and will continue our search for quality Chinese cuisine elsewhere.
"Great service at a crucial time! A huge thanks to Cecile for the assist in loading our plywood in preparation for IRMA. Exceptionally helpful!"

I had an excellent dining experience with an outstanding chicken tagine dish, where the meat was tender and fell off the bone effortlessly. Accompanied by a flavorful carrot salad seasoned with mint and cumin, the meal was delightful. The service was commendable, and the ambiance inside the restaurant was cheerful and brightly lit, contributing to a pleasant visit. Remarkably, the total cost came to around $13, making it not only a culinary success but also an affordable dining option.

Despite high expectations fueled by numerous positive reviews, our dining experience fell remarkably short, particularly regarding the food quality. Visiting at 10 PM, we hoped for a late-night culinary delight but were met with disappointment. It's concerning that the quick turnaround of our dishes suggested they weren't freshly prepared. From the room-temperature, overdressed Caesar salad to the flavorless hush puppies and undercooked, tepid chicken wings, the meal was underwhelming. The only mildly redeeming element was the chicken and biscuits, offering a decent flavor though marred by inconsistency in temperature.

On a brighter note, the establishment boasts a trendy atmosphere complemented by friendly service, aspects that did little to compensate for the culinary letdown. Given the experience, it's unlikely we'd return or recommend dining here, at least for those seeking quality food, especially in the late hours. If an establishment chooses to operate its kitchen late, it should uphold standards that match its day-time service.

Disappointing experience with online ordering: Despite the convenience anticipated from placing an order 30 minutes prior to pickup, the effort proved futile as the establishment claimed to have no record of the transaction upon arrival. This negated the advantage of skipping the line, leading to a frustrating outcome with no resolution provided. Unacceptable and discouraging service.

An absolute must-try in Philly, especially if you're a fan of cream-filled donuts. My visit was a delightful surprise - the cream-filled delight was so unforgettable, I made a special trip back just to get more for the road. Every bite was heavenly, making the drive back to Michigan a deliciously memorable experience. No regrets on indulging in all six; they were simply that good!

Joe Bob's establishment is a place to avoid, especially if you're concerned about safety and hygiene. Known for attracting a dubious crowd, including "drunk gamblers," it's notorious for its unwelcoming atmosphere and the apparent indifference of its owners and staff towards non-gambling patrons. The kitchen's mold issues and the unpleasant odor resembling a "sewer plant" only add to the establishment's lack of appeal. The focus on gambling profits over customer experience and investment in the venue itself is a stark departure from the standards set by its original owners. The staff, described as unfriendly and only attentive to high-spending gamblers, further diminishes the appeal. In contrast, options like the nearby fast-food restaurant "El Pollo Loco" offer a cleaner environment, friendlier service, and a safer dining experience, making it a preferred alternative.

During our first visit, seeking an alternative to the bustling Terakawa on a cold Friday night, my family and I were pleasantly surprised by our dining experience. From the outset, the staff showcased their excellent service and friendliness, notably assisting my wife with her jacket while she held our baby, a gesture demonstrating their attentiveness.

We indulged in a variety of dishes: Chicken Katsu Curry Ramen for myself, Shrimp Katsu Ramen for my sister, and Shoyu Ramen for my wife. Each dish was exemplary in its execution—the curry soup paired with perfectly fried chicken was a standout for me, as was the quality and preparation of the shrimp in my sister’s dish. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her Shoyu Ramen, affirming the overall quality of our meal.

We also sampled the pork buns, which were exceptional albeit a unique take on the traditional offering.

Overall, our experience was remarkable for its great food and equally impressive service. I am certainly glad we decided to dine here, and it’s safe to say we will be returning.

Brew D Licious stands out as the premier coffee destination in town, offering an unparalleled coffee experience that overshadows all other local coffee houses. The owner, Brigitte, impresses not only with her deep knowledge of coffee brewing but also with her remarkable ability to turn every visitor into a loyal patron. Her dedication is evident in the exceptional quality of the coffee she sells, ensuring it's always fresh, and her exceptional customer service extends to personal deliveries during construction of her new location. While the current setting within the Hollander Hotel has its drawbacks, such as a cramped space and an unpleasant odor, anticipation is high for the opening of her new venue. Visitors are eager to enjoy Brew D Licious's superior coffee in a more inviting and aromatic environment. Brigitte's commitment to excellence has significantly raised the bar for coffee standards in St. Petersburg, making the upcoming grand opening of her new location a highly anticipated event for all coffee enthusiasts in the area.
"Finally found fantastic pizza and garlic knots at the beach! The excellent location and cool street vibe make it stand out. It's clear these guys are experts in their craft."

This reviewer focuses solely on the oysters offered at the establishment, praising them as the freshest and best-tasting they've ever had. Although there was a minor service hiccup when the server failed to return with information on the oyster variety, the quality of the oysters themselves more than compensated for this oversight. The reviewer enthusiastically recommends the oysters, assuring potential diners they won't be disappointed.

Tried the local cuisine and was thoroughly impressed - it's the best I've experienced in the area. The kung pao beef and basil shrimp stood out, both accompanied by delightful pork fried rice. To top it off, the delivery service was remarkably fast. Highly recommend!

This eatery goes beyond the usual deli expectations, providing generous portions that are sure to satisfy. My wife and I enjoyed the Philly and club sandwiches, both of which were delicious and offered great value — our entire meal, including four bags of chips for the kids, came to just over $20. A tip for future visitors: come with an appetite, as the servings are impressively large.

This review praises a dry cleaning and alterations business, dismissing criticisms as largely unfounded and possibly motivated by biases unrelated to the service quality. The reviewer emphasizes their positive experiences, highlighting the staff's competence over friendliness, the successful removal of decade-old stains, and a consistently quick turnaround time of 2-3 days—even during busy periods. They express a strong recommendation for the business and plan to continue using its services after moving. This endorsement underlines the business's reliability and skill in garment care.

The new location surpasses the Rittenhouse branch in size and offers the convenient bonus of street parking. The service here is commendable, with our server being notably amiable and eager to share her personal favorites from the menu. Although the Groothie came highly recommended, my taste test revealed it to be overly sweet for my preference. However, the Udon Noodle Salad did not disappoint, delivering a flavorful and satisfying experience.

Visited for the first time with family and were thoroughly impressed thanks to our exceptional server, Bailey. She provided friendly and attentive service, enhancing our dining experience. The food was nothing short of incredible - from the generously portioned hummus plate to the fresh pretzels, mozzarella sticks, and caprese salad. Everything tasted fresh and exceeded expectations for a first-time visit. We're definitely planning a return visit!

This Fazoli's location has the potential to be a great spot for a quick bite, thanks to its tasty entrees, reasonable prices, and delectable breadsticks. Unfortunately, the dining experience is marred by lackluster service and a noticeable attitude problem from the staff. A particularly disappointing instance involved a manager giving a hard time to customers for simply taking advantage of the advertised free, unlimited breadsticks, contradicting their own promotion. Additionally, service inefficiencies were evident, highlighted by a new hire struggling to manage orders during a busy lunch rush, further impeding the overall customer experience. A 4/5 star experience is within reach for this restaurant if these issues are addressed.

The review reflects a mixed experience at a car wash facility encountered spontaneously during an errand run. Initially ashamed of the car's condition, the decision to opt for the $12 Tchoup was driven by convenience and the unsatisfactory state of the vehicle. Despite a brief wait due to a queue, the added entertainment of iguanas, parrots, and Ms. Pac-Man in the waiting area provided a unique distraction.
