Upon inspection post-wash, the service was found lacking in thoroughness, with remnants of bird droppings on the hood and bugs on the grill signaling a job that was, perhaps, too rushed or lacked attention to detail. This led to a reflection on a preferred car wash service in Los Angeles known for its meticulous cleaning, highlighting a perceived gap in value and quality between the two experiences.

Summarizing, the reviewer acknowledges the utility of the chosen service in a pinch but expresses disappointment in the cleaning quality, which did not meet their expectations or standards set by previous experiences elsewhere. The conclusion leans towards exploring other washing options, specifically a touchless system, even in the absence of entertaining amenities, suggesting a prioritization of cleaning quality over supplementary experiences.

The venue has recently replaced its large, live turtle tank with a vibrant fish aquarium. Although the whereabouts of the turtle remain unclear, this update hasn't diminished the location's charm. Highly recommended.

This Starbucks offers a highly efficient drive-thru experience, with fast-moving lines ensuring quick service, even when busy. The indoor area is comfortably spacious, complemented by an ample amount of outdoor seating. Overall, it stands out as an excellent location for coffee enthusiasts.

This review shares a disappointing hair salon experience. The customer, who prefers scissor cuts for their straight hair, specifically requested not to have their hair cut with clippers. Despite assuring the customer they could accommodate a scissor cut, the stylist proceeded to use clippers for about 90% of the haircut, contradicting the customer’s clear request. The review suggests seeking services elsewhere for those who prefer scissor cuts over clipper styles such as high and tight or faded cuts.

This dining spot in NOLA is a gem with its excellent food, ambiance, and location. I had the pleasure of enjoying a delicious artichoke and crab salad for lunch, which was absolutely delightful and left a lasting impression, making my mouth water at the mere thought of it. My friend opted for the grilled and roasted vegetable platter, and every bite was a testament to the quality and excellence of the food. I highly recommend this place for an unforgettable dining experience.

Had an excellent lunch recommendation while at the Nashville airport, leading me to a place with a funky, eclectic atmosphere. The menu was filled with great, healthy options. I tried the sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberries, and it was absolutely fantastic. A delightful experience!

Whenever we travel from Orlando, we often find ourselves drawn to this cozy venue. Its intimate setting is perfect for those who appreciate a smaller, more personal atmosphere. The staff is fantastic, always ensuring that the service is nothing short of excellent. For an optimal experience, I highly recommend requesting table #4.

This restaurant offers an exceptional dining experience, marked by great food, atmosphere, and service. Having visited twice, the consistency in quality was evident, with each visit being as pleasurable as the last. The culinary offerings, although slightly expensive, are mouthwateringly good, especially for those with a penchant for Nutella. The Belgian Waffle topped with Nutella stands out, providing a heavenly taste sensation.

This brunch spot shines as a great late-morning option on weekends, with minimal wait times after the 1 PM rush. However, the seating process lacks structure, often leaving guests confused whether to seat themselves or wait to be guided. Despite this, service improves significantly once seated, with attentive staff and a clean environment.

The menu offers a range of options, with dishes varying from satisfactory to excellent. While the chicken wings and onion rings fall flat in terms of flavor and execution, the smashwich and classic diner-style club sandwich stand out for their quality. The establishment truly excels with its breakfast offerings, particularly the egg and omelette platters, and the waffle, which is noted for its perfect blend of sweetness and crispiness.

Overall, if you can navigate the initial seating hurdle, this spot delivers a solid dining experience with great value and tasty food.

This establishment would have earned a solid 5-star rating from me, but unfortunately, their Reuben sandwich fell short of expectations, particularly due to the lackluster rye bread—an unexpected letdown from a place that prides itself on its bread offerings.

On the brighter side, the menu does have its highlights. My fiancée's unnamed sandwich, which combined chicken, bacon, and avocado on French bread, was a standout, delivering on flavor and satisfaction. Additionally, their spicy chicken soup paired with cornbread made for a great meal, boasting a generous mix of vegetables and chicken with just the right level of heat, complemented by delicious, sizeable cornbread.

The chai latte, however, was underwhelming and is something I’d advise skipping. 

Despite being a bit on the pricey side, the restaurant’s welcoming atmosphere, coupled with the friendly and accommodating staff, makes it a worthwhile spot for a delightful breakfast or lunch experience. 

So, if you're curious and find yourself in the vicinity, give this place a visit and see how it fares for you. Remember to skip the Reuben and the chai latte, but definitely consider their exceptional sandwiches and the spicy chicken soup!

Target shines as a one-stop shopping destination, eclipsing Wal Mart with its diverse array of products spanning from apparel and electronics to groceries and household items. Notably, its competitive pricing, particularly in the makeup section, stands out as a significant advantage, offering savings of $2-3 compared to other retailers. The store's well-stocked grocery aisle and impressive range of household appliances add to its appeal. Customer service is top-notch, with an ample number of registers operational to ensure minimal wait times. Overall, Target offers a superior shopping experience with its variety, affordability, and efficiency.

This establishment would have earned a 5-star rating from me but upon reflection of my overall rating history, I believe I may typically be overly generous. That said, I exclusively sampled the Oysters here, which were undeniably spectacular. A special shoutout to Kentrelle at the Oyster Bar – requesting the "firecracker" is a must. It's an experience so impressive it's metaphorically explosive.

This HMV location stands out as the largest and arguably best in the city, offering an unparalleled selection that surpasses the typical hot and new titles. It's particularly noted for its variety of gifting options such as figurines, mugs, and blankets. While prices remain consistent with other stores, the broad inventory compensates for this. A notable service is the option to order in titles not available in-store, though communication from staff regarding order arrivals could be improved.

The checkout process is efficient, even during busy times, with staff at the tills receiving specific praise for their speed and for not aggressively promoting the Pure rewards program. However, it's worth mentioning that the rewards program may not offer substantial value, based on personal experience with redemption items.

In conclusion, while prices and the ordering process have room for improvement, the selection and swift checkout service earn this location high marks. It remains a recommended destination for those in search of specific movies or CDs, with a rating of 3 out of 5 stars.

Absolutely outstanding dining experience! From the impeccable fried oysters to the sumptuous crawfish bisque and perfectly cooked shrimp with grits, every dish was a hit. Just a heads-up: reservations are essential. Don't miss out on this culinary delight!

Embarking on a holiday mission for the perfect coat led to an unexpected saga. Initially, Burlington caught my eye, but lacked my size. A brief stint with a Target coat ended in dissatisfaction. My journey then led me to Ross, where a pleather bomber jacket momentarily filled the void - until post-Christmas wrinkles revealed its true form. Attempts to revive the coat failed miserably. With no receipt or tags, I approached Ross's understanding manager for an exchange. Against all odds, my dream camouflage coat appeared in my size, as if by fate. Ross's exceptional customer service has won my loyalty, transforming the quest into a testament to perseverance and unexpected joy.

An excellent choice for delicious eats, offering standout dishes like the superb Udon Noodle Salad and the irresistibly tasty Crispy Hipcity Ranch. Coupled with friendly staff and swift service, it's a top spot. The convenience of their delivery service is a notable bonus. Highly recommended for a delightful dining experience.

In this heartfelt review, the author shares their enamoring experience at a Philadelphia pizza spot, highlighting how it stands out not only for its atmosphere but also for its exceptional culinary offerings. The restaurant's unique feature of accommodating preferences with a cheeseless option, The Marinara, immediately pleased their son and set a positive tone for the visit. The comparison to renowned pizza joints like Lombardi's and Grimaldi's elevates the establishment's status in the eyes of the reader.

The author's detailed descriptions of their dishes, such as the Salsiccia pizza adorned with roasted fennel and the innovative Rotolo, serve to vividly paint the culinary artistry and bold flavors the restaurant offers. Moreover, the sharing of a unique cocktail, The Brooklyn, emphasizes not just the food but also the inventive drink menu and the considerate service that enhances the dining experience.

The review is peppered with personal anecdotes and humor, engaging the reader while providing insight into the restaurant's ambiance and customer-centric approach. The addition of dessert, including a noteworthy mention of the Affogato, wraps up the meal on a high note, further showcasing the variety and quality of the menu.

Finally, the reviewer's intention to explore more of Vetri's establishments and the commendation of the service solidify the five-star experience. This enthusiastic and detailed review not only serves as a compelling recommendation for the restaurant but also captures the joy of discovering a place that feels like a culinary haven.

This high-end store in West Edmonton Mall stands out for its excellent array of designer clothing, particularly excelling in suits, dress shirts, and fancy attire for men. The shopping experience is enhanced by the helpful yet unobtrusive staff who prioritize customer comfort over pushy sales tactics. While the pricing reflects the quality and exclusivity of the merchandise, the value and service provided ensure satisfaction. Ideal for those seeking premium, dressy options without the pressure of aggressive salesmanship.

This dining spot offers tasty Mediterranean fare that, while enjoyable, may not stand out significantly from what one might find at a typical food truck. It serves as a perfectly decent option for late-night eats, providing a satisfying amount to eat for the price, though a bit more generosity in portions could make it feel like a better value. The restaurant boasts ample seating and maintains a clean, well-kept environment, making it a refreshing break from the nearby bustling bar and club scene. Service is speedy and friendly, ensuring a pleasant experience even when staffed minimally. The eclectic decor, featuring an outer space mural, and a seemingly random music selection, contribute to an atmosphere that's both quirky and relaxed. Despite its peculiarities, the place holds a certain charm, compelling enough for a return visit.

This bait shop stands out for its exceptional customer service, with staff members who are not only friendly but also proactive in sharing useful fishing tips. Their bait quality is unparalleled, and the store boasts an impressive inventory of tackle at surprisingly competitive prices. Customers who have previously relied on larger retailers like Walmart or Dick's Sporting Goods have found this shop to be a superior alternative. The only downside noted is the wish for more locations across town, highlighting its appeal and the convenience it offers to the fishing community.

Nigel's selection of candy, particularly the Bon bons, is highly praised for its exceptional quality. Not only is the drive to his location worth it, but his amiable personality further enhances the buying experience. The candy's popularity is evident, as friends often eagerly consume any purchases, much to buyers' chagrin. Definitely a must-visit for any sweet tooth out there.

Muriel's offers a quintessential New Orleans dining experience in the heart of the French Quarter, perfect for both locals and visitors seeking classic local dishes. Their lunch special, priced at $17, includes a choice between soup or salad, a main entree, and an option to add a Bloody Mary or martini for $4—an unbeatable deal for the quality and quantity provided. The Bloody Mary, noted for its size and perfect spiciness, is a highlight. The convenience of text message notifications for table readiness enhances the experience, allowing guests to explore the surroundings without being tethered to the restaurant location.

Seating by open shutters adds to the ambiance, though service can be hit-or-miss, likely due to the busy nature of the establishment. The food itself is largely exemplary; from the excellently cooked pork chop and perfectly seasoned red beans to the standout turtle soup. The only minor letdown was the dry cornbread. Portion sizes are generous, ensuring satisfaction throughout the day.

Beyond the food, Muriel's stands out for its stunning location and the rich history it brings to dining conversations. Despite some small service hiccups, it remains a prime choice for a memorable and affordable meal in New Orleans. A visit to Muriel's is highly recommended for those looking to immerse themselves in the culinary and cultural offerings of the French Quarter.

Based on the recommendation of our shuttle driver, we decided to give this place a try and it didn't disappoint. The red velvet ice cream, with its creamy texture and generous pieces of cake mixed in, was absolutely wonderful. A delightful treat that truly lives up to the hype - it's a must-try for anyone visiting!

This eatery offers a friendly service with the staff willing to accommodate customers, such as waiving minimum credit order amounts for local workers. The selection includes typical American-Chinese fare, with an average taste profile. Some greasiness in sauces was noted, though overall the food doesn't lean heavily on oil, and there are vegetarian options available, focusing on tofu. Attractive lunch specials are on offer, enhancing its appeal for a budget-friendly meal. However, a severe drawback is the potential for food poisoning, as experienced firsthand, casting doubt on the establishment's food safety standards. Consequently, despite its positives, caution is advised when considering dining here.

This charming eatery offers a delightful dining experience, albeit with a minor setback due to its no-reservation policy. Braving the cold for a cozy seat inside proved worthwhile for a taste of their menu. The bianco salad, shared between two, featured an intriguing addition of white chocolate shavings, yet it fell short of remarkable, lacking the necessary zest to elevate its flavors. On the other hand, the western addition pizza, split among four, was the star of the show. Its unique deep dish cornmeal crust was a delightful surprise, blending flavors reminiscent of cornbread and traditional pizza dough, all with a satisfying greasy goodness that whispered 'yum' with every bite. While not the pinnacle of pizza, its distinctive taste and texture made it a noteworthy dish. The only deterrents are the price point and the inevitable crowds, which can detract from the overall experience. However, if you find yourself in the vicinity, this place is undeniably worth the visit for a taste of something different yet delicious.

Indy Reads stands as a beacon in the heart of downtown, emphasizing the poignant absence felt in areas lacking a local bookstore. More than just a venue for purchasing books, it serves as a communal hub for literature enthusiasts to engage in discussions, enjoy readings, and immerse themselves in the world of books. This store distinguishes itself by allocating all proceeds towards adult literacy, reinforcing its commitment to social impact. With a focus on used books, Indy Reads encourages the cycle of giving and receiving, allowing patrons to discover unexpected treasures among their vast selection. While they do offer a range of new books, their unique initiative enables customers to special-order items not readily available in-store.

However, the store is not without its imperfections. The $1 children's book section, though economically priced, presents a challenge with its tightly packed and color-coded arrangement, complicating the browsing experience. Despite this minor setback, the overall affordability and inviting atmosphere of Indy Reads make it a must-visit spot. Whether you're looking to donate, purchase, or simply lose yourself in a sea of stories, Indy Reads offers a welcoming space for all book lovers while supporting a noble cause.

Had an unwelcoming experience at Just Tires due to poor customer service and inflexibility regarding appointments. Despite having a concerning issue with my tire, I was met with a lengthy wait time and a dismissive attitude when requesting a booked return visit, which contradicted my previous appointment-making experiences with them. Frustrated, I took my business to Mr. Tire where, despite a visibly higher customer volume, my issue was addressed promptly and efficiently, resulting in a new tire replacement within half an hour. This stark contrast in service quality highlights the importance of customer treatment and operational management.

Had an exceptional experience with this flower shop! As a flower shop owner myself, I have high standards, but they exceeded expectations. The arrangement was vibrant and delivered swiftly after a same-day request. Their creativity with the budget provided was truly impressive. Highly appreciative of their service. Thank you!

This dining experience was profoundly disappointing, meriting a one-star review solely because a zero-star option is unavailable. Despite having reservations, seating was in a less desirable area of the establishment. The ordered queso fundido with chorizo, served unconventionally with tortillas instead of chips, and the subsequent request for chips and salsa, which took an excessive amount of time to arrive, only to be unsatisfactory in quality. The main dish, carne asada tacos accompanied by an unanticipated pairing of hard white rice and refried beans, further diminished the experience due to lack of seasoning and unexpected rice choice. Collectively, these issues, including a notable delay in food service and subpar quality, lead to a firm recommendation to avoid this establishment, suggesting that even fast-food alternatives might offer a better dining experience.

This charming coffee spot, owned by the delightful Karyn, offers a fantastic selection of coffee complemented by the convenience of a drive-through. Karyn's warm smile and welcoming demeanor enhance the cozy experience, making it a must-visit for coffee lovers seeking both quality brews and pleasant service.

Ed's, formerly known as Red's, is an entertainment powerhouse reminiscent of a mini cruise ship on land. Despite the slightly confusing signage that may trick you into thinking "Ed's" is just a missing letter away from its original name, this venue goes beyond in offering a plethora of activities suitable for all ages. From pool rooms and video games to bowling, dance areas, and an array of restaurants and lounges, Ed's is a paradise for those seeking endless amusement. It's particularly appealing for hosting lively young kids’ parties, serving as a sophisticated alternative to the likes of Chuck E. Cheese.

Music enthusiasts would find Ed's an invaluable addition to the local scene, as it creates a platform for lesser-known bands to shine without needing to fill enormous venues. With the capacity to host up to 600 guests, the venue perfectly suits artists like Ween, Jurassic Five, and Interpol, making live music shows affordable and intimate. Overall, Ed's stands out as a vibrant hub for entertainment, dining, and live music, catering to a wide audience while supporting the arts within the community.

Despite my extensive culinary experiences throughout Asia Pacific, I find myself perplexed by the high praise often bestowed upon this dining spot. However, it's worth noting that the delightful conversation and exceptional company I enjoyed greatly enhanced the overall experience.

Disheartening recent visit due to the absence of the once beloved salad and pizza bar. Previously a frequent patron at another location, my excitement for their relocation quickly faded upon discovering the discontinuation of the salad bar that I adored. The disappointment deepened with the realization that enjoying pizza now requires ordering an entire pie. This change significantly detracted from my dining experience, leaving me nostalgic for past visits.

The recent visit to Poblano's was deeply disappointing, underscoring a stark departure from its previously high standards. The cherished Amiga bowl, once brimming with shredded chicken, was regrettably replaced by dry, sparse chicken crisps, devoid of its essential rice layer, grilled onions, peppers, and the luscious queso sauce. This unexpected change raised concerns about the restaurant's consistency and ingredient quality.

Upon raising the issue, the response from management was dismissive, insisting no alterations had been made despite my long history of patronage. This claim was further contradicted when the deteriorated quality of another staple, the soft tacos, was addressed; what used to be moist and flavorful was served stale and tasteless.

An apology from another manager revealed kitchen staff challenges that evening, suggesting the issues may have been temporary. However, the initial defensive stance and denial of evident changes left a sour taste, overshadowing the subsequent attempt to rectify the situation.

Regrettably, this experience casts doubt on Poblano's ability to deliver the consistently good Mexican cuisine it once did. Despite previous positive encounters, this visit warrants two thumbs down, signaling a need for immediate improvement in both food quality and customer service to regain trust and patronage.

Dewey's Pizza is a convenient option due to its proximity to my home. Their pizzas, particularly the Pepperoni, Socrates' Revenge, and Bronx Bomber, are visually appealing with a crust that does not disappoint. However, the overwhelming saltiness of these pizzas, presumably from the sauce and meat combination, significantly detracts from the overall flavor experience, rendering my taste buds numb to other flavors. This issue is a major downside that Dewey's needs to address. As for the salads, although they're generously portioned, they seem to lack uniqueness or value, feeling like something easily replicated at home. In summary, while Dewey's has the potential for greatness, the excessive saltiness of their pizzas and the unremarkable salads leave room for improvement.

Title: High Hopes Met With Mixed Feelings at PF Changs

My recent visit to PF Changs encapsulated a bittersweet dining experience. I entered with anticipation but exited feeling underwhelmed, predominantly due to the culinary aspect. On the bright side, our server stood out for his exceptional attentiveness and warmth, setting a promising stage for what was to come.

The meal kicked off on a positive note with a swiftly served, piping hot egg drop soup, suggesting a promising meal ahead. Unfortunately, the subsequent dishes didn't maintain this momentum. My choice of the adventurous Shrimp with Candied Walnuts served with brown rice was a letdown. The dish itself felt overloaded in flavors that clashed rather than complemented, with the shrimp's excessive sweetness not harmonizing with the candied walnuts and melon balls. The brown rice, meant to be a staple, was disappointingly cold and bland. Similarly, the Sesame Chicken platter ordered by my companion failed to impress, suffering from the same fate of being served lukewarm.

However, not all was lost. The dessert, a decadent 6-layer chocolate cake, was the highlight of the meal. Its rich, chocolatey goodness was perfectly executed, making it a memorable end to an otherwise mediocre meal.

PF Changs' dedication to accommodating food allergies, particularly gluten sensitivities, is commendable and worth noting. It's a thoughtful gesture that's increasingly important in today's dining scene.

In conclusion, while the service and dessert at PF Changs were exemplary, the main courses left much to be desired. The restaurant shows promise with its attentive service and consideration for dietary restrictions, but the kitchen's execution and dish composition need refinement.

This dining experience delivers a blend of highs and lows within the intriguing setting of an abandoned car wash, adding a unique layer to the barbeque adventure. The standout dish, without a doubt, is the Mac n cheese, which is so deliciously compelling it's described cheekily as being worth extraordinary measures to enjoy. The ribs, while boasting a great flavor profile, disappoint in tenderness, likened humorously to the toughness of shoe soles. The pulled pork, on the other hand, is praised for its sweet taste and overall quality. However, the sides are a mixed bag; the baked beans are passable but unremarkable, and the cole slaw, although creamy, is marred by an unpleasant aftertaste reminiscent of lake water, making it something to possibly skip on future visits. Despite the culinary ups and downs, the overall experience is deemed special and worth trying, thanks to its unique location and memorable food items.

I had a mixed experience at this eatery, though there are definitely highlights. The fries are exceptional, leaving a lasting impression with their delightful taste. However, the beef kebob sandwich was underwhelming, being overly heavy on onions and skimping on the meat, though I'm inclined to believe this might have been a one-off issue worth revisiting. On the downside, the smoothies felt more like a mix of syrup and ice, lacking authenticity in flavor. Despite this, the restaurant scores with its fair pricing and excellent service, all wrapped up in a charming mom-and-pop atmosphere that adds to its appeal. I'm considering a second visit, if only for those unforgettable fries.

Taqueria Burrito's Grill, under new ownership, is a culinary gem in New Orleans East that brings the authentic taste of Mexican cuisine reminiscent of small, undiscovered taquerias. The reviewer, recently relocated from Houston, praises the establishment's delicious offerings, particularly the green sauce which pairs excellently with cheese enchiladas, and the Mexican rice that meets their picky standards. Emphasizing the authenticity and quality that match their nostalgic experiences from Houston, the reviewer expresses excitement about having found a go-to spot for Mexican food in the area. They highlight the restaurant's convenient hours, breakfast service, and availability for takeout, with plans to become a frequent customer. Contact number provided is 504-242-0573 for those interested in experiencing "YUMMY" flavors themselves.

Unfortunately, my takeaway experience involving the Mexican Roll and Philadelphia Roll was disappointing. The portion sizes were notably small, failing to meet expectations. Flavor-wise, both rolls were underwhelming, offering nothing distinctive or particularly enjoyable due to their blandness.

This review celebrates the trendy and diverse shopping experience offered in the vicinity of Mass Ave, highlighting Silver in the City, Boomerang Boutique, Global Gifts, and Homespun as top spots for finding unique gifts. The reviewer particularly praises Silver in the City for its selection of the newest items for home and style, and its dog-friendly policy. However, they deduct a star due to the conspicuous surveillance by friendly staff, which impacts the browsing experience. The shops' competitive edge in offering trendy items in a limited area is appreciated, making this an appealing destination for those looking to indulge in the latest fashions or find that perfect gift.

I recently enjoyed takeout from a restaurant about 45 minutes before it closed and decided on the puttanesca. It was a fantastic choice, delivering a perfect balance of salty spiciness that truly delighted my taste buds. The menu's versatility impressed me, offering a broad range of combinations or the creative option to customize your dish. However, my main criticism lies in the lack of a gluten-free dough option, which is a significant oversight for those of us with dietary restrictions. Despite this, the meal was delicious, though I know my gluten sensitivity will have consequences.

The dining experience was excellent, with the highlight being the delicious crab cake Benedict. The service was commendable, and the smoothies were notably smooth and enjoyable. Highly recommend for both the food and dining service.

My quest for the perfect breakfast in New Orleans led me to a gem serving up authentic Grillades. Despite having attempted this dish at home, experiencing it in its native habitat was a whole different ball game. The restaurant, with its diner vibes, offered a cozy spot by a window overlooking Canal Street, enhancing the dining experience with a view.

Service was swift and commendable, setting the stage for the main act - Grits and Grillades. The dish, a hearty ensemble of slow-roasted beef with peppers and onions in a savory brown gravy atop creamy Gouda cheese grits, exceeded my expectations. It's a rare joy to find a restaurant rendition of a dish that surpasses my own culinary attempts, and this meal did just that. This delightful breakfast discovery has firmly established itself as a non-negotiable part of my New Orleans itinerary for future visits.

This review reflects an extremely disappointing experience with a company, meriting a rating lower than one star if possible. The reviewer encountered significant communication issues, including multiple instances where calls were unanswered. After managing to speak with an employee, misinformation about available units, pricing, and move-in dates was provided, leading to confusion and wasted time. Further attempts to resolve issues were met with more unhelpfulness and a lack of accountability from the company, ultimately costing the reviewer a non-refundable $50 application fee. The company is criticized for prioritizing profit over tenant satisfaction and care.

Sierra and India from JOTSB were absolutely fantastic in managing our family reunion in Santa Barbara. With attendees coming from globally, their foresight in purchasing and replenishing supplies, alongside their flexible and enjoyable demeanor, greatly contributed to the success of our gathering. Their flawless service and attention to detail made the event memorable. I eagerly look forward to organizing another event in Santa Barbara just to avail of their outstanding services again. Highly recommend!

This cafe left us underwhelmed. Despite its quirky signage and disappointing bagel selection, the food quality barely managed to pass muster. My pastrami, egg, and cheese sandwich was scant on meat and featured unmelted cheese, while my wife unfortunately encountered spoiled creamer for her coffee. Next time, we're more likely to return to dependable favorites like Einstein's or St Pete Bagel.

This Italian restaurant impresses with its very nice employees and reasonable prices. The standout feature is their excellent homemade salad dressing, which complements the overall good quality of the food. It’s an all-around solid choice for anyone craving Italian cuisine.

This place offers an impressive breakfast burrito that shines with a well-balanced mix of bacon, egg, cheese, and notably well-seasoned, finely cut potatoes, avoiding the common pitfall of an overly potato-heavy or mushy filling. While the burrito could benefit from a slightly more generous cheese portion, this is a minor quibble in the broader context of its quality. The establishment further delights with a variety of salsas at the salsa bar, enhancing the dining experience. Coupled with consistently friendly and welcoming staff, it's a joy to have such a quality eatery conveniently located about a mile from home. Here's hoping it remains a neighborhood staple for many years to come.

As a newcomer to Tucson and a connoisseur of pizza, including that from NYC, I was pleasantly surprised to find the best pizza I've ever had, particularly near the University of Arizona. The standout feature is its magical crust, an unparalleled foundation that sets it apart from every other pizza I've tried. I indulged in the "five alarm" pizza, its spiciness hitting the perfect note for those who yearn for an extra kick. For anyone considering a visit, I confidently predict you won't be disappointed.

Celebrated my birthday at Honey's, a place I've heard much praise about. Despite its famed crowds, my wait was a brief 20 minutes. The food lived up to the hype—delicious French toast, home fries, sausage, and an irresistible slice of Jewish apple cake for dessert. This outstanding dining experience ensures my return.

Tria shines with its knowledgeable staff and impressive selection of beers and wines, making every visit a delight. The option for outdoor seating in warmer months adds to its charm, although securing a table can be a challenge due to its popularity. While I haven't tried the food, the drinks alone are worth the visit.

Mae's Chinese Restaurant is a standout culinary gem located on the east side, offering an unparalleled dining experience. My family and I stumbled upon this delightful eatery as an unexpected alternative to a less welcoming establishment across the street, and we couldn't have been more pleased with this twist of fate. From the moment you step inside, Mae's greets you with a warm, inviting atmosphere, beautifully enhanced by tasteful decor and a fresh ambiance that sets the stage for an exceptional meal.

The food at Mae's is a revelation, notably superior in freshness and flavor, devoid of the common pitfalls of greasiness or the sense of being reheated. Each dish we tried felt thoughtfully prepared, highlighting the quality of ingredients and the culinary skills of the chefs. The service further elevates the dining experience; the staff is attentive, friendly, and always on hand to ensure your meal goes smoothly, enhancing the overall enjoyment of the visit.

What makes Mae's even more appealing, especially for families like mine, is the incredible value. The prices are remarkably reasonable, allowing us to indulge in a variety of delicious dishes without breaking the bank. The lunch specials, in particular, are impressive and provide great options for a satisfying meal at an excellent price point.

In conclusion, Mae's Chinese Restaurant is a must-visit for anyone looking for top-notch Chinese cuisine on the east side. Its combination of fresh, flavorful food, a welcoming environment, attentive service, and excellent value make it a favorite destination for my family and me. I wholeheartedly recommend giving Mae's a try; it's an experience you're likely to cherish and return to.

This Tucson gem has solidified its place as my top favorite spot with its flavors hitting the mark perfectly and outdoing expectations. The strawberries & champagne, toasted marshmallow, and cheesecake flavors especially stand out as personal favorites. Even after moving to Phoenix, discovering their expansion into the valley was a highlight for me. This is a place I plan to frequent time and again, a true testament to its quality and appeal.

This establishment has experienced a steep decline over the past three years, transitioning from a once good location to a disappointing one. On a busy Saturday evening, service was critically understaffed with only two employees, leading to full tables and lines of customers waiting to order and pay. The quality of food has also plummeted, exemplified by a barely edible, burnt sandwich on hard bread. Urgent improvements are necessary for this location to redeem itself.

This unique and well-maintained cemetery provides an intriguing backdrop for photography enthusiasts interested in capturing images of angels and other esoteric subjects. While one might find the fascination with such a locale slightly eerie, the serene environment, absence of any supernatural disturbances (notably zombies), and occasional lighthearted interruptions by spell-casting witches add a touch of whimsy. The cemetery's layout and the craftsmanship of its tombstones and angelic statues are commendable, offering a peaceful yet visually captivating experience.

During a recent visit to Port Richey, I opted for a stay at the Holiday Inn Express, swayed by the promise of twin beds, competitive pricing, proximity to familial connections, and the allure of a complimentary breakfast. Typically, my travel accommodations are with Hyatt Place/House, but given the circumstances of the trip—primarily undertaking it with my brother—I ventured a change.

The staff's affable and helpful demeanor alongside the provision of free WiFi and a commendably diverse breakfast selection were the highlights of my stay, casting a positive light on the hotel's service quality and amenities. However, the comfort and functionality of the room amenities left much to be desired. The beds, overly soft to the point of discomfort, suggested a need for urgent replacement, significantly detracting from the quality of my sleep throughout the three-night stay. Additionally, the air conditioning system's erratic performance due to unreliable thermostat controls further marred the room's comfort level.

Despite the availability of a pool, hot tub, and a small gym, my review does not cover these facilities as I did not avail myself of them during my stay.

In summary, my experience at the Holiday Inn Express was average. While the service and certain amenities met my expectations, the lack of basic comfort in bedding and room climate control made it clear that my usual preference for Hyatt establishments may have set a standard of comfort and quality that was not met on this occasion.

The service at this establishment left much to be desired, with the staff appearing more invested in personal entertainment and interactions rather than assisting customers. The food itself was mediocre – neither impressive nor disappointing. Overall, this experience merits a generous 2 out of 5 stars.

This establishment offers excellent food, but notably, both the customer service quality and portion sizes have significantly declined over time. As a frequent patron for over two years, I've observed a steady decrease in the quantity of food provided, to the extent that takeout dishes are now less than half full, a stark contrast to the initial generous servings. Upon addressing this issue, the response was dismissive, and I was inaccurately told my observations were wrong. Further attempts to discuss the situation led to an offer to refuse the dish without charge, but choosing this option resulted in undue criticism from the staff. Regrettably, due to these persistent issues, I have decided to cease patronizing this establishment.

The dining experience was notably enjoyable with the food being exceptional in quality, particularly the chicken poblano which was a highlight, and the variety of enchiladas that left a lasting impression. The staff stood out for their friendliness and helpfulness, readily providing menu suggestions that enhanced our meal choices. Moreover, the Happy Hour offerings proved to be a fantastic deal, complemented by house margaritas that were superior in taste compared to many other establishments. Overall, a highly recommended dining spot for both the quality of food and service.

The salted caramel chocolate cake was a standout - truly the best I've ever enjoyed. The Apple Brown Betty also impressed with its awesome flavor. Coupled with a good beer selection, this place offers a delightful culinary experience.

This laid-back bar caters well to the college crowd, offering the allure of cheap drinks and the option to watch big games on projectors. However, the viewing experience is slightly marred by the projector screens being too narrow, causing parts of the picture to spill onto the walls. During the day, the space feels ample and comfortable, though one can anticipate a more crowded atmosphere come nighttime.

I experienced extremely poor service at this establishment - not once, but twice within a month. My recent order for a half-sausage, half-cheese pizza was completely botched despite multiple clarifications over the phone. Initially, the staff member misunderstood the order entirely, substituting cheese for beef. After correcting the mistake via a second phone call, my pickup order still ended up being entirely sausage. This echoes a previous visit where my order was forgotten altogether. Disappointing and frustrating.

During a visit to Marmont Steakhouse on January 26, 2013, for restaurant week, our dining experience was extremely disappointing. The meal commenced with a crab bisque soup that was served cold and had to be returned for reheating. The calamari that followed was bland, overly fried, and had a rubbery texture. The most distressing part of the meal involved an order of lobster ravioli, which turned out to be beef ravioli. Despite assurances from the waitstaff that it was lobster, it was eventually admitted to be beef, causing significant distress as I had not consumed beef since 1994. This resulted in a severe physical reaction. The response from the staff to these issues was lackadaisical and the apologies felt insincere. I strongly advise against dining at this establishment based on our horrendous experience.

Tako stands unparalleled in the realm of sushi eateries, delivering an unmatched dining experience that's both delightful and affordable. The establishment's commitment to freshness and quality is evident in every dish, ensuring a gastronomic adventure that's hard to beat. Its cozy private rooms amplify the joy of festive gatherings, offering a perfect backdrop for memorable nights out, especially since it's BYOB. Highlights include the zesty jalapeño yellowtail, crunchy kani salad, intricately prepared bird's nest roll, and the innovative naruto, a delightful serving wrapped in cucumber instead of rice. The menu is foolproof, satisfying a wide range of tastes without compromising on quality or value. Remarkably, indulging in this culinary feast doesn't break the bank—I've never spent more than $35, tips included, even when fully indulging with friends. For an unbeatable sushi experience that's both enjoyable and economical, Tako is my top recommendation.

This local ice cream spot offers a delightful experience with its range of very good, custom-made flavors. The Espresso Chip, Moose Tracks, and Graham Slam particularly stand out for their uniqueness and delicious taste. Highly recommended for anyone looking to indulge in some exceptional frozen treats.

My spouse and I have been loyal customers of this car wash for several years, consistently satisfied with their service. They offer a unique perk with Ladies Day on Wednesdays, providing discounts on all wash options, and they extend a similar courtesy to firemen on Mondays. Although it's not a hand-wash service and may not achieve perfection, it's an excellent value for a quick and affordable $5 wash. Additionally, their occasional 2-for-1 specials on auto detail packages are particularly attractive, and we've always been pleased with the quality of their work.

The restaurant presents a perfectly average dining experience. The quality of the food, including dishes like drunken noodles and Thai green curry, is decent but nothing that stands out. Similarly, the service is hit or miss, fluctuating between satisfactory and lackluster. In all, it's a middle-of-the-road option for those in the area.

Title: A Divine Dining Experience at Redemption

Review:

My milestone Yelp review goes to an extraordinary experience I had at Redemption about two months ago. Though my praise may come a bit delayed, the memory of what I confidently dub one of the best meals of my entire life remains vivid and cherished.

Redemption's setting, an old church, offers a uniquely beautiful backdrop that enhances the dining experience. As someone who has a keen interest in old church architecture, I found the surroundings truly mesmerizing, adding a special touch to our evening.

The service was nothing short of incredible. Accompanied by a group of seven, including several insiders of the New Orleans restaurant scene, our expectations for a memorable meal were high. Redemption's staff did not disappoint, providing an evening that was both delightful and seamless.

The menu offerings were extraordinary, with two dishes standing out in particular. The Paneed Smoked Soft Shell Crab a la Christian was a revelation. Although I never had the original, this dish, with its cold-smoked and fried soft shell crab, was a bite of heaven. It transformed the crab into something transcendental, leaving an indelible mark on my palate.

Equally impressive was the Seafood Stuffed Filet of Fish a la Christian's. The combination of mirliton and seafood stuffing complemented the fresh flounder perfectly, enhancing rather than overshadowing its natural flavors.

This meal at Redemption was, without exaggeration, one of the top ten dining experiences of my life. For those who have yet to visit, I wholeheartedly recommend it. It's not just a meal; it's an encounter with culinary divinity set against the backdrop of striking architecture and impeccable service.

Rating: ★★★★★

This local spot is a gem, winning hearts with its rotating selection of flavors, ensuring there's always something new to try on my bi-weekly visits. The attentive staff might surprise you with hidden toppings from under the counter if asked, enhancing the customization experience. The ambiance is unexpectedly electrified with intense EDM beats, creating a unique, awesome vibe. A must-visit for those seeking a lively, flavor-packed outing.

This dining experience was nothing short of amazing, featuring standout dishes like Steak Tartare, Caribbean Seafood Pepper Pot, and Curried Goat. The exceptional quality of the Steak Tartare sets a new personal standard, while the innovative pairing of sweet curry with gnocchi alongside the goat offers a delightful culinary surprise. Even a sample of the lime cheesecake didn't disappoint, proving to be top-notch. Opting out of drinks post-Mardi Gras, the service still shone brightly, ranking as some of the best in a town renowned for its hospitality. Overall, an extraordinary dining delight.

On a Wednesday night visit, despite the lack of crowd, finding a table without a reservation proved challenging, leading to seating in the bar area with tall tables. The uninviting exterior on a dimly lit, nearly deserted street contrasts sharply with the interior's stylish, masculine decor characterized by dark wood, subtle lighting, and artistic nods to old Missouri.

The dining experience is boosted by attentive service, with seemingly one server per table. The concise yet captivating menu prompts curiosity, exploring a variety of seasonings and ethnic influences with a focus on rustic, comforting dishes. Despite an initial hesitance, our server was friendly, well-informed, and attentive.

Opting to share three small plates and a side dish proved to be slightly excessive for two, highlighting the generous portions. Highlights included the intriguing smoked trout and the venison hot dogs, alongside excellently prepared french fries with delightful dipping sauces. The mini monte cristo sandwiches, while delicious, lacked the original twist seen in other menu items.

The culinary experience, including two draft beers, was both filling and affordable at $52.05 before tip, showcasing the establishment's commitment to originality and value. The venue promises a unique dining experience, perhaps with a rotating menu that keeps the offerings fresh and engaging.

High Score on the scale, but a win in my heart - that's my verdict for the frozen yogurt spot on South Street. It's embarrassingly easy to 'win' at loading your cup to the brim here, not because of a lack of self-control, but because everything on offer is irresistibly delicious. Even their fat-free options are a treat, making it an indulgence without the guilt. It's the perfect pit stop for anyone exploring South Street and in need of a sweet escape. Totally recommend giving this place a try; it's a game-changer for your taste buds. 😊

Visited with friends and was thoroughly impressed by the waitstaff's exceptional service amidst challenging circumstances. While the food and decor were satisfactory, it was the servers, particularly one with purple hair, who stood out. Despite facing absurd complaints and demanding behavior from neighboring tables, including threats of no tipping over trivial issues (despite a clear gratuity policy for bills over $50 mentioned in the menu), the servers, especially our purple-haired hero, exhibited remarkable professionalism. Juggling multiple plates, providing flawless explanations of the menu, and keeping a vigilant eye on all tables, the server managed these situations with utmost grace. This experience deserves a commendation for the staff's patience and skill—customers could do well to exhibit basic decency. Thumbs up and five stars to the restaurant's incredible staff.

Title: Positive Shopping Experience at Hallmark, Despite Not Purchasing

My visit to Hallmark dealership was notably more pleasant compared to other dealerships I've encountered. Although I ultimately did not purchase a vehicle from them, the process was straightforward and devoid of the high-pressure tactics often found elsewhere. 

Prices for their vehicles were both fair and competitive, with the added benefit of reasonable certifications and warranties for used vehicles. I appreciated the professional demeanor of both the salesman and sales manager, who provided a non-pushy environment allowing for a relaxed test drive experience. 

The only reason for not closing a deal with Hallmark was a personal preference for a different car make/model. However, considering the hassle-free experience and the courteous staff, I would certainly recommend Hallmark dealership for those in the market for a vehicle. Their transparent and customer-friendly approach makes them a worthy option for local buyers.

I had a disappointing experience at this establishment. The white meat fried chicken I ordered was slimy and overly salty, and the complementary sides — Mac and cheese along with garlic mashed potatoes — were served cold and lacked any real flavor. Adding to the discomfort, the service was peculiar; the server laughed inappropriately while taking my order, leaving me feeling awkward and unwelcome. Due to these reasons, I have decided not to return.
We enjoyed both the warm and cold lobster rolls, which were delicious, and the bread was exceptional. Although the prices are a bit high, the quality of the food justifies the cost. Highly recommend!

The Habit Burger stands as a formidable contender in the burger scene, consistently delivering mouthwatering experiences. The eternal debate between choosing it or In-N-Out speaks volumes of its quality. On a recent visit to the Goleta location, the double char burger paired with a chocolate shake did not disappoint, maintaining its delicious standard. Additionally, their onion rings are noted for being exceptionally good, further solidifying The Habit Burger's reputation as a top-notch burger destination.
This place has been a beloved fixture for my husband and me for around 8 years, not just for its delicious and swiftly served food but also for its excellent drink specials.

This trendy and charming spot in Broad Ripple captivates with its bustling ambiance and no-reservation policy, necessitating an early arrival for a chance to secure a table. The lively scene, while enjoyable, can become detrimentally noisy, hampering dinner conversation. The establishment offers an array of creative cocktails and dishes recommended by attentive servers. Highlights include the delicious guacamole (though a mishap with nuts occurred), the delightful Harvest salad with its perfect blend of fruits, vegetables, and herbed goat cheese mousse, and excellently prepared main courses like the Veracruz Trigger fish and Serrano Scallops. Sides like the Stewed Black Beans shine, but the Tostones may feel dry to those unfamiliar. While accommodating to various dietary restrictions, the lack of gluten-free, dairy-free dessert options is a minor letdown. Despite this, the quality of the meal and the overall experience make it a must-visit destination. Just make sure to arrive before the evening rush to avoid a long wait.

After numerous visits to Jackson's over the past two years, it's time to share my thoughts. The panini Reuben stands out for its exceptional use of garlic, perfectly sliced meat, and beautifully melted cheese, all encased in delectable rye bread I'd happily keep stocked at home. However, the simultaneous arrival of the salad with the sandwich dampened the experience, compounded by a somewhat sloppy presentation.

A repeated concern is the direct placement of the panini on a plate without a napkin, a minor detail that leads to soggy bread if not addressed promptly. Despite this, the quality of both food and drink - slightly pricey - is commendable, supported by an impressive selection of wines and beers.

The staff are generally friendly, though the fast-paced environment can sometimes affect the service quality, as noted during busier dining periods. Despite these shortcomings, the warmth of the wait staff and overall quality of food ensure my continued patronage. Jackson's remains a worthwhile dining choice, albeit with room for minor improvements.

I had a mixed experience at this nail salon. My pedicure, done by Young, was fantastic. She was friendly, positive, and gave an incredibly thorough pedicure with an exceptional massage. However, my experience with the gel manicure, done by the owner, was disappointing. Despite my old gel needing a soak-off, she forcefully used a drill, leaving my nails thin and improperly cleaned of the old polish. The new gel polish was applied unevenly with noticeable bumps and incomplete coverage. While I adored Young's service, the manicure experience makes me hesitant to return.

I recently had the pleasure of trying a trio appetizer that was truly amazing, complemented by their delicious pizza. Both dishes impressed with their quality and taste, making for a memorable dining experience. Highly recommend!

This Westside Tucson eatery is a hidden gem, offering delicious food at affordable prices. The Indian taco and sweet fry bread come highly recommended. With irresistible daily deals, such as $1 tacos on Tuesdays and Fridays, it's a place I find myself dining at least once weekly. A definite must-visit for anyone in the area.

This bakery isn't just about fantastic cookies, cupcakes, and puddings. Their star attraction for me was the salted caramel cake ordered for a birthday bash. This four-layered marvel, filled with decadent caramel buttercream, did not disappoint. I was particularly impressed with their commitment to using real ingredients in their icing, a fact that was palpably reflected in its taste. The cake managed to strike a perfect balance between elegance and deliciousness, making it a remarkable find.

Opt for a delightful post-dinner treat at this hidden gem near Broadway, where indulging in homemade ice cream becomes the perfect excuse to meander around the neighborhood. The quality and taste of their ice cream genuinely stand out, with 'Cake Mix' flavor stealing the spotlight. It's an ideal spot to sweeten the end of a date night.

Thrilled to have discovered an exceptional local sushi gem! Initially overlooked in favor of Domino's, my decision to give it a try was a game-changer. I particularly enjoyed the sushiya roll, which stood out with its fresh salmon and perfect miso. This spot has won me over, and I see many repeat visits in my future. Highly recommend it for an exceptional dining experience - a solid 10/10!

This local Thai restaurant stands out as the best in the area, serving up delectable dishes that are worth the 30-minute journey. The red curry, pad thai, and chicken satay with peanut sauce are particularly exceptional, offering a flavorful experience that leaves you wishing for closeness. Additionally, their lunch specials are a great deal, enhancing the overall dining experience.

During our first visit to this destination with my family and toddler, we found a plethora of activities that were thoroughly enjoyed by my daughter. However, despite its potential for a perfect rating, I was compelled to rate it only 2 stars due to the disappointing level of cleanliness observed throughout our stay. The admission fee, even for my 15-month-old, underscores the expectation of a well-maintained venue, yet it fell short with visible dust, unattended electrical cords, and a noticeable absence of sanitation efforts by the staff. This oversight detracts significantly from the overall experience. It is my hope that management addresses these concerns to improve future visits. This review comes from a place of constructive feedback, as I rarely feel moved to write reviews, but felt the need to share this experience.

I recently visited as a walk-in and was thoroughly impressed by the cleanliness of the location and the warmth of the staff. Tammy worked wonders on my eyebrows, delivering fantastic results. Additionally, as a first-time guest, I was pleasantly surprised to receive the service free of charge! They offer a variety of excellent waxing packages too. I'm definitely planning a return visit!

As a sushi enthusiast, I felt compelled to share my disappointing experience at a restaurant that boasted a 4.5-star rating. Contrary to the inviting images posted, the reality was starkly different. The sushi was a letdown, with poorly sliced fish and bland sushi rice. Even the dynamite roll failed to impress, being overly salty and drenched in mayonnaise, to the point that I couldn't finish it after just one bite. This dining experience was unfortunately my worst at a highly rated establishment. My advice: steer clear.

This review details a disappointing dining experience due to poor service. The reviewer waited 30 minutes without being attended to, leading them to order directly from the counter. Despite a manageable number of patrons, the waitstaff appeared uninterested in serving, focusing instead on personal conversations. The reviewer also notes an instance where new customers were advised to opt for takeout rather than dine-in, highlighting the staff's reluctance to serve. The overall recommendation is to avoid dining in and consider delivery options instead, labeling the establishment's service as subpar.

This Caribbean restaurant truly stands out as the best in town with its fresh, perfectly cooked dishes. The stewed and curried chicken are exceptional, and the plantains are the best around. The personal touch from the owner, ensuring customer satisfaction, adds to the experience. The pricing is unbeatable, offering hidden gems like oxtails not listed on the menu. The option to bring your own bottle (BYOB) is a delightful bonus. A must-visit establishment that lives up to its 5-star reviews. We can't wait to return and will recommend it to everyone.

**Review of Momo's Ouzaria**

Momo's Ouzaria offers a lively ambiance perfect for group gatherings or first dates, with semi-secluded tables in the back for those seeking a bit less noise. It might not be the ideal spot for a quiet, romantic evening, but it delivers an entertaining dining experience complete with a belly dancer, adding a unique, albeit slightly awkward, touch of fun.

The menu features a variety of tapas, with generous portion sizes that defy the usual tapas experience. Highlights include a three-cheese sampler (featuring feta, goat cheese, and kasseri), Greek meatballs, and particularly noteworthy pan-seared scallops—large, tender, and delicious. While the traditional Greek salad was a miss due to its overly sweet dressing, the gyro meat received favorable comments, suggesting a potential go-to for future visits.

An additional perk was the surprisingly affordable Spanish granacha, offering excellent value at just $6 for a generous pour, enhancing the dining experience without breaking the bank.

While Momo's might not top the list for the best Greek food in town, its vibrant atmosphere and enjoyable tapas make it a standout choice for a fun night out. Perfect for those open to exploring what an ouzaria has to offer, Momo's is a place we'll confidently return to.

This review reflects a significant decline in customer service quality at a previously cherished store. The reviewer, after a hiatus of three years prompted by consistently poor service, recounts experiences marked by unwelcoming and overly critical staff behavior—highlighted by an incident with an employee who reprimanded the way a book was handled and threatened a charge for potential damage. Such interactions starkly contrast the positive memories of the store from the late 1990s, suggesting a downturn in service ethos over the years. Despite the lapse in time, the reviewer remains hesitant to revisit, indicating a lasting negative impact from the repeated unsatisfactory experiences.

Experiencing this jazz show is an unequivocal must, despite its minor inconveniences. Be prepared for a queue, close quarters on wooden benches without the luxury of climate control. Yet, these small sacrifices pale in comparison to the vivacity and allure of the performance and venue. It's an enthralling experience that encapsulates the essence of a legendary jazz night. After the initial visit, the charm of the space and the exuberance of the show are likely to draw you back. This is a unique adventure into the world of jazz that everyone should dive into at least once.

The experience falls short of expectations, notably not justifying the $5 entrance fee per person. The layout of the venue is perplexing, making navigation a challenge, and the self-guided tour proves to be lackluster. It might be more economical and enjoyable to consider visiting the courthouse instead.
This frozen custard spot in St. Louis, MO, is unparalleled – truly the best the city has to offer. An absolute must-visit for anyone in the area. Don't miss out on this exceptional culinary gem.

The establishment leaves a bit to be desired in terms of ambiance, not quite hitting the mark of a four-star experience. While the setting may appear worn, the service is welcoming and the sushi satisfactory. If in the area with a craving for sushi, a return visit isn't out of the question, but it wouldn't be a first choice destination.

The dining experience was exceptional, highlighted by an extensive exploration of the menu. From the tantalizing crawfish beignet to the savory seafood stuffed mushrooms, crab cakes, crab cake po'boy, and seafood flatbread, each dish was a delightful journey of flavors. All the selections were scrumptiously prepared, making it a truly memorable meal.

This Dairy Queen location seems to primarily excel at serving Blizzards and is perhaps not the best option for those seeking a wider array of food options. Service might not meet expectations, as the staff appears to be mainly comprised of inexperienced young adults, potentially affecting the overall dining experience. If you're craving a Blizzard, it could be worth a visit; otherwise, it might be wise to explore other dining venues.

My husband Damon and I are passionate about supporting local businesses, as we believe it's crucial for sustaining the community's economy. Being business owners ourselves, we feel a kinship towards small, independent establishments. On our recent travels, we stumbled upon a remarkable local shop that aligns perfectly with our values. This gem stands out for its exclusive selection of locally made, designed, and manufactured goods, showcasing the town's creative spirit. The store's range is impressively eclectic, offering everything from clothing and artwork to unique food items. The shop owner's warmth and easy smile made our experience even more delightful. Among our finds were a whimsical dragonfly wall sculpture, ingeniously crafted from a chair leg, and space-age pens with a unique design courtesy of a local talent. If you share our love for supporting local creativity and economy, this shop is a must-visit.

This delightful coffee shop has left a lasting impression with its superior coffee offerings, earning high praise from a visitor accustomed to Sacramento's coffee scene. The reviewer, in particular, lauds the matcha lattes, signaling this establishment as their preferred choice in Reno. It’s described as a gem, suggesting a unique and cherished find, leaving an impression of longing for a similar experience back in Sacramento.

I recently had an extraordinary dining experience at a Chipotle in Idaho, thanks to an outstanding staff member named Taylor. As a newcomer to the area, her gesture of comping one of my three meals was a delightful surprise that made my week, not just my day. Taylor's exceptional customer service skills and genuinely warm demeanor truly set her apart from the rest. She's an absolute gem, epitomizing the kind of interaction that makes a dining experience memorable. Highly commendable!

This gem boasts an impressive selection of over 500 martinis, along with the novelty of Petron margaritas available in giant pitchers—a must-try for enthusiasts. While not the cheapest option around, the reasonable prices are well worth it for what you get. The standout feature, however, is the exceptional service. Staff members are incredibly friendly and patient, always ready to guide you through their extensive menu, time permitting. It's a bustling place, which speaks volumes about its popularity. If you're still contemplating, it's time to stop and head over to experience their delightful offerings for yourself.

Claudio's is a treasure trove for anyone with a penchant for Italian cuisine, far surpassing the ordinary grocery shopping experience. Embodying an old-school, family-centric ethos, Claudio's has a magnetic charm that draws long lines of devoted patrons - a testament to the unmatched quality of their offerings. With expert knowledge in all things Italian, especially cheeses, the staff at Claudio's goes above and beyond to assist, fostering a communal atmosphere where even fellow shoppers are eager to help. This isn't your mundane trip to the supermarket for basic ingredients; it's an immersive experience into the heart of Italian culinary tradition that makes even those of us without Italian roots ("medigan") yearn to be part of this vibrant culture. Claudio's is more than a store; it's an invitation to be part of a community that celebrates the rich flavors and heritage of Italy.

This hotel exemplifies a classic case of style over substance, leaving a lot to be desired. Firstly, be prepared for a hefty bill, as the hotel charges exorbitant fees for basic services such as airport shuttles ($35 per person) and offers rooms at a steep price of around $275 a night. Despite housing a range of amenities including a nail salon, a prestigious chocolate store, nine restaurants, and bars, their prices are unreasonably high, such as $2.50 for a small bottle of soda. 

The service quality profoundly lacks, with extended waiting times and unhelpful responses being a common theme, alongside an exceptionally loud cleaning staff disrupting the peace as early as 6:30 a.m. Despite branding itself as a resort, the establishment operates more like a conventional hotel, incapable of providing a tranquil experience amidst the chaos of hosting multiple conventions simultaneously. This results in relentless noise, from 24-hour courtyard music to the barely-there soundproofing of rooms.

Its vast size further complicates its hospitality, making navigation a challenge and dining at peak times an ordeal due to quickly filled restaurants. This, coupled with its inconvenient location that necessitates a significant walk for alternative dining options, significantly detracts from the guest experience.

Labelled as a resort, it falls short of providing the serene and comfortable stay one might expect, instead offering a stressful and overpriced experience more suited to convention-goers than vacationers seeking relaxation.

After much anticipation, my visit to this restaurant proved to be somewhat disappointing. The Dan Dan noodles, while flavorful, lacked the protein I expected and felt more like an average, albeit spicy, pasta dish. The scallion pancakes fell short when compared to those I've recently enjoyed in Chinatown, resembling flat quesadillas rather than the crispy, substantial offerings elsewhere. The Wontons in Chili Oil were overwhelmingly spicy without much flavor, and the Talapia Medallions, although well-fried, were marred by inedible greens.

Despite the excellent service and pleasant atmosphere, the culinary experience did not inspire a return visit. The food seemed overly Americanized and lacked the authentic Szechuan essence I was hoping for, making me yearn for the Cantonese cuisine's focus on flavors with optional heat. I find myself more inclined towards more authentic, less commercialized spots where the cultural immersion contributes to the dining experience.

The guest's experience at a Hyatt property highlighted significant frustrations due to the hotel's inability to accommodate a critical request for a feather-free room, despite multiple confirmations. The oversight not only disregarded the guest's needs but also raised concerns about the potential for severe allergic reactions. Furthermore, the guest found the parking fee of $29 per night to be unreasonably high for St. Louis. The repeated apologies from the hotel staff, without resolving the core issue, added to the dissatisfaction. This experience calls into question the hotel's commitment to guest comfort and safety, as well as the transparency of their additional charges.

**Review of Pancake Heaven**

After initially facing a daunting hour-long wait during a weekend visit at around 10am, my partner and I were determined to give this place another try, this time arriving right at opening. Our strategy paid off as we quickly got seated despite the early crowd. The highlight of our breakfast was undoubtedly the pancakes—between the indulgent butter pecan for myself and the tasty bananas foster for my partner, these fluffy treats stole the show. Not to mention, each pancake order generously includes two eggs and a choice of meat, with a nod to health-conscious eaters through options like turkey sausage and bacon. If you're planning a visit, take my advice: arrive early and wear comfortable clothing. It's a pancake paradise well worth exploring.

During our visit, the food quality didn't quite meet our expectations, particularly the fried green tomatoes, which were a letdown for us as connoisseurs of the dish. The meatloaf did stand out as the highlight of the meal, though the sides were only average. Additionally, the entertainment was underwhelming, with only a few songs played each hour, which detracted from the overall experience.

Our dining experience was excellent, thanks to our server Tina, who provided attentive and fast service. Despite it being a busy Sunday morning around 10 am, we only had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. The highlight was definitely the huevos bruncheros, an exceptional breakfast choice that I highly recommend. It's a must-try item that words can't adequately describe.

I had a disappointing experience with my new glasses from this optician. Upon collection, I found the lenses horribly out of focus, indicating a failure to accurately measure and align the pupils with the lens's center of focus. An attempt by a staff member to suggest readjusting the glasses on my face was impractical and did not address the core issue. Despite claims of initial measurements being taken, I have no recollection of such a procedure. After requesting the lenses be redone and sent off as urgent, I am still left waiting and without my glasses. This experience has been highly unsatisfactory.

This hidden gem, nestled at 33 S. 43rd Street, is a treasure trove for computer accessories with unbeatable prices and an inventory that never disappoints. Despite its modest exterior, the store is well-stocked with a wide range of electronic goods, from external hard drive docks to external CD burners with lightscribe capability, all at surprisingly affordable prices. The customer service is commendable; while there might be a slight language barrier with the older of the two gentlemen running the shop, their patience and effort to communicate effectively are notable. This place is a must-visit for all your computing needs - just ensure you head to the current address and not the outdated one.

This hotel impressed with its unique Clue game-inspired aesthetic that adds a charming allure. The staff, from the respectful bellboys and valet drivers to the bartenders and phone customer service team, contributed significantly to a positive experience with their prompt service and friendly demeanor. The hotel's location in the bustling streets of downtown Boise offers a vibrant setting, though it might prompt guests to explore nearby dining options for more budget-friendly meals. However, the lack of air ventilation in the bathrooms is a notable drawback. Nonetheless, the overall excellent service and atmosphere have us eager to return next year.

Visited the Atlantic City location and tried the strawberry flavor—absolutely mind-blowing! It strikes the perfect balance of sweetness, enhanced by real strawberry bits, without being overly sugary. At just $2 for a small, it's also quite a steal. My only disappointment is not sampling the other flavors. It's a must-try for my next trip to Philly/AC. Highly recommended!

I had a delightful lunch experience here yesterday. The service was outstanding with a very amiable staff. The portion sizes are generous, nearly sufficient for two, highlighting the cherished recipes from Mrs. Doll. The legacy continues through her son, maintaining the culinary traditions. Highly recommended for a satisfying meal.

The Bridgeport Rib House offers satisfactory take-out BBQ options at reasonable prices, based on multiple visits. However, the pickup process within the bar is subpar, detracting from the overall experience. Comparable barbecue quality can be found elsewhere in the area without the inconvenience of weak service.

**Review of [Restaurant Name]:**

Recently, after a menu overhaul and price hike, I ventured to this establishment with expectations sadly unmet. Admittedly still a novice in the culinary arts, mastering a few pasta dishes at home, I found their offerings to lack both freshness and flavor. A particular disappointment was the state of leftovers, which seemed prematurely aged by days.

The service experience did little to redeem the food. Despite a welcoming hostess, a mishap with a wine pour went awkwardly unaddressed, suggesting a lapse in basic dining room etiquette.

While this spot may pass muster for a casual happy hour, its ambitions of grandeur fall noticeably short. In an era where value and quality are paramount, I find it hard to justify spending here.

Had a positive experience at this shop when I went in to replace my grandfather's watch battery. Not only did they notice and replace a missing pin for free, but they also didn't charge me for the battery change. The wait time was longer than expected, but given their exceptional service and kindness, it was well worth it. Definitely a place I'd consider for future jewelry purchases.

This unique eatery beautifully marries the best of a Jewish deli, a Southern comfort food joint, and a hint of a Mexican dive's charm, creating a surprisingly delightful fusion. The brisket stands out for its quality, though it's worth noting that it comes without the traditional tomato-based sauce some may expect. Their take on the latke breaks from tradition in shape but certainly not in taste, proving to be a delightful iteration of the classic dish. A special mention goes to the Jewish Apple Cake, which, despite being slightly overdone on the bottom, maintained its deliciousness hours later, serving as a comforting treat on a flight back to LA. This spot is a must-visit for anyone looking to experience a unique culinary blend that satisfies on multiple levels.

This restaurant offers an experience that is more about the ambiance and group entertainment than culinary excellence. The Chinese cuisine served is mediocre at best, but the establishment shines in its ability to accommodate large, lively gatherings with its karaoke room rental feature. Customers can bring their own drinks and enjoy a selection of contemporary songs across multiple languages on the karaoke machines. While the food is average and reasonably priced, the quick service and the venue's tolerance for rowdiness make it a solid choice for group outings where the focus is more on fun than food.

The reviewer enthusiastically updates their previously positive review of Khyber, underscoring their continued patronage despite moving slightly further away. A testament to its allure, Khyber's Southern barbecue evidently remains a major draw, with the reviewer highlighting the exceptional quality of various meat options, from brisket to pulled pork. They also give special mention to the mac and cheese and coleslaw, suggesting these sides notably enhance the dining experience. Beyond the food, the ambiance of Kyber is described as consistently lively yet comfortably balanced, with a staff commendable for their knowledge and service, particularly in offering beer recommendations. This combination of delectable food, welcoming atmosphere, and attentive service firmly secures Khyber's place in the reviewer's favor.

This establishment stands out for its exceptional selection of bread, with the German rye being particularly noteworthy. The poached eggs, a personal favorite, are always cooked to perfection, making for an ideal breakfast. The eggplant panini and Laurie's salad come highly recommended for a satisfying lunch.

Tony's in Chalmette surprisingly serves some of the best Mexican food in Louisiana, defying expectations with its high-quality, delicious offerings.
