From a well-curated menu, the chiles rellenos stand out as a particularly exceptional dish, noted for their size and excellence. Additionally, the authentic touch of Mexican Coca-Cola, sweetened with real sugar, enhances the dining experience. Overall, everything tried at Tony's has been impressively good, making it a must-visit for Mexican cuisine enthusiasts in the area.

This establishment suffers from a fundamentally flawed business model that significantly hinders the ordering process. The professionalism of the staff is notably lacking, further detracting from the customer experience. Additionally, the quality of the food is subpar, as evidenced by a sandwich that was inadequately filled, failing to meet basic expectations. Overall, this is one of the worst experiences encountered in recent memory.

The staff at this dancewear store stand out for their friendliness and attentiveness, offering a broad selection of quality items at reasonable prices. However, the variety within specific categories, particularly men's dancewear, is somewhat limited. While its city location is convenient, finding exactly what you're looking for can be hit or miss, with successful finds only about a quarter of the time. Despite these drawbacks, it's often my first stop for new dancewear needs.

Based on a personal referral, my experience at this establishment was highly satisfactory. The service was impressively expedited, completing medium-sized individual braids in a mere five hours, a task accomplished by the coordinated efforts of three attendants simultaneously. The cost was reasonable at $150, with the added convenience of including the hair. Beyond the efficiency and craftsmanship, the staff's cordial demeanor significantly enhanced the visit, ensuring my return in the future.

The lamb gyros plate is highly recommended, delicious enough to warrant the drive, with some even opting to get an extra order for takeout. Their tiramisu is also very good, providing a sweet finish to the meal. Though the dolmas are tasty, they come with a more vinegary flavor than preferred. The included Greek salad adds a fresh and enjoyable component to the entrée. Overall, a pleasurable dining experience with minor adjustments desired for personal taste preferences.

"The Yum Yum Club offers delicious food, particularly shining through with their awesome macaroni salad. While service can occasionally come off as less than friendly, the combination of reasonable prices and great-tasting meals keeps me returning."

During our first visit to Reno, my husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this exceptional hotel, which set a high bar for our trip. Our room featured a delightful spa and a shower equipped with a steam room, enhancing our relaxation experience. The hotel boasted various dining and relaxation options, ensuring we didn't need to step out for a good time. The cleanliness and ambiance of the casino were commendable, offering a pleasant environment for non-gamblers like myself, with the sweet surprise of winning $41 from a $1 slot machine. Although our exploration outside the hotel didn't quite match up to our expectations of Reno, the hotel itself was a highlight. The convenience of easy room checkout saved us valuable time. For those seeking a comfortable, clean, and modern accommodation in Reno, this hotel is a perfect choice.

Based on thorough research of Yelp reviews, we chose this hibachi and sushi spot for a family outing, and it certainly lived up to the hype. The sushi was exceptional, and the hibachi did not fall short of spectacular, offering a delightful culinary experience. The meal was perfectly rounded off with a dessert of fried bananas and ice cream, marking a delicious conclusion. The service was commendable for its attentiveness, ensuring a memorable visit. We are eagerly anticipating our next visit to indulge once more. Highly recommended!
Fantastic pizza, exceptional service, and a perfect spot for both friends and family make this place highly recommended.

Had a great experience recently at this spot with friends, enjoying some food and drinks. The service stood out as excellent, and the drinks were particularly noteworthy. I'm already looking forward to my next visit!

I visited this spot due to its high ratings, particularly eager to try the lamb, which indeed proved to be quite flavorful. However, I was disappointed to find out that the garlic Naan seemed to be pre-made from Trader Joe's rather than freshly prepared. Additionally, the pricing for the lamb felt steep given the portion size. Another point of dissatisfaction was the payment process; despite indications at the entrance that American Express was accepted, the owner refused to take my Amex card. Given these drawbacks, I'm inclined not to revisit.

This hidden gem, nestled in a nondescript strip mall in Brentwood, is a must-visit for any ice cream aficionado. Thanks to a fortunate Yelp discovery, it has now become an essential pit stop for indulging in unique and mouthwatering ice cream flavors. During my visit, the pumpkin and whipped cream cheese flavors stood out, both offering a delightful taste reminiscent of pumpkin pie when combined. What elevates the experience further is Michael, the owner, who greets you with warmth, generous samples, and expert recommendations. His passion for creating innovative flavors promises exciting future visits. An undiscovered delight awaiting your taste buds!

The establishment offers excellent food and good coffee, with the quality of its baked goods and culinary offerings being particularly notable. While the coffee served is satisfactory, an expanded espresso bar with more diverse options would enhance the experience.

Holly Grove is a standout choice for anyone passionate about supporting local agriculture and enjoying high-quality produce. Their selection impresses with both staple and unique items not commonly found in conventional grocery stores, all sourced locally. This not only supports the local economy but also takes full advantage of the region's year-round growing season—an opportunity not to be missed. Beyond produce, they offer meats raised locally and bread from nearby bakeries, further emphasizing their commitment to the local community. The ambiance is equally charming, with a welcoming atmosphere enhanced by the sight of people caring for the garden. The only minor drawback is its location, which may be inconvenient for some, yet that does not diminish the overall exceptional value Holly Grove offers to those seeking to support local growers and makers.

Visited this restaurant for the first time on a busy Saturday night during March Madness, resulting in somewhat slow service. Although it took a while to receive complimentary homemade chips, they were fantastic. The children's entertainment options, such as a nearby TV playing a kid's movie, were a thoughtful touch. I enjoyed a delicious burger with seasoned fries, while my husband found his blackened chicken a bit too spicy. The kid's macaroni and cheese was great, but our daughter preferred the chips. The interior seating arrangement, particularly a table near the women's bathroom, was slightly off-putting. Appreciated the 15% military discount offered. Would recommend despite the minor service delay, rating it just shy of 5 stars due to this.

Had a pleasant stay at a decent hotel located in downtown Tampa. We stayed in a suite which featured a fold-out couch, providing comfortable accommodations. Although we missed it, the hotel offers a happy hour with free drinks, a welcoming touch. The highlight was the complimentary breakfast, truly exceptional with made-to-order omelets, fresh fruit, cereal, various bread options, bacon, sausage, home fries, a selection of juices, and pastries. It was, without a doubt, the best free breakfast I've ever experienced. The room itself was modern, equipped with two TVs, maintained cleanliness, and boasted a strong shower. Overall, a recommendable stay for those visiting the area.

This delightful restaurant, nestled in the vibrant heart of downtown St. Petersburg, offers a cozy and welcoming ambience. It serves up delectably flavorful burgers that are a must-try, with their chicken and potato gratin dish receiving special mention for its unique addition of arugula, although the choice of cheese in the gratin may not appeal to everyone. While the wine prices lean towards the higher side, discouraging some patrons, the overall dining experience is enhanced by the pleasant atmosphere and the attentive service provided by the staff. Definitely a place to revisit, especially for burger enthusiasts.

I've been a loyal patron of Cd Roma's for over a decade and have witnessed its evolution from a cozy, home-style establishment to its current, more modern ambiance. This shift demonstrates a successful adaptation to changing times, a refreshing move that many restaurants fail to achieve. The food remains exceptional, with staples like Chicken Parm, Eggplant Parm, house salad, Alfredo, and their superb pizza keeping me coming back. Notably, their to-order Alfredo sauce pairs perfectly with breadsticks, a highlight of my visits. However, some appetizers, such as the frozen cheesesticks and calamari, fall short in quality, an area ripe for improvement. Despite missing the old, homey vibe and the simpler times it evokes, Cd Roma’s continuous allure, far surpassing options like Olive Garden, confirms my ongoing patronage.

Waffle House maintains consistent quality across its locations, ensuring a predictable dining experience. While the ambiance characterized by yelling and the limited dining space may not appeal to everyone, these elements are part of its unique business model. Despite these factors, the prospect of breakfast at Waffle House remains enticing.

Henry provided an outstanding experience in helping us secure a storage locker. His expertise, professionalism, and friendly demeanor stood out, making the process smooth and enjoyable. Even our dog Marley was welcomed warmly. We highly recommend their services for a hassle-free and pleasant experience.

This restaurant provides an exceptional dining experience with its prime location and inviting atmosphere. The cuisine is consistently superb, boasting a wide variety of dishes that never disappoint. What truly sets this place apart, however, are the drinks. Jared, a skilled mixologist behind the bar, crafts unique cocktails that are must-tries for any visitor. It's highly recommended to take a seat at the bar to witness his expertise firsthand and perhaps challenge his creativity. Additionally, the daily specials are not to be missed, as they always promise something extraordinary. Whether it's your first visit or your hundredth, this restaurant guarantees a remarkable meal each time.

This spot certainly has its fans, thanks to its prime location, fresh food, and a commendable variety of vegan options. The crispy ranch and curry tofu stand out, with the chick'n in the crispy ranch earning special mention, alongside tasty fries. However, some aspects, like the overly sweet green lemonade, leave a bit to be desired, leading to an overall impression of mediocrity despite the unique offerings. Considering the price point of around $10 for lunch, it may not astound, but given its popularity and the chance to try something different, it might be worth a visit. Just temper expectations and explore its varied menu.

The customer experience at this venue was deeply disappointing due to the rude service received at the counter, unsanitary conditions, and an overall negative atmosphere. It's advisable to seek alternatives as this place is not recommended.

During my last day in New Orleans, braving the pouring rain, I was determined to experience authentic New Orleans cuisine—with a vegan twist. My visit to this eatery was nothing short of spectacular. The hospitality was top-notch, with Jamone graciously offering samples of everything, making the already difficult choice of what to eat even harder. Their ability to infuse classic New Orleans flavors into vegan dishes was impressive, ensuring there wasn’t a single bad option on the menu. The portions were generous, providing great value without compromising on quality or taste. The highlight for me was the bread pudding, a perfect end to an already fantastic meal. If I were local, this place would be a regular spot for me. For anyone in search of delicious vegan food that captures the essence of New Orleans, this place is a must-visit. Be sure to come hungry to fully enjoy the abundance of options!

Discovering this gem was a delightful surprise on our detour back to Boston. Dubbed a "magical vegan heaven," it lived up to its name, even impressing my non-vegan wife who couldn't get enough of their Philly steak. The lure of their dishes is irresistible—I can testify, having savored every bite of their curry tofu wrap. Be prepared for the cozy space; it's small with limited seating, making takeaway a popular choice. However, don't let this deter you. The place is a culinary delight, with offerings like their kale lemonade that alone warrant a five-star rating. It's settled; this establishment is a must-visit for our next Philly trip.

My wife and I are huge fans of this spot, thanks to its attentive management and excellent service. We highly recommend the Tiger Roll, Pink Lady Roll, and Tornado Roll. Don’t forget to ask for Billy, our favorite! Overall, it stands out among others in the area. A must-try!

This eatery is a must-visit for lunch in New Orleans, especially for fans of Southern cuisine. Their fried chicken stands out for its flavor and crunch, while the red beans and rice provide a deliciously comforting side option. A staple for any trip to the city, the place is noted for its friendly and attentive staff, adding to a pleasant dining experience. Additionally, the reasonable prices make it an attractive option for travelers and locals alike.
As a local resident, I often visit Mint and can confidently say every option is a delight, with the Taro Tapioca Smoothie standing out as an ideal treat for those with a sweet tooth.

The restaurant offers a commendable dining experience with its emphasis on freshness. Both salsa and guacamole, made fresh daily, along with homemade chips, set a high standard for quality. The shrimp burrito, noteworthy for its generous size, does not compromise on taste or freshness. However, the service provided by the wait staff falls into the realm of average, leaving room for improvement in this area.

Despite eagerly anticipating my visit to this highly recommended eatery, I found myself somewhat let down by the experience. The standout option, the costanza, while boasting flavorful fillings, was encased in a crust that deviated from the expected doughy texture of traditional calzones, leaning instead towards a breadier constitution which I found disappointing. Furthermore, the calzones, though generously sized, scrimped on the meat content, leaving something to be desired. The dessert, an apple pie calzone, was particularly underwhelming due to an atypical spice use that overshadowed the expected cinnamon flavor and the near absence of apple chunks, rendering the filling almost pureed. While the ambience of the place is inviting and its proximity to my residence is a plus, the food didn’t quite live up to the hype on this occasion. I’m inclined to give it another try, hoping my initial experience was just a one-off, but my expectations are now more tempered.

This Philadelphia gem offers not just an amazing view but also impeccable professional service and great fare, making it a must-visit spot. Nick, an outstanding server, made brilliant recommendations including a lovely 2010 Bordeaux-Chateau Font Merlet that perfectly complemented the Tuna Tartare and Steak Tataki. The fabulous nighttime view has me eager to return for what promises to be spectacular sunsets.

The restaurant offers very good food, but struggles significantly with table turnover and staff efficiency, especially during busy periods. Despite the diligent efforts of the staff, long wait times for seating and receiving food (over an hour for each) are common, leading to customer dissatisfaction. Notably, management's handling of staffing schedules appears inadequate, impacting the dining experience negatively. These operational issues, particularly the extensive wait times, have deterred at least one customer from planning a return visit.

I recently visited a breakfast spot with a strong preference for my usual order: eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, wheat toast, and a side of salsa. While the hashbrowns were undercooked for my liking, a request I'll remember to make next time, the rest of the meal was quite satisfying. It outperformed the Cajun Kitchen on Chapala, though still fell short of the CK in Goleta.

The portions were generous, offering great value for the price, especially compared to CK. I was particularly impressed by the ambiance of their well-shaded patio, a feature missing at CK, which complimented the dining experience. The server handling five tables did an exemplary job, maintaining cheerfulness and efficiency throughout.

Special requests were accommodated without issue, an important factor for someone with particular dining preferences like myself. Considering the quality of service, affordability, and the delight of dining on a beautiful patio, this spot stands out, especially for those who value outdoor seating.

I'm already planning a return visit to explore their lunch menu, hopeful it will match the breakfast experience.

This all-you-can-eat establishment offers a decent value at $27 per adult, specifically for those with hearty appetites aiming to indulge in multiple plates of sushi rolls and tempura. However, the culinary experience dips when ordering from the regular menu, which unveils the mediocrity of the offerings. The maki rolls, although passable in taste, disappoint with their fridge-cold presentation, hinting at a lack of freshness. A notable letdown was the oyster ponzu, which not only missed its namesake sauce but was also burdened with an overly thick batter reminiscent of fast-food onion rings. While the place might cater to specific cravings, particularly for voluminous eating, it's advisable to steer clear of the squid, among other selections.

After a disappointing experience with another locksmith, I turned to this company and couldn't have been more satisfied. They promptly dispatched a locksmith to my location within 20 minutes of my morning call, and the job was completed in under an hour. An added bonus was receiving 4 free keys. Their exceptional service truly stands out.

This establishment suffers from extreme overcrowding, leading to an unpleasant dining experience where the odor of patrons competes unfavorably with the smell of unclean facilities. The food, described as mediocre, does not justify the pricing, and the service leaves much to be desired, with inattentive staff members. Given Philadelphia's rich culinary landscape, it's advisable to seek better alternatives rather than wasting time and money here.

This establishment boasts an impressive selection of beers complemented by a knowledgeable staff, promising a solid foundation for a good night out. However, the experience nosedives when food is introduced into the equation. Despite the potential for a pleasant visit, the food served was disappointing: undercooked, inedible fries, inconsistently cooked burgers, and buns that seemed cold and slightly hard, detracting significantly from the overall dining experience. The service only added to the dismay, showing a lack of responsiveness and flexibility when faced with feedback about the unsatisfactory meals, which were charged at full price despite being left untouched. In summary, whilst a haven for beer lovers, it's advisable to either lower your culinary expectations or dine elsewhere to avoid disappointment.

My initial visit to this establishment was marred by communication issues due to heavy accents from the staff, resulting in an incorrect order despite phoning ahead. Although the staff was friendly and rectified the mistake, an additional 20-minute wait was not what I had anticipated. Nevertheless, the food, once correctly received, was enjoyable.

Giving the place a second chance turned out to be a delightful decision. I ordered a pizza steak that significantly exceeded my expectations—a generous portion of meat, ample mozzarella, and well-balanced sauce, crafted into a delicious offering. This experience has greatly improved my initial impression, and I find myself considering returning for more, potentially making their pizza steak a personal favorite.

This bar, known for having the longest bar in the city, creates a surprisingly relaxed atmosphere, especially considering its bustling happy hours. It serves as the perfect Saturday night destination, especially for those looking for a spot to unwind after a show at the Troc, avoiding the usual Chinatown or dive bar route. It's also become a favored spot for those coming from shows at the Electric Factory, offering a comfortable place to relax after hours on your feet. Beyond its physical space, the bar boasts an impressive array of sports packages, making it an ideal venue for catching those out-of-town football or baseball games. The upstairs area adds to the allure, with pool tables and an additional jukebox. However, it's important to note that this beloved spot, known as IBP, has unfortunately closed its doors. RIP IBP.

This place boasts a lively atmosphere, a dog-friendly huge deck, and a generous happy hour that makes it a popular spot, earning it four stars for beer, ambiance, and service. However, the experience is somewhat marred by the prevalent smoking on the deck, which could benefit from a non-smoking section. 

While the key lime pie shines, the food generally disappoints, meriting only two stars. The offerings, from pretzels with lackluster cheese dip to pretzel bun sandwiches that fail to impress in both quality and value, leave much to be desired, especially for a native Wisconsinite accustomed to higher cheese standards. With potato chips as the sole side, the absence of fries is notably underwhelming. Given the superior sandwiches available next door, it's suggested the establishment might do better to focus on its strengths in serving beer and perhaps allow food from neighboring eateries.

This establishment exceeds expectations in every aspect, providing a consistently clean environment with a noticeable positive ambiance among the employees. Their fluff and fold service elevates the experience further, delivering clothes in an impeccable state, perfectly folded and exceptionally clean, akin to purchasing them anew. The use of environmentally friendly detergent is a commendable touch. Modern Laundry has successfully transformed laundry from a chore into a convenient errand, securing my loyalty. Highly recommended!

This establishment offers a pleasant dining experience with tasty food and a nice atmosphere, as one might expect from a CBD location. However, it's worth noting that the back room can become stuffy during busy times. The raw oysters and burgers come highly recommended, although prices are slightly elevated for lunch.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting a noteworthy small shop that came highly recommended on Yelp, and it certainly lived up to the hype. Situated a bit out of the way, it was absolutely worth the drive. The standout favorite for me had to be their excellent wine cakes – a true testament to their culinary expertise. Based on this initial visit, I am already looking forward to returning. A great find for anyone looking to explore quality offerings in a cozy setting.

My dining experiences are often met with a critical eye, but The Love stands out as a delightful exception. Our Father's Day lunch was nothing short of exceptional. The menu presents a challenge not in finding something appealing, but in deciding among the many enticing options. Service was impeccable, with a waiter who was both professional and accommodating, enhancing the already lovely, bright atmosphere. The food itself left no room for disappointment. My omelet, surprisingly hot through the center, came with a delightful mix of roasted peppers and onions, and greens were a welcome addition to every plate. My warm spinach salad was particularly memorable. Meanwhile, my husband savored the unique cornmeal Belgium waffles, enriched with blueberry butter—a treat for the taste buds. The choice of La Colombe coffee was the cherry on top of an already perfect meal. Simply put, The Love left us wanting for nothing.

This dining experience was a mixed bag. The sushi roll offered was satisfactory, although the variety left something to be desired. The hibachi grill provided a disappointing experience; despite specifying a medium-cooked steak, it was served well-done. Additionally, the chicken options for the rest of the group were found to be under-seasoned. A significant discrepancy was found regarding their advertised late happy hour from 8-11, which, according to staff, only applied to a different location – a detail not mentioned on their website, causing confusion and dissatisfaction. Overall, the dining experience fell short of expectations due to cooking inaccuracies and misleading promotions.

I recently took advantage of a Groupon deal for Lee How Fook, lured in by positive Yelp reviews, only to walk away feeling let down. The restaurant's cozy size, accommodating approximately 10 tables, suggests an intimate dining experience, and indeed it seems wise to book ahead for weekend visits. Service was passable, although communication barriers made menu inquiries somewhat challenging.

The meal began on a high note with delightful pan-seared pork dumplings and sui mai appetizers, both complemented by an appetizing dipping sauce. Unfortunately, the main courses didn't maintain this standard. The sweet & sour chicken was disappointingly more sweet than sour, paired with undercooked vegetables that left much to be desired. Moreover, my preference for spicier dishes may have clouded my judgment here. The pan-fried noodle dishes, one with shrimp and the other with beef in black bean sauce, were particularly underwhelming, lacking in flavor with the beef dish missing the advertised spicy kick.

Overall, despite a promising start, the meal ended in dissatisfaction. Lee How Fook may have the potential for a nice dining experience, but my visit did not meet the expectations set by its online reviews.

This hot chicken ranks among the finest fried chicken experiences, especially noteworthy for someone hailing from the South/NC, a region renowned for its fried chicken. However, the pricing seems steep relative to the portion sizes offered. On a brighter note, the drinks served alongside are exceptionally good, adding a positive aspect to the dining experience.

Lee How Fook delivers an exceptional dining experience without needing elaborate praise. Their General Tso chicken stands out as a must-try, effectively showcasing the high quality of their offerings. Don’t just take my word for it; try it and see. - Coolie

During a stay at the Hilton hotel on St. Charles, dining at Luke, a restaurant connected to the hotel, became an unexpected highlight. Chef John Besh's establishment impresses with its take on traditional New Orleans cuisine, and surprisingly, one of the best burgers on offer. Despite initial reluctance to order something as ubiquitous as a burger in a city known for its distinct culinary culture, it proved to be an excellent choice—huge, juicy, and bursting with flavor. The experience was further elevated by the bread pudding a la mode, a must-try dessert that rounded off the meals beautifully. Visiting Luke three times in five days speaks volumes about the quality of the food and the overall dining experience, making it a noteworthy recommendation for anyone looking for outstanding eats in New Orleans.
Disappointed to learn upon arrival that this location, famed for its delectable fish tacos, has sadly closed its doors.

After an incredible day of skiing at Squaw, I faced the daunting realization that I had lost our car keys. Despite efforts by security to locate them, I was left pondering my options, which seemed to include an unwelcome tow back to SF. In a stroke of luck, I contacted Alpine's Truckee office, and Jacob was a beacon of hope. His experience was evident as he swiftly provided a quote and estimated his arrival time, even courteously updating us on a slight delay. Our ordeal turned into a happy hour wait, ending with Jacob efficiently creating new keys for us in under four minutes. His service was honest and quick, making him the go-to for any future mishaps, though I hope there won't be any. A hearty thank you to Jacob for turning a potential disaster into a mere hiccup. Alpine also accepts AAA, adding to their convenience.

On New Year's Day 2017, our dining experience was exceptionally disappointing even before we had a chance to try the food. Seated at 7:30 PM, by 8:15 we still hadn't received water despite being introduced to multiple waiters who each claimed they would be attending to us for the evening. After a frustrating 45 minutes attempting just to get water for our large party, in a notably small restaurant, we decided to leave. We ended up going across the street to Dat Dog, where the hot dogs significantly exceeded our expectations. A stark contrast in service and satisfaction.

My recent experience was deeply disappointing as 75% of my order was incorrect. Upon arriving home and distributing the food, I discovered several items were missing, including a burger. This mishap significantly undermined the enjoyment of my meal.

My recent visit to Farmhaus was a testament to its popularity and quality, enduring a bit of a wait due to its bustling atmosphere, especially on a weekend night. Arriving early, we were tactfully handled by the staff who provided menus to prepare our order in advance, a smart move that allowed us to plan ahead during our extra wait time.

The culinary experience at Farmhaus proved exceptional, with the smoked fish dip and escolar with prawns taking the spotlight for their impeccable taste. Other menu items like the mushroom salad and tapenade did not disappoint either, although the meatloaf could benefit from a touch more moisture and flavor. A missed opportunity to try the nachos leaves room for anticipation in future visits.

While service experienced occasional lapses, it was understandable given the restaurant's operational challenges under a full house. This did little to detract from the overall pleasing dining experience.

Farmhaus has certainly piqued my interest to return, especially with the prospect of trying their lauded blue plate special lunches and enjoying dinner with the added ambiance of outdoor seating. This establishment showcases a worthwhile dining adventure that beckons for future exploration.

Despite enjoying the cuisine at Dish on multiple occasions, our latest experience has compelled us to reconsider our patronage due to a significant lapse in customer service. Upon reserving a table for three well in advance, we were dismayed to find ourselves cramped at the smallest table in the restaurant, practically dining with the guest seated perilously close at the adjacent table. Our request for a more suitable seating arrangement was met with rudeness, presented as a take-it-or-leave-it scenario. This disregard for a reservation made weeks in anticipation, especially planned as a special outing, was disheartening. Regrettably, this has led us to exclude Dish from our dining options.

I visited this restaurant for a late evening date and was pleasantly surprised by the quality. The highlight of our dining experience was definitely the milkshake, which ranks as one of the best I've ever tasted. The food and service were commendable, though I couldn't shake off an odd vibe from the place, which might just be my personal perception. Overall, it was a pretty good dining experience.

This review expresses deep disappointment in a new establishment aiming to offer Nashville its first authentic Greek culinary experience. Unfortunately, it falls significantly short, presenting a menu that diverges from traditional Greek cuisine into an Americanized version of Mediterranean dishes. Key Greek specialties like Skordalia and Avgolemono are poorly misrepresented, deviating from their authentic recipes. The reviewer advises those seeking genuine Greek cooking to look towards established Greektown communities in Detroit or Toronto, concluding with a resolute disapproval of the establishment.

During my recent visit to New Orleans with a group of friends, we had an exceptional dining experience that stands out as the best meal we enjoyed in the city. Our party of four was attended to by the wonderful Travis, Susan, and Caroline, who provided us with top-notch service throughout the meal. 

I opted for the set price menu, starting with a refreshing strawberry salad appetizer that was the perfect introduction to the meal. The main course, a chicken entrée, was remarkably prepared with crispy skin and incredibly moist meat, accompanied by delicious cornbread stuffing. It was, without exaggeration, the best chicken dish I’ve ever had. The dessert, a rich chocolate cake, was delectable, though quite indulgent. 

One of our party, a vegetarian, was thrilled with her vegetable selection plate, highlighting the restaurant's ability to cater to diverse dietary preferences with excellence. The other two members of our group opted for the pork served with sweet potato mash and had nothing but praise for it.

The restaurant's location added to the allure of our dining experience, making it not only the best meal we had in New Orleans but also a memorable one for its ambiance and exceptional service. This spot is highly recommended for anyone looking for a standout dining experience in the city.

My experience at this veterinary clinic has been exceptional, thanks to the attentive staff and their exceptional care. The front desk associate, Kris, demonstrated outstanding service by assisting me and my nervous dog, Leonidas (Leo), with an umbrella to our car during a heavy rain, going above and beyond what is expected. For about two years, Leo has been a patient here, and his anxiety during visits has always been a concern. However, since we started seeing Dr. Deutsch, there has been a noticeable improvement. Dr. Deutsch's approach is thorough and thoughtful, ensuring Leo is comfortable and at ease during his appointments. Highly recommend this clinic for their dedication and exceptional care towards pets and their owners.

This charming spot genuinely lives up to the "farm fresh" label, serving up inventive, flavorful dishes that impress with their well-judged portions. The cozy dining room, infused with a friendly atmosphere, alongside attentive service, creates an ideal environment for reconnecting with friends and loved ones. Don't forget, it's BYO – a perfect excuse to bring along a favorite bottle. A must-try is the Bloody Beet Steak, which stands out as a testament to the kitchen's creativity. Highly recommended for a delightful dining experience.
Delighted by the Island Bowl, it's a bomb choice for anyone seeking a tasty yet health-conscious option. Echoing Dr. Steve Bruhle, it's a win for your health!

The burger at this joint stands out in a crowded field, thanks to its exemplary simplicity paired with high-quality ingredients, resulting in a flavor that sets it apart. The cheese melts beautifully, complementing the juicy, glistening patty in a way that truly elevates the experience. However, the bacon, despite its appealing appearance in photos, disappoints due to excessively thick slices dominated by unrendered fat, which fails to melt and detracts from the overall indulgence.

On another note, the establishment's adoption of communal tables significantly detracts from the dining experience. The forced proximity to strangers not only subjects diners to potentially unwanted conversations but also undermines the overall enjoyment of the meal. This trend, while popular, is a misstep in creating a comfortable and personal dining atmosphere.

Review of LA Fitness:

After a few weeks at LA Fitness, I'm satisfied with my experience. The gym's location is convenient, and the membership cost is reasonable, providing great value. It has all the essential facilities I need, including a variety of cardio machines, weights, a lap pool, a spin class room, and a spacious aerobics studio. I was also pleased with the friendly staff and the complimentary personal trainer session offered upon signing up. An added benefit is the ability to access all their area locations without additional fees. For those with kids, limited babysitting services are available.

However, there are a couple of downsides. The gym doesn't open until 8 am on weekends, which is inconvenient for an early riser like myself. Additionally, the pre-work group fitness class options are limited, with only a 5:45 am spin class available, which is too early for my preference.

If you're looking for a gym with luxury amenities like a smoothie bar, massage services, or advanced high-tech equipment, LA Fitness might not meet your expectations. But for anyone seeking a straightforward, no-frills workout environment with good equipment and friendly people, LA Fitness is a cost-effective choice.

This sushi spot in Santa Barbara is a must-visit for enthusiasts, thanks to Hiro San, a masterful chef acclaimed not only for his exceptional skills but also for his engaging personality. With a focus on high-quality ingredients, this venue promises a sushi experience that satisfies even the most discerning palates. If the essence of sushi to you lies in both the artistry of preparation and the quality of conversation, sitting in front of Hiro San is an experience you wouldn't want to miss.

This theater, despite its dated appearance, stands out for its unbeatable ticket prices and exceptionally friendly staff, making it a favorite alongside the Loft. Its low crowds and diverse movie selection, ranging from major blockbusters to unique indie films, provide a relaxed and inclusive viewing experience. For those who enjoy a quieter, more varied cinematic experience without breaking the bank, waiting for a movie to be shown here is definitely worth it.

This spot boasts a fun ambiance, with an inviting interior and comfortable outdoor seating that elevates the dining experience. The brunch options are delicious, and the beer selection is notably exceptional. However, our visit was marred by notably poor service. Our waiter was unprofessional and lacked knowledge of the menu, making for a frustrating experience, especially given the fact that the restaurant was far from busy. His attitude and mistakes with our order significantly detracted from our overall enjoyment. Were it not for these service issues, this establishment would easily earn four stars.

This restaurant impresses with its great ambiance and creative menu options. It's also noteworthy that it shares a kitchen with La Mulita next door, a place we equally admire. However, the no-reservation policy is a bit of a drawback, especially on weekends when waiting for a table becomes a gamble. Additionally, the requirement for your entire party to be present before seating can inconvenience groups with tardy members. Despite these minor inconveniences, the dining experience remains highly recommended.

Visited Cool Springs on a busy Thursday when Bonefish Grill was overwhelmed with customers, we found this place as a great alternative with a reasonable 15-minute wait. As always, the food did not disappoint, maintaining its reputation for excellence. A reliably good choice for dining out.

Title: A Delightful Dining Experience in Tarpon Springs

My visit to this restaurant in Tarpon Springs was quite the treat, offering a delightful blend of prompt service and delectable dishes. Despite a brief wait of about 10 minutes, our dining experience was smooth, thanks to the highly efficient and bustling staff, with our waiter standing out for his quick service.

The menu was a feast for the senses. The gyro and chicken souvlaki were both delectable, hitting all the right notes of flavor and tenderness. The spanakopita, with its slightly harder than preferred filo dough crust, was nonetheless a satisfying choice, radiating authentic taste and texture. Catering to all ages, the simple hotdog option was a hit with the younger diner in our group. An order of the cheese, emphatically accompanied by a joyful "opa!", added an authentically Greek touch to our meal.

This restaurant has quickly become our go-to spot in Tarpon Springs, and it's easy to see why. With its lively atmosphere, friendly staff, and tempting menu, it’s a place we look forward to visiting time and again.

Gryphon Cafe, nestled just two minutes away from the bustling Wayne Starbucks, offers a serene escape for true coffee aficionados. This intimate and dimly lit cafe exudes a chill ambiance, perfect for savoring their exceptionally good lattes brewed with strong espresso. While their baked goods might occasionally miss the mark, as experienced with a rather dry, stale brownie, the cafe more than makes up for it with its vibrant support of the local music scene, hosting lively performances on Friday and Saturday nights from 9 p.m. In essence, Gryphon Cafe presents a unique and refreshing experience, promising not just a coffee break but an infinite feeling of relaxation and cultural engagement.

Title: A Standout Experience at Metamorphosis Tattoo Shop

Rating: ★★★★★

Review: In an industry filled with uncertainties and last-minute cancellations, Metamorphosis Tattoo Shop in Indianapolis shines as a rare, five-star experience. Unlike other local tattoo parlors that left me disappointed with their lack of professionalism and reliability, Metamorphosis sets a gold standard for how a tattoo business should operate.

My journey through various shops was plagued with frustration, from artists forgetting appointments to last-minute cancellations—even as I was on my way to get inked. However, my experience at Metamorphosis was the polar opposite. The staff, especially my artist Trevor, upheld the utmost professionalism, making my rib tattoo session enjoyable and memorable. 

What distinguishes Metamorphosis from its competitors is not just their exceptional artwork but their respect for customers and adherence to professional business practices, including the reasonable request of a non-refundable deposit to secure an appointment. The prices are average for the high quality of work provided, making it a worthwhile investment for anyone seeking a tattoo.

Additionally, the shop's atmosphere is free from the "rock star" egos found elsewhere, offering a welcoming environment for customers. I appreciate their dedication to customer satisfaction and hope they maintain their excellent team and service standards. Despite its location in a posh area, Metamorphosis is a true gem without an ounce of pretension.

I highly recommend Metamorphosis to anyone tired of the runaround at other shops. Here, you're guaranteed not only stunning artwork but also the respect and professionalism you deserve. I eagerly look forward to my next visit with Trevor.

I recently tried the lengua burrito and was impressed by its neat presentation and non-greasy quality. The food was simple yet satisfying and pleasantly easy on the wallet. Based on this positive experience, I'm looking forward to trying the flan on my next visit.

The ambiance of the restaurant was notably compromised by poor lighting, making it a challenge to even see our meals, which in themselves were disappointingly average. Despite going in with hopeful expectations, the dining experience fell short.

This delightful review highlights the exceptional qualities of banana pudding from a beloved local shop. Praised for its amazing taste, even in its simplest form without extra toppings, this pudding stands out for its flavor and quality. Beyond the product, the shop earns accolades for its customer-centric approach, creating a welcoming atmosphere that clearly makes a strong, positive impression. The reviewer's affection for the establishment is evident, hoping for its continued success and expressing a commitment to support it for years to come. This blend of excellent product and exemplary service seems to make this shop a cherished part of its community.

I had a disappointing experience at Shepard's restaurant. After accidentally leaving my organizer/wallet on my table, I called the next day to inquire about it. Initially, they claimed nothing was turned in, but upon a second call, it was found in the safe — minus a $100 bill I had placed inside. Despite having witnesses to the bill's presence, the assistant manager refused to investigate the matter, claiming it wasn't the restaurant's responsibility to look after guests' belongings. The refusal to even question staff or explore the situation further is a glaring example of poor customer service. I'm left feeling frustrated and helpless, with no effort made by Shepard's to resolve the issue.

Dined here last night and was thoroughly disappointed. The restaurant consistently ignores feedback from bad reviews, and it shows. The prime rib I ordered was more fat and gristle than meat – even my dog turned it down. My side of fries arrived cold, and a simple request for regular butter was completely overlooked. It appears there's a lack of effort to address and rectify ongoing issues.

I'm awarding a 4-star review to this establishment primarily because my exploration of their menu remains limited. However, the vegan General Tso's pizza I sampled defied previous criticisms of soggy pizzas, presenting a delightfully crisp and fluffy crust adorned with generous portions of delectable "chicken". The balance of flavor, especially the iconic sauce with its subtle heat, impressed me. Their customer service was notably accommodating, seamlessly adapting my order to vegan preferences and proactively resolving a minor pricing issue. The delivery was prompt, and the food arrived hot. Their home-made seitan is particularly noteworthy. I wholeheartedly recommend them for a culinary experience that combines conscientious preparation with robust flavors.

Located conveniently within the Drury Plaza hotel, this restaurant is an ideal dining option for guests unfamiliar with the area. Despite the challenge of accommodating our large party of 20+ diners each night, the service managed to be quite efficient, with only minor oversights like a few forgotten drinks. The restaurant impresses with its generous portion sizes and satisfying food quality. Highlights included a notably large and tasty Cuban sandwich and flavorful shrimp tacos with a pleasant kick. The shandy also received commendations, though the margaritas, especially one involving Patron, fell short of expectations and are not recommended. Overall, a solid dining experience for guests of the Drury Plaza hotel.

Tanti and the Papertini team earn each of their 5-stars with their extraordinary wedding floral creations. More than mere bouquets, their artful arrangements are elevated by the unique incorporation of materials like paper, wire, and luxe fabrics. Beyond their innovative designs, the team stands out for their friendly, personable service, making them an invaluable addition to any wedding planning team. While Papertini can cater to traditional tastes, their true brilliance shines in crafting unique, sophisticated pieces that are far from ordinary. Highly recommended for those seeking something uniquely beautiful for their wedding.

My New Year's Day brunch experience at Mr. B's in New Orleans was unforgettable. Despite initial concerns about wait times, my boyfriend and I were promptly seated, ready for an instant gratification dining experience. The ambiance immediately set a welcoming tone with its jazz music, transporting us to a world of culinary delight.

Our meal began with a fresh loaf of bread that we eagerly consumed, setting the stage for the flavorful journey ahead. The gumbo ya-ya that followed did not disappoint, offering the perfect blend of spice and savory that I had hoped for in a traditional gumbo. The highlight of our brunch was undoubtedly the bbq shrimp. Prepared with heads and tails intact, they were served with a rich, delectable sauce that perfectly complemented the succulent shrimp, despite the messiness of the dish.

Service at Mr. B's was both friendly and efficient, contributing to an overall pleasant dining experience. While the prices were on the higher side, the quality of the food justified the cost. I would highly recommend trying the brunch at Mr. B's to anyone looking for a taste of New Orleans' culinary best.

Visited a notable steakhouse in St. Louis for a client dinner and found it to be a pleasant surprise, complete with a scenic view of the arch en route. The appetizer, Carmine's trio, featured mixed reviews on my end; the crab cakes stood out as above average, the scallops were somewhat too sweet, but the toasted ravioli was enjoyable. True to the establishment's reputation, the filet mignon did not disappoint — cooked to a perfect rare as requested, well-seasoned without being overly salty, and portioned just right. The experience was further enhanced by an impressive wine list, contributing to a memorable evening.

Today, my office colleagues and I decided to try lunch from San Antonio Taco for the first time, motivated by its promising reviews. Unfortunately, our experience fell short of expectations. Collectively, we found the sides of refried beans overwhelmingly salty, and the rice disappointingly clumpy. My personal choice of beef enchiladas also left much to be desired; the beef was cut with the grain, resulting in a stringy and inedible texture. While I typically am open to giving restaurants a second chance, I'm hesitant to consider a revisit to San Antonio Taco.

Cousin's is a preferred shopping destination for essentials in North Philly, particularly favored over Fresh Grocer by the reviewer. The store offers competitive prices, making it a go-to for budget-conscious customers. However, the quality of produce and the store's inconvenient hours post-5pm are noted drawbacks. Despite these issues, the store's proximity to the reviewer's residence and its affordability make it a regular choice for their shopping needs, especially as an alternative to pricier options like Trader Joe's during colder seasons or tight-budget periods.

This place presents a mixed bag, offering some standout dishes alongside others that are merely average. The Sausage and Pepper Pizza and a mysterious but delightful cream-filled puff pastry are the stars of the show, boasting flavors that are memorable and well-executed. These items alone are compelling reasons to return.

However, the menu's breadth leads to uneven experiences. While the assorted sweets and bagels are good, they don't reach the same heights as the top picks. The wheat everything bagels are noted as a pleasant surprise, challenging the usual expectations of whole wheat bagels.

The pepperoni pizza falls short, particularly when compared to the sausage and pepper counterpart, suffering from a lack of flavor and generous toppings. The service timing also detracts from the experience, with a notable wait time even after arriving at the advised pickup time, compounded by the shop's small, seatless space.

Despite these inconsistencies, the culinary gems found here and the establishment's proximity make it a place worth revisiting, with hopes that future experiences will lean more towards the 'great' than the 'so-so'.

This speakeasy is a hidden gem offering a unique blend of class and casual vibes. With good music and an excellent cocktail menu, it makes for a highly recommended spot for those looking to unwind. However, be warned that the food offerings are limited to a single appetizer dish that may not meet everyone’s taste. Ensure you don’t arrive on an empty stomach expecting a meal. True to its speakeasy roots, the focus here is on drinks and atmosphere.

I had an extremely disappointing experience where I spent a considerable amount of money only to receive spoiled food. Additionally, more than half of my large order was incorrect. Sadly, this has deterred me from ever returning to this location.

This restaurant experience merits a lukewarm 3.5-star review primarily due to the unavailability of desired items and inflexibility in fulfilling specific requests. Despite the anticipation for a biscuit-based chicken slider, as hinted at in promotional materials, the establishment outright denied such an option. Further disappointment ensued when the sought-after buttermilk bites were declared unavailable, only to later appear as part of a different order. The quality of glazed donuts also detracted from the overall experience, being notably thick and dry. Positively, the sliders (spanning fried chicken, beef belly, and a mediocre catfish) alongside the brown buttered cream sundae garnered appreciation. While these selections hinted at the establishment's potential, the inconsistencies and limitations make it difficult to recommend for repeat visits.

Discovering this local cafe just a short walk from my apartment was a delightful surprise, thanks to a recommendation. True to its reputation, it offers a warm, welcoming atmosphere, making it a popular choice for breakfast and brunch enthusiasts. My first visit was memorable with a delicious salmon scramble made with egg whites, showcasing their ability to deliver both flavor and health-conscious options. On my follow-up visit, the tofu with brown rice breakfast plate did not disappoint, maintaining the high standard set by my initial meal. The quick seating despite its popularity only adds to its charm, ensuring this cafe isn't just a hidden gem but a testament to the joys of exploring local eateries.

Visited for dinner on a Friday at 6pm, pleasantly surprised by the manageable crowd level. The staff were exceptionally friendly, and the ambiance resembled something from the Magnolia Journal. Both the food and drinks met high standards of quality. However, service pacing was an issue; cocktails and appetizers arrived simultaneously with the main course, leading to a slightly less-than-perfect experience. Recognizing they are a new establishment and empathizing through past hospitality experience, I find this a minor grievance. Therefore, I rate it 4 out of 5 stars.

This restaurant offers a tranquil dining atmosphere with a 1960s business vibe, where guests can choose from Tony's menu or opt for the bar selection. The Risotto comes highly recommended, and other dishes like the special linguine with shrimp and lobster and the strip steak have received rave reviews from diners. The standout aspect of this establishment is its exceptional service - staff strike the perfect balance between attentiveness and discretion, enhancing the dining experience further.

This sushi spot stands out as a personal favorite, offering impressively large and delicious sushi rolls alongside exceptional service. The Heat Attack appetizer, reminiscent of Korean-style jalapeno poppers, Sapporo roll, and Honey roll are particularly delightful choices. Additionally, their menu features an intriguing section dedicated to deep-fried rolls, broadening the dining experience. The freshness and appealing presentation of their dishes are consistently remarkable. For those looking to explore, the spicy sashimi bowl comes highly recommended as a tantalizing new taste experience.

This review details two disappointing experiences at a bar, where the customer encountered poor service from different bartenders on separate visits. The review describes feelings of being ignored and treated indifferently by the staff. The first bartender served the customer with an unwelcoming attitude, while the second failed to acknowledge the customer altogether, even when not busy and directly interacting with a large group of other customers. Despite the establishment’s high rating, the reviewer suggests that the quality of service at the bar significantly detracts from the overall experience, hinting that service might be better when dining at a table instead.

This dining spot offers a delightful experience with its exceptional atmosphere and above-average selection of options. Their lunch bento boxes come highly recommended for their quality. Additionally, the boba is a must-try for visitors, adding an extra layer of enjoyment to the meal. Some may voice complaints, but such dissent appears to come from particularly choosy patrons, suggesting the venue's offerings are generally pleasing. A standout recommendation is the beef braised soup—a hearty and delicious choice that warmly rounds off the dining experience.

My husband and I had a fantastic dining experience, thanks to the beautiful decor, great atmosphere, and most importantly, amazing food. Despite being priced like typical New York establishments, the quality far exceeded expectations. My husband indulged in udon noodles, while I enjoyed several sushi rolls, with the Spicy Salmon standing out as a must-try. The flavors were perfectly balanced - noticeable without being overpowering. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and highly recommend it for a tasteful culinary experience.

This hotel charms with its loveliness and exceptionally friendly and helpful front desk staff. If you're allocated a room away from the club as we were, restful nights are guaranteed. However, it's worth noting that those seeking quiet might want to look elsewhere. For visitors in pursuit of fun and a vibrant atmosphere, this hotel hits the mark perfectly!

I had an exceptional dining experience here, particularly enthralled by both their pizza and gnocchi offerings. The use of fresh ingredients and a diverse menu truly captures the essence of a quaint European family restaurant. Easily, this is the best pizza you can find in Middle Tennessee. Highly recommend!

This haircut experience significantly exceeded expectations, especially considering the modest $16 price tag. Originally anticipated to be a basic trim for damage control, it turned out to be an impressively professional haircut that complemented the face shape and revitalized the hair's health. The experience outshone previous salon visits, enhanced by an excellent shampoo and meticulous service. The only caveat was the longer wait time and duration of the cut, but this meticulous attention to detail was preferred over a hurried job. It's a reminder to allocate sufficient time for a visit, given the thoroughness ensured by the salon's student-driven approach and their comprehensive steps to ensure customer satisfaction. Overall, an outstanding value that left a desire to tip more generously for the exceptional service received.

The Presidio Chapel provided an exceptional setting for my daughter's wedding in May 2015. Rain Longo, the event coordinator, was incredibly supportive, patient, and enthusiastic, ensuring a seamless experience. The chapel's authenticity and the beautiful adjoining room for preparations contributed to the day's enchantment. With the affordable rental including six hours of use, the venue exceeded our expectations. A heartfelt thank you to everyone involved for creating such a perfect and memorable day.

I visited the waxing salon as a pre-vacation treat, not being a regular waxer. My specialist, Miriam, was on time and demonstrated knowledge in her craft, dedicating our hour-long session to both the service and a detailed lecture on the benefits of waxing over shaving. She also heavily promoted EWC products throughout the session.

The service on my brows and lower legs was executed well, but my underarms were left with noticeable stray hairs, which Miriam suggested I tweeze out myself. Additionally, remnants of wax were left on my skin in various spots. Despite the satisfactory shaping and waxing of certain areas, the oversight in thorough cleaning and complete hair removal, particularly underarms, made me feel unprepared for a beach unveiling.

The dining experience showcased excellent food and attentive service, meriting positive remarks. The standout dishes included the flavorful King and I stir fry, known for its perfect blend of heat and curry, and the well-received pad see ew. While the pad thai was found to be slightly on the sweeter side, it still found favor. Portion sizes were reasonable, ensuring leftovers without overwhelming the appetite. However, the ambiance was significantly marred by a high noise level, compelling diners to raise their voices for conversation. This single drawback held the restaurant back from achieving a higher rating. Improvement in managing the noise could potentially elevate the overall experience. Overall, a solid three-star establishment worthy of a visit for the food quality alone, albeit with considerations for the noise-sensitive.

This review expresses significant dissatisfaction with a rental car service at the St. Louis Airport, focusing on both a personal incident of theft and general cleanliness issues. The reviewer, a frequent customer, alleges their $300 radar detector was stolen from the returned vehicle, pointing toward a lack of integrity among the cleaning staff, despite filing a lost item report (Reference Number: 4355421). Moreover, they criticize the overall cleanliness of the vehicles, mentioning uncleaned front seats, dashboards, and the habitual finding of trash, like plastic bottles, under the seats. The reviewer's experiences highlight a consistent failure in meeting basic car rental expectations, calling into question the management's surveillance and accountability measures. Their dissatisfaction extends to a point where the reviewer expects a refund for the stolen item, underlying a deep sense of betrayal despite their loyalty to the service.

This place offers a fantastic atmosphere that is both laid-back and welcoming, even to our four-legged family members. The cozy wrap-around porch provided the perfect setting for our last meal of the trip. Their menu options cater to both indulgent and healthy preferences, as seen in the delicious but rich bananas foster French toast and the delightful vegetable omelet. The portion sizes are generous, ensuring you leave satisfied. I'm already looking forward to revisiting and exploring more of their menu, especially their famous juices. An overall excellent dining experience.

This place offers delicious food with generous portions at great prices. The girl behind the counter is incredibly friendly and always greets customers with a smile. I only wish it were closer so I could visit more frequently.

This outdoor trail offers a beautiful natural landscape, perfect for a range of activities including running, walking, hiking, and biking. Conveniently, there are numerous spots to rest along the route, making it ideal for those seeking a scenic getaway or an active day out in nature.

The service at this establishment is exceedingly slow, particularly from the kitchen, with a wait time of 40 minutes for a pasta and salad. It's a spot recommended for those seeking to extend their dining experience, perhaps intentionally lengthening a date. However, it's important to note that the delay does not stem from the waitstaff but from the kitchen's pacing.

This delightful dining spot has won over many hearts, including mine, with its scrumptious offerings. The appetizing chips, salsa, and beans set a high standard, which is effortlessly met by the creamy guacamole and the irresistible chimichanga bites, accompanied by a delicious sauce. The street tacos and enchiladas for dinner are nothing short of amazing, living up to every expectation. While the restaurant lacks a full bar, it creatively compensates by offering potent margaritas prepared at their sister location, ensuring patrons can enjoy a genuine experience without a liquor license on site. Awarding it 4 out of 5 stars, this place nearly reaches the pinnacle of favorites, mainly due to its convenience in the heart of downtown and the exceptional service, highlighted by their consistently attentive server. A must-visit for those seeking quality Mexican cuisine.
Holy smokes! Excellent sushi with good rolls, superb service, and reasonable prices. Plenty of healthy choices available. Definitely worth every penny. Highly recommended!
We enjoyed an excellent lunch with fantastic service. The Gumbo Ya Ya, BBQ shrimp, and crab cakes were particularly delicious. Highly recommended for great food and experience.

This workout is impressively effective, providing a remarkable experience in just 20 minutes. Initially skeptical, I found myself converted after trying it, now feeling healthier and more invigorated than ever. Special shoutout to Chelsey, whose guidance makes the process even more enjoyable. Highly recommend!

This charming restaurant earns a perfect score for its delightful atmosphere and exceptional location, both undoubtedly making it a place worth visiting. However, when it comes to the main event—the food—the experience takes a bit of a dip, bringing the overall rating down to three stars. The smoked turkey club I tried was almost there, with its generous inclusion of two sides being a highlight. Unfortunately, the meat didn't quite hit the mark in terms of flavor. On the side, the creamed spinach was enjoyable, but the mac and cheese fell short, coming across as dry and lacking in taste, especially disappointing given it came with an extra charge. Despite these culinary missteps, I'm not ready to write this place off. The restaurant's ambience and location have left a lasting impression, compelling me to return and explore more of the menu with the hope of finding a dish that fully lives up to the establishment's potential.

Had a fantastic brunch experience during NYE weekend at this charming spot. From the moment you step inside, the cozy decor envelops you, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The Eggs Veney was an exceptional choice, perfectly prepared, and savored every last bite. Overall, a delightful dining experience with great food that I highly recommend.

At Ali Ba Ba's, the experience is a satisfying deviation from the usual late-night NYC shwarma or gyro run, enough so to warrant not one but two visits. Their offerings are notably larger than what you might find in New York, albeit at a price that reflects this upscale in size—doubling to $6. This price point could be attributed to the specialized market in New Orleans, where the local palate traditionally leans towards po' boys rather than Mediterranean wraps. One downside is their exclusive offering of rooster sauce as the only hot sauce option, which might not cater to all tastes. Additionally, service can be on the slower side. However, when it comes to quality and satisfaction, Ali Ba Ba's gyros stand out significantly against neighboring fast-food options like the $5 pizza slices or hot dogs, making it a worthwhile stop for anyone craving a gyro in NOLA.

This establishment is a true hidden gem within the community, offering both exceptional food and amazing customer service. Its great location further adds to its appeal, making it a must-visit for anyone looking for quality dining accompanied by a welcoming atmosphere.

This delightful spot in West Philly earns a glowing 5-star review, standing out for its incredible Turkish coffee, delicious veggie wrap, and tasty cheese steak. Beyond the food, it’s praised for its inviting atmosphere, complete with a cozy cafe section perfect for lounging. The reviewer promises a return visit, highlighting the unforgettable experience and the 'great vibes' this place offers.

Jones is an exceptional dining spot that captures your heart (and taste buds) from the first visit. My initial encounter during the YEE introduced me to their delectable comfort food offerings, including mouthwatering mac and cheese, sliders, and scrumptious cocktails - an experience that left me eager for more. Returning with my mother only reaffirmed my love, especially after tasting their outstanding calamari, which was crispy, flavorful, and far from rubbery. For dessert, the simplicity of a Duncan Hines yellow cake slice served with milk was surprisingly delightful. Another visit with a visiting friend brought an array of dishes to our table, including Seared Ahi Tuna, Halibut, and a Roast Beef Dinner, the latter stealing the show with its succulent, perfectly cooked meat and creamy, garlic-infused mashed potatoes. While the tuna was enjoyable, the halibut proved to be more flavorful to me. Jones continues to beckon for future visits with its consistently impressive cuisine that leaves me saying, "Yum yum yum."

The Penang chicken, paired with flavor-infused white rice, stands out as an all-time favorite for its consistent taste across locations in Boston and Philly. Despite a lengthy queue, seating was speedy, approximately 15-20 minutes, and service remained quick throughout, ensuring a fast transition to enjoying the scrumptious, juicy chicken. Opting out of a to-go order for the journey back to Virginia felt prudent at the moment but was immediately regretted upon returning home—a mistake not to be repeated. This dining experience combines efficiency with culinary delight, making it highly recommendable for chicken aficionados.
Experienced an unnecessarily long wait despite ample available seating, indicating inefficiencies in seating management.

Screamagedon delivers an unparalleled haunted experience that instantly ranks as a must-visit attraction. From impressively realistic haunted houses to the thrill of navigating the woods with just a glow stick, every aspect is meticulously designed to immerse and terrify. The haunted hayride, a standout feature, offers a spectacle with fire, faux weaponry, and chilling characters that make for an unforgettable adventure. In comparison to other Halloween events like Busch Gardens' Howl-O-Scream or Halloween Horror Nights, Screamagedon stands out for its unique blend of horror and realism. It's a high-quality alternative that promises an adrenaline-packed visit, making one eagerly anticipate their next trip.

The service received was exceptional, marked by efficient online request response times of 30-45 mins and timely scheduling. Shanna’s punctuality and thoroughness in both treatment and sharing preventive advice were commendable. Although the pricing is on the higher side, it is justified by the effectiveness of the treatment compared to over-the-counter options, which proved inadequate in my previous experiences. The professional-grade comb used during treatment, superior in removing nits, is a notable mention, albeit it should ideally be part of the service package rather than an additional purchase. Despite this, investing in the comb for future incidents seemed prudent. Overall, the service is highly recommended for those seeking reliable and effective treatment.

This BBQ Chicken Sandwich, priced attractively at $5.75, delivers on both taste and customization. The chicken was perfectly grilled, and the option to personalize toppings and sauces adds a delightful touch. The variety of bun choices, including grilled sourdough, wheat, and white, cater to different preferences, making it a versatile and value-for-money offering.

This dining experience proved to be largely disappointing, significantly marred by a nearly two-hour delivery time despite being located just blocks away from the establishment. The long wait was attributed to a single driver handling ten orders, which felt unreasonable. The main course, a shrimp scampi, fell well below expectations due to an overly ambitious recipe that strayed too far from the traditional, resulting in an unsatisfactory dish. The saving grace of the meal was the sweet potato cheesecake, which was delightful and merited five stars on its own. This dessert would be the sole item worth ordering again from this restaurant.

Despite the service being somewhat pretentious and the considerable wait time, the experience is crowned by what can only be described as the best burger imaginable. It's a culinary triumph that elevates the entire ordeal, marking it as a must-visit for burger aficionados. Simply put, the burger transcends all expectations.

I had a great experience with Hi-energy gym, using my Perms Plus membership seamlessly between Atlanta and Tampa. The Tampa location surpassed my expectations with its spacious layout and expansive range of equipment – a noticeable upgrade from the Perimeter location in Atlanta. Additionally, the yoga class offered a nice workout variation. The convenience of free parking in the garage for up to two hours, along with the ability to obtain guest passes for local coworkers, added to the overall positive experience. Highly recommend for those looking for a versatile and accommodating gym experience.

This food spot is highly commended for its accuracy in serving fresh-made dishes. The staff is noted for their friendliness, and the quality of food, particularly the Italian specialties, is consistently praised for being delicious. The establishment is also recognized for its excellent rolls. A counterpoint is provided to a negative comment from OTTIS B., suggesting a potential misunderstanding on the part of the reviewer rather than a reflection of the establishment’s quality. It's underscored that the owners are very much focused on customer satisfaction.

I recently purchased a used 2009 Rav4 from Glanzmann Subaru, attracted by its unique availability and competitive pricing. Opting to buy this vehicle from nearly 1000 miles away, based in TN, I relied heavily on the dealership’s honesty and online representation of the car. Despite the dealership's overall efficient buying process, I encountered unforeseen challenges, particularly regarding interstate purchase logistics, which I felt could have been better addressed beforehand.

My primary concern, however, stems from the car's misrepresented condition. Despite my proactive efforts to inquire about any potential flaws over the phone, hoping to avoid any surprises upon arrival, the sales team’s description fell significantly short of the reality. Unmentioned aesthetic defects, including large dents, cracked paint, and cuts in the leather, awaited me, leading to an unavoidable sense of disappointment given the expenses and effort of traveling from Nashville to Philadelphia to make the purchase.

Although Glanzmann Subaru appears to be a small family-owned dealership from which one might expect a higher level of honesty and customer care, my experience was regrettably contrary. While the Rav4 itself is a solid vehicle, the undisclosed defects undeniably detract from its overall value. Reflecting on this, honesty should be paramount in any dealership’s policy, especially in instances where buyers are making significant decisions based on trust and the representation provided. I urge Mr. Jeff Glanzmann and his team to consider this moving forward, to prevent similar buyer experiences and to foster a more trustworthy environment.

Echoing the chorus of 5-star reviews, I must admit my initial skepticism about the overwhelming praise was quickly dispelled after my own visit. This boutique not only impressed with its cleanliness and welcoming ambiance, but also with the exceptional service provided by Lori. My first experience with the blue hard wax was revolutionary - a game-changer that means I'll never return to regular wax. The option for a "custom wax" was an added bonus that made the experience even more personalized and satisfying. I left feeling extremely pleased with the results and have already scheduled my next appointment. My gratitude extends to Yelp reviewers for guiding me to this gem!

This dealership leaves much to be desired. Despite multiple attempts to give it a chance, informed by positive experiences with Hyundai vehicles within my family, it consistently fails to meet expectations. Customer service and trustworthiness appear to be significant issues, leading to a firm decision to seek services elsewhere in the future.

Dinner at the Creole House with my girlfriends was a venture motivated more by the inclement weather than a specific desire to dine there. The bacon garlic oysters, our starter, fell short of expectations, overpowered by bacon and cheese, while the jumbo buffalo wings were a saving grace with their satisfactory seasoning. Our main courses varied in success; the jumbalaya pasta was disappointingly bland, the blackened red fish acceptable but accompanied by overly salty vegetables, and the canal street red fish was mediocre but might be given a second chance, despite lacking in garlic sauce. The paddle boat drinks were more juice than alcohol, necessitating an extra shot for strength. Overall, the food experience at Creole House was a letdown, meriting a lukewarm 3-star rating. However, it’s worth noting our server Alexander’s exceptional hospitality, which slightly mitigated the overall dining experience.

Visited BlackFinn for Sunday lunch with high expectations fueled by social media hype, but the experience was a letdown. The interior was nicely decorated and the staff friendly, setting the stage for a promising meal. We ordered mojitos, which were satisfactory, and proceeded with our main orders: a Cuban sandwich for me (with a specific request to hold the mustard and add mayo) and a Prime Rib sandwich for my partner, both accompanied by Black Finn fries.

Unfortunately, the meal failed to meet our expectations. The fries were overly salty, although the accompanying dipping sauces were a hit. My Cuban sandwich arrived smothered in the very mustard I had asked to be excluded, leading to its return. My partner's Prime Rib sandwich came with an insufficient meat-to-bread ratio and a scant serving of au jus.

After a disappointing wait, my remade sandwich missed another mark by lacking Swiss cheese, prompting further dismay. Although the managerial response was professional, offering apologies and compensating us for the mishaps, the meal was far from what we had anticipated. Despite the letdown, we're open to giving BlackFinn another chance, hoping for a redemption. Overall, a two-star experience for the effort and customer service, but the food and fulfillment of order specifics need significant improvement.

At this particular Bob Evans location, while the food retained its usual quality and was enjoyable, the service significantly detracted from the overall dining experience. Despite the establishment not being overly busy, my family and I were left unattended for about 10 minutes without even being offered drinks. A waitress was noticed moving back and forth nearby without acknowledging us, and it was only after a noticeable wait that two servers approached us, attributing the delay to a misunderstanding about table assignment. The incident points to a clear need for improved customer service and communication among the staff at this location.

This service has been a reliable choice for business mail for years. The team behind it consists of great individuals, ensuring the service quality remains excellent. Highly recommended for anyone seeking dependable mail solutions.
